Job Description:
Make your next move an expert one.
 

   At Colliers it’s not our success that sets us apart, it’s how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what’s right for our clients, people and communities.
 


   Why Colliers?
 

   Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers’ continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.
 


   Who you are
 

   You are a passionate Data Scientist, adept at leveraging statistical and machine learning techniques, including Natural Language Processing (NLP), to derive insights and craft business-ready data products . Your expertise lies in collaborating with business stakeholders to pinpoint business challanges and develop analytical solutions. You thrive on building and fine-tuning machine learning models, delving deep into data analysis, visualizing findings, and effectively communicating insights to the business. Does this resonate with you? Apply now!
 


   What you bring
 



     Bachelor's or higher degree in a quantitative field, such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Sciences, or Data Science or Certification in Data Science
   


     3+ years of experience working as a data scientist or in a related field.
   


     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
   


     Strong programming skills in Python, R, or another statistical programming language.
   


     Strong experience with SQL and database technologies.
   


     Proficient in the data exploration process, with a keen eye for identifying patterns and anomalies.
   


     Demonstrated expertise in data cleansing and preprocessing to ensure quality and consistency for analysis.
   


     Experience with machine learning techniques, including time series analysis
   


     Strong communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills.
   



   Bonus skills and experience
 



     Experience working with cloud-based data platforms, such as AWS or Azure.
   


     Experience with shaping organization governances and processes in building and using ML products
   


     Experience with Azure ML.
   


     Experience with deep learning techniques, such as neural networks and convolutional neural networks.
   


     Experience with NLP/LLM (i.e., Langchain) and Generative AI
   


     Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, PowerBI, or matplotlib.
   


     Experience with experimental design and statistical hypothesis testing.
   


     Knowledge of infrastructure or real estate
   



   What success looks like
 



     Work with business stakeholders to identify and understand business problems and develop analytical solutions to address them.
   


     Build and maintain statistical and machine learning products, including NLP, to solve business problems.
   


     Perform data analysis and visualization to communicate insights to business stakeholders.
   


     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop data-driven solutions.
   


     Identify and evaluate new data sources to improve modeling and analysis.
   


     Develop and implement processes for data preparation, model development, and model deployment.
   


     Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and techniques in data science and machine learning.
   


     Communicate complex analytical concepts and results to non-technical stakeholders.
   


     Maintain documentation of analytical work, including code, models, and analysis results.
   



 "Approximate Salary Range for Role: $79,310.00 to $147,290.00 .



 Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on this job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all Canada locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training."

Make your next move an expert one.
 

   At Colliers it’s not our success that sets us apart, it’s how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what’s right for our clients, people and communities.
 


   Why Colliers?
 

   Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers’ continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.
 


   Who you are
 

   Are you a diligent and organized professional with a passion for commercial real estate? We are seeking a versatile Lease Administrator to join our property management company specializing in commercial real estate. As a Lease Administrator, you will play a vital role in handling and administering lease agreements, ensuring compliance, and leading the lease ticketing system to support the accounting department.
 


   What you bring
 



     Bachelor's degree in business administration, real estate, or a related field (preferred).
   


     Validated experience as a Lease Administrator or in a similar role within the commercial real estate industry.
   


     Strong understanding of commercial real estate leasing practices, lease agreements, and legal terminology.
   


     Proficiency in property management software and lease administration systems (e.g., Yardi).
   


     Outstanding interpersonal skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.
   


     Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
   


     Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
   


     Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced and multifaceted environment.
   


     High level of integrity and ethical conduct when handling critical lease and tenant information.
   



   What success looks like
 



     Produce lease proposals, offers to lease, lease agreements, amendments, and renewals.
   


     Accurately process lease agreements, amendments, and renewals, ensuring all documentation is complete and compliant with legal and financial requirements.
   


     Review and interpret lease terms and conditions to ensure adherence to established guidelines.
   


     Maintain a comprehensive and up-to-date lease database, tracking key lease dates, rent escalations, and other pertinent information.
   


     Act as a liaison between property managers, accountants, and leasing agents to address inquiries, resolve issues, and provide lease-related information.
   


     Collaborate with the accounting department to ensure timely and accurate processing of rental payments and financial obligations.
   


     Prepare and distribute lease-related documents, including tenant estoppel certificates, rent invoices, and operating expense reconciliations.
   


     Conduct periodic audits of lease data to identify and resolve discrepancies or inconsistencies.
   


     Assist in the preparation and review of lease abstracts, summaries, and reports for management and stakeholders (internal or external).

Overview: 
 
   At Colliers Project Leaders, we deliver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.
 


 Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the 
  possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 15,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 

 Your role

 Join our team as an Assistant Project Manager with the Federal Government business unit.

 In this role, you’ll support experienced project managers and get the opportunity to sharpen your skills on diverse range of projects varying in scope and complexity. You will hone your project management skills by contributing to various projects from commercial buildings and fit-ups, social organizations, schools, water and wastewater and Indigenous communities.

 Take a positive approach to your work and enjoy learning and contributing new ideas and solutions. Build strong relationships with your teammates and project stakeholders. Responsibilities: 
 
Support with planning and coordinating project management activities including financial, planning and contracting aspects 
Working with a variety of project management tools such as Microsoft Project, MS Word, MS Excel, etc. 
Assisting with formulating and managing project plans
 Maintaining various systems for the management and control of the project in a manner compatible with client standards, and security protocol for project staff and records management system 
Reviewing and updating project costs and schedules
 Preparing project progress reports on project status, project schedules, project expenditures and impending actions to be undertaken
 Qualifications: 
 
2 years of experience supporting real property infrastructure
 A university or college degree/diploma in engineering, preferably with a background in engineering, architecture or related discipline
 Experience assisting with construction activities, ensuring adherence to scope, schedule and budget
 Excellent interpersonal, verbal communication and presentation skills
 Strong computer skills, including a working knowledge of scheduling (MS Project), word processing (Word) and spreadsheet (Excel) software applications
 PMP designation or other industry recognized credentials are considered assets
 Must hold or be eligible for Secret level security clearance from the Federal Government



 Don’t have every single qualification? We know that some people are less likely to apply for a job unless they are a perfect match. At Colliers Project Leaders, we’re not looking for “perfect matches.” We’re looking to welcome people to our diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but don’t have every single qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. Whether it’s this role or another one, you may be just the right candidate.
 


 What you can expect:


 An opportunity to truly impact our communities
 A flexible work environment
 A comprehensive onboarding experience
 Significant professional development, training, and a mentorship program
 A paid volunteer day
 An environment where people feel welcome, heard and included, regardless of their differences
 And much more!


 Join our team of difference-makers and help shape the growth of dynamic communities.

Overview:
 

 At Colliers Project Leaders, we deliver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.
 




  Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 15,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 


 Your role


 Are you motivated to build your career in Project Management? If you have interest supporting projects in a variety of sectors such as commercial, institutional, or light industrial and you’re eager to gain more experience in these areas, we would love to hear from you!




  We are looking for an Project Management Co-op Student/Intern to start in 2024, joining our team in our Calgary office. In this role, you’ll work with experienced project managers to sharpen your relationship management skills and successfully achieve project deliverables. You’ll hone your project management skills by working on various projects from different industry sectors. Our Co-op students get the opportunity work with the best in the industry and to develop their skills on a diverse range of projects that vary in scope and complexity. 
 Responsibilities: 
 
Be a key contributor, working alongside and learning from the best project leaders in the industry
 Gain valuable exposure to effective project delivery systems, processes and tools
 You will build core project management skills needed for future success by assuming a hands-on role supporting capital project delivery and develop a deeper understanding of design principals, construction methodologies and contract law 
Provide superior project support to Project Managers by drafting reports, doing cost tracking and producing progress status updates 
Prepare detailed meeting minutes, make scheduling and budget adjustments, and prepare tender and contract documents
 Perform research for proposal and projects as needed
 Ensure project activities are conducted in accordance with Colliers Project Leaders’ Quality Management System
 Attend important project and site meetings, documenting action items and key decisions to share with the team
 Qualifications: 
 
3rd or 4th year student enrolled at the School of Schulich, University of Calgary.
 A keen interest in project management along with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative, team-based environment 
Self-motivation, drive and a high level of personal accountability 
Willingness to learn, and advance technical knowledge and capability
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
Strong organizational ability and attention to detail
 Proficient in MS Project, MS Word and MS Excel
 A professional appearance, candor and appropriate communication style needed to interact effectively with clients and project stakeholders

         Join our team as a Brokerage Operations Coordinator in Toronto, ON.

         Are you looking for a job where you will play a significant role in the overall success of the team through your administration and customer service skills? Is the Commercial Real Estate Industry Attractive to You for Building Your Career? We want to meet you!

           1 - 3 years of administrative/team support experience in a professional environment.
         


           Interest and ability to use new technology (customer relationship management systems, billing, DocuSign, Adobe Pro etc.)

           Experience conducting research through MLS, MPAC, RealNet, and/or the Internet if required.

           Commercial real estate experience a plus

           You will liaise with internal departments and external vendors to process requests for property signage using a variety of applications such as jotforms/google docs.
         


           You will assist in management and coordination of transaction and due diligence processes – sign backs, going firm, amendments, subject removals, closing documentation, deposit monies, processing trade records and following up on overdue invoices. Entering deal sheets and submitting completed trade record and supporting paperwork to Deal Administration team.
         


           You are confident in your ability to maintain a good relationship with clients and colleagues in various departments (data, research, marketing, and brokerage project specialists).
         


           You are confident in your ability to coordinate information for clients, recent lease/sale reports, availability information, other required documentation.
         


           You will provide general office support through file management, organizing and documenting distribution and Salesforce contacts, meeting coordination and note taking, general office maintenance, invoicing, etc.

Overview: 
 
   At Colliers Project Leaders, we deliver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.
 




  Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the 
  possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 15,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 


 Your Role



 As an Assistant Project Manager with the Alberta business unit, you’ll join our team of experts who lead major capital building and infrastructure projects. Working with communities across Alberta, our team is part of bringing meaningful change by assisting communities gain access to housing, education and healthcare where people live, as well as delivering clean drinking water, and fostering opportunities for economic participation and environmental stewardship.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Work alongside experienced project managers to learn the keys to client relationship building and successful project delivery
 Provide project support to Project Managers by performing schedule updates, maintaining project controls, developing progress reports and preparing tender and contract documents
 Attend various project meetings, capturing accurate action items and key decisions in meeting minutes
 Provide a communication path between the Project Manager and other project stakeholders
 Ensure that project activities are conducted in accordance with Colliers Project Leaders Quality Management System
 Qualifications: 
 
A university degree or diploma in engineering, architecture, construction management or project management (or an equivalent combination of academic and practical experience)
 Self-motivation, initiative and an eagerness to learn and contribute to meeting project deliverables
 1 to 3 years of experience representing owners to multiple stakeholders to deliver construction and building projects of varying size and scope
 Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
 Previous exposure to consultant and design management, construction contract administration or project financials is an asset
 A results-oriented approach with the ability to take action and responsibility
 Exceptional detail orientation, organizational skills and the ability to prioritize competing tasks to meet tight deadlines and client expectations
 Strong computer skills, including a working knowledge of scheduling (MS Project), word processing (Word) and spreadsheet (Excel) software applications
 CAPM or PMP accreditation would be an asset

   At Colliers it’s not our success that sets us apart, it’s how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what’s right for our clients, people and communities.
 


   Why Colliers?
 

   Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers’ continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.
 


   Who you are
 

   The Copywriter will be a key Marketing Studio team member, primarily supporting brokerage content writing initiatives, and assisting with other service line content and one-off marketing requests. You will play an important role in the development and overall growth of the Marketing Studio department on a national scale, as well as providing service excellence to our clients, advisors, and team through the development of key marketing messages and property marketing content.
 


   As the Copywriter, you will be responsible for partnering with the studio team in planning, proofreading, and writing various types of content including business development proposals, property marketing campaigns, neighbourhood profiles, video scripts, and internal and external presentations and communications. You will collaborate with leaders and others on the team to develop creative ideas and execute consistent brand messaging and content for marketing collateral used by advisors, service lines, and practice groups. You will create and manage informative, entertaining, and inspiring content for both internal and external audiences.
 

   This is a Hybrid working arrangement at either of our following locations: Vancouver or Montreal or Toronto or Edmonton.
 


   What you bring
 



     Degree and/or Certificate in English, Communications, Marketing, Journalism, or a related field.
   


     Portfolio or 2-3 writing samples from previous work that are relevant to our content to show your abilities/capabilities.
   


     Professional services experience preferred.
   


     High level of computer proficiency and CMS experience.
   


     Experience supporting and advocating within a change management environment.
   


     Comfortable in a complex, flat matrix organizational structure with many stakeholders.
   


     Capacity to write and generate content with strong editing and proofreading skills with an emphasis on business writing and an understanding of articulating client value.
   


     Analytical, detail-oriented nature with experience using numbers to deliver marketing insights and action.
   


     Residential and/or commercial real estate marketing experience is an asset.
   


     Willing to work flexible hours as needed.
   



   **Please include a download link or online portfolio in addition to your resume.**
 


   Skills and Experience
 



     Expert writing, editing, and proofreading skills and familiarity with Canadian Press writing standards.
   


     Exceptional organization, time management, and prioritization skills, with the ability to thrive under pressure and ensure deadlines are met.
   


     Basic understanding of social media and website optimization strategies and best practices.
   


     Extremely comfortable in a fast-paced environment.
   


     Self-motivated with high attention to detail and a focus on results.
   


     Understanding of design and copy typesetting fundamentals.
   


     Ability to provide constructive critical feedback to improve the writing capability of team members.
   


     High level of service orientation within the business and strong business acumen.
   


     Works well independently as well as in a team.
   


     High level of drive, energy, and initiative.
   


     A quick learner – able to learn about the company and clients quickly and accurately.
   


     Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.
   


     Possesses strong presentation and public speaking skills.
   


     Able to read, write and speak French is a bonus.
   



   What success looks like
 



     Work with marketing service line leads and marketing specialists to create, edit, and adapt content for all property marketing pieces (brochures, ads, social posts, videos, eblasts, etc.).
   


     Partner with marketing leadership to create, edit and manage content support for marketing collateral for various service lines, practice groups, events, and special assignments.
   


     Develop, manage, and maintain project content calendar, ensuring timely delivery of content pieces and coordinating with stakeholders to gather input and approvals.
   


     Act as the copy editor/proofreader for communications and content requests coming through Marketing Studio.
   


     Manage multiple projects under tight deadlines with the ability to multitask and prioritize.
   


     Provide editorial support for advisors in relation to thought leadership, profiles, and editorials.
   


     Ensure written materials comply with and complement the overall company position, content style guide, and visual identity guidelines.
   


     Assist with content development and editing/proofreading RFP responses, pitches, and proposals with cross-functional teams.
   


     Be proficient in longer-form storytelling.
   


     Other duties as requested.

Overview: 
 
   At Colliers Project Leaders, we deliver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.
 


 Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the 
  possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 15,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 


 Your role



 Join our team as a Project Manager with the Federal Government business unit.
 


 In this role, you’ll join our team of experts who lead major capital building and infrastructure projects. As the Project Manager you acts as a trusted advisor to our clients, representing their interests at all times to multiple stakeholders and providing technical and project leadership to the teams they oversee. Our people are not only Project Managers, they are Project Leaders who take a client centric approach to project delivery.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Planning and coordinating project management activities including financial, planning and contracting aspects
 Working with a variety of project management tools such as Microsoft Project, MS Word, MS Excel, etc
 Support senior team members in project documentation and co-ordination
 Produce internal and external project status reports
 Manage and update project budget data and reports on individual project financial statuses
 Review budget data and be able to forecast project services costs for each quarter
 Co-ordinate consultant drawings, documentation and other submissions amongst the project team for review and comments
 Assist design managers in compiling multi-discipline reports for client review
 Maintain high standards related to final product quality
 Assist with overall project performance including forecasting, costing, scheduling, and quality assurance
 Qualifications: 
 
5+ years of experience in project management managing projects
 A university degree in engineering, architecture or other related discipline
 Effective leadership and organizational skills with the ability to effectively influence others and successfully resolve a variety of client, project and technical issues
 Excellent interpersonal, verbal communication and presentation skills
 Strong computer skills, including a working knowledge of scheduling (MS Project), word processing (Word) and spreadsheet (Excel) software applications
 PMP, P.Eng., OAA designation or other industry recognized credentials are considered assets
 French/English bilingual is considered a strong asset
 Must hold or be eligible for Reliability or Secret level security clearance from the Federal Government

Overview: 
 
   At Colliers Project Leaders, we deliver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.
 




  Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 17,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 


 Your role


 Join our team as an Associate Project Manager in our Whitehorse, Yukon office.

 Our Associate Project Managers get the opportunity to work with the best in the industry and to develop their skills on a diverse range of projects that vary in scope and complexity. In this role, you will be able to demonstrate your experience by supporting projects in a variety of sectors such as municipal, indigenous, health and post-secondary. Responsibilities: 
 
Be a team player and show up with a can-do attitude for clients and colleagues 
Work alongside experienced project managers to learn the keys to client relationship building and successful project delivery
 Be curious, ask questions and share your observations with the project team
 Assist in the delivery of complex capital projects by performing schedule updates, maintaining project controls, developing progress reports and preparing tender and contract documents
 Grow your experience and take on responsibilities that align with your skills and ambition
 Attend various project meetings, capturing accurate action items and key decisions in meeting minutes
 Provide a communication path between the Project Manager and other project stakeholders
 Ensure that project activities are conducted in accordance with Colliers Project Leaders Quality Management System
 Qualifications: 
 
Understanding of Indigenous culture, rights and title and community governance
 Proven ability to build and maintain relationship across a wide range of clients, colleagues and project partners
 Desire to support Indigenous communities and local governments to deliver meaningful community projects 
Self-motivation, initiative and an eagerness to learn and contribute to meeting project deliverables
 1 to 3 years of experience representing owners to multiple stakeholders to deliver construction and building projects or other community projects of varying size and scope
 Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
 Previous exposure to consultant and design management, construction contract administration or project financials is an asset
 A results-oriented approach with the ability to take action and responsibility
 Exceptional detail orientation, organizational skills and the ability to prioritize competing tasks to meet tight deadlines and client expectations
 Strong computer skills, including a working knowledge of scheduling (MS Project), word processing (Word) and spreadsheet (Excel) software applications
 CAPM designation, PMP and LEED accreditation would be an asset

Make your next move an expert one.
 

   At Colliers it’s not our success that sets us apart, it’s how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what’s right for our clients, people and communities.
 


   Why Colliers?
 

   Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers’ continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.
 


   Who you are
 

   Are you an aspiring HR professional looking to grow your knowledge and expertise? Do you want to support employee-related programs that add-value and provide meaningful impact to the professionals you support?
 


   We’re seeking a People Services (HR) Advisor who will provide support to the People Services (HR) Business Partner team to assist in the planning and execution of programs for the Canadian lines of business. You’ll provide advisory across a variety of HR-related areas, including employee engagement, performance management, training and development, orientation and onboarding, HR analytics, retention strategies, and DEI&B.
 


   You will also be responsible for handling employee questions and requests, the day-to-day operations and administration including developing job descriptions, loan and draw agreements, conducting exit interviews, and providing HR metrics and employment law information to managers (and employees) upon request. If you get excited about the details, enjoy idea-generation to improve processes, and have a natural curiosity where you seek to understand the “why” behind things, this might be the role for you. Sound interesting? Apply today!
 


   What you bring
 



     Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources or a related field
   


     1-3 years of Human Resources experience in a similar role
   


     Broad range of experience with HR programs and policies
   


     Strong computer skills with previous experience working with MS Office programs
   


     Excellent attention to detail with the ability to multi-task; and exemplary communication skills
   


     Knowledge of current HR-related federal, provincial, and local legislation and regulations
   



   Bonus skills and experience
 



     A CHRP/CPHR designation (or working towards one)
   


     Experience working in a multi-location, matrixed organization
   


     Commercial real estate experience
   


     Workday experience
   



   What success looks like
 



     Partner with HR Managers on the development, implementation, and continuous management of HR initiatives/programs throughout the business lines.
   


     Partner strategically with dedicated HR Managers and business leaders to drive and deliver people strategies and goals.
   


     Works with the HR Managers through a range of employee relations matters; performance management issues, coaching managers, conducting investigations, disciplinary action, handling of terminations, and conducting exit interviews. Keep HR Managers apprised and escalates urgent issues to the Employee Relations team when necessary.
   


     In partnership with the HR Managers, support People Leaders with any questions during the annual bonus/merit cycles ensure smooth and timely execution of bonus process.
   


     Work closely with extended HR team members (Talent Acquisition, Learning & Development, Compensation, Benefits, Payroll, Legal, Employee Relations, and HR Solutions, etc.) to deliver expert specialist advice to managers and employees.
   


     Responsible for administration of separation process, this includes calculating severance recommendations, drafting termination paperwork, and updating the separation tracker.
   


     Responsible for creating ad-hoc training and/or partnering with our Learning and Development team to create training materials and facilitate training as needed.
   


     Support HR Managers with analysis of their employee engagement survey results, conduct focus groups, and provide recommendations for their action plan.

   Join our team as a Research Coordinator in Victoria, BC.
 


   Who you are:
 

   You are a curious person with a keen eye for detail. Because of your interest in commercial real estate trends, you keep up to date on the local market and are keenly interested in bringing data together to tell the story. The Research Coordinator is responsible for tracking and data management of various forms of market research and activity to assist with presentations and pitches.
 


   What you bring
 



     BA/BS or equivalent required.
   


     Minimum of 1 year work experience in a business or office environment required.
   


     Experience in quantitative and quantitative analysis, along with strong writing and research skills.
   


     Strong organizational, time management and project management skills with a demonstrated ability to work both independently and within a team environment.
   


     Proficiency with Microsoft 365 including Excel, Word, PowerPoint.
   


     Ability to develop constructive and cooperative working relationships with others and maintain them over time.
   


     Ability to work in a fast paced and demanding environment, while maintaining the ability to meet deadlines without compromising accuracy, excellent product quality and attention to detail. High level of attention to detail is essential.
   



   Bonus skills and experience:
 



     Experience in BI, data visualization and GIS tools would be an asset.
   


     Real Estate or Urban Land post-secondary is an asset.
   


     Experience in residential or commercial real estate is an asset.
   



   What success looks like:
 



     You will capture data on market activity by observing, receiving, and otherwise acquiring information from relevant sources (including listings, comparables and others) and enter it into existing CRM+ database and/or relevant projects.
   


     You will assist in the preparation of periodic research publications on the commercial real estate market in Winnipeg.
   


     Following Colliers standard processes, undertake the compilation, verification, and publication of quarterly industrial and office statistics.
   


     You will assist in the compilation and creation of research resources to provide internal and external clients with accurate information and market analysis.
   


     You are confident in your ability to monitor industry statistics and follow trends through report reading and current events and improve/update current projects with this information.
   


     You will collaborate with Colliers Data Team to update data and troubleshoot to ensure that market data is accurate and meets QA standards.
   


     You will attend industry events in order to network and build relationships within the industry.

Overview: 
 
   At Colliers Project Leaders, we deliver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.
 




  Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the 
  possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 15,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 


 Your Role



 We're looking for a Project Manager who is motivated by the opportunity to leverage their skills in the municipal sector of the British Columbia business unit to join our rapidly growing team in Northern BC and act as a trusted advisor to Owners on a variety of municipal infrastructure, public works and Indigenous projects.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Develop strong client relationships and act as the client’s single point of contact throughout the project to achieve the client’s strategy and goals.
 Lead programs or work and large capital projects, varying in size and scope.
 Ensure client expectations are met or exceeded on all projects and the client’s best interests are represented with respect to contractual and technical issues.
 Select, organize and influence the performance of multi-disciplined project teams.
 Lead client and project meetings. Manage multiple stakeholders and communication streams.
 Maintain contact with existing and prospective clients and respond to business development and sales opportunities with support from the Business Development Managers, Principals or Vice President.
 Regularly reporting on project status by means of schedule updates, meeting minutes, financial records and other reports.
 Provide oversight and leadership to the change management process, payment certificates and other contract or project related administrative documents.
 Oversee the control of project related documents and deliver all work in accordance with our Quality Management System and procedures.
 Qualifications:
 


 5 - 7 years of project management experience, representing owners in the delivery of building developments.
 A university degree or diploma in engineering, architecture, construction management.
 Project Management Professional designation (PMP) would be an asset.
 Experience working with public sector clients would be an asset.
 Deep knowledge of various design and construction methodologies, project management models and financial management, as well as building codes, contract law and relevant legislation.
 Advanced understanding of Project Management methodologies and experience working in a PMO environment.
 Effective client management and people management skills matched with the ability to effectively influence others and successfully resolve a variety of client and technical issues.
 Detail oriented leader with the ability to work in a process driven environment.
 Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
 Strong computer skills, including a working knowledge of scheduling (MS Project), word processing (Word) and spreadsheet (Excel) software applications.

Make your next move an expert one.
 

   At Colliers it’s not our success that sets us apart, it’s how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what’s right for our clients, people and communities.
 


   Why Colliers?
 

   Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers’ continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.
 


   Who you are
 

   You are an energy professional with in depth knowledge and experience in the areas of energy efficiency, decarbonization and Net Zero, as well as broader sustainability initiatives. You are capable of planning and implementing energy conservation projects and sustainability programs within the commercial real estate industry. You are well-versed in business practices, including business case development, project management, developing budgets and liaising with key stakeholders.
 


 Essential Functions and Job Duties
 




     Energy tracking and monitoring – Encourage adoption of Colliers utility data management system for all properties and utilize for energy tracking and support reporting to property managers and clients.
   


     Coordinate and manage energy conservation & emission reduction projects – Review existing energy study reports, conduct assessments of energy usage, and identify opportunities to reduce consumption and emissions for assets across client portfolios. This includes creating energy reduction targets and goals, evaluating cost savings, obtaining capital improvement costs, identifying available financial incentives to support the business case. Develop an implementation plan, help coordinate the execution of energy and emissions reduction projects and liaise with vendors, contractors and building operators to ensure seamless execution. Where financial incentives are applicable, complete and submit applications and/or oversee and monitor applications completed by third parties as required.
   


     Coordination with Local Distribution Companies (LDC) – Responsible for all LDC program deliverables as required, including coordinating and assisting with site visits and inspections, attending required educational seminars, and generating reports as required.
   


     Performance monitoring & capacity building – Monitor and report on key performance metrics as identified or required across managed properties that support continuous improvement and best practices. Coordinate internal capacity building and awareness initiatives to build up knowledge amongst Colliers personnel and building occupants.
   


     Building Certifications – Using available building data and client goals for their assets and portfolios, help identify building performance and occupant experience certifications for properties to strive towards. Support gap analyses and the coordination of materials required to support the submission process
   


     ESG disclosures and industry reports – On an ongoing basis collect and maintain information to support the development of case studies, contribute to Colliers annual reporting, thought leadership and other publications that demonstrate our progress to achieve our national, global environmental and social impact goals. In addition, ensure the collection of property level performance data needed to support client ESG reporting needs.
   


     Property onboarding & general administration – Support the onboarding of new properties and general administration duties as required.
   



 What you bring
 



     University degree in Environmental Science/Engineering, Sustainability Management, or related field.
   


     Possess at least one of the following designations: Certified Energy Manager (CEM), LEED Green Associate / LEED AP specialty, BCIT Sustainable Energy Management Associate Certificate, UBC Masters in Clean Energy, or Registered Professional Engineer.
   


     3 – 5 years of related knowledge and experience, with an emphasis on building science, electrical, HVAC and facility control systems and experience in facility energy efficiency and GHG emissions management
   


     Experience supporting or leading business case development, financial management, project planning, and contract negotiations.
   


     Ability to build strong relationships with people at all levels of an organization, meet deadlines without compromising accuracy, excellent product quality and attention to detail.
   


     Demonstrated experience in project management, presenting business case and/or project plans that include both financial and operational requirements; Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI and/or other data management and visualization tools.
   



 Bonus skills, experience and designation
 



     Commercial Real Estate Experience.
   


     WELL AP, Fitwel Ambassador
   



 What success looks like
 



     You will be an advocate within Colliers, engaging both internal and external stakeholders in promoting energy and sustainability best practices.
   


     Contribute to the implementation of Colliers’ ESG program and support clients in tracking ESG KPIs to achieve targets.
   


     Successfully meet LDC Energy Manager requirements including providing quarterly reports, coordinate and assist with implementing projects and attend all required training and education seminars.

  Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 15,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 


 Your role



 Join our team as a Risk Specialist to support with managing risk on capital projects for our Federal Government team.
 


 As a risk management consultant, you are part of a dynamic and client oriented professional environment providing consulting services to owners. You are great with numbers AND people. As a trusted and reliable member of our team, you bring a positive, customer service approach that benefits our clients and everyone you work with. You love diving deep into research and analysis to provide strategic solutions for your clients. You are passionate about real property and infrastructure as an enabler of organizational strategy and performance. You are looking for an opportunity to expand your knowledge and further your growth as a professional.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Provide guidance as the primary stakeholder managing risk on projects of various sizes and complexities.
 Conduct risk assessments and evaluate potential risks and opportunities
 Identify project and procurement risks, review and audit claims.
 Recommend alternative solutions, methodologies, and strategies for risk mitigation, acceptance, avoidance, or transfer as is most appropriate understanding the client’s unique approach and risk tolerance level. 
Develop and manage the implementation of Risk Management Plans
 Design and facilitate risk identification and risk planning workshops.
 Employ analysis tools such as PESTEL, SWOT, etc. to support the risk management plan development and risk monitoring and control activities.
 Coach, mentor and train project teams in risk mitigation techniques
 Assist with development of Communication Plans with a view to supporting risk management.
 Provide leadership and support to the design, implementation and evaluation of clients’ products/services performance measures, risk management and risk mitigation strategies
 Prepare cost and cash flow estimates (e.g., identifying the resources, levels of effort and related costs) as required to support the agreed-upon risk management approach for the project.
 Qualifications: 
 
University degree in Planning, Architecture, or Engineering, supported by a mix of academic and practical experience
 Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar professional environment or advisory role, consulting to public sector clients
 A broad consulting skill set including strong presentation and stakeholder management, business case and report writing, and organizational and analytical skills
 Strong financial analytical skills
 Excellent verbal and presentation skills with the ability to effectively interpret and compile information and effectively articulate and present findings
 Exceptional writing ability and aptitude for compiling well-thought out and concise summaries, reports and recommendations that provide outstanding value to clients
 Excellent relationship-building skills to interact with clients, colleagues, and external industry subject matter experts
 Advanced proficiency in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint is essential; MS Project experience is an asset.
 Must hold or be eligable for valid Government Security clearance at the Reliability or Secret level.

   At Colliers Project Leaders, we deliver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.
 


 Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the 
  possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 15,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 


 Your Role


 We are seeking a construction focused Project Manager to join our growing team in the Alberta Business Unit. In this pivotal role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the successful execution of construction projects while maintaining seamless communication with the client and stakeholders. Your focus will be coordinating construction related tasks in occupied buildings while ensuring minimal disruptions to maintain the continuity of business operations. Responsibilities: 
 
You are seen as a valued and trusted team member and a subject matter expertise in contract administration and project management Understand the intricacies of maintaining business operations within construction environments
 Develop strategies to minimize disruptions to building occupants while maximizing project efficiency
 Proactively identify potential challenges and implement solutions to prevent disruptions
 Skillfully navigate daily challenges, adapting to changes while safeguarding business continuity
 Identify and address issues that may impact project progress, proactively proposing adjustments as needed
 Work closely with subtrades, contractors, and consultants to successfully execute the project
 Create communication and execution plans for construction related tasks
 Be familiar with design-bid-build, construction management, and design-build projects
 Build knowledge, skills, and expertise to achieve their business goals and objectives
 Understand how to represent the owners best interests regarding contractual and technical challenges
 Be seen as a leader and thrive with your ability to manage change, communicate, and coordinate between multiple stakeholders, resolve issues, and deliver projects on time and on budget
 Qualifications: 
 
A university degree or diploma in engineering, architecture, construction management or an equivalent combination of academic and practical experience
 PMP designation is an asset and will be supported to complete
 A minimum of five years’ experience in project coordination and construction related management
 A keen eye for detail
 Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills Strong computer skills, including a working knowledge of scheduling (MS Projects)

  Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 17,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 


 Your role



 Join our team as a Business Development Manager with the 
  Southern Ontario team.
 




  In this role, you’ll join our team of experts who lead major capital building and infrastructure projects. In collaboration with the Vice-Presidents, Principals, Client Relationship Managers and designated Senior Project Managers, you will organize, motivate and lead the business unit’s development efforts. For that purpose, you will lead the production and implementation of the annual business development plan and the attainment of the annual sales targets (by business unit, program, and segment targets). You will be responsible for generating and responding to leads, keeping the sales funnel full and providing business development and sales coaching for the business unit’s teams as required. 
 Responsibilities: 
 
Instituting a disciplined Business Development process within the business unit primarily focused on prospective clients
 Initiating and nurturing prospective client relationships to seek out and secure specific opportunities where Colliers Project Leaders experience and expertise can be leverage
 Collaborating closely with VP’s and Business Units across our organization to support marketing and sales efforts with existing clients, including exploring opportunities to sell new and expanded Colliers Project Leaders service offerings (Infrastructure Advisory, Construction Solutions, IPD Advisory, Furniture & Equipment Planning and Operational and Move Readiness)
 Motivating and monitoring the business unit team and their performance with respect to this business development activity in the business unit. 
Assisting in setting annual and monthly sales objectives and targets for the business unit along with the Vice President, Directors, and Account Manag
 Helping manage the business unit annual sales plan and providing accurate, monthly updates, revisions, and modifications to the plan to senior managemen
 Integrating segment and program sales targets into the business unit business plans and assist the Vice President in meeting these t
 Developing and maintaining as required, detailed knowledge of the full spectrum of Colliers products and services.
 Participating proactively in business unit and national business development, marketing and sales meeting
 Perform competitive market analysis and conduct research initiatives designed to support growth and expansion targets.
 Leveraging the CRM software through regular and consistent use of our Microsoft Dynamics 365 ‘Connect’ software.
 Working with Marketing in the review and development of consistent, best of class marketing materials and strategies.
 Assessing networking and trade show opportunities from a business development perspective and assume a leadership role working within the business unit to plan, participate in, actively follow up on leads, and report back to senior management on the return on these investments.
 Support and input within proposal development if required by the pursuit team. 
Where applicable, acting as proposal lead from receipt of RFP to submission of the finished product to the client. Also provides input on all and/or leading certain applicable, major business unit proposal submissions.


   1
  Qualifications: 
 
University Degree in Business Administration or equivalent combination of post-secondary education and industry experience.
 Previous experience in Business Development Manager role in the project management, design and construction, facility management, or real estate industry. A background in Project management consulting industry is considered an asset.
 Minimum 5 years’ experience in a Business Development role.
 Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to effectively influence and persuade management, colleagues, and clients and prospective clients.
 A commitment to providing intrinsic and extrinsic value in each client interaction.
 Demonstrated negotiating, written and verbal communication skills with an emphasis on listening skills.
 The ability to lead a team in the development and delivery of winning proposals to acquire new business and drive growth.
 Has assisted with the development and has executed tactical sales plans including regularly exceeding quotas and account objectives.
 Knowledge of building or lateral infrastructure design and construction is an asset. 
Ability to follow policies and processes, yet remain flexible, entrepreneurial, and highly client focused.
 Actively involved in national industry and trade associations.
 Computer literate (including use of CRM systems, Excel, Word, Power Point).

This pivotal position entails collaborating with a multidisciplinary team, including managers, designers, and coordinators to oversee the entire lifecycle of RFP/RFI/Business Development opportunities within the Occupier Services Canada platform. The Director of Business Development, serves as a seasoned expert, shaping the strategic direction of the team while championing the Colliers brand and culture.
 


   What you bring:
 



     Bachelor's degree in in Real Estate, Finance, Business Administration, Accounting, Mathematics, or related area
   


     10 - 12 years of relevant experience required to perform the role
   


     Demonstrated existing quality relationships with executives and decision makers with major Canadian-based global corporations (Fortune 500).
   


     Active leadership of business/relationship development on behalf of a (1) Enterprise Clients / Corporate Solutions / Occupier Services or Global Occupier Services provider .
   


     Track record as a lead in “solutioning” and winning integrated, global, (1) multi-service line Enterprise Clients / Corporate Solutions / Occupier Services or Global Occupier Services engagements.
   


     Reputation as a best-in-class service provider representative within (1) CoreNet, IAMC, ICSC industry organizations.
   


     Demonstrated working knowledge of (1) Portfolio Optimization, CRE Strategy, CRE Organizational Design, Account and Transaction Management, Project Management, Lease Administration and IWMS technology.
   


     Strong skills in the following areas: business management, human relations, financial analysis, relationship building, time management, planning and organizing, written and verbal communications.
   


     Previous experience managing projects nationally and/or globally.
   


     Outstanding technology proficiency as well as excellent negotiation and presentation skills
   



   Bonus skills and experience:
 



     Master’s Degree a plus
   


     CRE experience / background preferred.
   



   What success looks like:
 



     You will develop and implement a business plan to meet objectives. Incorporate an advisory, solution-centered approach to clients, developing broader and higher relationships with target clients. Ensure to enter deep within target market and develop prospective accounts. Conduct sales activities to attain Enterprise Clients (Managed Accounts) new business, owning the entire sales/pursuit cycle.
   


     You will development and outstanding management and ownership of a pipeline of leads, short-term and long-term, primarily within the Fortune 1000. This includes active reporting and multi-party collaboration and communication, following a defined sales process that will continue to improve over time.
   


     You will focus on opportunities for larger outsourcing contracts, primarily involving one or more of the primary service lines of Transaction Management, Strategy & Consulting, Project Management and Lease Administration.
   


     You are confident in your ability to go directly to prospective clients and initiate the opportunities but will involve extensive collaboration as a part of our Occupier Services platform with many Colliers brokers that are brought in and communicated with along the way. Many pursuits will be global, requiring leadership and partnership with our global teams. Creating maximum visibility internally and with the external market is important, so this would involve working out of the local office, as applicable, multiple days per week and some weeks full-time.
   


     You will actively lead and/or partner in sales presentations. The selected individual will be a key stakeholder on continuous improvement of presentation deliverables for the Enterprise Clients team within the Occupier Services platform.
   


     You will develop RFP and RFI responses, proposals, and other standard documents, facilitating necessary input from multiple business lines, offices, and individuals globally.

Overview:

 Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the 
  possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 15,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 


 Your Role


 As a Senior Associate, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution with the Infrastructure Advisory business unit. Responsibilities: 
 
Provide critical analysis and transaction advisory services to a wide range of infrastructure project sectors including roads, bridges, water/wastewater, district energy systems, hospitals, prisons, airports, schools, defense systems, and ports to determine the best way to finance and procure them for the public sector
 Developing and revising financial models 
Conduct a broad range of market research and analysis, including due diligence review of precedent practices for other infrastructure projects and investments
 Support the development of reports and information memorandums, research, and industry papers
 Support the preparation of business cases, proposals, presentations, and contributing to business development
 Provide commercial and financial analysis of project finance structures, instruments, and pricing
 Draft and review of procurement documents and schedules and precedent project benchmarking
 Advise on alternative financing (i.e. P3, AFP, others including IPD or Alliancing) and other innovative transaction structures, and ensuring they attain the right balance of risk transfer and bankability
 Perform due diligence and perform detailed analysis that will help develop comprehensive strategies and business plans in support of client investments
 Apply your exceptional writing skills to prepare reports for a broad variety of assignments.
 Contribute to winning proposals and participate in compelling client presentations
 Build on your understanding of the Canadian advisory marketplace and gain exposure to a diverse range of clients and major infrastructure projects across the country
 Qualifications: 
 
University degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Commerce, Finance, or a related mix of academic and practical experience
 MBA or master’s degree in a relevant discipline is an asset
 CAPM/PMP is an asset
 LEAN/Six Sigma is an asset
 Government of Canada security screening reliability status or higher is an asset
 3-5 years of experience in similar advisory role, consulting to public and private sector clients
 A broad skill set including strong presentation and stakeholder facilitation, business case and report writing, organizational and analytical skills
 Excellent communication and writing skills
 Solid financial and general excel modeling skills
 Experience in roads, transportation, buildings, and energy infrastructure is an asset
 Experience with public private partnerships , Alternative Financing and Procurement or other collaborative procurement models for the delivery of public infrastructure is an asset
 Proficiency in working with Procurement documents (RFQ, RFP, and Project Agreements); and Procurement models (traditional, alternative, collaborative) is an asset
 Excellent verbal and presentation skills with the ability to effectively interpret and compile information and effectively articulate and present findings
 Demonstrated writing ability and aptitude for compiling well-thought out and concise summaries, reports and recommendations that provide outstanding value to clients
 A positive outlook and demonstrate an energetic disposition with clients, along with the ability to effectively influence positive client decisions
 Excellent relationship-building skills to interact with clients, colleagues, and external industry subject matter experts

 As a Commercial Debt Advisor, you will develop, analyze, and recommend commercial mortgage loan investments. The role is accountable to develop an effective internal and external network for acquiring successful prospects and to coordinate the client relationship for further revenue generation. Additional responsibilities include assisting with closings, analyzing other potential real estate transactions and performing special projects such as portfolio valuation and investment research. Success in the role will require the identification, negotiation, structuring and provision of the initial underwriting for unique, complex business transactions, ensuring credit decisions and recommendations in accordance with the financial lenders while collaborating with Colliers International Real Estate Agents.
 


 Responsibilities:
 



     Work with lending partners to originate a wide variety of commercial real estate loans across Canada focused on making first and second mortgage loans as well as construction, bridge and subordinate debt financings to real estate developers, builders, and owners. Act as subject matter expert providing market, industry, and pipeline information as appropriate.
   


     Meet frequently with clients and prospects and apply relationship selling and relationship expansion strategy and performance to current and potential Real Estate clients, ensuring comprehensive, holistic financial solutions.
   


     Accompany and support Colliers International Real Estate Agents as required, with client interactions (joint calls) and relationship building.
   


     Understand and adhere to credit granting policies relative to quality and verification of information, analysis, profitability, and credit recommendations, executing sale of credit and services to Real Estate clients and prospects as defined.
   


     For new prospects, review and analyze financial statements, cash flow and working capital position, business plans, goals and objectives etc. developing suggestions and alternatives that meet or exceed the client’s objectives. Prepare proposals, undertake negotiations with prospects, and oversee external lenders negotiations relative to the sale of real estate product and services.
   


     Leverage technology and profitability tools to identify & refer sales opportunities, ensuring optimal effectiveness
   


     Monitor market trends, pricing, and activity and provide robust communication around asset class relative value and opportunities across the broad investment team
   


     Screen and review prospective commercial mortgage loan investments
   


     Perform due diligence to assure prospective investment meets underwriting criteria and approved mandate
   



 Experience:
 



     At least five years of related work experience in real estate investments preferred
   


     Experience as a mortgage originator
   


     Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Economics, or related field
   


     Intermediate to advanced Excel including proficiency with pivot tables, PowerPoint, and Word
   


     Strong research, analytical and problem-solving skills
   


     Understanding of discounted cash flow modeling, real estate fundamentals and capital structures
   


     Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
   


     Ability to work both independently and as a team member
   


     Flexibility and adaptability at handling multiple priorities and initiatives
   


     Optimistic, energetic with “can do” / resourceful style

   Chez Colliers Maîtres de projets, nous livrons des solutions en gestion de projets dans le domaine de la construction de bâtiments et d’infrastructures pour répondre aux besoins de nos clients à travers l’industrie. Notre travail fait une différence en optimisant les collectivités et en améliorant la vie des gens qui y vivent. Cela nous passionne!
 




  Nous sommes déterminés à concrétiser la vision de nos clients, ce qui nous pousse à regarder bien au-delà de l'immédiat, vers toutes ces 
  possibilités que nous pouvons réaliser avec eux dans le futur. Nous avons plus de 15 000 projets complétés à notre actif - Ces projets contribuent encore aujourd’hui à la croissance de collectivités durables, progressistes et inclusives.
 


 Votre rôle



 En tant que Gestionnaire de projet - Fédéral, vous intégrerez un environnement professionel dynamique qui est orienté vers le succes des projets de ses clients dans sa prestation de ses services de consultation. Vous êtes doué(e) avec les chiffres ET avec les gens. vous amenez une attitude positive tant auprès de nos clients que de vos collègues. Vous aimez plonger en profondeur dans un sujet afin de résoudre des problématiques et fournir des solutions stratégiques à vos clients. L'immobilier et les infrastructures vous passionnent car elles permettent l'optimisation des stratégies organisationnelles et de la performance globale. Vous recherchez une opportunité d'accumuler de nouvelles connaissances et de progresser professionnellement.
  Responsabilités: 
 
Planifier et coordonner les activités de gestion de projet, y compris les aspects financiers et contractuels, et la planification
 Travailler avec une variété d’outils de gestion de projet, notamment Microsoft Project, MS Word et MS Excel
 Soutenir les membres de l’équipe principale dans la documentation et la coordination des projets
 Produire des rapports d’étape internes et externes sur les projets
 Gérer et mettre à jour les données budgétaires des projets et les rapports sur la situation financière de chaque projet
 Examiner les données budgétaires et établir les coûts prévisionnels des coûts des services liés aux projets pour chaque trimestre
 Coordonner les dessins, la documentation et les autres soumissions des consultants au sein de l’équipe de projet pour révision et commentaires
 Aider les responsables de la conception à compiler des rapports multidisciplinaires à présenter aux clients aux fins d’examen.
 Maintenir des normes élevées en matière de qualité du produit final
 Contribuer au rendement de l’ensemble des projets, y compris les prévisions, le calcul des coûts, la planification et l’assurance qualité
 Prérequis: 
 
De 5 à 7 ans d’expérience en gestion de projet

   At Colliers it’s not our success that sets us apart, it’s how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what’s right for our clients, people and communities.
 


   Why Colliers?
 

   Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers’ continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.
 


   Who you are:
 

   The Business Success Manager plays a pivotal role in supporting our Canadian business applications and ensuring the satisfaction of our users with our applications and IT services. The Business Success Team is responsible for collecting feedback on enhancements and defects, capturing demands for new applications and IT services from business leaders, and assessing potential shared demands across departments. The team also plays a vital role in change management and communications with the business, ensuring smooth adoption of new applications and addressing change management concerns proactively.
 


   What you bring:
 

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business, or a related field, or equivalent combination of education and professional work experience.
Proven experience in a customer-facing technical/software support role.
Strong knowledge of current releases and proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
Excellent written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Self-motivated and results-driven, capable of working independently and as part of a team.



   Bonus skills and experience:
  

Experience with Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Power BI, SharePoint, and MS Teams.
Familiarity with general computer troubleshooting and debugging.
Knowledge of training material creation in various formats (Word, PDF, Video).
Experience logging support tickets in Service Now or a similar application.
Familiarity with documenting bugs/defects in Azure DevOps or a similar application.
Experience in software testing, creating test scripts, and leading user acceptance testing (UAT).
Previous experience in business analysis or change management is advantageous.
Knowledge of Agile processes and SQL would be beneficial.




   What success looks like:
  

Interact with users of our business applications, troubleshoot issues, and ad dress their concerns promptly and effectively using the rest of the IT Team.
Maximize user adoption and engagement by onboarding new customers, providing training, and offering continued support for technology product offerings.
Proactively identify potential change management issues and prepare strategies to address them during application rollouts.
Ability to work with multiple business lines.
Collaborate with business leaders to capture demands for new applications and IT services.
Assess demands from different departments to identify potential shared interests and synergies.

Proactively anticipates potential change management challenges and formulates strategies to mitigate them, promoting smooth adoption and integration of new applications.

Work closely with the Senior Manager and other team members to align with organizational goals and objectives.
Gather feedback from users on applications and services to identify areas for improvement and drive continuous enhancement efforts.

Overview: 
 
   At Colliers Project Leaders, we deliver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.
 




  Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the 
  possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 15,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 


 Your role



 Join our team as a Business Development Manager with the Québec and Eastern Ontario teams.
 


 In this role, you’ll join our team of experts who lead major capital building and infrastructure projects. In collaboration with the Vice-Presidents, Principals, Client Relationship Managers and designated Senior Project Managers, you will organize, motivate and lead the business unit’s development efforts. For that purpose, you will lead the production and implementation of the annual business development plan and the attainment of the annual sales targets (by business unit, program, and segment targets). You will be responsible for generating and responding to leads, keeping the sales funnel full and providing business development and sales coaching for the business unit’s teams as required. 
 Responsibilities: 
 
Instituting a disciplined Business Development process within the business unit primarily focused on prospective clients.
 Initiating and nurturing prospective client relationships to seek out and secure specific opportunities where Colliers Project Leaders experience and expertise can be leverage.
 Supporting marketing and sales efforts with existing clients, including exploring opportunities to sell new and expanded Colliers Project Leaders service offerings (Development Solutions, Driver, Infrastructure Services, Bid Document Reviews, )
 Motivating and monitoring the business unit team and their performance with respect to this business development activity in the business unit. 
Assisting in setting annual and monthly sales objectives and targets for the business unit along with the Vice President, Directors and Client Relationship Manag
 Helping manage the business unit annual sales plan and providing accurate, monthly updates, revisions, and modifications to the plan to senior managemen
 Integrating segment and program sales targets into the business unit business plans and assist the Vice President in meeting these targets.
 Developing and maintaining as required, detailed knowledge of the full spectrum of Colliers products and services.
 Participating proactively in business unit and national business development, marketing and sales meeting.
 Keeping abreast of what competitors are doing and offering in the business unit.
 Leveraging the CRM software through regular and consistent use of our Microsoft Connect software.
 Working with Marketing in the review and development of consistent, best of class marketing materials and strategies.
 Assessing networking and trade show opportunities from a business development perspective and assume a leadership role working within the business unit to plan, participate in, actively follow up on leads, and report back to senior management on the return on these investments.
 Where applicable, acting as proposal lead from receipt of RFP to submission of the finished product to the client. Also provides input on all and/or leading certain applicable, major business unit proposal submissions.
 Supporting the fulfillment of Colliers Project Leaders staffing requirements, specifically project management staff.
 Qualifications: 
 
University Degree in Business Administration or equivalent combination of post-secondary education and industry experience.
 Preferably has been a Business Development manager in the project management, design and construction or real estate industry and ideally the project management consulting industry.
 Minimum 5 years’ experience in a Business Development role.
 Strong leadership qualities and ability to effectively influence and persuade management, colleagues, and clients and prospective clients.
 A commitment to providing intrinsic and extrinsic value in each client interaction.
 Demonstrated negotiating, written and verbal communication skills, in French and English, with an emphasis on listening skills.
 The ability to lead a team in the development and delivery of winning proposals.
 Has assisted with the development and has executed tactical sales plans including regularly exceeding quotas and account objectives.
 Ability to follow policies and processes, yet remain flexible, entrepreneurial and highly client focused.
 Involved in national industry and trade associations.
 Computer literate (including use of CRM systems, Excel, Word, Power Point).
 Fluency in both French and English is a requirement as this role will involve working with people and clients in Eastern Ontario as well as Quebec
