 Chez Colliers Maîtres de projets, nous livrons des solutions en gestion de projets dans le domaine de la construction de bâtiments et d’infrastructures pour répondre aux besoins de nos clients à travers l’industrie. Notre travail fait une différence en optimisant les collectivités et en améliorant la vie des gens qui y vivent. Cela nous passionne!
 




  Nous sommes déterminés à concrétiser la vision de nos clients, ce qui nous pousse à regarder bien au-delà de l'immédiat, vers toutes ces 
  possibilités que nous pouvons réaliser avec eux dans le futur. Nous avons plus de 15 000 projets complétés à notre actif - Ces projets contribuent encore aujourd’hui à la croissance de collectivités durables, progressistes et inclusives.
 


 Votre rôle



 La personne sélectionnée amènera une vaste expérience en leadership de projets et sera à même de démontrer un portfolio de projets infrastructurels divers en termes de champs d’actions et de complexités. Idéalement vous détiendrez à la fois un statut en règle avec l’OIQ, une certification PMP et de l’expérience en tant que représentant du propriétaire ou dans un environnement de services professionnels concentré sur les projets d’infrastructures publiques majeures. Nous avons besoin d'une personne qui réside ou qui est prête à se relocaliser en Mauricie, au Québec.
  Responsabilités:
 


 Représentez les intérêts de vos clients en les aidant à atteindre leurs objectifs stratégiques de développement en exerçant vos compétences en gestion de projets et votre expertise en révision de design
 Conseillez les clients en appliquant votre compréhension globale du design, de la construction et de l’opérationnalisation d’infrastructures publiques majeures
 Épaulez les clients à travers la mise en place, l’initiation, l’exécution, le suivi de performance et la gestion de la documentation de leurs projets
 Menez une équipe hautement qualifiée en les guidant vers des buts communs et en établissant divers niveaux d’autorité et canaux de communication
 Agissez en tant que point pivot entre Colliers Maîtres de projets et le client
 Menez des rencontres de projet et des visites de chantier afin d’identifier et de résoudre des problèmes en coordonnant les actions de multiples parties prenantes
 Œuvrez en tant qu’ultime responsable de la gestion de la relation avec vos clients dans le but de cultiver une relation de confiance avec ceux-ci
 Contribuez à la croissance stratégique de l’unité d’affaires des Services d’infrastructures
 Usez de votre leadership et de vos habiletés communicationnelles afin de rassembler les différentes parties prenantes et les équipes de projet
 Révisez le travail de vos pairs, mentorez et contribuez au développement de gestionnaires de projets et de personnel de soutien technique en ingénierie
 Prérequis: 
 
Un diplôme en ingénierie civile ou autre discipline de l’ingénierie reliée au poste
 Membre en règle de l’OIQ et certification PMP
 Minimum de 10 ans d’expérience en projets majeurs d'infrastructures publiques (conception, construction, livraison finale et opérationnalisation)
 Expérience étendue en gestion de projets au service direct de clients dans des milieux pertinents au poste
 Avoir mené et/ou contribué significativement à la préparation de requêtes de soumissions et à des processus complets de gestion d’appels d’offres publics
 Fortes aptitudes professionnelles de plusieurs modes de livraison dans les industries de la conception et de la construction
 Le leadership nécessaire pour influencer les décisions clés pouvant résoudre les problématiques des projets et des clients
 Excellentes capacités de présentation/communication verbale et écrite
 Bonnes capacités informatiques, incluant la planification d’horaire (MS Project)

Make your next move an expert one.
 

   At Colliers it’s not our success that sets us apart, it’s how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what’s right for our clients, people and communities.
 


   Why Colliers?
 

   Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers’ continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.
 


   Who We Are
 

   Colliers Strategy and Consulting Group has the largest dedicated real property strategy and consulting practice in Canada, supported by the country’s largest real estate services company.
 

   The Development Advisory team is a full-service real estate platform that has offices in Vancouver, Toronto and Calgary. Its pipeline of projects has a construction value exceeding $2 billion, and includes high-rise urban mixed-use towers, affordable housing communities, large-scale industrial warehouses, urban and suburban office buildings, and large-scale commercial land plays. Servicing both the public and private sectors, its clients include insurance companies, pension plans, private equity fund managers, corporations, family offices, and non-profits, universities and municipalities.
 

   Please note that this is a Hybrid Working Arrangement position out of our Vancouver, BC office.
 


   Who you are
 

   As a Senior Development Management Professional, you will lead research, business planning and financial analysis, development team composition and coordination, development approvals and construction coordination, policy, analytical and strategic support to the Strategy & Consulting team. This role requires a strategic and proactive thinker who can anticipate potential risks.
 


   What you bring
 



     Experience in the Commercial real estate sector, Residential real estate sector.
   


     5+ years of experience as a Construction Manager for a General Contractor
   


     Strong experience with multiple full cycle project management from business development to project close out.
   


     Experience with Multi-Residential Builds, or High-Rise Builds is a Must
   


     University degree in Architecture, Engineering, Urban Planning or Urban Land Economics.
   


     Exceptional analytical skills, good business judgement and strong ability to think through range of possibilities and scenarios and clearly communicate these possibilities to a wide range of parties.
   


     Knowledge of regulatory and planning processes and policies, Provincial Planning Act, current development processes and trends.
   


     Knowledge of various types of construction methodologies project management models and financial management as well as building codes, zoning bylaws and contract law.
   


     Strong management and organizational skills. Good communicator, motivated, diligent, energetic, and positive attitude.
   


     Ability to take direction and implement the development program in accordance with the project objectives.
   


     Proven success for building and sustaining strong relationships with team members and partners, including community stakeholders and government authorities.
   


     Conflict resolution skills consistent with Collier’s core values.
   



   Bonus skills and experience
 



     An MBA or Law degree would be considered an asset.
   



   What success looks like
 



     You have an ability to lead, monitor, and be accountable for successful completion of projects within budget, from project feasibility through to project close out, for assigned real estate projects, developing strong client relationships and acting as the client’s single point of contact throughout the entire project to achieve client’s development goals.
   




     You will oversee the procurements of design consultants in accordance with an approved pro forma and approved pre-development budget.
   




     You will review and approve the preparation of financing packages
   


     You will balance profit maximization while maintaining design quality.

Overview: 
 
   At Collier Project Leaders, we deliver capital project solutions to fulfill our clients’ needs across the built environment. The work we do makes a difference in communities and for the people who live there. We have a passion for it.
 




  Our commitment to realizing our clients' vision inspires us to look beyond the immediate – to the 
  possibilities of what we can achieve together. We are 15,000 projects and counting – improving lives and helping shape the growth of sustainable, progressive and inclusive communities.
 


 Your Role


 We’re looking for a Project Manager who is seeking the right opportunity to leverage their skills in the municipal and facility infrastructure services sector of our British Columbia business unit. You bring previous experience leading projects varying in scope and complexity in the delivery of municipal and provincial infrastructure projects including transportation systems such as roadways, bridges, railways and transit ways, water and wastewater management, and other infrastructure projects. You’ve become known as a trusted advisor to your clients and have built strong, lasting relationships with senior leaders and decision makers. Responsibilities: 
 
Develop strong client relationships and act as the client’s single point of contact throughout the project to achieve the client’s goals and objectives;
 Lead programs or work and large capital projects, varying in size and scope.
 Manage all stakeholders including both clients and consultants;
 Ensure that client expectations and satisfaction are met or exceeded on all projects and the client’s best interests are represented with respect to contractual and technical issues;
 Select and organize project teams and establish levels of authority and lines of communication;
 Lead the control of project related documents and deliver all work in accordance and compliance with Colliers Project Leaders Quality Management System and procedures;
 Chair project and site meetings, find resolution to issues and coordinate between multiple stakeholders;
 Maintain contact with existing and prospective clients and respond to business development and sales opportunities with support from the Business Development Team, Principal or Regional Vice President;
 Report on project status by means of schedule updates, meeting minutes, financial records and other reports;


 Provide oversight and leadership to the change management process, payment certificates and other contract or project related administrative documents.
 Qualifications: 
 
A university degree or diploma in engineering, architecture, construction management or quantity surveying (or an equivalent combination of academic and practical experience) 
5 - 7 years of project management experience, representing owners in the delivery of building facility and infrastructure developments.
 Demonstrable experience in the initiation, planning and delivery of complex municipal building and facility infrastructure projects
 Strong understanding of best practice Project Management methodologies and procedures within a PMO environment
 Effective client management and people management skills matched with the ability to effectively influence others and successfully resolve a variety of client and technical issues.
 Detail oriented leader with the ability to work in a process driven environment.
 Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
 Strong computer skills, including a working knowledge of scheduling (MS Project), word processing (Word) and spreadsheet (Excel) software applications
 Eng or PMP designation are an asset


 Don’t have every single qualification? We know that some people are less likely to apply for a job unless they are a perfect match. At Colliers Project Leaders, we’re not looking for “perfect matches.” We’re looking to welcome people to our diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but don’t have every single qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. Whether it’s this role or another one, you may be just the right candidate.
 


 What you can expect:


 An opportunity to truly impact our communities
 A flexible work environment
 A comprehensive onboarding experience
 Significant professional development, training, and a mentorship program
 A paid volunteer day
 An environment where people feel welcome, heard and included, regardless of their differences
 And much more!


 Join our team of difference-makers and help shape the growth of dynamic communities!

Survol: 
 
   Chez Colliers Maîtres de projets, nous livrons des solutions en gestion de projets dans le domaine de la construction de bâtiments et d’infrastructures pour répondre aux besoins de nos clients à travers l’industrie. Notre travail fait une différence en optimisant les collectivités et en améliorant la vie des gens qui y vivent. Cela nous passionne!
 




  Nous sommes déterminés à concrétiser la vision de nos clients, ce qui nous pousse à regarder bien au-delà de l'immédiat, vers toutes ces 
  possibilités que nous pouvons réaliser avec eux dans le futur. Nous avons plus de 15 000 projets complétés à notre actif - Ces projets contribuent encore aujourd’hui à la croissance de collectivités durables, progressistes et inclusives.
 


 Votre role



 Colliers Maîtres de projets est à la recherche d’un 
  Directeur ou d’une 
  Directrice possédant de solides compétences en développement des affaires. Vous ferez partie de l’équipe de direction des unités d’affaires du 
  Québec et serez responsable d’aligner et de mettre en œuvre les priorités et les initiatives de l’entreprise. Vous travaillerez dans une structure organisationnelle matricielle pour élaborer, orienter et évaluer l’exécution des stratégies de développement des affaires afin d’atteindre les cibles annuelles de croissance dans les pourcentages à deux chiffres, et ce, dans les objectifs de profitabilité préétablis. En tant que gestionnaire de personnel, vous aurez la responsabilité d’attirer, de garder en poste, de motiver et d’inspirer les employés de votre équipe de gestionnaires de projets.
  Responsabilités: 
 
 Leadership


 Attirer, garder en poste, motiver et inspirer nos talentueux professionnels de la gestion de projets et veiller à ce que tous les membres de l’équipe aient les qualifications, la formation et l’expérience nécessaires
 Définir l’orientation de l’équipe et la doter des capacités requises pour soutenir les besoins en ressources de notre entreprise
 Offrir régulièrement de l’encadrement et du mentorat à ses subordonnés directs en leur fournissant des commentaires constructifs, tout en les incitant à réaliser leurs ambitions professionnelles
 Informer le Vice-président du Québec de l’état des projets, des risques et des occasions clés avec exactitude et en temps opportun
 Soutenir et mettre en œuvre notre stratégie et nos initiatives d’entreprise
 Anticiper les tendances de l’industrie et décrire les répercussions qu’elles auront sur les besoins des clients à l’interne et à l’externe, dans le but d’élaborer des approches pour intervenir en conséquence.


 Développement des affaires


 Élaborer la stratégie de croissance diversifiée et le plan d’action tactique de l’équipe pour atteindre les objectifs de vente et de revenus d’honoraires établis pour l’année
 Adopter une approche stratégique pour rechercher, dénicher et obtenir de nouveaux clients, en partenariat avec l’équipe nationale de développement des affaires et les chefs de secteurs
 Revoir et mettre à jour les comptes et les ventes annuelles actualisées dans nos systèmes
 Amener l’équipe à participer activement à l’expansion de nos activités auprès de nos clients existants à l’aide de notre programme de gestion de comptes


 Identité de marché


 Participer à la communauté d’affaires locale et y exercer une présence unifiée, en faisant du réseautage et en s’employant activement à faire croître l’entreprise, à renforcer notre identité de marché et à dénicher les employés les plus talentueux
 Exercer un leadership éclairé, donner des conférences et participer activement à d’autres activités liées au marketing pour que notre entreprise soit reconnue comme la meilleure de sa catégorie


 Gestion financière


 Développer le sens des finances des membres de l’équipe. Examiner régulièrement la performance financière de l’équipe par rapport au budget et au plan d’affaires, et faire des dépenses d’affaires adéquates qui ont un motif et un objectif clairs
 Avoir une excellente compréhension de la comptabilisation des revenus et de la présentation des rapports, et soumettre des budgets et des prévisions réalistes afin de permettre une planification adéquate des activités
 Prérequis: 
 
Posséder au moins huit (8) ans d’expérience en leadership des opérations et du développement des affaires, de préférence dans une entreprise de services-conseils. Avoir acquis la capacité de conclure des ventes, de gérer une partie des résultats d’une unité d’affaires en fonction des principales mesures établies, de motiver et d’inspirer des équipes et de gérer les risques commerciaux
 Posséder des titres de compétence reconnus par l’industrie ou un MBA (ou une combinaison équivalente de formation et d’expérience)
 Avoir établi un solide réseau/une forte présence sur le marché (au sein d’associations sectorielles et commerciales d’envergure régionale) et avoir dirigé l’intégration des services et l'exploitation de nouvelles occasions de marché
 Démontrer d’excellentes aptitudes pour la communication verbale et écrite, l’animation et les présentations pour nos clients et les membres de notre propre organisation de tous les échelons, ainsi que la capacité à préparer des offres de services qui sont retenues
 Afficher et maintenir une attitude positive et énergique


 Vous n'avez pas toutes les qualifications requises? Nous savons que certaines personnes hésitent à postuler sur un emploi si elles ne correspondent pas exactement au profil énoncé dans l’offre d’emploi. Chez Colliers Maîtres de projets, nous ne cherchons pas le ‘’match parfait’’. Nous offrons un milieu de travail divers, inclusif et authentique, et nous y accueillons des personnes d’origines et de parcours variés. Par conséquent, si ce poste vous intéresse, mais que vous ne correspondez pas exactement au profil énoncé, postulez quand même! Que ce soit pour ce poste ou pour un autre, nous pourrions bien avoir besoin de vous!
 

 Ce qui vous attend :


 La possibilité d’avoir un impact positif réel sur nos collectivités clientes
 Un environnement de travail flexible
 Une expérience d’intégration à l’entreprise reconnue
 De nombreuses occasions de perfectionnement professionnel, de formation et de mentorat
 Une journée de bénévolat rémunérée au service de la cause de votre choix
 Un environnement où les gens se sentent réellement accueillis, écoutés et inclus, quelles que soient leurs particularités.
 Et bien plus encore!


 Joignez-vous à notre équipe de leaders de changement et participez à la croissance de collectivités dynamiques.



 Mentions



 Colliers Maîtres de projets fait partie de Colliers (NASDAQ, TSX : CIGI), une société de services professionnels et de gestion d'investissements diversifiée de premier plan, comptant plus de 17 000 professionnels opérant dans 63 pays.

   Pourquoi Colliers ?
 

   Colliers est une société dynamique qui compte sur votre expertise pour faciliter sa croissance continue en tant que leader du secteur. Notre culture agile et décentralisée vous offre de nombreuses possibilités pour découvrir nos activités et acquérir rapidement de l'expérience afin d'accélérer votre carrière.
 


   Description de l’emploi
 

   En tant qu'initiateur de prêts hypothécaires commerciaux, vous développerez, analyserez et recommanderez des placements de prêts hypothécaires commerciaux. Ce rôle consiste à développer un réseau interne et externe efficace pour attirer des clients potentiels et à coordonner les relations avec les clients pour générer des revenus supplémentaires. Parmi les autres responsabilités, notons l'assistance à la clôture de transactions, l'analyse d'autres transactions immobilières potentielles et la réalisation de projets spéciaux tels que l'évaluation de portefeuilles et la recherche d'investissements. Pour réussir dans ce rôle, il faudra identifier, négocier, structurer et fournir la souscription initiale pour des transactions commerciales uniques et complexes, en veillant à ce que les décisions et les recommandations de crédit soient conformes aux prêteurs financiers, tout en collaborant avec les agents immobiliers de Colliers International.
 


   Responsabilités :
 



     Travailler avec des partenaires de prêt pour créer une grande variété de prêts immobiliers commerciaux à travers le Canada, en mettant l'accent sur les premiers et deuxièmes prêts hypothécaires ainsi que sur les financements de construction, de relais et de dette subordonnée pour les promoteurs immobiliers, les constructeurs et les propriétaires. Agir en tant qu'expert en fournissant des informations sur le marché, l'industrie et le potentiel de vente, le cas échéant.
   


     Rencontrer régulièrement les clients et prospects et appliquer la stratégie et les performances de vente et de développement des relations auprès des clients actuels et potentiels du secteur immobilier, en proposant des solutions financières globales et complètes.
   


     Accompagner et soutenir les agents immobiliers de Colliers International, selon les besoins, lors de leurs échanges avec les clients (appels conjoints) et du développement des relations.
   


     Comprendre et respecter les politiques d'octroi de crédit relatives à la qualité et à la vérification des informations, à l'analyse, à la rentabilité et aux recommandations de crédit, et exécuter la vente de crédit et de services aux clients et prospects du secteur immobilier, selon les modalités prévues.
   


     Pour les nouveaux prospects, examiner et analyser les états financiers, les flux de trésorerie et la position du fonds de roulement, les plans d'affaires, les buts et les objectifs, etc. en formulant des suggestions et des alternatives qui atteignent ou dépassent les objectifs du client. Préparer des propositions, entreprendre des négociations avec des prospects et superviser les négociations avec les prêteurs externes relativement à la vente de produits et services immobiliers.
   


     Utiliser la technologie et les outils de rentabilité pour identifier et référer les opportunités de vente, en assurant une efficacité optimale
   


     Suivre les tendances, les prix et l'activité du marché et assurer une communication efficace en matière de valeur relative des classes d'actifs et d'opportunités au sein de l'équipe d'investissement
   


     Filtrer et analyser les investissements potentiels en matière de prêts hypothécaires commerciaux
   


     Effectuer une vérification préalable afin de s'assurer que l'investissement potentiel répond aux critères de souscription et au mandat approuvé
   



   Expérience :
 



     Au moins cinq ans d'expérience professionnelle, de préférence dans le domaine des investissements immobiliers
   


     Expérience en tant qu'initiateur de prêts hypothécaires
   


     Diplôme d’études supérieures en finances, en économie ou dans un domaine connexe
   


     Niveau intermédiaire à avancé en Excel, y compris la maîtrise des tableaux croisés dynamiques, PowerPoint et Word
   


     Solides compétences en matière de recherche, d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes
   


     Compréhension de la modélisation des flux de trésorerie actualisés, des principes fondamentaux de l'immobilier et des structures de capital
   


     Compétences exceptionnelles en matière de communication écrite et verbale
   


     Capacité à travailler de façon autonome et en tant que membre d'une équipe
   


     Flexibilité et capacité d'adaptation permettant de gérer des priorités et des initiatives multiples
   


     Optimiste, énergique et débrouillard

   Join our team as a Software Quality Assurance Analyst in Toronto, ON.
 


   Who you are:
 

   We are looking for a QA Analyst to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality. This includes designing and implementing tests, debugging, and assisting the development team in defining corrective actions. The QA Analyst will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics.
 


   The QA Analyst must monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to exceed quality standards.
 


   What you bring
 



     Bachelor's or higher degree in a quantitative field, such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Sciences, or Data Science or Certification in Data Science
   


     5 - 8+ years of experience working as a Quality Assurance analyst or in a related field.
   


     Proven work experience in software development
   


     Proven work experience in software quality assurance
   


     Experience in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases.
   


     Firsthand experience with both white box and black box testing
   


     Firsthand experience with automated testing tools
   


     Solid knowledge of SQL, scripting, and data analysis
   


     Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process. Specifically testing facilitation and execution in an agile environment
   


     Experience working in Azure DevOps to create and maintain.
   


     Test Cases
   


     Defects
   


     Business Analysis background is required to collaborate with Business Analysts to assist in creating and maintaining business requirements as necessary.
   



   Bonus skills and experience:
 



     Experience in Commercial Real Estate
   


     Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus.
   



   What success looks like:
 



     Creating and managing test strategy documents to define “Software Testing Approach” to achieve testing objectives.
   


     You will review requirements, specifications, and technical design documents with the project team to provide timely and meaningful feedback.
   


     You will create detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases.
   


     You are confident in your ability to estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities.
   


     You will perform a walkthrough of the test cases /test suites created with development team, BA, Business success team.
   


     You proactively create reports on testing status and communicate to team and leadership.
   


     You are confident in your ability to design, develop and execute automation scripts.
   


     You will Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs.
   


     You will chair and manage QA defect triage sessions with the project team.
   


     You will perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved.
   


     You will develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs.
   


     You will liaise/collaborate with internal teams (e.g., developers, team leads, business analysts) to identify system requirements.
   


     You will investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions.
   


     You will track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts.
   


     Leveraging testing tools and test strategies to ensure software quality.

Residential Leasing Agent
We are seeking a dependable, self-starter to join our Residential Leasing Team. In this role, you'll be responsible for facilitating the rental of residential suites. Your duties will include answering rental inquiries via phone calls, emails, texts, and online booking requests as directed by the Property Manager.
Providing detailed information about the rental property will be a key part of your role. This can include topics such as rental rates, lease terms, suite availability, incentives, pet policies, building amenities, and neighborhood information. You will schedule and conduct showings, either in-person or through video tours (if available), and relay feedback from these showings to the Property Manager or Property Administrator.
In cases where you can't accommodate a showing due to scheduling conflicts, you will collaborate with the Property Manager to ensure it happens. Another aspect of your role will be instructing prospective tenants on the application process and reporting conditions of all vacant suites available for rent. You may also contribute to social media posts under the guidance of the Property Manager. There may also be other duties as required.
What you bring:

Grade 12 minimum, post-secondary education is considered an asset
Professional approach and demeanor as a representative of Colliers in the community
Must have a valid driver’s license and vehicle
Previous sales or marketing experience or training considered an asset
An excellent customer service approach to handle daily interactions with potential renters/customers
Experience using email
Familiarity with social media mediums such as Instagram, Facebook and Twitter considered an asset
Ability to take initiative and deal intuitively with situations, work well under pressure and with minimal direction/supervision
Independent, self-starter, team player
Excellent organizational, time management and prioritization skills
Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to deal effectively and pleasantly with stressful situations
Willing to show suites on any day in the week which may include Saturdays and/or Sundays, and may include evening showings

Please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview. Thank you for your interest in the Leasing Agent position.

Company events
Dental care
Employee assistance program

Paid time off

French not required

property management: 1 year (preferred)

   At Colliers it’s not our success that sets us apart, it’s how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what’s right for our clients, people and communities.
 


   Why Colliers?
 

   Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers’ continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.
 


   Who you are
 

   You are a customer-focused compensation professional with strong project management and communication abilities. You have the ability to influence and collaborate with various business functions and geographic locations. You thrive in ambiguity and demonstrate strong judgement in resolving issues. You are looking for an opportunity to lead and administer multiple compensation programs with an impactful team. Sound like you? Apply now!
 


   What you bring
 



     Bachelors degree in Business with a concentration in Human Resources, or related field or comparable degree, or equivalent experience, MBA and CCP preferred
   


     Minimum 5-7 years of compensation design experience with 1-2 years experience at the manager level preferred.
   


     Experience in leading complex compensation programs, including base pay, variable pay, equity compensation, Job Architecture or Job Evaluation
   


     Experience in salary structure or incentive plan design
   


     Knowledge of US and Canada laws and regulations related to compensation
   


     Advanced knowledge of Excel, including handling large databases and creating Excel charts
   


     Strong knowledge of compensation benchmarking, survey participation, and salary recommendations
   


     Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze data and draw conclusions
   


     Strong project management skills with the ability to run multiple projects simultaneously
   


     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong relationships
   


     Experience working with senior leadership and influencing decision-making
   



   Bonus skills and experience
 



     Experience with Workday
   


     Certified Compensation Professional (CCP)
   



   What success looks like
 



     Design and implement competitive compensation programs that align with the Colliers’ overall goals and objectives
   


     Analyze and evaluate job descriptions to determine appropriate salary ranges and market competitiveness
   


     Provide direction and support to HR business partners, managers, and employees on compensation-related matters, e.g. advise on salary recommendations for promotions, lateral movements, etc.
   


     Oversee survey participation and keep abreast of salary survey and trend policies and practices in partnership with consulting organizations
   


     Act as a project SME for critical projects such as integrations, transitions, etc. to ensure alignment in compensation structure for acquired entities with Colliers
   


     Work closely with HR business partners to ensure compensation programs support the recruitment, retention, and development of talent
   


     Work with Finance and Accounting to ensure data accuracy in bonus and merit plan assignment
   


     Ensure compliance with all applicable laws and regulations related to compensation programs, pay transparency and pay equity
   


     Compensation Processes:
   


     Lead and manage the day-to-day administration of compensation programs, including the annual merit review process and bonus programs
   


     Act as a Project Lead for the Job Architecture project in partnership with external consultants, the internal project team, business stakeholders, and senior leadership
   


     Ad-hoc Projects:
   


     Support with compensation philosophy design
   


     Support with data integrations of acquired entities into Workday
   


     Conduct Workday testing for functionalities, on a need basis

 Are you a highly motivated self-starter with hands-on experience in the operation of plant equipment? Are you looking for an opportunity to broaden your knowledge and progress in increasing levels of responsibility? We want to hear from you!
 

   In this role, you will work with a team of talented, operators overseeing the day-to-day operations of plant and field, preparing equipment for maintenance, troubleshooting, and working with the control room for plant optimization and maximizing plant efficiencies.
 


   Minimum Requirements:
 



     Three years of experience in plant operations; experience in heavy oil processing, sour gas processing, water treatment/power plants or refinery operations
   


     High School Diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)
   


     A valid driver's license and a clean driving record
   


     Alignment with our values of safety above all else, respect, raise the bar, commitments matter and do the right thing.
   



   Key Accountabilities:
 



     Follow all operating processes and procedures during operations to ensure the safety of our people, equipment, and the environment.
   


     Prepare and complete daily area logs and communicate significant changes and findings in a timely manner
   


     Ensure timely action and process adjustments during plant upsets that are consistent with operational objectives and target outputs
   


     Prepare equipment and systems for maintenance and commissioning
   



   Location & other key details
 



     You will work out of our Fort Hills Plant in Fort McMurray, Alberta
   


     The shift schedule is a 7 days on / 7 days off rotation (12-hour shifts)
   


     You will be on a Fly-In-Fly-Out Rotation from one of the approved hubs of Edmonton or Calgary or a Bus-In-Bus-Out of Fort McMurray.

 We're looking for a Geologist to complete daily field geological activities supporting Mine Operations for the Syncrude site.
 
 In this dynamic role, you will apply a broad spectrum of geological principles to support the geological activities.
 

   Minimum Requirements:
 

 Two years of operations support (production) geology roles
 An undergraduate degree in Geosciences
 Geologist or Geologist-in-Training. Registered or immediately eligible for membership with the Association of Professional Engineers, Geologists and Geophysicists of Alberta (APEGA)
 Familiarity with regional/local Geology and McMurray Formation lithofacies
 Prior exposure to Microstation, Surpac and dispatch software (Wenco) preferred
 Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite of applications
 A valid driver’s licence and a clean driving record



   Responsibilities:
 

 Daily mine tours of shovel pits
 Daily ore grade calculations and compilation of ore reports
 Estimating ore grade/fines and ore quality control at operating shovel faces
 Delineating ore/waste boundaries in shovel pits based upon field observations and interpretation of geological data (cross-sections, maps and block model)
 Advise on geological recommendations to maintain desired ore blend
 Collect samples of oil sand material from ore pits and stockpiles as requested
 Investigate geological hazards or anomalies observed in the mine and report on findings
 Provide support to investigations of bitumen recovery excursions



   Location and other Key Details:
 

 You will work out of a Syncrude Mildred Lake location in Fort McMurray
 The shift schedule is a 6 on /6 off rotation; 12-hour shift
 Must be physically fit to work outdoors and able to operate a 4x4 light vehicle in a mining environment
 Our engineering roles follow internal compensation guidelines and the pay band will generally be based years of experience and scope of work

 Do you want to be a part of a fully integrated emergency response team at our Fort Hills site? You will use your emergency response expertise to carry out a dynamic array of emergency duties on a highly motivated team to protect our assets and the environment
 

   Minimum Requirements:
 

Previous experience in an emergency response role in both medical and fire fields
National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) 1001 Level 1 and II IFSAC/Pro Board Certification
Advanced Care Paramedic (ACP) certification from the Alberta College of Paramedics and applicants with Registered Nurse certification in Alberta or Primary Care Paramedic (PCP)certification will be considered based on the pool of applicants
Certification and experience in one of the following areas is preferred: NFPA 1072 Hazmat Awareness, Operation, and or Technician, NFPA 1006 Rope Awareness, Operations, and or Technician
A High School Diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)
A valid driver’s license and a clean driving record – a valid class three and four driver's license with Q (air brakes) is preferred



   Responsibilities:
 

Respond to all emergency incidents on our site, including downgrading events, medical, rescue, motor vehicle accidents, and fire and gas alarms
Provide world-class medical care for occupational and non-occupational injuries and illnesses
Perform and lead daily equipment inspections
Show dedication and initiative in daily and weekly safety meetings
Self-driven to develop and improve emergency response capabilities on a daily basis, covering array of skill sets deemed critical within a dual-service emergency services department



   Location and other Key Details:
 

This position is located at our Fort Hills Location, 90kms north of Fort McMurray
This position has been identified as safety-sensitive
The shift schedule is a seven days on / seven days off rotation (7 days, 7 off, 7 nights, 7 off hours 0600 – 1800 and 1800- 0600)
You will be required to perform some heavy lifting, use ladders, and work on elevated work sites such as scaffolds, towers, and within confined spaces
You will be required to complete an annual fitness evaluation successfully
This is a 12 month contract role

En vous joignant à Suncor, vous travaillerez pour l’un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada qui offre un avenir prometteur aux personnes talentueuses. Nos perspectives d’emploi évoluent avec nos activités. Notre milieu de travail repose sur une équipe dynamique de professionnels qui possèdent des aptitudes et des compétences diversifiées.
 
 Êtes-vous à la recherche d'un nouveau défi et intéressé à vous joindre à notre groupe de maintenance et de fiabilité à notre raffinerie de Montréal? Nous embauchons un technicien en instrumentation pour installer, entretenir, dépanner et réparer notre équipement d'instrumentation tel que, pression, débit, niveau, température, pH, valve de contrôle, détecteur de gaz, etc.
 

   Ce poste vous offre un encadrement dans un environnement d'équipe collaboratif et votre développement sera encouragé. Vous participerez aux discussions d'analyse et serez un contributeur et vous ajouterez de la valeur.
 


   Exigences minimales :
 



     Détenir un diplôme d’études collégiales en instrumentation et contrôles ou équivalent
   


     Parler couramment français et avoir une connaissance fonctionnelle de l'anglais écrit et parlé
   


     Aptitudes à travailler de façon sécuritaire et avoir une bonne analyse des risques dans un environnement industriel
   



   Responsabilités :
 



     Mettre en œuvre des programmes et affectations d’entretien préventif et prédictif pour les systèmes d’instrumentation
   


     Effectuer la planification des travaux, y compris l’évaluation et la sélection du matériel
   


     Entretenir et réparer les différentes composantes d’un système de contrôle distribué (DCS) et automate programmable (PLC)
   


     Utiliser les différents logiciels afin d’établir la communication avec les instruments
   


     Utiliser et mettre à jour les différents plans instrumentation tel que dessin de boucle et P&ID
   



   Emplacement et autres détails importants :
 



     Vous travaillerez à notre raffinerie de Montréal, située au 11701, rue Sherbrooke Est
   


     L'horaire de travail est deux jours, deux jours de congé, trois nuits, deux jours de congé, deux jours, trois jours de congé ; deux nuits, deux jours de congé, trois jours, deux jours de congé, deux nuits, trois jours de congé; quarts de 12 heures
   


     Prêt à travailler en temps supplémentaire
   


     Ce poste a été désigné critique pour la sûreté
   


     Capacité de travailler dans des conditions climatiques rigoureuses et dans les hauteurs
   



   Pourquoi Suncor?
 

   Les activités de Suncor sont reliées notamment au développement, à la production et à la valorisation des sables bitumineux, à la production pétrolière et gazière extracôtière, au raffinage du pétrole au Canada et aux États-Unis, et aux réseaux de distribution des ventes au détail et des ventes en gros Petro-Canada de l'entreprise (comprenant la Transcanadienne électrique, un réseau pancanadien de bornes de recharge rapide de véhicules électriques). Suncor développe des ressources pétrolières tout en faisant progresser la transition vers un avenir sobre en carbone grâce à des investissements dans l'électricité, les carburants renouvelables et l'hydrogène.
 


   Grâce à notre solide stratégie de croissance et à notre approche bien établie à l'égard du développement durable, de l'excellence opérationnelle, de la discipline en matière d'investissements, de la technologie et de l'innovation, nous vous offrons des bases solides pour continuer de faire avancer votre carrière. Nous vous permettons de profiter d'occasions intéressantes où vous pourrez apprendre, apporter votre contribution et vous perfectionner en occupant divers postes qui feront avancer votre carrière – ce qui présente des perspectives d’avenir extrêmement prometteuses. Nous voulons approfondir notre engagement à l'égard de l'inclusion et de la diversité et créer un milieu de travail respectueux.
 


   Nous sommes un employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi qui encourage toutes les personnes qualifiées à postuler. Nous sommes déterminés à offrir un environnement de travail diversifié et inclusif où chaque employé se sent valorisé et respecté. Nous étudierons au besoin la prise de mesures d'adaptation en matière d'accessibilité. Consultez notre objectif social pour en savoir plus sur la façon dont nous travaillons pour renforcer la confiance et le respect mutuels avec les Autochtones au Canada.

 Do you envision yourself leading others on a successful path of development? Are you known for your strengths in leadership and ability to motivate a team? If yes, we have the role for you!
 

   As Team Lead Operations (Shift Supervisor), you will lead a team of 15-20 operators ensuring efficient execution of work, performance management, and resolving operational issues. You will lead with focus on worker health & safety, as well as the environmentally responsible and reliable operations of the Upper, Mid and Lower Plants. The Burrard Products Terminal provides a critical refined products link to domestic product supply in the lower mainland of British Columbia and access to export markets for Suncor’s distillate production.
 

 Minimum Requirements:
 



     5 years or more of post certification experience in refining/terminal operations or related Industrial, Utility or Oil and Gas processing experience
   


     3 years or more of prior supervisory or leadership roles such as team lead, foreperson, unit lead and/or panel operator, preferably in a unionized environment
   


     A valid driver’s licence and a clean driving record
   


     4th Class Power Engineering certification (or higher)
   


     A High School Diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)
   


 Responsibilities:
 



     Collaborate with site leaders to ensure the safe and reliable operations of Terminal including process units, fire protection and safety systems, and that products are blended to the appropriate quality specifications and transported as per plan
   


     Foster collaboration and create an inclusive and respectful work environment
   


     Ensure safe work practices, the collective agreement, and corporate policies are administered in a fair and consistent manner
   


     Monitor environmental regulations/requirements, and report any non-compliances
   


     Provide input to Maintenance team regarding priority, requirements, risks and operational impacts
   


     Lead daily toolbox talks and monthly shift safety meetings with employees and follow up on items raised
   


     Participate in HAZOP reviews and develop JSAs
   


     Lead effective incident reporting and investigations

 Avez-vous des connaissances approfondies des procédures de l’entrepôt et êtes-vous intéressé à vous joindre à Suncor à titre de technicien(ne) d’entrepôt?
 

   Relevant du superviseur de l’entrepôt, les techniciens d’entrepôt reçoivent, entreposent et distribuent le matériel requis pour notre raffinerie de Montréal.
 


   Exigences minimales :
 



     Posséder une expérience minimum de 3 années dans un milieu d’approvisionnement et d’entreposage
   


     Connaissances approfondies des procédures de l’entrepôt
   


     Expérience dans la gestion et prise d’inventaire
   


     Expérience de l’environnement MM de SAP
   


     Expérience avec la technologie RFID
   


     Expérience en contrôle de qualité du matériel (QA/QC)
   


     Qualifications valide pour la conduite d’un chariot élévateur
   


     Très bonnes compétences en informatique (Excel, Word, Outlook)
   


     Aptitudes démontrées dans le service à la clientèle et à travailler en équipe
   


     Bon sens de l’organisation et sens du détail
   


     Diplôme études secondaire ou équivalent
   


     Parler couramment français et avoir une connaissance fonctionnelle de l'anglais écrit et parlé
   



   Responsabilités :
 



     Effectuer les entrées de données et toute transaction relative à la mise en disponibilité du matériel.
   


     Identifier les besoins opérationnels dans SAP pour assembler le matériel des travaux de routine ou des arrêts d’unités
   


     Maintenir de bonnes relations avec les fournisseurs et clients internes
   


     Effectuer toute autre tâche nécessaire à la bonne marche des opérations de l’entrepôt
   



   Emplacement et autres détails importants :
 



     Vous travaillerez à notre raffinerie de Montréal, située au 11701, rue Sherbrooke Est
   


     Les heures de travail normales sont de 40 heures par semaine, du lundi au vendredi
   


     Vous devez être disposé à effectuer des heures supplémentaires, au besoin
   



   Pourquoi Suncor?
 

   Les activités de Suncor sont reliées notamment au développement, à la production et à la valorisation des sables bitumineux, à la production pétrolière et gazière extracôtière, au raffinage du pétrole au Canada et aux États-Unis, et aux réseaux de distribution des ventes au détail et des ventes en gros Petro-Canada de l'entreprise (comprenant la Transcanadienne électrique, un réseau pancanadien de bornes de recharge rapide de véhicules électriques). Suncor développe des ressources pétrolières tout en faisant progresser la transition vers un avenir sobre en carbone grâce à des investissements dans l'électricité, les carburants renouvelables et l'hydrogène.
 


   Grâce à notre solide stratégie de croissance et à notre approche bien établie à l'égard du développement durable, de l'excellence opérationnelle, de la discipline en matière d'investissements, de la technologie et de l'innovation, nous vous offrons des bases solides pour continuer de faire avancer votre carrière. Nous vous permettons de profiter d'occasions intéressantes où vous pourrez apprendre, apporter votre contribution et vous perfectionner en occupant divers postes qui feront avancer votre carrière – ce qui présente des perspectives d’avenir extrêmement prometteuses. Nous voulons approfondir notre engagement à l'égard de l'inclusion et de la diversité et créer un milieu de travail respectueux.
 


   Nous sommes un employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi qui encourage toutes les personnes qualifiées à postuler. Nous sommes déterminés à offrir un environnement de travail diversifié et inclusif où chaque employé se sent valorisé et respecté. Nous étudierons au besoin la prise de mesures d'adaptation en matière d'accessibilité. Consultez notre objectif social pour en savoir plus sur la façon dont nous travaillons pour renforcer la confiance et le respect mutuels avec les Autochtones au Canada.

Junior Physicist

 Candu Energy Inc. is looking for a Junior Physicist to be a part of our team in the Fuel and Physics department supporting the design of new nuclear power plants and the operation, refurbishment, or waste management and decommissioning of existing CANDU nuclear power plants.

 Location – Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the team:

 Plan, perform, document, review, and verify technical analyses that includes:
   
 the use of radiation transport codes,
 performing dose calculations, and/or
 application / development of activity transport models.

 Acquire skills through instructor-led courses, on-the-job training, or self-study assignments.
 Present results to internal and/or external stakeholders.
 Collate, assimilate, and summarize results from existing analyses.
 Follow the relevant procedures, guidelines and standards governing the work being performed.
 Develop, adapt, or modify computer codes for specific applications and to solve new problems.
 Attend and participate in meetings at the office, remotely, or at client sites as needed.

 The ideal candidate:

 Undergraduate degree in Physics, Engineering Physics, Nuclear Engineering, Health Physics or equivalent.
 Knowledge of radiation transport, dose calculations, activity transport and/or dispersion models through education or experience.
 Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office suite of programs especially Excel and Word.
 Ability to multi-task, prioritize work, adhere to schedules, and respond to changing demands.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present technical material effectively.
 Good interpersonal skills with the ability foster and maintain working relationships.

 Willing to be designated as a Nuclear Energy Worker.

 Additional Preferred Qualifications:

 Postgraduate degrees or equivalent qualifications in Physics, Engineering Physics, Nuclear Engineering, Nuclear Chemistry, or equivalent.
 Familiarity with CANDU design.

 Experience applying radiation transport codes (e.g. MCNP) and/or performing dose calculations.
 Eligible to obtain license for nuclear software that falls under the US Department of Energy 10 CFR part 810 radiation physics codes, such as MCNP and SCALE.
 Experience working at a nuclear facility, performing radiation transport and shielding calculations.
 Experience in code development including source control and testing.
 Knowledge of the nuclear regulatory framework in Canada.

Come Build Your Career at Aecon!
As a Canadian leader in infrastructure development, Aecon is safely and sustainably building what matters for future generations to thrive! We lead some of the most impactful infrastructure projects of our generation, at the forefront of transformational change in transportation and energy, and partnering every day to build, connect, power, and strengthen our communities.
At Aecon, you can count on:

Safety First. Our number one core value. If we can’t do it safely, we don’t do it at all.
Integrity. We lead by example, with humility and courage.
Accountability. We’re passionate about delivering on our commitments.
Inclusion. We provide equitable opportunities for everyone.





  We lead the infrastructure industry with purpose, and our people are at the heart of everything we do. So, we invest in our people, just like they invest in us!
 


At Aecon we:

Ensure you and your family receive the services needed to support your mental, emotional, and physical well-being

Are committed to supporting and investing in inclusive work environments, through initiatives like Equity, Diversity & Inclusion training, our Aecon Women in Trades and Aecon Diversity in Trades programs, and our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to ensure we are building inclusion into every aspect of our culture at Aecon.
Are a leader in sustainable construction. With a strong commitment to operating responsibility by minimizing our impact on the environment and surrounding communities.




Our business success relies on strong execution and continuous improvement – driven by the diversity, expertise and teamwork of our people. We’re always searching the globe for innovative, collaborative minds to join our best-in-class Aecon community!



 About Us


  The Shoreline Power Group is a fully integrated Joint Venture of Aecon, United and AtkinsRéalis located in Kincardine, Ontario. Shoreline Power Group is the centerpiece of the Major Component Replacement (MCR) program which replaces the main components of 6 reactors at the Bruce Power Nuclear Generating Station. The scope of work includes the removal and replacement of calandria tubes, pressure tubes, and feeders as well as construction management and trade labor. This project is part of Bruce Power’s Life Extension Program, which will allow Bruce Power’s CANDU units to continue to operate safely through to 2064.

What You Bring To The Team

Basic knowledge of engineering terminology;
Considerable experience working with and understanding drawings and documentation;
Proficient in using Electronic Document Management Systems

Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 You might know AtkinsRéalis for the great work we do across our wide variety of projects. We're proud to say this is thanks to our people's diversity of thought, expertise, and knowledge. And when you join us, you'll be a part of this genuinely collaborative environment, where everyone's voice is valued and treated equally.

 We're passionate about what we do, but we don't take ourselves too seriously. Simply put, this is a great place to be. So, when it comes to your life outside of work, ask us about our flexible and remote working policies designed to help you get the most out of life.

 The role we are seeking to fill sits within the growing Asset Management team in our Infrastructure Operations & Maintenance business. Building on our success in infrastructure operations and maintenance, and with the support of our world class global asset management service delivery teams, we are looking to inform, grow, and serve the Canadian asset management business process transformation market, as well as our own internal operations projects, particularly in rail, highways, and municipal infrastructure markets. We create a culture and environment to inspire our people, ensure collaboration with our clients and continue to shape the future of asset management. We are passionate about the importance of net zero and the role that transportation must play in meeting the global requirements.

 The Canadian asset management is a growing field, with key legislation and industry best practices driving an increased awareness of the value of modern asset management principles.

 Significant growth is being driven by long-term funding commitments from Government and private industry, in recognition of the critical role that asset management plays in supporting long term economic growth. Our clients face key challenges in defining and delivering their long-term programs, maximizing the value of assets, and embracing new technologies so that they can deliver the best outcomes for users and for the economy.

 These challenges are driving the need for change in the way our clients do business enabling them to deliver their investments and meet strategic priorities.

 Our Team thrives on:
 Based in our Capital and O&M business unit, our Asset Management team is supporting leaders to think differently by helping them understand their sources of value, re-aligning their strategic priorities, providing support to re-organize their businesses and develop processes to support new operations. We help uncover and then overcome cultural and organizational challenges which are hindering success.

 We do this by:
 Putting people at the heart of all we do and taking time to understand what really matters.

 Respecting knowledge and complementing it with our own, and committing to valuing, inspiring, and empowering everyone to be successful-ensuring Organizations, projects and programs have the best chance to deliver on their commitments.

 We believe that both our own and our client’s organizations, projects and programs thrive because of people; their culture and strength of relationships. Engaged and motivated people, in the right environment and with the tools, capabilities and recognition they need, will thrive.

 The individuals:
 We are looking to recruit talented individuals that are passionate about leading excellence in transformation and complex business change. Like our team, these individuals will take pride in delivering an authentic and hands-on-approach to understand our client’s business challenges and help achieve their ambitions.

 The roles we hope to fill will enhance our existing Asset Management consulting expertise: strategy setting; organizational and operational design; implementing and managing transformational change programs, including cultural and behavioural leadership; business performance improvement; benefits realization; and complex stakeholder engagement.

 You will have responsibility for managing client and stakeholder facing work from the outset, building, and fostering a network of professional working relationships, where you understand and help our clients solve multi-faceted business issues. As a highly skilled and experienced member of the team you will lead projects and workstreams, bringing together the skills of the team and wider business, to deliver measurable outcomes.

 You will be expected to support achievement of challenging operational and consultancy revenue targets, undertaking bid management and delivery activity, and providing input to the development and delivery of our transportation strategy.

 The role is based on our Toronto office. Travel to attend client sites across Canada and occasionally overseas, as required, is key.

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 Your role wihtin the team:
 We are looking for people that bring a blend of consulting capabilities and a deep understanding of transformation techniques to suit different situations. These might include:

 Strategy development-both business and delivery.
 Operational improvement and organizational development.
 Business process improvement-continuous improvement.
 Change and implementation management.
 Cultural and behavioural development.
 Research and analysis.
 Business process transformation project management.


 In particular we are seeking individuals with excellent client-facing experience developing and leading teams to deliver:

 Operational Effectiveness-driving identification and realization of operational effectiveness improvement plans and/or operational excellence strategy.
 Operating Models-designing and implementing new and enhanced models to increase value.
 Business process re-engineering-supporting clients to rethink the way they work to deliver measurable improvement.
 Experience in delivering asset management process transformation projects is a benefit but is not required.


 Why pick AtkinsRéalis as an employer? 
Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Have 5+ years of experience in consulting services to clients.
 Hold at least a degree or equivalent qualification (post-graduate qualification and relevant technical certifications in change/business development activity would be desirable).
 Be able to lead across competing tasks and operate successfully even when under pressure.
 Be a highly collaborative individual, developing and maximizing the value of stakeholder networks within and outside AtkinsRéalis, including with our market facing teams; and, have well-developed emotional intelligence with the ability to flex your style to suit different stakeholders and support others in your team to do the same as part of wider development activity.
 It is also essential that you can provide technical assurance of other’s deliverables, have excellent written communication skills, and can present, deliver, and oversee outcomes which are compelling, accurate, and engaging both to clients and in support of our business development and work winning activities.
 Have a background in transportation and/or municipal infrastructure.


 Have experience with ISO55000 certification and industry best practices in Asset Management.
 Hold a Certified Management Consultant (CMC) or equivalent accreditation.
 Hold a project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent accreditation.

 About AtkinsRéalis
 Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. The breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital.

Student Project Coordinator

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 Location – Mississauga, ON.

 How will you contribute to the team:

 The position of Student Project Coordinator will be a junior contributing role to assist Project Managers or Senior Technical Leads in the execution of periodic reactor inspection programs, major nuclear refurbishment projects, or new-nuclear projects. The successful candidate will join a mature team of project and engineering personnel, and will be assigned tasks in the areas of engineering, engineering administration and/or project administration.
 The employee will be required to obtain security clearance for CANDU Energy Inc. facilities and possibly for our customer sites. This activity typically requires extended time for someone who is not a citizen of Canada, so Canadian citizenship is an advantage.
 The employee may be assigned to short-term field service assignments on CANDU Field Services projects, typically during customers’ outages and at their sites. During these assignments, the employee may be requested to perform work in a radiological work environment such as set-up and operation activities of certain tooling. In this event, the employee will be required to Nuclear Energy Worker qualified and trained to CANDU Energy’s RP program as “Group 3” worker and with our customer’s onboarding process, as well as receiving practical training related to the project. Physical fitness and hands-on experience with tools and equipment will be an advantage.
 The employee will be expected to perform tasks and activities commensurate with their level of experience and familiarity with the technology, while supervised by more senior engineering (and EIT) staff. Responsibilities will include activities such as:
 Organizing, hosting, minuting regular project and/or customer meetings for senior staff.
 Collecting data and status for the purpose of regular schedule updates.
 Updating project Key Performance Indexes
 Maintaining a running log of project lessons learned
 Minor document revisions, including learning to navigate the various SNC-Lavalin / CANDU administrative systems (e.g. ProAct and MyTrak, Aconex)
 Performing any other administrative or analytical review or investigation as directed
 Self-study of the requisite quality procedures required to perform typical engineering and/or project administration tasks.

Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 CANDU performs Reactor inspection and maintenance services to the fleet of CANDU nuclear reactors operating around the world. In addition, we also provide mid-life Reactor Refurbishment services to all of our CANDU customers. These activities typically involve the design, build, deployment and maintenance of specialized robotic tooling used for activities performed within the primary heat transport system (fuel channels, feeders, and steam generators). Our technical staff are experts in the design and use of complex tooling systems deployed during reactor outages in a radiation environment.

 The Project Coordinator will report to the Project Manager or the General Manager and will be responsible for the coordination of engineering, procurement, and construction work. This role will require continuous communication with all project team members, and will be responsible for identifying, planning, and implementing various scopes of work.

 The candidate is also responsible for maintaining accurate and up-to-date project data on a daily basis, compiling monthly reports, and facilitating daily communication with the Project Manager and Engineering team. This role relies heavily on collaboration with cross-functional teams and assisting the Project Manager in various tasks to ensure project success.

 For growth of the candidate, we may also rotate the successful employee through short-term assignments in other CANDU Energy or AtkinsRéalis Nuclear project teams, to expose them to broader parts of the organization. Rotations may include a supporting role in the preparation and execution of CANDU Field Services work. In this event, the incumbent will be responsible for supporting field services teams and ensuring all aspects of work are performed in accordance with contracted scope, and may be requested to perform work on-site, including working in the customer's reactor vault.

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the Team:

 Responsible for assigned scope of the project and accountable for performing duties that facilitate work progressing with safety, quality, schedule, cost, and contractual requirements.
 Liaise with key stakeholders as required generally including engineering, construction, quality client & subcontractors.
 Update and maintain project-related information in programs such as Excel, including project timelines and task progress.
 Monitor task assignments, deadlines, and dependencies, and report any deviations for timely resolutions.
 Assist in the creation and maintenance of project documentation, including monthly reports and status updates.
 Facilitate daily communication with Engineering team members to gather project updates and ensure project success.
 Maintain a positive relationship with client project counterparts.
 Responsible for helping implement the project schedule for assigned engineering, procurement, construction segments of the project.
 Coordinates the delivery of project deliverables.
 Ensure work is performed within quality program requirements.
 Ensure a strong nuclear safety culture is reinforced continuously.

The technician will have to install and configure workstations, software, as well as various peripherals. He/she will also provide technical support for any incidents or requests that are assigned to him/her. He/she will also participate in different projects related to workstations.

 Responsibilities

 Process and update all assigned user incidents and service requests and meet established deadlines
 Provide technical support to users for problems related to the use of the company’s IT systems
 Diagnose problems with computers or their peripherals and recommend or implement solutions to correct these
 Train the users in the use of computer equipment, software and other peripherals
 Perform workstation configuration and delivery according to established procedures
 Participate in user’s relocation (unplugging workstations, reinstalling, configuring printers, updating client files)
 Perform tests on new installation or deployment procedures
 Document user support procedures (writing simple processes and training documents) according to the established format
 Know the user support procedures specific to the various sites covered by the IT group


 Requirements
 Diploma

 Collegial diploma in information technology
 0-2 years of experience

 Technical skills

 Base knowledge of the operating systems (and office suites) in use in the company as well as the installation and configuration of workstations and their peripherals

 General skills

 Excellent customer service
 Analytical mind
 Good team spirit
 Bilingual French/English (spoken and written)

 Working conditions

 May have to lift equipment weighing up to 30 kilos,
 May have to work at other offices near the main office
 Occasional overtime work on evening and weekends

 AtkinsRéalis is hiring an Environmental Regulatory Specialist who is seeking more experience and increased responsibility combined with exposure to a wide variety of infrastructure (e.g., transportation, power, etc.) and other environmental assessment planning projects. The ideal candidate will be a motivated and detail-oriented with a minimum of 10 years of demonstrated experience providing environmental assessment and consulting services in a related role.

 Your role within the team:
 To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

 Oversee the development, implementation, auditing, and maintenance of Environmental Management Systems and Sustainability Initiatives for projects as the Project Manager or Environmental Manager.
 Coordinate and guide efforts to obtain and comply with environmental approvals/permits for projects from government/regulatory agencies (all jurisdictions).
 Develop, prepare and maintain project/task schedules and budgets for the environmental component of projects, including monitoring project progress, work hours, budgets and expenditures using project scheduling and cost control tools.
 Provide advice and guidance on environmental management as well as environmental compliance issues.
 Independently coordinate and manage external subcontractors.
 Effectively delegate tasks and activities to intermediate and junior staff and providing technical and supervisory guidance on assigned tasks.
 Assist with and, as necessary, taking a lead role in the development of proposals, qualification documents and other business development related activities.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.

 The ideal candidate: 

Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Planning, Geography, Environmental Science, or Environmental Studies
 10+ years of practical, progressive environmental consulting experience including construction environmental management and regulatory permitting
 Extensive knowledge of environmental management systems, including ISO 14001 as well as applicable laws, bylaws and regulations and legislative environmental requirements.
 Familiarity and demonstrated experience with infrastructure projects such as transmission lines, transportation projects (roads, highways, transit) and water/wastewater projects. Experience working on linear infrastructure projects would be an asset.
 The ability to lead, motivate and mentor technical and professional staff at different levels of career development.
 Exceptional organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills.
 Knowledge of and experience with project management fundamentals including cost control, scope management and scheduling.

Create, manage, and manipulate spatial and non-spatial data and associated metadata.

 Favoriser la collaboration entre les équipes afin d'aider les membres de l'équipe de projet à mener à bien les tâches du projet et à produire les résultats escomptés.

 À propos d’AtkinsRéalis

Opérateur(trice) trafic

 Le Réseau Express Métropolitain (REM) est un réseau de train léger automatisé conçu pour simplifier les déplacements dans la grande région de Montréal. Le REM est l'un des plus importants réseaux de transport automatisé au monde et le plus important projet de transport en commun entrepris au Québec au cours des 50 dernières années. Avec ses 67 km et 26 stations, le REM vous emmènera rapidement au centre-ville, sur la Rive-Sud, sur la Rive-Nord, dans l'ouest de l'ile ainsi qu’à l'aéroport.

 L’équipe E&M est en charge de l’exploitation du REM ainsi que de la maintenance de l’ensemble des infrastructures et équipements du réseau, incluant les véhicules, les voies, les stations et les centres de maintenance de Rive-Sud, St-Eustache et Sainte-Anne-de-Bellevue.

 Le Groupe PMM est à la recherche de candidats compétents et dynamiques pour combler le poste d’Opérateur(trice) trafic. Le titulaire du poste aura un rôle clé puisqu’il contribuera activement à la réalisation de la mission du Groupe PMM, soit d’assurer l’efficacité de la mobilité des voyageurs du réseau REM.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe

 Au sein de l’équipe du REM, vous relèverez du Chef de service et vous aurez à :

 Superviser et contrôler le mouvement des trains pour assurer un service efficace et rapide.
 Coordonner le balayage de la voie avant le début du service commercial.
 Coordonner l'ouverture et la fermeture commerciale, en coordination avec les autres opérateurs du PCC impliqués dans ce processus.
 Gérer l’horaire en ligne (validation, modification).
 Superviser et surveiller la séquence de lancement automatique des trains à partir des CEE (Centre d’Exploitation et d’Entretien).
 Vérifier la disponibilité des trains pour le début du service commercial, gestion de la flotte et faire face à toute demande de train supplémentaire lorsqu’un besoin survient pour un remplacement de train.
 Superviser et contrôler le mouvement des trains non commerciaux et des véhicules d'entretien, principalement pendant les quarts de nuit et exceptionnellement pendant les heures creuses quotidiennes.
 Assurer le contrôle des permis et des accès pour occuper la voie.
 Répondre à un incident de retard de train en coordination avec le superviseur du PCC.
 Traiter les défaillances et alarmes du matériel roulant et de la signalisation ainsi que les défauts du système en intervenant rapidement et de manière décisive pour prévenir et minimiser les retards de service.
 Gérer les situations d'urgence (supervision de l'évacuation des trains, sauvetage des trains, ...).
 Communiquer à l’opérateur de communication les éléments clés nécessaires pour fournir des informations aux passagers.
 Assurer la gestion des alarmes du système d’intrusion de détection, du système de détection de vents excessifs et du système de détection de boîtes chaudes.
 Achèvement du journal des événements et du signalement des erreurs pour le CEE.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ?

 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe, au Canada et dans le monde entier;
 un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 l’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.


 Le/la Opérateur(trice) trafic recherché(e)

 Diplôme d’études collégiales en logistique de transport un atout
 Minimum de 5 ans d’expérience dans le domaine;
 Connaissance générale en exploitation ferroviaire
 Expérience pertinente en salle de contrôle ou expérience pertinente en transport collectif
 Facilité à utiliser les outils de radiocommunication
 Facilité à travailler avec les ordinateurs car ils seront des principaux outils de travail
 Posséder une bonne maitrise du français (verbal et écrit).
 Disposé à travailler en horaires irréguliers (service 24/24)
 Quarts de 12 heures (2-3/3-2) horaire à rotation. La répartition des congés, des samedis et des dimanches est intégrée à l'horaire.
