Nous déployons des capacités mondiales à l’échelle locale pour fournir à nos clients des services uniques et complets couvrant tout le cycle de vie d’un actif — consultation, services-conseils et services environnementaux, réseaux intelligents et cybersécurité, conception et ingénierie, approvisionnement, gestion de projet et de construction, exploitation et entretien, mise hors service et capital. Nous offrons l’ampleur et la profondeur de nos capacités dans des secteurs stratégiques clés tels que Services d’ingénierie, Énergie nucléaire, Exploitation et entretien et Capital.

 Chez AtkinsRéalis, nous cherchons à embaucher des individus possédant des caractéristiques, parcours et perspectives diversifiées. Nous croyons fermement que le talent de classe mondiale ne fait aucune distinction à l’égard du genre, de l’origine ethnique ou nationale, de l’identité et de l’orientation sexuelle, de l’âge, de la religion ou de la déficience, mais s’enrichit plutôt de ces différences.

 AtkinsRealis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology.

 Your role within the team

 As a member of our Computer Systems Engineering (EHM + Digital Twin) team, you will:


 Prepare requirements and develop tools for test/development systems as needed for the production of safety critical software.
 Execute software engineering tasks including software requirements specification, software design descriptions, coding, verification, testing, and documentation.
 Evaluate computer vendor products and prepare processes and procedures for implementing such products into the computer software design, development and V&V processes.
 Assist in planning activities associated with design, verification and testing of computerized safety, control and monitoring systems.
 Assist in preparation of work-scopes, design and quality requirements, and design plans for the various stages of computer systems development.
 Participate in the concept design of safety, control and monitoring computer systems to define the system requirements, computer architecture, product/tool technologies and evaluate system performance and reliability.
 Assist in preparation of guides and procedures following international standards for work practices related to quality software for safety applications in the nuclear industry.
 Develop software and scripts using a variety of programming languages/ toolsets/ environments including, but not limited to: IEC 61131-3 languages, C, C++, Varian / SSCI-890 Assembler, Fortran, Pascal, Visual Studio, LabView, XML, Photon.
 Test script development using in-house scripting languages.
 Update and/or prepare Computers Engineering design documents including software requirements specifications, software design descriptions, and software manuals.
 Interface with various engineering disciplines, suppliers, and other divisions within the company.
 Deliver technical presentations accurately and effectively.
 Manage assigned work effectively, including prioritizing, executing, managing schedule and budget, and reporting, to meet project goals.

 The Environment division of AtkinsRéalis is a rapidly growing full-service consulting firm that is dedicated to responding to the changing needs of our clients. We are committed to technical excellence and provide solutions-driven environmental services to assist clients in planning, managing, and conducting their projects. Our growing organization is seeking like-minded individuals to join our Contaminated Site Assessment, Remediation and Reclamation team.

 Individuals who join our team can expect to work closely with senior technical experts and professionals in a wide variety of fields, collaborating across regions and groups to provide the high-quality technical solutions that our clients expect, while receiving unparalleled mentorship and long-term career growth opportunities. The work environment is dynamic and flexible, offering a strong emphasis on health and safety and competitive compensation and benefits.

 AtkinsRéalis Environment has one of the most experienced environmental and geosciences engineering consulting teams in Canada and is currently seeking a Junior Environmental Scientist to join our Fort St John, BC team. The successful candidate will be responsible for completing fundamental tasks related to Phase I and II Environmental Site Assessments and land Reclamation activities, including groundwater monitoring and sampling, remedial excavations, spill response and vegetation assessments. Other technical responsibilities may include subcontractor supervision, project coordination, cost tracking, and report preparation for peer review.

 Location - Fort St John, BC

 Your role within the team:

 Historical data review and subsequent site inspections.
 Groundwater monitoring and sampling.
 Hydraulic conductivity testing.
 Surface soil and water sampling.
 Soil vapour sampling.
 Supervision of drilling activities.
 Installation of groundwater monitoring wells.
 Supervision of remedial excavations.
 Photographic and written documentation of site activities.
 Communication with on-site personnel and Project Manager.
 Assist in communicating and building relationships with clients.
 Promoting Health and Safety programs and culture.
 Working as a team with other regions as opportunities arise.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Bachelor's degree or technical diploma in environmental science, geoscience, environmental or geological engineering, or another related discipline. Eligibility for professional designation is considered an asset.
 Demonstrated technical skills in field activities related to Phase I and II Environmental Site Assessments (ESA) including groundwater monitoring and sampling techniques, various drilling techniques, soil sample collection and logging, soil vapour sampling, remedial excavations, spill response and quality assurance / quality control protocols.
 0 - 3 years of progressive experience encompassing project execution, contractor supervision, and project coordination.
 Candidates with experience primarily in the upstream oil and gas section are preferred, however, work in multiple settings, both geographically and industrially is considered an asset.
 Strong communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment.
 Self-motivated, high energy, strong organizational and time management skills.
 Capable of understanding and appropriately applying prescribed safety and technical protocols.
 Willing to undertake field work year-round and travel throughout Western Canada, at times for extended periods (weeks).
 Candidates must possess a Valid Class 5 Full driver’s license with a clean driving record.

 About AtkinsRéalis

 Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people.  Recueillir les exigences des parties prenantes et traduire les besoins des clients en solutions.

 La capacité de travailler avec l'équipe pour concevoir et mettre en œuvre les rapports, tableaux de bord et autres produits de données réels Éduquer et former les utilisateurs finaux afin qu'ils puissent utiliser pleinement les solutions de création de rapports.

 Étudiant en Baccalauréat ou DEC en informatique, ingénierie, technologie ou expérience connexe.
 Compétences technique (SQL, Power BI, Azure, Excel, Visio)
 Expérience dans la création, la conception, l'analyse et la maintenance de produits d'entreposage de données / BI Reporting.
 Connaissance dans l'utilisation des progiciels de reporting et des bases de données (SQL, etc.), l'écriture de requêtes, le développement ETL, la cartographie et la rédaction de rapports.
 Solides compétences analytiques avec la capacité de collecter, organiser, analyser les besoins de l'entreprise.

 AtkinsRealis is dedicated to responding to the changing needs of our clients. We are committed to technical excellence and provide solution-driven environmental services to assist clients in planning, managing, and conducting their projects. Our growing organization is seeking like-minded individuals to join our Contaminated Site Assessment and Remediation team in Burnaby, BC is looking for an experienced Environmental Scientist to join our team. 

You will work on a variety of projects for various clients across Canada but primarily in BC. The ideal candidate is an industry professional that aspires to a broad base of environmental consulting and project experience and has the long-term drive, ambition and potential to develop and progress within our organization. Individuals who join our team can expect to work closely with senior technical experts and professionals in a wide variety of fields, collaborating across regions and groups to provide high-quality technical solutions that our clients expect, while receiving unparalleled mentorship and long-term career growth opportunities. The work environment is dynamic and flexible, offering a strong emphasis on health and safety and competitive compensation and benefits.

 The primary function of the successful candidate is to assist the Project Manager with managing multiple projects of varying complexity within set timelines and provide skilled organization pertaining to planning, budgeting, issue resolution, resource allocation and management. This successful candidate will also be responsible for project budgets, timelines, deliverables, completion of field programs and preparation of technical reports. This role may also liaise with the client directly regarding the project work and status. This role reports to both the Project Manager and the Team Lead.

 How will you contribute?

 Under the guidance of the Project Manager:

 Develop scope of activities and budgets for contaminated sites investigation or remediation projects.
 Coordinate projects and deliverables by setting priorities, evaluating and managing risks, and monitor performance.
 Design and prepare work plans and technical reports for field programs.
 Maintain a robust understanding and current knowledge of BC environmental regulations, protocols and technical guidance documents (experience and knowledge of federal regulations is an asset)
 Review monthly invoices to clients, Maintain billable targets as set by the Team Lead, Ensure project staff meet, maintain, or exceed client-specific health and safety requirements and Undertake occasional travel to project sites (primarily in British Columbia) as needed.
 Coordinate the execution of field programs, including intrusive investigations (drilling and test pitting), monitoring well installation, groundwater monitoring and sampling, soil vapour, sediment, surface water or porewater sampling, remedial excavations, and other specified tasks.
 Perform project management functions including budgets, schedule, communication, resources, HSE, and quality.
 Supervise subcontractors and subconsultants during project execution.
 Supervise, mentor, and train junior professional staff involved in carrying out field programs; ensure project requirements are clearly communicated and understood, and health and safety protocols are followed.
 Prepare technical reports including: documenting of scope activities and execution methods; evaluation and interpretation of data, results or findings; and preparation of conclusions and recommendations.
 Assist in the preparation and execution of proposals in response to client’s requests, RFQs and RFPs


 What will you contribute?

 5+ years of progressive work experience in in the area of contaminated sites investigation and remediation in environmental consulting or relevant sectors.
 A bachelor’s degree or equivalent in environmental science/engineering or geoscience, and a professional designation (e.g., P.Eng., P.Geo., P.Ag., AScT, etc.) recognized in BC, or be eligible for registration.
 Demonstrable experience in collaboration with your team and environmental contractors on various projects of differing complexity - your experience should include preparation and review of work plans and reports for Stage 1/2 PSIs, Phase I/II/III ESAs, DSIs and remediation programs including planning and execution of soil, groundwater, vapour, sediment, surface water, porewater or mine waste investigation, interpretation of field observations, interpretation of laboratory data with respect to applicable environmental regulations, preparation of technical reports, evaluation of remedial options, and preparation of technical specifications. Must be familiar with BC CSR process and HWR requirements.
 Proven experience in field project execution, supervision and coordination of junior field or office staff and subcontractors; data management, review and interpretation; and technical report writing.
 Proven experience in fundamental project management: budget development/control, scope management, scheduling, and quality.
 Valid driver’s license and willingness to travel to and work at remote locations if required for more complex field assignments, site visits, or meetings with clients or other stakeholders.


 Compensation Range: 
Expected compensation for this role is between $73,000 - $110,000 annually. Base salaries are determined according to several parameters like skills, experience, location, and potential impact on the role. Internal and external competitiveness are also taken into account in our offers.

** Programme de développement des nouveaux gradués / New Graduate Development Program **

 Pourquoi joindre notre équipe ?
 AtkinsRéalis, en collaboration avec ses partenaires, est fière d’avoir gagné le projet du prolongement de la ligne bleue du métro de Montréal, estimé à plus de 2.6 milliards de dollars. Ce prolongement s’étendra sur une longueur de tunnel d’environ 5,8 km et comprendra l’ajout de cinq (5) stations à l’est de l’actuelle station Saint-Michel, soit les stations Pie-IX, Viau, Lacordaire, Langelier et Anjou (terminus).

 Le projet comprend également l’ajout de deux terminus d’autobus métropolitains, un stationnement incitatif métropolitain ainsi qu’un tunnel piétonnier pour faire le lien avec le futur service rapide par bus sur le boulevard Pie-IX. Plusieurs infrastructures opérationnelles y seront construites afin d’assurer l’exploitation de ce nouveau tronçon, dont un garage de trains de métro, un centre d’attachement, un centre de services regroupant les équipes d’entretien des infrastructures en station et un poste de district.

 Nous sommes à la recherche de CPI en électricité (prolongement de la ligne bleue) pour se joindre à ce projet.

 Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe ?

 Participer à la rédaction de devis techniques
 Rédiger des spécifications standards et évaluations techniques des soumissions
 Produire des relevés
 Préparer des estimations budgétaires
 Vérifier des documents techniques des fournisseurs
 Participer à la conception des systèmes de sécurité
 Effectuer la coordination avec les autres disciplines
 Effectuer des suivis de chantier
 Participer aux rencontres clients
 Fournir une assistance au personnel technique


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ?  Parce Que Nous Offrons Notamment

 L’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe, au Canada et dans le monde entier;
 Un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 L’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 Un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.

 CANDU performs Reactor inspection and maintenance services to the fleet of CANDU nuclear reactors operating around the world. In addition, we also provide mid-life Reactor Refurbishment services to all of our CANDU customers. These activities typically involve the design, build, deployment and maintenance of specialized robotic tooling used for activities performed within the primary heat transport system (fuel channels, feeders, and steam generators). Our technical staff are experts in the design and use of complex tooling systems deployed during reactor outages in a radiation environment.

 The Project Coordinator will report to the Project Manager or the General Manager and will be responsible for the coordination of engineering, procurement, and construction work. This role will require continuous communication with all project team members, and will be responsible for identifying, planning, and implementing various scopes of work.

 The candidate is also responsible for maintaining accurate and up-to-date project data on a daily basis, compiling monthly reports, and facilitating daily communication with the Project Manager and Engineering team. This role relies heavily on collaboration with cross-functional teams and assisting the Project Manager in various tasks to ensure project success.

 For growth of the candidate, we may also rotate the successful employee through short-term assignments in other CANDU Energy or AtkinsRéalis Nuclear project teams, to expose them to broader parts of the organization. Rotations may include a supporting role in the preparation and execution of CANDU Field Services work. In this event, the incumbent will be responsible for supporting field services teams and ensuring all aspects of work are performed in accordance with contracted scope, and may be requested to perform work on-site, including working in the customer's reactor vault.

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the Team:

 Responsible for assigned scope of the project and accountable for performing duties that facilitate work progressing with safety, quality, schedule, cost, and contractual requirements.
 Liaise with key stakeholders as required generally including engineering, construction, quality client & subcontractors.
 Update and maintain project-related information in programs such as Excel, including project timelines and task progress.
 Monitor task assignments, deadlines, and dependencies, and report any deviations for timely resolutions.
 Assist in the creation and maintenance of project documentation, including monthly reports and status updates.
 Facilitate daily communication with Engineering team members to gather project updates and ensure project success.
 Maintain a positive relationship with client project counterparts.
 Responsible for helping implement the project schedule for assigned engineering, procurement, construction segments of the project.
 Coordinates the delivery of project deliverables.
 Ensure work is performed within quality program requirements.
 Ensure a strong nuclear safety culture is reinforced continuously.

This position is for a professional who is self-motivated and willing to continue to further develop his/her career with experience in nuclear field.
 A Human Factors Engineering Assistant is required to provide specialized human factors and cognitive science analysis, design and evaluation services to projects involving new designs and/or enhancements to CANDU Plants.

 Duties will include the following:

 Perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy procedures and QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulatory requirements
 Provide support to plant facility system design engineers to integrate human factors into design modifications or new projects
 Identify the need, and preparation of the human factors engineering program plans, summary report, V&V plan, and design guides and procedures
 Perform and document human factors analyses e.g., function and task analyses
 Development of computerized displays and conventional panel human-system interfaces e.g., meters and control devices
 Participate in human factors verification and validation activities
 Participate in discussions with facility design engineers, CANDU utility staff
 Perform control centre design activities such as prepare Design Guides, prepare specifications for Human System Interface (HSI), preparation of detailed drawings (e.g. nameplate details) for control panels, work with vendors to ensure compliance with procedures and standard design, etc…
 Support technical reviews (in the area of Human Factors) for project documentation to ensure Human factors scope is adequately addressed
 Prepare estimate of work and monitors schedules to meet completion dates for scopes of work

 Interface with various engineering disciplines, suppliers, and other areas of the company

 5-7 years experience in the application of human factors to engineering design and development processes in process control or related industries, experience in the Nuclear industry is preferred; and a Master’s degree in Human Factors would be desirable;
 Demonstrate excellent technical skills and problem-solving capabilities, and be able to seek practical solutions to human factors problems in design and operation (e.g., procedures);

 Willing to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW)

Ingénieur(e) en télécommunications
 AtkinsRéalis possède une expertise sans égale lorsqu’il est question d’ingénierie, de consultation et d’intégration des systèmes de télécommunication et de technologies de l’information et des communications qui appuient les plus grandes infrastructures québécoises, canadiennes et internationales (aéroports, hôpitaux, universités, compagnies hydroélectriques, ouvrages routiers). Notre offre de service en télécommunication et cybersécurité s’étend des services de consultation et d’ingénierie jusqu’à la planification stratégique à long terme pour les plus grands acteurs des infrastructures québécoises. 

Nos spécialistes offrent des services en ingénierie et en gestion de projet dans de multiples disciplines comprenant les systèmes de câblage structuré (fibre optique, coaxial, cuivre), les réseaux informatiques, les services de réseau vocal (téléphonie IP et conventionnelle), les réseaux sans fil (Radiocommunication, Wi-Fi, Micro-ondes), les systèmes de sécurité et la protection des infrastructures critiques.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe
 En tant qu’ingénieur(e) en télécommunication, vous devrez :

 Diriger des projets de télécommunications de grande envergure jusqu’à leur mise en service et leur acceptation finale par le client;
 Estimer les efforts requis par différents types de ressources pour compléter des projets de télécommunications de grande envergure;
 Être responsable de la préparation de livrables pour vos projets et gérer toutes les ressources nécessaires pour la complétion de vos projets;
 Planifier les besoins de clients en télécommunication à long terme et créer leurs plans maîtres de développement;
 Planifier et mettre en place l’implantation de changements technologiques chez nos clients;
 S’assurer que la surveillance des travaux, la mise en service et les tests sont effectués en respectant les exigences techniques des contrats.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur?

 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 L’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe;
 Un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 L’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 Un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.


 L’ingénieur(e) en télécommunications recherché(e)

 Expérience de 5 ans en gestion de projets d’ingénierie interdisciplinaire dans le domaine des télécommunications et des systèmes de sécurité.
 Baccalauréat en ingénierie, en électricité, en télécommunications ou en toute autre discipline connexe.
 Être membre de l'O.I.Q 
Avoir une maîtrise en câblage structuré de télécommunication (aménagement de salles de télécommunication, câblage de fibre optique et de cuivre à paires torsadées, réseaux de canalisation pour les systèmes de télécommunications).
 Avoir une maîtrise des réseaux informatiques filaires et sans-fil et des systèmes téléphoniques.
 Avoir une maîtrise des systèmes de sécurité communicant sur les réseaux IP.

Chemist or Corrosion Engineer

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world since for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology.

 Reporting to the Manager, Feeder & Piping Engineering, Materials, Welding & Chemistry, Chemist or Corrosion Engineer will work on chemistry and corrosion related work, supporting and consultation for manufacturing of nuclear components.

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the team:

 Perform chemistry and corrosion related work in an engineering environment and prepare technical documents following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and (regulation) regulatory? requirements.
 Lead or support improvement materials and manufacturing processes through chemistry considerations.
 Establish and understand chemistry specifications for nuclear power plant systems to prevent degradation of components including new builds, refurbishment projects, and operating Candu stations.
 Assess and evaluate the use of materials (metallic and non metallic) in nuclear systems, components, tooling, and construction; Includes failure analysis.
 Support and consultation for manufacturing of nuclear components (steam generators, heat exchangers, pumps, valves, piping) related to cleanliness, handling, corrosion protection, and inspections.
 Incorporate R&D results and products, in the areas of chemistry, corrosion, and material behaviours, into the CANDU systems and new reactor designs.
 Conduct statistical analysis and modeling of test and plant data.
 Lead or support material degradation testing programs in a test lab environment, and/or work with external testing laboratories.


 Coordinate and interface with clients, suppliers, fabricators, and stakeholders and other design disciplines or department to execute assigned engineering work.
 Provide technical guidance and support and collaborate with other entities including laboratories, and other third parties.
 Perform complex assignments independently or under limited supervision of a senior Chemist, analyst, or engineer.
 May be required to develop and deliver presentations to communicate status, problem resolution or promote related reactor components and Balance of plant equipment.

 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The Ideal Candidate:

 B. Sc., B. Sc. Eng. Or Graduate degree related to chemistry or Engineering Chemist including courses and/or work experience in such applications.
 Knowledge of process chemistry of nuclear power plants, including primary and secondary water-borne systems, and water radiolysis
 Knowledge of degradation mechanisms impacting metallic and non-metallic materials in nuclear power plant environments, including from the contribution of radiation
 Experience using statistical/data analysis software.
 Basic knowledge of CANDU mechanical and process systems, structures and components is an asset.
 Eligibility to be registered as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario is an asset.
 3-5 years of related work experience in process chemistry or corrosion with specialization in nuclear power plant environments.
 Prior experience working in a lab/testing environment.
 Working knowledge of CSA N285.6 and ASME Section II/III/V/IX codes and any other applicable standards or regulatory guides related to permanent plant components, pressure boundary equipment, and/or reactor systems is preferred.
 Must be able to apply technical principles in a logical and practical manner to resolve engineering issues or technical problems.
 Self initiative to perform research and gather information.
 Ability to communicate effectively, both verbal and written.
 Excellent organizational and time management skills, including considering the plans of others.
 Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and the ability to work cooperatively in a multidisciplinary team.
 Computer skills (Word, Excel) and,
 Willing to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW)

 Create and issue small dollar, best commercial goods purchase orders, including Punch out and Pcard.

Si vous êtes à la recherche d’un employeur qui a des projets internationaux d’ingénierie de grande envergure à vous proposer. Si vous souhaitez faire la différence auprès d’une multitude de communautés en améliorant leur quotidien. Si vous souhaitez vous joindre à une équipe inclusive et diversifiée sur qui vous pouvez compter… alors nous sommes l’employeur qu’il vous faut!
 Relevant du coordonnateur du département Matériaux le poste de technicien(ne) stagiaire en contrôle qualité des matériaux offre une occasion de s'immerger dans le domaine captivant de l'ingénierie des matériaux. En tant que membre clé de notre équipe à Québec, le titulaire du poste contribuera activement à soutenir la croissance continue de notre département. Cette opportunité vous permettra non seulement d'acquérir une expérience pratique précieuse, mais également de participer à des projets novateurs qui façonnent l'avenir de notre organisation.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe:

 En tant que technicien(ne) stagiaire en contrôle qualité des matériaux, votre rôle sera de collaborer activement au succès des projets:

 S’assurer de la conformité des matériaux (granulat, béton, enrobé et autres matériaux connexes) utilisés au chantier.
 Réaliser les essais, expertises et surveillance selon les normes afin de garantir la durée de vie des ouvrages à rénover/construire.
 Signaler tout écart de mise en œuvre des matériaux à l’aide de mémos de non-conformité et rédiger un rapport de chantier pour chacune des interventions effectuées.
 Collaborer avec l’équipe technique de projet en assurant le suivi des besoins au chantier.
 Étalonner ses équipements de chantier afin d’assurer la justesse des mesures et des résultats.
 Appliquer les mesures de SST et de protection à l’environnement.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ? 
Parce que nous proposons :

 L'opportunité de travailler sur divers projets d'envergure pour des clients internes et externes.
 Un environnement passionnant où l'équilibre travail-vie personnelle est important.
 Un large éventail d'opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement.
 Salaire compétitif.
 Frais de stage pris en stage.
 Opportunité de continuer à temp plein à la suite de l’obtention du diplôme.
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et la sécurité.


 Le/La technicien(ne) stagiaire en contrôle qualité des matériaux recherché:

 DEC en cours de réalisation en génie civil, foresterie, minéralurgie ou métallurgie.
 Bonne connaissance du français.
 Capacité à travailler autant de façon autonome qu’en équipe.
 Détenir la carte ASP construction, un atout.
 Certification ACI, un atout.
 Capacité à soulever des charges pouvant atteindre 25 kg.
 Disponibilité à travailler sur différents quarts de travail (jour/soir/nuit/fin de semaine).
 Disponibilité à travailler sur des chantiers éloignés, un atout.
 Permis de conduire valide à la date de début en emploi.
 Avoir accès à un véhicule automobile. Des déplacements sont requis dans le cadre de l'emploi.

Why join us?

 AtkinsRéalis provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

 AtkinsRéalis is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

 Your role within the team:
 To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:


 General reception duties including welcoming guests and clients, receiving, directing, preparing, distributing and signing for incoming and outgoing courier packages, opening and date stamping all general correspondence.
 Manage local office requirements including ordering office and kitchen supplies and raising IT requests and working with IT to resolve office computer fax, photocopier, cell phone and regular phone issues.
 Format, edit, proofread and distribute outgoing correspondence, reports, proposals, and other documents according to company templates and standards.
 Compile complex PDF documents.
 Prepare and distribute agendas, notes, Powerpoint slides and other material needed prior to meetings; record, prepare and distribute meeting minutes.
 Classify documents related to projects according to the established procedure as well as carry out document control related tasks.
 Assemble data and statistical information when requested for research and informational purposes.
 Organize and maintain various documents (corporate CVs, project fact sheets, etc.).

 Lead teams in the execution of tasks for defined scopes of work adhering to schedule and budget constraints.
 Represent the organization in discussions with clients and partner organizations.
 Develop, adapt, or modify computer codes for specific applications and to solve new problems.
 Create and evaluate models or methodologies related to radiation physics.
 Collate, assimilate, and summarize results from existing analyses.
 Present results/updates to internal and/or external stakeholders.
 Mentor and train helping to develop junior staff in various areas of expertise related to radiation physics.
 Cooperate with internal stakeholders, communicate with clients, and collaborate with academic institutions.

Gestionnaire de projets TI

 La prestation des technologies de l'information au sein du groupe AtkinsRéalis est assurée par une fonction appelée Services informatiques (IT Services), qui est structurée de manière globale avec une présence importante au Canada, en Inde et au Royaume-Uni. Les services informatiques ont développé un modèle d'exploitation pour révolutionner la façon dont les services informatiques sont fournis à l'entreprise, en passant d'une approche " Business as Usual " à une organisation axée sur la valeur commerciale. Les principaux concepts comprennent la transition vers des produits numériques, l'adoption d'approches de livraison agiles dans l'ensemble de l'organisation, l'exploitation des services en nuage et l'application de l'accent mis sur le soutien des offres de projets de l'entreprise et leur exécution.

 Le chef de projet réalisera des projets au sein du bureau de gestion du portefeuille. Vous ferez partie d'une équipe dynamique et rapide qui offre une expérience client exemplaire à nos utilisateurs finaux en réalisant des déploiements commerciaux clés. Vous gérerez la livraison de solutions informatiques à valeur ajoutée aux divisions de AtkinsRéalis par l'application pratique et pragmatique des disciplines de gestion de projet, en veillant à ce que les clients obtiennent des résultats en temps opportun et des résultats à valeur ajoutée, et en démontrant comment une gestion de projet professionnelle profite à l'organisation.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe

 Au sein de l’équipe Services TI , vous relèverez de la Vice-présidente PMO et entreprise et vous aurez à :

 Entreprendre des tâches de gestion de projets internes pour répondre aux besoins spécifiques des divisions et des fonctions de l'organisation
 Gérer des équipes pluridisciplinaires afin de garantir l'avancement et la livraison des produits conformément aux délais, à la qualité, aux processus et aux procédures convenus.
 Veiller à l'application pratique et pragmatique des méthodes de livraison, en faisant preuve de compréhension et en adoptant une approche consultative.
 Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les clients, en contribuant à l'élaboration et à la livraison des exigences afin de permettre une compréhension précise et claire des besoins et des aspirations.
 Négocier les ressources nécessaires aux équipes de réalisation des projets
 Aider à la création d'analyses de rentabilité pour les projets, si nécessaire.
 Assurer l'interface avec les partenaires de services externalisés et gérés et les gérer afin de garantir que les solutions les plus avantageuses sont fournies à l'ensemble de l'organisation.
 Négocier les ressources nécessaires aux équipes de réalisation de projets, tant en interne qu'auprès des organisations partenaires.

Since AtkinsRéalis is an international organization that has offices all around the world where thousands of employees are located, and its clientele is international and national, we must be able to provide services in French and in English. Therefore, a good knowledge of both languages is required because of the nature of our professional services you will provide.

Why join us?

 AtkinsRéalis provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

 AtkinsRéalis is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world. 
AtkinsRéalis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world since for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology and to apply our extensive knowledge to service the BWR/PWR market. Our expertise includes: Nuclear Steam Plant (NSP) engineering, Balance of Plant (BOP) engineering, Plant Life Management and Extension, Retube Tooling Systems, Inspection and Maintenance Services, Steam Generator Replacement, Plant Equipment Refurbishment and Retrofits.

 How will you contribute to the team?


 Perform conceptual and/or detailed design of CANDU electrical systems and modifications thereof, including definition of system functional and performance requirements, single line diagrams, definition of various classes of power, general arrangement, protection requirements, environmental qualification and seismic qualification requirements and electrical power system analysis using ETAP
 Perform electrical equipment selection, sizing, and specification for various types of electrical equipment, and produce equipment-related documentation including assessment documents, setpoint calculations, error analyses, technical specifications, etc.
 Update, and/or prepare electrical engineering design documents, including Design Requirements, Design Descriptions, Elementary Diagrams, Functional Specifications, etc., together with supporting analysis/assessment documents and other design basis documents.
 Provide input to the CAD designers for preparation of various electrical related engineering drawings such as General Arrangement Drawings, Single Line Diagrams, Wiring and Connection Diagrams, Bills of Materials, etc.
 Interface with other engineering disciplines and suppliers.
 Assist in providing responses to technical enquiries from design review team and regulatory agencies.
 Prepare estimates, schedule and costing for various proposals.
 Ensure strict adherence to budget and schedule on all assigned tasks.
 Assist in providing support to engineering groups at site.
 Deliver technical presentations accurately and effectively.


 What will you contribute?

 University Degree in the field of electrical engineering
 A minimum of 2 years of pertinent electrical engineering experience
 Familiarity with electrical system functions, configurations and equipment as used for CANDU plant process systems, safety systems or safety-related systems, or for similar systems in other industries.
 Site experience in the design, construction, or commissioning of plant electrical systems, for nuclear or fossil-fuel generating stations would be an asset.
 Familiarity with CANDU procedures and QA programs would be an asset.
 Familiarity with pertinent CSA, IEEE or related Electrical Engineering codes and standards
 Ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team including other engineering disciplines and technicians, technologists and drawing office personnel.
 Strong problem solving skills are essential.
 Excellent written and oral communication skills.
 Above average initiative, drive and resourcefulness.
 Proven experience to work to tight schedules.

 Founded in 1911, S AtkinsRéalis is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?
 Le monde qui nous entoure se transforme, notre façon de l’alimenter doit donc aussi évoluer.  À propos d’AtkinsRéalis
 Issue de l’intégration d’organisations établies de longue date, la première en 1911, AtkinsRéalis est une entreprise mondiale de pointe de services professionnels et de gestion de projet, dédiée à façonner un meilleur avenir pour notre planète et ceux qui l’habitent. Nous créons des solutions durables qui lient individus, données et technologie pour transformer les infrastructures et les systèmes énergétiques du monde. Nous déployons des capacités mondiales à l’échelle locale pour fournir à nos clients des services uniques et complets couvrant tout le cycle de vie d’un actif — consultation, services-conseils et services environnementaux, réseaux intelligents et cybersécurité, conception et ingénierie, approvisionnement, gestion de projet et de construction, exploitation et entretien, mise hors service et capital. Nous offrons l’ampleur et la profondeur de nos capacités dans des secteurs stratégiques clés tels que Services d’ingénierie, Énergie nucléaire, Exploitation et entretien et Capital.

 Chez AtkinsRéalis, nous cherchons à embaucher des individus possédant des caractéristiques, parcours et perspectives diversifiés. Nous croyons fermement que le talent de classe mondiale ne fait aucune distinction à l’égard du genre, de l’origine ethnique ou nationale, de l’identité et de l’orientation sexuelle, de l’âge, de la religion ou de la déficience, mais s’enrichit plutôt de ces différences.

Ingénieur(e) en télécommunications
 AtkinsRéalis possède une expertise sans égale lorsqu’il est question d’ingénierie, de consultation et d’intégration des systèmes de télécommunication et de technologies de l’information et des communications qui appuient les plus grandes infrastructures québécoises, canadiennes et internationales (aéroports, hôpitaux, universités, compagnies hydroélectriques, ouvrages routiers). Notre offre de service en télécommunication et cybersécurité s’étend des services de consultation et d’ingénierie jusqu’à la planification stratégique à long terme pour les plus grands acteurs des infrastructures québécoises. 

Nos spécialistes offrent des services en ingénierie et en gestion de projet dans de multiples disciplines comprenant les systèmes de câblage structuré (fibre optique, coaxial, cuivre), les réseaux informatiques, les services de réseau vocal (téléphonie IP et conventionnelle), les réseaux sans fil (Radiocommunication, Wi-Fi, Micro-ondes), les systèmes de sécurité et la protection des infrastructures critiques.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe
 En tant qu’ingénieur(e) en télécommunication, vous devrez :

 Diriger des projets de télécommunications de grande envergure jusqu’à leur mise en service et leur acceptation finale par le client;
 Estimer les efforts requis par différents types de ressources pour compléter des projets de télécommunications de grande envergure;
 Être responsable de la préparation de livrables pour vos projets et gérer toutes les ressources nécessaires pour la complétion de vos projets;
 Planifier les besoins de clients en télécommunication à long terme et créer leurs plans maîtres de développement;
 Planifier et mettre en place l’implantation de changements technologiques chez nos clients;
 S’assurer que la surveillance des travaux, la mise en service et les tests sont effectués en respectant les exigences techniques des contrats.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur?

 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 L’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe;
 Un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 L’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 Un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.


 L’ingénieur(e) en télécommunications recherché(e)

 Expérience de 5 ans en gestion de projets d’ingénierie interdisciplinaire dans le domaine des télécommunications et des systèmes de sécurité.
 Baccalauréat en ingénierie, en électricité, en télécommunications ou en toute autre discipline connexe.
 Être membre de l'O.I.Q 
Avoir une maîtrise en câblage structuré de télécommunication (aménagement de salles de télécommunication, câblage de fibre optique et de cuivre à paires torsadées, réseaux de canalisation pour les systèmes de télécommunications).
 Avoir une maîtrise des réseaux informatiques filaires et sans-fil et des systèmes téléphoniques.
 Avoir une maîtrise des systèmes de sécurité communicant sur les réseaux IP.

Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 CANDU Energy Inc., is looking for a Specialist Radiation Physicist to be a part of our team in the Fuel and Physics department supporting the design of new nuclear power plants and the operation, refurbishment, or waste management and decommissioning of existing CANDU nuclear power plants. As part of that team, you will work alongside colleagues to:

 Your role within the team:

 Plan, perform, document, review, verify, and/or supervise technical analyses that includes:
 the application of radiation transport codes,
 performing dose calculations, and/or
 application / development of activity transport models.
 Lead teams in the execution of tasks for defined scopes of work adhering to schedule and budget constraints.
 Represent the organization in discussions with clients and partner organizations.
 Develop, adapt, or modify computer codes for specific applications and to solve new problems.
 Create and evaluate models or methodologies related to radiation physics.
 Collate, assimilate, and summarize results from existing analyses.
 Present results/updates to internal and/or external stakeholders.
 Mentor and train helping to develop junior staff in various areas of expertise related to radiation physics.
 Cooperate with internal stakeholders, communicate with clients, and collaborate with academic institutions.
 Follow the relevant procedures, guidelines and standards governing the work being performed.
 Attend and participate in meetings at the office, remotely, or at client sites as needed.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Undergraduate degree in Physics, Engineering Physics, Nuclear Engineering, Health Physics or equivalent.
 More than 15 years of relevant experience performing neutronics, radiation transport, dose, activity transport and/or dispersion model calculations or 10 years of experience with an advanced degree.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present technical material effectively.
 Working knowledge of project management practices experience in a leadership role.
 Possess a high degree of initiative, be self-motivated and have a demonstrated commitment to life-long-learning.

 Additional Preferred Qualifications:

 Postgraduate degrees or equivalent qualifications in Physics, Engineering Physics, Nuclear Engineering, or equivalent.
 Registered Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario, qualified to seal engineering documents.
 Familiarity with CANDU design
 Conversant in the codes and Standards used in safety analysis.
 Ability to program especially in python, MATLAB, C++, or Fortran and familiarity with the Linux operating system.
 Experience applying radiation transport codes (e.g. MCNP) and/or performing dose calculations.
 Eligible to obtain license for nuclear software that falls under the US Department of Energy 10 CFR Part 810 radiation physics codes, such as MCNP and SCALE.
 Experience working at a nuclear facility, performing radiation transport and shielding calculations.
 Experience in code development including source control and testing.
 Knowledge of the nuclear regulatory framework in Canada.

Stagiaire en ingénierie des matériaux

 Rejoignez-nous pour remodeler l'avenir avec AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis se consacre à l'ingénierie d'un avenir meilleur pour notre planète et ses habitants.

 La division Géosciences et Matériaux est actuellement à la recherche de stagiaires pour les postes de technicien(ne)s de chantier en ingénierie des matériaux pour notre bureau de Trois-Rivières afin de soutenir la croissance de l’équipe déjà en place.

 Emplacement - Trois Rivières, QC

 Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe?

 En tant que stagiaire, votre rôle sera de collaborer activement au succès des projets :
 S’assurer de la conformité des matériaux (granulat, béton, enrobé et autres matériaux connexes) lors de leur arrivée au chantier;
 Réaliser les essais, expertises et surveillance selon les normes afin de garantir la durée de vie des ouvrages à rénover/construire;
 Signaler tout écart de mise en œuvre des matériaux à l’aide de mémos de non-conformité et rédiger un rapport de chantier pour chacune des interventions effectuées;
 Collaborer avec l’équipe technique de projet en assurant le suivi des besoins au chantier;
 Étalonner ses équipements de chantier afin d’assurer la justesse des mesures et des résultats;
 Se conformer aux mesures de sécurité en vigueur.

 L'opportunité de travailler sur divers projets d'envergure pour des clients internes et externes.

 Un large éventail d'opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement.

 La personne que nous recherchons détient une belle capacité d'apprentissage, elle est dynamique et motivée pour apprendre un nouveau domaine.
 Posséder un diplôme d’étude secondaire.
 Un fort intérêt pour travailler dans le domaine de la construction et à l’extérieur.
 Bonne communication orale et écrite.
 Capacité à travailler autant de façon autonome qu’en équipe.
 Détenir la carte ASP construction.
 Capacité à soulever des charges pouvant atteindre 25 kg.
 Disponibilité à travailler sur différents quarts de travail (jour/soir/nuit/fin de semaine).
 Disponibilité à travailler sur des chantiers éloignés, un atout.

 Conception conceptuelle, de base et détaillée.

 Production de diagrammes de flux de blocs, de PFD, de P&ID, de dessins de plans et de bilans thermiques et matériels.
 Soutenir la mise en service des systèmes mécaniques et de processus et participer aux FAT et SAT.

Junior Geotechnical Engineer

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 We are currently seeking a Junior Geotechnical Engineer to join AtkinsRéalis’ Geoscience & Materials (G&M) team in Edmonton, reporting to the Geotechnical Manager. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting AtkinsRéalis’ G&M team on a variety of projects for various clients, primarily within the province of Alberta with opportunities to work across the country. The ideal candidate is an emerging professional within the industry with a working knowledge of soils and typical construction practices within the region, and a desire to expand their technical skillset. The position will be based out of Edmonton, AB.

 Your role within the team:

 Lead, manage and contribute to geotechnical investigations and assessments.
 Conduct geotechnical field investigations and monitoring of construction activities.
 Undertake geotechnical assessments using specialized softwares such as GeoStudio, Rocscience and PLAXIS.
 Understand materials testing objectives, construction drawings and design reports to support geotechnical investigation and design recommendations.
 Provide guidance and troubleshooting for quality control testing and performance of materials such as soil, concrete and asphalt.
 Contribute to the development of project proposals/cost estimates and participate in the process of securing new business opportunities or expanding the scope of existing projects.
 Analyze and prepare recommendations and reports for projects relating to foundation design, infrastructure, shoring, retaining walls, slope stability, road structure design, dikes and dams, materials testing, and other geotechnical related projects.

Gestionnaire de projets TI

 La prestation des technologies de l'information au sein du groupe AtkinsRéalis est assurée par une fonction appelée Services informatiques (IT Services), qui est structurée de manière globale avec une présence importante au Canada, en Inde et au Royaume-Uni. Les services informatiques ont développé un modèle d'exploitation pour révolutionner la façon dont les services informatiques sont fournis à l'entreprise, en passant d'une approche " Business as Usual " à une organisation axée sur la valeur commerciale. Les principaux concepts comprennent la transition vers des produits numériques, l'adoption d'approches de livraison agiles dans l'ensemble de l'organisation, l'exploitation des services en nuage et l'application de l'accent mis sur le soutien des offres de projets de l'entreprise et leur exécution.

 Le chef de projet réalisera des projets au sein du bureau de gestion du portefeuille. Vous ferez partie d'une équipe dynamique et rapide qui offre une expérience client exemplaire à nos utilisateurs finaux en réalisant des déploiements commerciaux clés. Vous gérerez la livraison de solutions informatiques à valeur ajoutée aux divisions de AtkinsRéalis par l'application pratique et pragmatique des disciplines de gestion de projet, en veillant à ce que les clients obtiennent des résultats en temps opportun et des résultats à valeur ajoutée, et en démontrant comment une gestion de projet professionnelle profite à l'organisation.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe

 Au sein de l’équipe Services Informatiques (IT Services), vous relèverez du Gestionnaire projets senior et vous aurez à :

 Entreprendre des tâches de gestion de projets internes pour répondre aux besoins spécifiques des divisions et des fonctions de l'organisation
 Gérer des équipes pluridisciplinaires afin de garantir l'avancement et la livraison des produits conformément aux délais, à la qualité, aux processus et aux procédures convenus.
 Veiller à l'application pratique et pragmatique des méthodes de livraison, en faisant preuve de compréhension et en adoptant une approche consultative.
 Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les clients, en contribuant à l'élaboration et à la livraison des exigences afin de permettre une compréhension précise et claire des besoins et des aspirations.
 Négocier les ressources nécessaires aux équipes de réalisation des projets
 Aider à la création d'analyses de rentabilité pour les projets, si nécessaire.
 Assurer l'interface avec les partenaires de services externalisés et gérés et les gérer afin de garantir que les solutions les plus avantageuses sont fournies à l'ensemble de l'organisation.
 Négocier les ressources nécessaires aux équipes de réalisation de projets, tant en interne qu'auprès des organisations partenaires.


 Le/la Gestionnaire de projets TI recherché(e)

 Avoir atteint un niveau approprié de compétence de spécialiste en gestion de projet et/ou pouvoir démontrer une application étendue des méthodologies formelles de gestion de projet, notamment les modèles Agile et Waterfall, y compris les approches hybrides.
 Antécédents clairement établis de réalisation réussie de projets grâce à l'application des principes, méthodes, techniques et outils de gestion de projet, de l'initiation à la mise en œuvre.
 Connaissance pratique et application de techniques telles que la préparation de dossiers commerciaux, la gestion des exigences, la planification, la gestion des risques et des problèmes, le contrôle des changements et la gestion de la configuration.
 Bonne connaissance générale des technologies de l'information
 Capacité à acquérir rapidement une compréhension de haut niveau des nouvelles technologies et des processus de développement.
 Expérience de la gestion et du contrôle des budgets et des coûts
 Vous êtes une personne polyvalente qui créera une équipe de projet hautement efficace et qui apportera de la valeur à nos clients.
 Vous avez un penchant pour l'action et pouvez décomposer des problèmes complexes en étapes qui permettent une livraison rapide.
 Vous êtes capable de démontrer une connaissance étendue et approfondie des produits et services associés aux services techniques.
 L'appréciation de l'expérience de l'utilisateur et des questions commerciales est indispensable.
 Faire preuve de leadership en adoptant une attitude proactive et volontariste.
 Vous êtes curieux et adoptez une approche créative dans votre travail.
 Compétences interpersonnelles et de gestion des parties prenantes bien développées, avec la capacité de communiquer, clairement et succinctement, à tous les niveaux, de la technique à l'encadrement supérieur.
 Capacité à hiérarchiser les activités en cas de demandes contradictoires.
 Capacité à gérer la charge de travail et à travailler au bon niveau de détail.
 Excellentes compétences écrites et parlées en français et en anglais

 IT Project Manager

 The delivery of Information Technology AtkinsRéalis is via a function called IT Services which is organised as a global operation with significant presence in Canada, India and the UK. IT Services has developed an operating model to revolutionise the way IT services are provided to the company, moving from a ‘Business as Usual’ focus to an organisation driven by Business Value. Key concepts include transitioning to digital products, adopting agile delivery approaches across the organisation, leveraging cloud services, and applying focus to supporting company project bids and delivery.

 The Project Manager will deliver projects within the Portfolio Management Office. You will be part of a dynamic fast pace team delivering exemplary customer experience to our end users by delivering key business deployments. You will manage the delivery of value-based IT solutions to AtkinsRéalis divisions through practical and pragmatic application of project management disciplines, ensuring customers are provided with timely outputs and outcomes that deliver value, and demonstrate how professional project management benefits the organisation.

 Your role within the team

 As a member of the IT Services team, you will report to the Senior project manager and be responsible for:

 Undertaking internal project management assignments to meet the specific needs of the organisations Divisions and Functions
 Manage cross-disciplinary teams to ensure progress and delivery of products in accordance with agreed timescales, quality, processes and procedures
 Ensure practical and pragmatic application of delivery approaches, providing an understanding and consultative approach
 Work closely with customers, aiding the development and delivery of requirements to enable accurate and clear understanding of needs and aspirations
 Negotiate resources required for project delivery teams
 Assist with the creation of business cases for projects if required
 Interface with and manage outsourced and managed service partners to ensure best value solutions are delivered across the organisation
 Negotiate resources required for Project Delivery Teams, both internally and from partnered organisations


 Qualifications for the position

 Practitioner of project management methods and practices
 Attained an appropriate level of project management practitioner level qualification and/or can demonstrate extensive application of formal project management methodologies including Agile and Waterfall models, including hybrid approaches
 Clearly evidenced track record of successful project delivery through application of project management principles, methods, techniques and tools from initiation through to implementation
 Working knowledge and application of techniques including business case preparation, requirements management, planning, risk and issue management, change control, and configuration management
 Good all-round knowledge of Information Technology
 Ability to quickly gain high-level understanding of new technology and development processes
 Experience of budget and cost management and control
 Well-rounded individual who will create a highly effective project team delivering value to our customers.
 Have a bias toward action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive delivery at speed.
 Be able to demonstrate breadth and depth knowledge in products and services associated within Technical Services.
 Appreciation of user-experience, business and commercial issues is a must.
 Provide leadership through a proactive can-do attitude
 Inquisitive and adopts a creative approach to their work
 Well-developed interpersonal and stakeholder management skills with the ability to communicate, clearly and succinctly, at all levels from technical though to senior management
 Able to prioritise activities with conflicting demands
 Able to manage workload and work at the correct level of detail
 Excellent written and spoken skills in French and English

 About Us


  The Shoreline Power Group is a fully integrated Joint Venture of Aecon, United and AtkinsRéalis located in Kincardine, Ontario. Shoreline Power Group is the centerpiece of the Major Component Replacement (MCR) program which replaces the main components of 6 reactors at the Bruce Power Nuclear Generating Station. The scope of work includes the removal and replacement of calandria tubes, pressure tubes, and feeders as well as construction management and trade labor. This project is part of Bruce Power’s Life Extension Program, which will allow Bruce Power’s CANDU units to continue to operate safely through to 2064.

Si vous êtes à la recherche d’un employeur qui a des projets diversifiés en hydrologie et hydraulique dans le secteur de l’hydroélectricité à travers le Canada et si vous souhaitez vous joindre à une équipe inclusive et diversifiée sur qui vous pouvez compter… alors nous sommes l’employeur qu’il vous faut!

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe 
Au sein de l’équipe en hydrologie et hydraulique dans l’un de nos bureaux (Montréal, Québec ou Toronto), vous aurez à :

 Réaliser des études de sécurité de barrages et des analyses de bris de barrages ;
 Évaluer les zones d’inondation ;
 Effectuer les analyses hydrodynamiques avec des outils de simulation 1D, 2D et 3D ;
 Élaborer les études hydrologiques : modélisation hydrologique, crues statistiques, précipitations maximales probables et crues maximales probables, laminage des crues ;
 Concevoir les infrastructures hydrauliques : évacuateurs de crues, déversoirs, bassins de dissipation d'énergie, prises d'eau, conduites forcées, canaux, dérivations provisoires, galeries/tunnels, passes à poissons, ponceaux …
 Réaliser les études d’énergie et l’optimisation de systèmes hydriques.

 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 L’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure ;

 L’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun ;

 Possède un minimum de 5 ans d’expérience pertinente ;
 Est membre en règle de l’Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec ou de Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO) (ou est éligible à le devenir) ;
 Est familier avec un ou plusieurs outils de modélisation hydraulique 1D, 2D ou 3D (ex : HEC-RAS, Telemac, OpenFoam, Flow3D) ;
 Est familier avec un ou plusieurs outils de modélisation hydrologique (ex. HEC-HMS) ;
 Maîtrise les méthodes et les outils d’analyse dans le domaine de l’hydrologie et de l’hydraulique. Une expérience dans le domaine des études de sécurité de barrage est un atout ;

 If you're looking for an employer with diversified hydrology and hydraulics projects in the hydroelectric sector across Canada, and want to join an inclusive and diverse team you can count on... then we're the employer for you!

 Your role in the team 
As a member of the hydrology and hydraulics team in one of our offices (Montreal, Quebec or Toronto), you will :

 Carry out dam safety studies and dam failure analyses.
 Carry out inundation studies.
 Perform hydrodynamic analyses using 1D, 2D and 3D simulation tools.
 Carry out hydrological studies: hydrological modeling, statistical floods, probable maximum precipitation and probable maximum floods, flood routing.
 Design hydraulic infrastructure: spillways, weirs, energy dissipation basins, water intakes, penstocks, canals, temporary diversions, galleries/tunnels, fishways, culverts, etc.
 Energy studies and optimization of water systems.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as your employer?

 The opportunity to work on a variety of large-scale projects.
 A stimulating work environment where work-life balance is important.
 Access to a wide range of training programs geared to individual development and interests.
 A competitive salary, flexible benefits, a share ownership plan and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The hydrology and hydraulics engineer we're looking for

 Holds a Bachelor's degree in engineering. A Master's degree in engineering or in applied sciences in hydraulics or hydrology is an asset.
 Has at least 5 years' relevant experience.
 Is a member in good standing of the Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ) or Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO) (or is eligible to become one).
 Is familiar with one or more 1D, 2D or 3D hydraulic modeling tools (e.g. HEC-RAS, Telemac, OpenFoam, Flow3d).
 Is familiar with one or more hydrological modeling tools (e.g. HEC-HMS).
 Is proficient in hydrological and hydraulic analysis methods and tools. Experience in Dam Safety Review studies is an asset.
 Is fluent in French (oral and written).
 Is fluent in English (an asset).

 CANDU Energy Inc., is looking for a Specialist Radiation Physicist to be a part of our team in the Fuel and Physics department supporting the design of new nuclear power plants and the operation, refurbishment, or waste management and decommissioning of existing CANDU nuclear power plants. As part of that team, you will work alongside colleagues to:

 Your role within the team:

 Plan, perform, document, review, verify, and/or supervise technical analyses that includes:
 the application of radiation transport codes,
 performing dose calculations, and/or
 application / development of activity transport models.
 Lead teams in the execution of tasks for defined scopes of work adhering to schedule and budget constraints.
 Represent the organization in discussions with clients and partner organizations.
 Develop, adapt, or modify computer codes for specific applications and to solve new problems.
 Create and evaluate models or methodologies related to radiation physics.
 Collate, assimilate, and summarize results from existing analyses.
 Present results/updates to internal and/or external stakeholders.
 Mentor and train helping to develop junior staff in various areas of expertise related to radiation physics.
 Cooperate with internal stakeholders, communicate with clients, and collaborate with academic institutions.
 Follow the relevant procedures, guidelines and standards governing the work being performed.
 Attend and participate in meetings at the office, remotely, or at client sites as needed.

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.

 Undergraduate degree in Physics, Engineering Physics, Nuclear Engineering, Health Physics or equivalent.
 More than 15 years of relevant experience performing neutronics, radiation transport, dose, activity transport and/or dispersion model calculations or 10 years of experience with an advanced degree.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present technical material effectively.

 This position provides an essential service to facilitate safe operation of Candu licensed facilities. The successful candidate will be expected to meet CANDU’s business objectives/customer requirements, and to ensure that this function is performed efficiently, within all applicable regulatory requirements. The Senior Radiation Protection Surveyor reports functionally to the Radiation Protection (RP) Manager.

 Your role within the team

 Develop a good knowledge of the RP program and procedures at Candu Energy.
 Develop a good knowledge of all instruments used by Radiation Surveyors in the course of their work.
 Perform and participate in formal and on-the-job training, as required.
 Perform radiation surveys as requested by supervisors, including daily routine radiation surveys.
 Post and mark radiation signage and zones as required by procedures.
 Perform loose and fixed contamination checks on personnel (exit procedures from radiation zones) and equipment or facilities.
 Perform basic hazard assessments, review, and approve work permits for RP requirements.
 Exercise judgement verifying procedural compliance and in offering advice on RP or contamination control questions as they arise in daily activities.
 Inform immediate supervision of any unusual conditions or actions impacting RP.
 Be conscious of the interaction between radiation control measures and their effects on production and schedule responsibilities.
 Recognize and appropriately respond to abnormal situations to ensure personnel safety is maintained.
 Maintain proper documentation in records and daily logs.
 Establish excellent communication and develop internal relationships with Candu staff.
 Establish and maintain an excellent business relationship with external industry peers and Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission (CNSC).
 Perform duties under varying degrees of supervision, including overtime, shift work, or irregular hours.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Graduate from a recognized institute of advanced technology or equivalent formal education in a relevant field.
 Minimum 6 to 8 years of related work experience in radiation protection with nuclear power experience preferred.
 Working knowledge of computer software and good record maintenance skills.
 Green badge qualification or equivalent at a nuclear power station is preferred.
 Ability to improve and deal with rapidly changing conditions.
 Ability to work in teams and maintain strong cooperation with co-workers.
 Ability to liaise with management, supervisors, customers, and regulatory agencies using tact and good judgement.
 Thoroughly accurate, conscientious and possess excellent judgement.
 Physically capable of lifting, handling, etc., various items on a regular basis.
 Must be willing and physically able to wear respiratory protection and protective clothing.
 Must be designated as a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW) or willing to be designated as a NEW.
 Strong written and verbal communication skills, to produce high quality applications and documentation for submissions.

Why join us?

 AtkinsRealis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world since for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology and to apply our extensive knowledge to service the BWR/PWR market.

 Our expertise includes: Nuclear Steam Plant (NSP) engineering, Balance of Plant (BOP) engineering, Plant Life Management and Extension, Retube Tooling Systems, Inspection and Maintenance Services, Steam Generator Replacement, Plant Equipment Refurbishment and Retrofits.
 Candu Energy Inc. is a leading full-service nuclear technology company and committed to design and deliver state-of-the-art CANDU® reactors, carry out life extension projects, provide plant life management programs and tools, and offer operation and maintenance services for existing nuclear power stations.
 The Control Systems and software developer is responsible for the design, implementation, verification, maintenance, and documentation of software as well as the selection and acquisition of suitable hardware and pre‑developed commercial software.

 How will you contribute to the team? 

Maintain a safe and clean working environment by complying with company procedures and policies.
 Timely execution of the assigned scope in the assigned software project capacities.
 Performing the suitability assessment (and qualification where needed) of system hardware and pre‑developed software components.
 Support designing, installation and testing of an assigned product test environment.
 Integrating software and hardware components and preparing software engineering documents such as test procedures, test reports, operation manuals etc.
 Site support and software maintenance services include shift work (day shift and night shift work)
 Implementing and maintaining key project support systems (i.e., configuration management, document management and change control systems) for the tooling department.
 Supporting the selection and qualification of Control Systems hardware by the tooling group.
 Assist on preparing validation tests and/or review the results of the validation testing.


 Responsible for change control - Using configuration management system provided by his/her department to maintain software files, release and documentation. Preparing and maintaining work plans for the control software change activities.


 Support OPEX Review - Assembling OPEX and assessing what changes should be incorporated in the future designs of Tooling and Equipment.
 Report and suggest resolution to any potential impacts to technical quality identified by the various tool manufactures and vendors.
 Ensure all work activities are performed safely, in collaboration with the Project Safety Manager.


 What will you contribute? 

Siemens PLC programming experience – Step 7, S7-SCL, S7-GRAPH, S7-Starter, SIMATIC NET, WinCC Flexbile and S7 Distributed Safety.
 Siemens SCADA programming experience – WinCC Classic.
 Siemens PROFIBUS and PROFINET.
 PELCO experience (Endura Certified System Technician an asset)
 Engineering drawings interpretation
 Engineering Change Control knowledge
 Analytical ability and effective decision making
 Excellent organizational skills
 Situational awareness and effective problem-solving skills
 Inter-personal communication skills
 Computer proficiency – Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, Access, Visio, PowerPoint, Outlook
 Written/oral communication skills


 QUALIFICATIONS 


Engineering degree (Electrical, Control, Software) from an accredited university,
 Minimum 4 years relevant work experience.


 OTHER ASPECTS


 Security Clearance (from Candu Energy and OPG) must be obtained and maintained as a condition of employment.
