Technicien(ne) en télécommunications
 AtkinsRéalis possède une expertise sans égale lorsqu’il est question d’ingénierie, de consultation et d’intégration des systèmes de télécommunication et de technologies de l’information et des communications qui appuient les plus grandes infrastructures québécoises, canadiennes et internationales (aéroports, hôpitaux, universités, compagnies hydroélectriques, ouvrages routiers). Notre offre de service en télécommunication et cybersécurité s’étend des services de consultation et d’ingénierie jusqu’à la planification stratégique à long terme pour les plus grands acteurs des infrastructures québécoises. 

Nos spécialistes offrent des services en ingénierie et en gestion de projet dans de multiples disciplines comprenant les systèmes de câblage structuré (fibre optique, coaxial, cuivre), les réseaux informatiques, les services de réseau vocal (téléphonie IP et conventionnelle), les réseaux sans fil (Radiocommunication, Wi-Fi, Micro-ondes), les systèmes de sécurité et la protection des infrastructures critiques.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe
 Au sein de l’équipe Télécommunications, Cybersécurité et Solutions Numériques, vous relèverez du Chef d’équipe en télécommunications et vous aurez à :

 Travailler en collaboration avec l'équipe d'ingénieurs et de techniciens pour préparer et monter les dessins des projets principalement avec les logiciels Autodesk, Autocad et Revit.
 Valider les conflits dans la maquette 3D lors de la modélisation.
 Participer à la conception technique et validation des concepts d’ingénierie.
 Participer aux rencontres de suivi de projets.
 Collaborer avec les différents membres de l’équipe technique et travailler en collaboration avec les différents groupes associés aux projets.
 Habileté à travailler dans un milieu structuré et organisé (normes et standard).

 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe;
 un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.

Water Treatment Engineer

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 In response to increasing opportunities and a healthy backlog of work, our Water Infrastructure Group is looking for a Water Treatment Engineer (Water and Wastewater Process) to join our growing team. We value teamwork, respect, and openness above all else, and we empower our people to grow and learn. Join us, as we work together to provide our clients with innovative, cost-effective, and practical solutions. This position can be based anywhere in Canada reporting to the Director, Water Infrastructure Western Canada.

 Your role within the team 
As a member of our Water Infrastructure team, you will:

 Lead water and wastewater process design team in preliminary and detailed engineering design packages including drawings, specifications, and cost estimates;
 Prepare process and instrumentation diagrams (P&IDs) and process flow diagrams (PFDs);
 Develop hydraulic calculations for process design;
 Work with multidisciplinary design teams in the preparation of engineering design packages;
 Project management to ensure quality of project deliverables on time and within budget;
 Work with applicable water and wastewater regulations and compliance strategies that maximize operating flexibility and reduce total project costs;
 Participate in water and wastewater proposal preparation;
 Leading, guiding, and mentoring a team of intermediate and junior staff.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients;
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important;
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities;
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan;
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate

 Holds a university degree in Civil or Mechanical Engineering from a recognized institution. A master’s degree in environmental, or Chemical Engineering related to water and wastewater treatment is preferred.
 Is registered as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) with PEO, or eligible for registration as professional engineer in Ontario.
 Has minimum 8 years of experience in Water and Wastewater Process Design.
 Has experience with preparing preliminary and detailed engineering design; contract specifications and special provisions; and tender documents.
 Has proven expertise and advanced knowledge in pumping and treatment technologies and recognized as a technical leader.
 Is familiar with municipal and provincial design standards in Manitoba and other Canadian provinces.
 Possess strong technical report writing and communication skills, and ability to represent the design team to the client.
 Familiar with industrial wastewater process design is an asset.

Ingénieur(e) en télécommunications
 AtkinsRéalis possède une expertise sans égale lorsqu’il est question d’ingénierie, de consultation et d’intégration des systèmes de télécommunication et de technologies de l’information et des communications qui appuient les plus grandes infrastructures québécoises, canadiennes et internationales (aéroports, hôpitaux, universités, compagnies hydroélectriques, ouvrages routiers). Notre offre de service en télécommunication et cybersécurité s’étend des services de consultation et d’ingénierie jusqu’à la planification stratégique à long terme pour les plus grands acteurs des infrastructures québécoises. 

Nos spécialistes offrent des services en ingénierie et en gestion de projet dans de multiples disciplines comprenant les systèmes de câblage structuré (fibre optique, coaxial, cuivre), les réseaux informatiques, les services de réseau vocal (téléphonie IP et conventionnelle), les réseaux sans fil (Radiocommunication, Wi-Fi, Micro-ondes), les systèmes de sécurité et la protection des infrastructures critiques.

 En tant qu’ingénieur(e) en télécommunication, vous devrez :

 Diriger des projets de télécommunications de grande envergure jusqu’à leur mise en service et leur acceptation finale par le client;

 Planifier les besoins de clients en télécommunication à long terme et créer leurs plans maîtres de développement;
 Planifier et mettre en place l’implantation de changements technologiques chez nos clients;
 S’assurer que la surveillance des travaux, la mise en service et les tests sont effectués en respectant les exigences techniques des contrats.

 L’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;

 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.

 Holds a bachelor’s or advanced degree in Geological, Civil (with geotechnical focus) or Geotechnical Engineering.
 Has 0-3 years relevant industry experience, since graduation, in geotechnical engineering related services.
 Is eligible for registration with EGBC or APEGA or APEGS as Engineer-in-Training or P.Eng designation.
 Demonstrates organization, tam collaboration, proposal and technical writing skills, and excellent verbal and interpersonal communication skills.
 Holds a valid Canadian driver’s license with a clean driver abstract.

 About AtkinsRéalis
 Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. The breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital.

Intermediate Hydrometallurgical Engineer

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 AtkinsRéalis’s Mining & Metallurgical (M&M) team in Canada is made up of more than 400 employees who work on large-scale projects to support mining sustainability, pit-to-port opportunities, metallurgical plant engineering, or mine closure and capabilities in the study, design, and construction of mining projects across a wide range of mining and processing methods and commodities. The team combines global-caliber expertise to provide tailored solutions for projects of any size, scope, or complexity. We believe in working openly and transparently, together, delivering world-class projects. We work collaboratively with teams across the world, from Canada to Brazil in the south to India in the east, delivering exceptional value and innovation to our clients. To support our growth initiatives, we are expanding our team and are looking for innovative, forward-thinking people who enjoy challenges and want to add value to project success, both locally and internationally.

 We are seeking an Intermediate Hydrometallurgical Engineer to join our Global Mineral and Metals Process team and support our growth to align with the demand to supply responsibly sourced critical minerals. We are looking for a top performer to add to our talented M&M group and to be a part of the sustainable movement. The new team member will provide tailored process solutions across all phases of project development and operational support with opportunities to advance towards their career aspirations.

 This opportunity will be based in Vancouver, BC. and offers work-life flexibility with global exposure with AtkinsRéalis teams and projects.

 There is potential for work at client sites and project responsibilities will be added as needed. In some cases, the opportunity may be available to relocate to other Canadian or international destinations for extended periods of time.

 Your role within the team:

 Adheres to, and supports company HSE, Quality Management System, Ethics and Integrity policies and procedures while being a leader through collaboration and innovation.
 Integrated role in advancing hydrometallurgical studies through to construction and commissioning.
 Lead the development of flowsheets, piping and instrumentation diagrams, mass and energy balances, process design criteria, technology package trade-offs and selections, and optimization of process designs using the latest technology in industry.
 Identify, scope, and manage process test work programs at external laboratories or client-based site labs.
 Engage with clients to understand project requirements and participate in the preparation of proposals and other business development initiatives.
 Support other engineers, process specialists and project managers on each of the phases of a project.
 Will use strong analytical and logical thinking to help find process solutions. Participate in plant reviews, optimizations, and debottlenecking studies.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Bachelor’s degree in Materials Science or Metallurgical Engineering, Chemical Engineering degrees will also be considered if there is work experience in hydrometallurgy.
 5+ years relevant experience through design, commissioning and/or operational experience of hydrometallurgy unit operations.
 Experience in developing flowsheets together with heat and mass balances using software such as METSIM.
 Eligible for professional engineer (P. Eng.) designation in any Canadian province.

Technicien(ne) en télécommunications
 AtkinsRéalis possède une expertise sans égale lorsqu’il est question d’ingénierie, de consultation et d’intégration des systèmes de télécommunication et de technologies de l’information et des communications qui appuient les plus grandes infrastructures québécoises, canadiennes et internationales (aéroports, hôpitaux, universités, compagnies hydroélectriques, ouvrages routiers). Notre offre de service en télécommunication et cybersécurité s’étend des services de consultation et d’ingénierie jusqu’à la planification stratégique à long terme pour les plus grands acteurs des infrastructures québécoises. 

Nos spécialistes offrent des services en ingénierie et en gestion de projet dans de multiples disciplines comprenant les systèmes de câblage structuré (fibre optique, coaxial, cuivre), les réseaux informatiques, les services de réseau vocal (téléphonie IP et conventionnelle), les réseaux sans fil (Radiocommunication, Wi-Fi, Micro-ondes), les systèmes de sécurité et la protection des infrastructures critiques.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe
 Au sein de l’équipe Télécommunications, Cybersécurité et Solutions Numériques, vous relèverez du Chef d’équipe en télécommunications et vous aurez à :

 Travailler en collaboration avec l'équipe d'ingénieurs et de techniciens pour préparer et monter les dessins des projets principalement avec les logiciels Autodesk, Autocad et Revit.
 Valider les conflits dans la maquette 3D lors de la modélisation.
 Participer à la conception technique et validation des concepts d’ingénierie.
 Participer aux rencontres de suivi de projets.
 Collaborer avec les différents membres de l’équipe technique et travailler en collaboration avec les différents groupes associés aux projets.
 Habileté à travailler dans un milieu structuré et organisé (normes et standard).


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ?
 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe;
 un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.

 DEP en dessin;
 Minimum un an d’expérience pertinente;
 Connaissance de la lecture de plans et devis
 Maîtrise de AutoCAD;
 Connaissance de Autodesk Revit et du logiciel Logesdes (Atout);
 Connaissance des réseaux de télécommunications (coaxial et IP) (Atout).

Why join us?

 SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

 SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world. 

Our Industrial Solutions Division is looking for a Process Engineer to lead our team and will be reporting to the Director of Pharmaceutical Engineering

 How will you contribute to the team? 

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

 Manages team members while making sure that resource utilization is adequate.
 Maintain team engagement and efficiencies.
 Manages the team’s multiple priorities, deliverables and client expectations.
 Identifies market opportunities and develops their team to meet market demand.
 Maintains client relationships and manages client’s satisfaction.
 Manages projects and delivers results to the clients in the area of process expertise.
 Offers value-added and innovative solutions to clients’ challenges, and takes part in the Business Development efforts in their area of expertise.
 Provides support, training and coaching/mentoring to team members.
 Delivers complex projects in their area of expertise by using industry skills to deliver innovative solutions.
 Collaborates with other key team members in the Life Science team (Automation, Mechanical Engineering, Validation, etc., both locally and internationally).
 Prepared to work on Canada wide and International projects.
 Participates in Industry events and conducts presentations.
 Supports local business growth activities.
 Conceptual, Basic and Detail design of biopharmaceutical/pharmaceutical processes and clean utilities.
 Calculations required to size equipment and utilities.
 Writing documentation to create specifications and tender documents.
 Preparing technical reports.
 Producing block flow diagrams, PFDs, P&IDs and Layout drawings.
 Producing heat and material balances.
 Producing process simulation models.
 Writing and executing validation protocols;
 Working knowledge of cGMPs.
 Commissioning of process and mechanical systems and participating in FATs and SATs.
 Holding and Leading client and supplier meetings. Must be able to cope with time zone differences with international clients.
 Troubleshooting equipment and process issues.
 Participating and contributing to equipment 3D model reviews, piping design reviews and building plan layout reviews.


 What will you contribute?

 Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical or Biological Engineering. Masters in a connected field is an asset.
 Minimum 10-year experience in Pharmaceutical /Biopharmaceutical process design. Experience in Agro industry would be an asset.
 Experience managing a team.
 Experience in managing clients and developing business.
 Proven track record of successful projects in a highly dynamic environment.
 Proven track record of successfully managing a team of professionals.
 Licensed by a Professional Engineering Association (in Canada) is required. Member of Professional Engineers of Ontario preferred.
 Advanced knowledge of GMP and biopharmaceuticals regulated environments (US FDA, KFDA, EMA and WHO regulations) is an asset.
 Ability to travel.
 AutoCAD experience would be an asset.
 Automation knowledge would be an asset.
 SuperPro, SchedulePro experience would be an asset.
 Autonomous and organized.
 Ability to thrive in a teamwork environment.
 Highly motivated and organized.


 What we offer at SNC-Lavalin: 

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

Technicien(ne) en qualité de l’air

 Vous êtes à la recherche d’une opportunité enrichissante en tant que Technicien (ne) en qualité de l’air ? Rejoignez notre division Environnement à Québec pour contribuer à la préservation de la qualité de l'air et à la protection de l'environnement tout en collaborant avec des professionnel(le)s expérimenté(e)s dans le domaine.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe :
 En tant que membre de notre équipe, vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la réalisation de projets environnementaux importants dans la région de Québec.

 Vos missions:

 Participer aux campagnes d’échantillonnages des émissions fugitives de procédés pétrochimiques.
 Analyser et annoter des P&ID de raffineries et d’usine pétrochimiques.
 Vérification de la conformité des lois et de la réglementation en environnement et en santé et sécurité au travail (qualité de l’air, etc.).
 Étalonnage et entretien des équipements de mesure et de prélèvement.
 Inspection et échantillonnage de contaminants pour des études de qualité de l’air intérieur (moisissures, amiante, plomb, poussières, formaldéhyde, etc.).
 Inspection environnementale de procédés chimiques pour la détection et réparation de fuites fugitives de composés organique volatils sur des sites industriels.
 Traitement de données.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ? Parce que nous offrons notament :

 L’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe;
 Un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 L’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 Un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.

 Nous recherchons un(e) candidat(e) compétent(e), dédié(e) et passionné(e) par la qualité de l'air et l'environnement.
 Le/la Technicien en qualité de l’air recherché(e) :

 Détient des connaissances en échantillonnage environnemental, ou en milieu industriel, un atout.
 Bonne maîtrise des logiciels Word, Excel et Outlook pour la gestion et l'analyse des données.
 Excellente condition physique, car le poste peut nécessiter l'utilisation d'équipements de mesure et d'échantillonnage lourds (jusqu'à 12 kg), le travail en hauteur et l'utilisation d'échelles.
 Permis de conduire valide et possession d'un véhicule pour les déplacements.
 Connaissance des différents standards, méthodes d'échantillonnage et réglementations liés à la qualité de l'air serait un atout.
 Qualités de coordination pour organiser et prendre en charge les opérations sur le terrain en collaboration avec les ingénieur(e)s en environnement.

Procurement Administrator

 Reporting to the Procurement Manager, the Procurement Administrator is responsible for complex administrative support duties in all procurement systems. They provide support to Buyers, Order Administrators, Expeditors, Procurement Engineering and Management. They handle and safeguard sensitive financial information on behalf of the Procurement department. Duties below are assigned depending on the business needs in support of Project and Services.

 Location – Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the team:

 Clerical duties related to Procurement activities including Requisitions, PO's, CO's, distribution, filing.
 Support to Procurement Management and Quality Management on reporting and general duties.
 Processing Non-Disclosure Agreements.
 Custodian of Proposal submission inbox.
 Material control administrator supporting Procurement Engineering.
 Supplier Documentation registration in Document Management System.
 Support to Logistics.
 Invoicing and Accounts Payable activities interfacing with Finance and Shared Services (AP).
 Create and issue small dollar, best commercial goods purchase orders, including Punch out and Pcard.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Administrative Experience in a busy office environment.
 Experience with administration duties in a Procurement environment an asset.
 Exceptional time management required.
 Proficient in database entry, MS Word, MS Excel and MS PowerPoint.
 Ability to work in a fast pace, project environment, supporting multiple customers, including repetitive tasks.
 Ability to work independently and maintain the influx of procurement requests, while maintaining project timelines and deadlines.
 Must be a professional team player, with the ability to work in a collaborative environment with collegues.
 Ability to be challenged to learn new tasks in short timeframes.
 Ability to take directions from Management and critical stakeholders.
 Post-Secondary or equivalent work experience or transferrable skills.

 This is not general administrative duties. This is more in line with a Junior Buyer role because it requires the learning of Procurement processes, procedures, systems, including hundreds of forms, templates and minimum 6 data platforms. We will provide the training.
 Proficiency in MS Office skills required. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment with some project pressure at times. Must be able to meet deadlines, keep up with the influx of requests. Looking for a stable work environment to grow as part of the team and if interested move up through the ranks of positions.

Job Description
  Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?

 SNC-Lavalin Inc., en collaboration avec ses partenaires, est fière d’avoir gagné le projet du prolongement de la ligne bleue du métro de Montréal, estimé à plus de 2.6 milliards de dollars. Ce prolongement s’étendra sur une longueur de tunnel d’environ 5,8 km et comprendra l’ajout de cinq (5) stations à l’est de l’actuelle station Saint-Michel, soit les stations Pie-IX, Viau, Lacordaire, Langelier et Anjou (terminus).

 Le projet comprend également l’ajout de deux terminus d’autobus métropolitains, un stationnement incitatif métropolitain ainsi qu’un tunnel piétonnier pour faire le lien avec le futur service rapide par bus sur le boulevard Pie-IX. Plusieurs infrastructures opérationnelles y seront construites afin d’assurer l’exploitation de ce nouveau tronçon, dont un garage de trains de métro, un centre d’attachement, un centre de services regroupant les équipes d’entretien des infrastructures en station et un poste de district.

 Le bureau de projet sera situé au centre-ville de Montréal sur la rue De la Gauchetière Ouest.

 Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe ?

 Effectuer la conception des systèmes électriques tels que distribution, éclairage, alarmes incendie et autres systèmes connexes
 Rédiger et effectuer les calculs reliés à la conception
 Participer à la rédaction de devis techniques d’électricité
 Participer à la rédaction d’étude technique en électricité
 Évaluer les coûts des travaux
 Participer à la surveillance des travaux
 Fournir une assistance au client et au personnel technique
 Effectuer l’ensemble de ces responsabilités sous la supervision de l’ingénieur responsable


 Que recherchons-nous ?

 DEP, AEC ou DEC en électricité du bâtiment ou l'équivalent
 Expérience de minimum 5 ans sur des projets en électricité du bâtiment
 Aptitudes de travail d’équipe en coordination avec les ingénieurs responsables de discipline
 Maitrise des logiciels Word, Excel, power point, Outlook.
 Maitrise des logiciels AutoCad et revit, un atout
 Mobile avec automobile un atout
 Posséder une bonne connaissance du milieu institutionnel
 Maîtrise du français (parlé et écrit), bilinguisme un atout
 Capacité à travailler en équipe


 Ce que nous offrons chez SNC-Lavalin :
 Chez SNC-Lavalin, vous profiterez d’une rémunération compétitive, d’un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire, et d’une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (assurances collectives, programme d’épargne-retraite, regime d’actionnariat, emploi permanent, programme de formation continue, etc.).  Vous pensez qu’une carrière dans notre équipe pourrait correspondre à votre profil, soumettez sans attendre votre candidature en ligne !

Civil EIT, Hydro Power & Dams Structures

 *Programme de développement pour nouveaux gradués / Graduate development program*

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.
 We are currently seeking a Civil EIT, who specializes in Hydro Power & Dams Structures in Vancouver. The Hydro Power & Dams Structures’ team at AtkinsRéalis is involved in several projects in the Water and Hydropower industry. They work on different type of projects, both large-scale and small-scale, and include a list of clients such as BC Hydro.

 Your role within the team 
As a member of the Hydro Power & Dams Structures’ team, you will:

 Perform engineering work in compliance with AtkinsRéalis QA programs, codes, standards, and regulations.
 Participate in detailed design of structural systems involving steel, reinforced concrete, or masonry elements.
 Conduct structural and seismic analysis, encompassing both static and dynamic analysis, and generating analysis reports.
 Utilize relevant software programs to prepare engineering computations and analyses.
 Create various technical documents, such as engineering drawings, change paper markups, calculations, reports, design requirements, bill of materials, and technical specifications.
 Provide technical guidance and instruction to Designers/Drafters.
 Conduct field walkdowns during different design phases as necessary and assisting with field construction and execution activities, including field changes and design revisions.

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients;
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important;
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities;
 Competitive salary, flexible benefits, an employee share ownership plan and also a defined contribution pension plan;
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate has

 A Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or Structural Engineering, with eligibility to register as an EIT with the EGBC;
 1 to 3 years of relevant experience;
 Proficiency in engineering software programs such as SAP2000, CSiCol, ETABS, S-Concrete, Mathcad, CADAM3D, ANSYS, etc.
 Familiarity with National Building Code, CSA standards, and relevant industrial regulations.
 Capable of resolving engineering issues and technical problems using fundamental technical knowledge.
 Strong communication and technical writing skills.

Water Resources Engineer

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 AtkinsRéalis’s Minerals and Metals team in Canada is made up of more than 400 employees who work on large-scale projects to support mining sustainability, pit-to-port opportunities, metallurgical plant engineering, or mine closure and capabilities in the study, design, and construction of mining projects across a wide range of mining and processing methods and commodities. The team combines global-caliber expertise to provide tailored solutions for projects of any size, scope, or complexity. We believe in working openly and transparently, together, delivering world-class projects. We work collaboratively with teams across the world, from Canada to Brazil in the south to India in the east, delivering exceptional value and innovation to our clients. To support our growth initiatives, we are expanding our team and are looking for innovative, forward-thinking people who enjoy challenges and want to add value to project success, both locally and internationally.

 We are seeking a Water Resources Engineer to join our Mine Water Resources team. The successful candidate will report to the Director – Mine Water Resources, your duties will be distributed among the following general activities:

 Project Execution/Management; and
 Business Development

 This role will be based in Vancouver, BC.

 Your role within the team: 

You will participate in the conduct of hydrological studies to assess the conditions applicable to the sites under study and in the establishment of water and mass balances to guide the design of civil engineering and water treatment works.
 Your involvement in projects may also include providing technical support or project management duties relating to the design of various hydraulic structures for water management, such as ditches, weirs, basins, pumping stations, culverts, spillways, etc., according to the specific needs of each project.
 Prepare technical notes, reports, and presentations.
 Participate in the preparation of technical proposals.
 Support existing resources in each discipline as needed.
 Support development of mine water management services through knowledge of mining industry governance for mine water management, mine closure/reclamation, climate change/adaptation, and low carbon emissions.
 Actively participate and pursue engagement within AtkinsRéalis M&M to advance innovation in services offered to industry relating to mine water management, closure/reclamation, carbon capture and mitigating impacts from climate change (climate adaptation).


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Bachelor's Degree in civil engineering with a specialization in hydrology, hydraulics, or equivalent.
 3+ years of hands-on experience in the field of water resources engineering.
 Proficient in the use of HEC-HMS and HEC-RAS software, demonstrating a strong understanding of hydrological and hydraulic principles.
 Experience using GIS Tools and proficiency in flood and hydraulic modeling software is highly desirable.
 Master’s degree in engineering or related field is considered an asset.

 Radiation Protection Manager provides an essential service to facilitate safe operation of Candu licensed facilities. The successful candidate will be expected to meet CANDU’s business objectives/customer requirements, and to ensure that this function is performed efficiently, within all applicable regulatory requirements.  Your role within the team:

 Act as Radiation Protection Program Authority for the RP Program for the Candu licensed facilities at the Mississauga and Whitby facilities, ensuring the program is maintained and managed effectively.
 Managing a team of health physicists and radiation surveyors, provide radiation protection services and advice on a day-to-day basis to users of the licensed radioactive facilities at the Mississauga facility.
 Interact with project and facilities management to plan and prepare for upcoming work in the facilities, including the scheduling of radioactive material shipments in and out of the facilities.
 Recruit, hire and manage RP and HP staff for all Candu licensed facilities.
 Act as a representative and advocate of radiation protection within and outside the company upholding and implementing high standards.
 Work with the Radiation Protection Director to ensure effective and consistent implementation of all radiation protection requirements across all Candu contracts nationally and internationally.

Opérateur.trice, Énergie et systèmes

 Le Réseau Express Métropolitain (REM) est un réseau de train léger automatisé conçu pour simplifier les déplacements dans la grande région de Montréal. Le REM est l'un des plus importants réseaux de transport automatisé au monde et le plus important projet de transport en commun entrepris au Québec au cours des 50 dernières années. Avec ses 67 km et 26 stations, le REM vous emmènera rapidement au centre-ville, sur la Rive-Sud, sur la Rive-Nord, dans l'ouest de l'ile ainsi qu’à l'aéroport.

 Le Groupe des Partenaires pour la Mobilité des Montréalais (Groupe PMM) est le Consortium choisi pour la fourniture d’un système complet de métro léger automatique et sans conducteur comprenant le matériel roulant et la signalisation ainsi que services d’Exploitation et Maintenance (E&M) afin de mettre en œuvre le projet du REM. Les membres de ce Consortium sont Alstom et AtkinsRéalis.

 L’équipe E&M est en charge de l’exploitation du REM ainsi que de la maintenance de l’ensemble des infrastructures et équipements du réseau, incluant les véhicules, les voies, les stations et les centres de maintenance de Rive-Sud, St-Eustache et Sainte-Anne-de-Bellevue.

 Le Groupe PMM est à la recherche de candidats compétents et dynamiques pour combler le poste d’Opérateur énergie et systèmes. Le titulaire du poste aura un rôle clé puisqu’il contribuera activement à la réalisation de la mission du Groupe PMM, soit d’assurer l’efficacité de la mobilité des voyageurs du réseau REM.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe

 Au sein de l’équipe d’exploitation et maintenance, vous relèverez du Chef de service, Poste de Contrôle Centralisé et vous aurez à :

 Gérer l’alimentation traction, en mode dégradé ou en situation normale, la ventilation ainsi que les signalements et les alarmes,
 Commander le retrait de la tension d'alimentation de traction au besoin
 Surveiller et contrôler l’alimentation de la zone de signalisation et de non-signalisation et des ateliers de maintenance
 Surveiller et prendre action sur les alarmes des stations tels que : ascenseurs, escaliers mécaniques, détections d’incendies, systèmes d’air climatisé & de ventilation, éclairage, alimentation électrique des stations, portes palières, etc., en collaboration avec l’opérateur trafic
 Gérer les incidents de détection d'obstacles des portes palières
 Contrôler des scénarios de ventilation pour expulser la fumée des tunnels et stations
 Coordonner les activités et les ressources requises à la maintenance qui se produisent sur des équipements ou dans les installations REM sous sa responsabilité;
 Fournir aux intervenants en salle de contrôle et sur le réseau, l’information pertinente sur les anomalies et les incidents;
 Avoir une gouverne opérationnelle sur les employés terrain lors d’intervention
 Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les autres opérateurs;
 Maintenir à jour ses connaissances concernant l’application des règles, normes, procédures et consignes.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ?

 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe, au Canada et dans le monde entier;
 un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 l’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.


 L’Opérateur.trice, Énergie et systèmes recherché.e

 Diplôme d’études collégiales spécialisé en électrodynamique ou technologie de l’électronique ou génie électrique ou technologie de l’électronique industrielle ou toute autre discipline appropriée.
 Expérience pertinente en salle de contrôle ou en gestion de l’énergie électrique (secteur manufacturier ou usine d’épuration, par exemple) - ATOUT
 Facilité à utiliser les outils de radiocommunication
 Facilité à travailler avec les ordinateurs car ils seront des principaux outils de travail
 Posséder une excellente maîtrise du français (verbal et écrit).
 Anglais fonctionnel

 AtkinsRealis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology.

 Your role within the team

 As a member of our Automated Refueling team, you will:


 Perform conceptual and/or detailed design of Candu instrumentation and control systems and modifications thereof, including definition of system functional and performance requirements and control algorithms, definition of control logic and wiring arrangements, control parameters, setpoints, instrument ranges and environmental qualification and seismic qualification.
 Perform specification, sizing, and selection for various types of I&C components, and produce component related documentation including assessment documents, setpoint calculations, error analyses, technical specifications, etc,.
 Update and/or prepare I&C engineering design documents including design requirements, design description, elementary diagrams, functional specifications, etc., together with the supporting analysis/assessment documents and other design basis documents.
 Provide input to the drawing office for the preparation of various I&C related engineering drawings such as general arrangement drawings, instrument loop diagrams, wiring and connection diagrams, bills of materials, etc.
 Provide or update wiring and technical design input to computerized wiring programs.
 Interface with various engineering disciplines, suppliers, and other areas of the company.
 Assist in providing responses to technical enquiries from design review teams and regulatory agencies.
 Assist in providing technical support to engineering groups at site.
 Deliver technical presentations accurately and effectively.
 Manage assigned work effectively, including prioritizing, executing, managing schedule and budget, and reporting, to meet project goals.

 Relevant Honours degree in a relevant field of engineering from a university of recognized standing, with some experience at an operating nuclear power station
 Demonstrate good technical skills and problem-solving capabilities, and be able to seek practical solutions to engineering problems.
 Possesses good interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment.
 Excellent written and oral communication skills.
 Willingness to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW).

Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?

 SNC-Lavalin inc., en collaboration avec ses partenaires, est fière d’avoir gagné le projet du prolongement de la ligne bleue du métro de Montréal, estimé à plus de 2.6 milliards de dollars. Ce prolongement s’étendra sur une longueur de tunnel d’environ 5,8 km et comprendra l’ajout de cinq (5) stations à l’est de l’actuelle station Saint-Michel, soit les stations Pie-IX, Viau, Lacordaire, Langelier et Anjou (terminus).

 Le projet comprend également l’ajout de deux terminus d’autobus métropolitains, un stationnement incitatif métropolitain ainsi qu’un tunnel piétonnier pour faire le lien avec le futur service rapide par bus sur le boulevard Pie-IX. Plusieurs infrastructures opérationnelles y seront construites afin d’assurer l’exploitation de ce nouveau tronçon, dont un garage de trains de métro, un centre d’attachement, un centre de services regroupant les équipes d’entretien des infrastructures en station et un poste de district.

 Le bureau de projet sera situé au centre-ville de Montréal sur la rue De la Gauchetière Ouest.
 Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe ?


Recueillir les données de base du client et des autres intervenants
Préparer et effectuer le suivi des échéanciers et des budgets de réalisation des travaux
Participer à toutes les phases de la conception des systèmes électriques tels que distribution, éclairage, alarmes incendie et autres systèmes connexes
Participer aux réunions de coordination
Rédiger des devis techniques d’électricité
Évaluer les coûts des travaux
Superviser la surveillance des travaux
Fournir une assistance au client et au personnel technique


 Que recherchons-nous ?


Baccalauréat en génie électrique avec une orientation bâtiment
Avoir entre 5 et 15 d’expérience pertinente dans le domaine de l’électricité du bâtiment
Être membre de l’Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ)
Posséder une bonne connaissance du milieu institutionnel et commercial
Capacité à mener des projets en électricité
Capacité à participer à la formation des ingénieurs plus juniors
Maîtrise du français (parlé et écrit), bilinguisme un atout


 Ce que nous offrons chez SNC-Lavalin :
 Chez SNC-Lavalin, vous profiterez d’une rémunération compétitive, d’un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire, et d’une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (assurances collectives, programme d’épargne-retraite, regime d’actionnariat, emploi permanent, programme de formation continue, etc.).  Vous pensez qu’une carrière dans notre équipe pourrait correspondre à votre profil, soumettez sans attendre votre candidature en ligne !

Environmental Project Manager

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 The Environment division of AtkinsRéalis is a rapidly growing full-service consulting firm that is committed to technical excellence and exceptional service to our clients. Our growing organization is seeking like-minded individuals to join our team. Individuals who join our team can expect to work closely with senior technical experts and professionals in a wide variety of fields, collaborating across regions and groups to provide the high-quality technical solutions that our clients expect, while receiving unparalleled mentorship and long-term career growth opportunities. We have one of the most experienced environmental and geosciences engineering consulting teams in Canada and we are seeking an Environmental Project Manager to join our Ontario team. This position is office/hybrid/or remote work based, focused on projects locally in Ontario while providing support across Canada and internationally where needed.

 Your role within the team

 The position includes primarily office-based type tasks, with field site visits/audits as required. To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

 Set and maintain project schedules and budgets, including project financial forecasting; makes decisions with respect to overall technical execution of the project; liaise with technical specialists or other senior project managers to ensure the technical integrity of the project.
 Provide technical expertise for contaminated site investigation and remediation programs. Interprets findings and preparation and/or review of technical reports.
 Supervision and mentorship of junior professional staff involved in carrying out field programs, ensuring project requirements are communicated and health and safety protocols are adhered to
 Actively promote Health and Safety programs and culture. Active in business development activities and maintaining client relationships.
 Participates in the preparation of proposals and cost estimates. Participates in short- and long-range planning.
 Preparing site assessment reports to meet regulatory and other requirements, identifying potential risk and scope of further action by appropriate stakeholders, if necessary.
 Communicating results of site assessment to stakeholders such as property owners, responsible party, regulators, the public, etc. via a public consultation or other appropriate communication process.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate

 Diploma or Degree from a program with relevant subject matter. Ideal candidate will be registered as a Professional Engineer or Geoscientist in Ontario.
 Minimum of 8 years of environmental consulting experience with 4+ years of progressive experience encompassing project planning, coordinating and project management with emphasis in the areas of contaminated site assessment and remediation. Demonstrated technical skills in field activities related to Phase I and II Environmental Site Assessments (ESA), including groundwater monitoring and sampling techniques, various drilling techniques, soil sample collection and logging, soil vapour sampling, remedial excavations, spill response and quality assurance / quality control protocols.
 Demonstrated experience with the interpretation of provincial and federal environmental regulations, with a strong understanding of Ontario legislation investigating various potential contaminants of concerns. Characterizing environmental aspects of site based on interpretation of data collected during site investigation, sampling and analysis (for example, contaminants, their concentration and general extent) determining the need and scope for sampling programs, including environmental indicators, chemicals of concern, and sampling constraints developing environmental sampling protocols, the frequency and timing of sampling, optimum locations for continuous or discrete sampling, data capture systems, and parameter list for analysis assessing the accuracy and precision of analytical results by applying good practice guidance or established QA/QC methods. interpreting analytical data to identify trends, significant changes from historical patterns, deviations, or evidence of environmental stresses, etc. ensuring site assessment is completed properly and that action plans are developed and implemented to satisfactorily achieve the desired outcomes.
 Strong communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment, including working with colleagues in different geographic regions. Self-motivated, high energy, strong organizational skills, and the ability to manage time and multiple projects appropriately. Strong written and verbal communication skills in the English language. Capable of understanding and appropriately applying prescribed safety and technical protocols.
 Candidates must possess a G class driver’s license with a clean driving record.

 Radiation Protection Manager provides an essential service to facilitate safe operation of Candu licensed facilities. The successful candidate will be expected to meet CANDU’s business objectives/customer requirements, and to ensure that this function is performed efficiently, within all applicable regulatory requirements. This position reports functionally to the Director of Radiation Protection.

 Your role within the team:

 Act as Radiation Protection Program Authority for the RP Program for the Candu licensed facilities at the Mississauga and Whitby facilities, ensuring the program is maintained and managed effectively.
 Managing a team of health physicists and radiation surveyors, provide radiation protection services and advice on a day-to-day basis to users of the licensed radioactive facilities at the Mississauga facility.
 Interact with project and facilities management to plan and prepare for upcoming work in the facilities, including the scheduling of radioactive material shipments in and out of the facilities.
 Recruit, hire and manage RP and HP staff for all Candu licensed facilities.
 Act as a representative and advocate of radiation protection within and outside the company upholding and implementing high standards.
 Work with the Radiation Protection Director to ensure effective and consistent implementation of all radiation protection requirements across all Candu contracts nationally and internationally.

Civil Engineering Technologist

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 We are currently seeking Civil Engineering Technicians / Technologists to join our diverse and experienced geotechnical team in Saskatoon, SK. The ideal candidate is an individual that has previous soils and concrete QA/QC testing and surveying experience and will be a motivated self-starter who embraces the opportunity to work on a variety of projects and has the long-term drive, ambition and potential to develop and progress within our organization.

 Our projects are primarily based in Saskatchewan, however other opportunities across Canada may arise from time to time. This role will require a significant amount of field work, including extended shifts and overtime. (Example shifts: 5 days on, 2 days off; 10 days on, 4 days off; or 2 weeks on, 1 week off) The projects include out-of-town work, especially during the peak of construction season from May to the end of October.

 Your role within the team:

 Conducting materials testing in accordance with ASTM (American Society for Testing and Materials), CSA (Canadian Standards Association) and Ministry of Highways standards on various materials such as soil, aggregate, concrete, etc.
 Density testing in-place using a nuclear densometer.
 Topographic and construction surveying with RTK GPS survey equipment.
 Contractor and construction supervision.
 Travel to various worksites across Saskatchewan (and out-of-province) as required.
 Work in our central laboratory as required, which may include duties such as materials testing, sample preparation, and cleaning/maintenance of laboratory equipment.
 Participation in our health and safety programs.
 Preparation of technical reports, including documentation of field activities and methods.

 The role may also require assisting with other tasks throughout the year including items such as:

 Providing assistance to our design team with preparation or revisions to design drawing and documents.
 Assistance with maintenance and upkeep of our field equipment and mobile field laboratories.

At United we are a team of engineers, builders, planners and thinkers that design and build today’s infrastructure, for tomorrow. We come to work every day committed to drive growth and deliver projects that matter for our clients, ourselves, and our communities. Through our work in the nuclear, conventional generation, renewable and power delivery markets, we create resilient infrastructure to last generations.


 ABOUT THE PROJECT


 The Shoreline Power Group is a fully integrated Joint Venture of Aecon, United and AtkinsRéalis located in Kincardine, Ontario. Shoreline Power Group is the centerpiece of the Major Component Replacement (MCR) program which replaces the main components of 6 reactors at the Bruce Power Nuclear Generating Station. The scope of work includes the removal and replacement of calandria tubes, pressure tubes, and feeders as well as construction management and trade labor. This project is part of Bruce Power’s Life Extension Program, which will allow Bruce Power’s CANDU units to continue to operate safely through to 2064.


 PURPOSE OF THE POSITION


 The Electrical QC Inspector is responsible for the performance of all quality functions and duties as related
 to the installation of major and minor electrical materials and equipment within their specific project.
 The position reports to the Quality Control Manager.


 WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING



Perform inspection on high and low voltage electrical materials, components, and equipment in accordance with the applicable code of construction and/or customer specifications. Such inspections shall include but not be limited to: 
   
Dimensional inspections 
Review of Material Test Reports 
Receiving inspection 
Visual inspections 
Electrical test witnessing

Generate and maintain Electrical Inspection and Test Plans. 
Perform internal weld monitoring as required. 
Perform Source Inspections, In-Process Inspections and Final Inspections 
Complete all associated documentation; Quality Control reports, sign-off on drawings, create as-built drawings, etc. 
Calibration of measuring and test equipment.


 WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU



Graduate secondary school education in QA/QC or a related discipline at the University or College level or a minimum of 1 year work experience in an Electrical QC role. 
Licensed Journeyman Electrician 
Good communication and organizational skills 
Computer literate in MS Office software 
Good working knowledge of latest Ontario Electrical Safety Code 
Experience with structural codes such as CSA W59 and CWB would be an asset.



 OTHER QUALIFICATIONS



Our background check process includes a full security check and clearance process as well as reference checks. The security clearance process includes a comprehensive list of previous residences, employment, education and other pertinent information. Those with a valid Bruce Power security clearance are strongly preferred

Piping / Feeder Analyst

 AtkinsRéalis/CANDU Energy Inc. is a leading full-service nuclear technology company providing nuclear power reactors and nuclear products and services to customers worldwide. Our 1,200 highly skilled employees design and deliver state-of-the-art CANDU® reactors, carry out life extension projects, provide plant life management programs and tools, and offer operation and maintenance services for existing nuclear power stations. This role is based out of the CANDU Energy Inc. home office in Mississauga, ON.

 Our expertise includes Nuclear Steam Plant (NSP) engineering, Balance of Plant (BOP) engineering, Plant Life Management and Extension, Retube Tooling Systems, Inspection and Maintenance Services, Steam Generator Replacement, Plant Equipment Refurbishment and Retrofits.
 AtkinsRéalis is currently looking for an Intermediate Piping / Feeder Analyst (s) to join our engineering team in Mississauga. The work is in support of Life Extension Projects and New Build project and requires a technical role in the design and analysis of feeder piping, feeder supports, and feeder in-line components. This is a permanent position.

 Your role within the team:
 This position requires an individual who is self-motivated and capable of working independently or under the instruction from a senior technical engineer and develop his/her career and experience in nuclear field. The candidate shall be able to follow the instruction from a qualified professional engineer to complete the assigned mechanical related scopes or tasks and develop necessary engineering design documentation as required.
 The qualified individual will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

 Perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulation requirements.
 Coordinate and interface with client, suppliers, stakeholders and other design disciplines or department to execute assigned engineering work.
 Involve in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design of CANDU or Nuclear process systems and modifications under supervision of a P.Eng.
 Learn and prepare engineering computations and analyses using applicable software (e.g., PipeStress, CaesarII, AutoPipe, MATLAB, MathCAD, ANSYS Mechanical (APDL preferred or Workbench), and LSDYNA. etc.).
 Modelling complex piping and support arrangements using finite element techniques.
 Perform pipe stress evaluation of piping systems (nuclear class or non-nuclear class) in accordance with ASME Section III, Div.1, and/or ASME B31.1 code requirements.
 Performing thermal, fatigue, seismic, linear and non-linear analyses in accordance with ASME Boiler & Pressure Vessel Code, Section III, Div.1 code requirements.
 Prepare Design Change Package (DCP) and Design Change Notice (DCN) packages following customer procedures.
 Prepare technical documents, such as: engineering drawings (including GA, ISO, pipe supports, flow diagrams), change paper markups, calculations, design/analysis reports, design requirements, design manuals, bill of materials, design specifications, technical specifications, data sheets, system classification lists, code classifications, commissioning specifications, etc.
 Prepare TSSA registration packages for pressure boundary modifications.
 Prepare requisitions or Engineering Quotation Requests (EQR) for equipment and materials to support procurement.
 Review supplier technical documents and performing technical bid analyses.
 Provide technical guidance and instruction to Designers/Drafters and more junior staff as required.
 Perform site visits to client and supplier shops as required.
 Perform field walk-downs during different design phases as required.
 Support field construction and execution activities, such as: field changes, design revisions, commissioning, AFS, closeout, etc.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matters.
 Complete the assigned scopes or tasks within given budget and schedule, and in good quality.

 The ideal candidate:

 Be a part of a team involved in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design and analysis of CANDU or Nuclear process systems and modifications.
 Engineering Degree in Mechanical from an accredited university or equivalent degree as recognized by Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO).
 Registered as an Engineer-In-Training or eligible to be registered as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario.
 5-10 years of related work experience in mechanical engineering within a heavy industrial environment such as: mining, oil & gas, power, etc.
 Basic knowledge of mechanical and piping systems or equipment (knowledge of CANDU nuclear systems would be an asset).
 Working knowledge of CSA N285.0 and CSA B51, CSA N289 and ASME Section III and ANSI B31.1 codes and any other applicable standards or regulatory guides related to permanent plant components, pressure boundary equipment, and/or reactor systems is preferred.
 Design engineering experience in nuclear class 2, 3 and 6 piping systems, valves, pumps and for Nuclear Power Plants is preferable.
 Experience in Stress Analysis using PipeStress, CaesarII, AutoPipe, MATLAB, MathCAD, ANSYS Mechanical (APDL preferred or Workbench) , and LSDYNA. or other similar software program is an asset.
 Qualified or eligible to be qualified as ASME Appendix XXIII is an asset.
 Must be able to apply technical principles in a logical and practical manner to resolve engineering issues or technical problems.
 Shall have excellent communication and technical writing skills.
 Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment.
 Site experience in construction, or commissioning of plant mechanical systems for nuclear or other heavy industries would be an asset.
 Must be willing to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW), although this will not be a regular requirement as part of the job.

Hydrology & Hydraulic Engineer

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 Our Environment Team has one of the most experienced environmental and geosciences engineering consulting teams in Canada. Our team members across Canada deliver superior service to every one of our clients. Our people are vital to our success, and we build teams that are second to none. Our team embraces challenges and is engaged in working together to contribute to our business objectives.

 We are seeking a Hydrology & Hydraulic Engineer to join our team. This position can be based at any of our offices within Canada.

 Your role within the team:

 The selected person will have to carry out, work in a team, and/or supervise various types of studies in the fields of hydrology and hydraulics, such as:

 Hydrological studies (hydrological modelling, statistical flood analysis, probable maximum precipitation and probable maximum flood analysis, flood routing).
 Hydraulic analyses with 1D, 2D, and 3D simulation tools.
 Design of hydraulic structures (culverts, ditches, spillways, stilling basins, temporary diversions, etc.).
 Design of bank erosion protection and channel stabilization (riprap rock, gabions, articulated concrete mats, turf reinforcement mats, erosion blankets, etc.).
 Flood hazard and hydrotechnical geo-hazard studies.
 Flow accretion studies and flow measurements (e.g., salt dilution tracing, acoustic Doppler velocimeter, flume, etc.).
 Stormwater management.
 Dam safety review and dam failure analysis.
 Wave studies and erosion protection.

 Ideally, 5 or more years of experience as a Hydrological/ Hydraulic Engineer.
 Member in good standing of a Canadian Engineering Order (or be eligible to become one).
 Fluency in English (spoken and written), French is an asset.
 Knowledge of analytical methods and tools in the field of hydrology and hydraulics.
 Knowledge of one or more HEC models (e.g., HEC-RAS, HEC-HMS).
 Knowledge of one or more 2D models (e.g., HEC-RAS 2D, FLO-2D, Telemac).
 Knowledge of 3D models an asset (e.g., FLOW 3D, Delft 3D).
 Experience in hydrotechnical design, stormwater management, flood hazard analysis, and dam safety studies an asset.
 Ability to work in a team environment as well as independently.
 Excellent technical writing skills.

Environmental Project Manager

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 The Environment division of AtkinsRéalis is a rapidly growing full-service consulting firm that is committed to technical excellence and exceptional service to our clients. Our growing organization is seeking like-minded individuals to join our team. Individuals who join our team can expect to work closely with senior technical experts and professionals in a wide variety of fields, collaborating across regions and groups to provide the high-quality technical solutions that our clients expect, while receiving unparalleled mentorship and long-term career growth opportunities. We have one of the most experienced environmental and geosciences engineering consulting teams in Canada and we are seeking an Environmental Project Manager to join our Ontario team. This position is office/hybrid/or remote work based, focused on projects locally in Ontario while providing support across Canada and internationally where needed.

 Your role within the team

 The position includes primarily office-based type tasks, with field site visits/audits as required. To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

 Set and maintain project schedules and budgets, including project financial forecasting; makes decisions with respect to overall technical execution of the project; liaise with technical specialists or other senior project managers to ensure the technical integrity of the project.
 Provide technical expertise for contaminated site investigation and remediation programs. Interprets findings and preparation and/or review of technical reports.
 Supervision and mentorship of junior professional staff involved in carrying out field programs, ensuring project requirements are communicated and health and safety protocols are adhered to
 Actively promote Health and Safety programs and culture. Active in business development activities and maintaining client relationships.
 Participates in the preparation of proposals and cost estimates. Participates in short- and long-range planning.
 Preparing site assessment reports to meet regulatory and other requirements, identifying potential risk and scope of further action by appropriate stakeholders, if necessary.
 Communicating results of site assessment to stakeholders such as property owners, responsible party, regulators, the public, etc. via a public consultation or other appropriate communication process.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.

 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate

 Diploma or Degree from a program with relevant subject matter. Ideal candidate will be registered as a Professional Engineer or Geoscientist in Ontario.
 Minimum of 8 years of environmental consulting experience with 4+ years of progressive experience encompassing project planning, coordinating and project management with emphasis in the areas of contaminated site assessment and remediation. Demonstrated technical skills in field activities related to Phase I and II Environmental Site Assessments (ESA), including groundwater monitoring and sampling techniques, various drilling techniques, soil sample collection and logging, soil vapour sampling, remedial excavations, spill response and quality assurance / quality control protocols.
 Demonstrated experience with the interpretation of provincial and federal environmental regulations, with a strong understanding of Ontario legislation investigating various potential contaminants of concerns. Characterizing environmental aspects of site based on interpretation of data collected during site investigation, sampling and analysis (for example, contaminants, their concentration and general extent) determining the need and scope for sampling programs, including environmental indicators, chemicals of concern, and sampling constraints developing environmental sampling protocols, the frequency and timing of sampling, optimum locations for continuous or discrete sampling, data capture systems, and parameter list for analysis assessing the accuracy and precision of analytical results by applying good practice guidance or established QA/QC methods. interpreting analytical data to identify trends, significant changes from historical patterns, deviations, or evidence of environmental stresses, etc. ensuring site assessment is completed properly and that action plans are developed and implemented to satisfactorily achieve the desired outcomes.
 Strong communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment, including working with colleagues in different geographic regions. Self-motivated, high energy, strong organizational skills, and the ability to manage time and multiple projects appropriately. Strong written and verbal communication skills in the English language. Capable of understanding and appropriately applying prescribed safety and technical protocols.
 Candidates must possess a G class driver’s license with a clean driving record.

Opérateur.trice, Communication

 Le Réseau Express Métropolitain (REM) est un réseau de train léger automatisé conçu pour simplifier les déplacements dans la grande région de Montréal. Le REM est l'un des plus importants réseaux de transport automatisé au monde et le plus important projet de transport en commun entrepris au Québec au cours des 50 dernières années. Avec ses 67 km et 26 stations, le REM vous emmènera rapidement au centre-ville, sur la Rive-Sud, sur la Rive-Nord, dans l'ouest de l'ile ainsi qu’à l'aéroport.

 Le Groupe des Partenaires pour la Mobilité des Montréalais (Groupe PMM) est le Consortium choisi pour la fourniture d’un système complet de métro léger automatique et sans conducteur comprenant le matériel roulant et la signalisation ainsi que services d’Exploitation et Maintenance (E&M) afin de mettre en œuvre le projet du REM. Les membres de ce Consortium sont Alstom et AtkinsRéalis.

 L’équipe E&M est en charge de l’exploitation du REM ainsi que de la maintenance de l’ensemble des infrastructures et équipements du réseau, incluant les véhicules, les voies, les stations et les centres de maintenance de Rive-Sud, St-Eustache et Sainte-Anne-de-Bellevue.

 Le Groupe PMM est à la recherche de candidats compétents et dynamiques pour combler le poste d’Opérateur énergie et systèmes. Le titulaire du poste aura un rôle clé puisqu’il contribuera activement à la réalisation de la mission du Groupe PMM, soit d’assurer l’efficacité de la mobilité des voyageurs du réseau REM.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe

 Au sein de l’équipe d’opération et maintenance, vous relèverez du Superviseur des opérations REM et vous aurez à :

 Gérer et fournir le support requis des appels des passagers depuis le train ou dans les stations du REM;
 Gérer les images de vidéosurveillance;
 Tenir les clients informés, via le système d’information passager, des informations sur le service, ainsi que des retards ou des perturbations probables sur la ligne;
 Communiquer des informations aux parties externes (services d’urgences);
 Gérer l'ouverture et la fermeture des stations (portes d'accès et / ou portes) et coordonner avec les opérateurs énergie et systèmes pour tous les sous-systèmes des stations;
 Gérer et contrôler les portes d'accès, incluant les CEE (Centre d’Exploitation et d’Entretien)
 Gérer les alarmes d’intrusion;
 Avoir une gouverne opérationnelle sur les employés terrain lors d’intervention.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ?

 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe, au Canada et dans le monde entier;
 un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 l’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.

Administrative Assistant

 Why Join Us?

 Our Environmental Team has an immediate opening for an Administrative Assistant in Trail, BC to support The Trail Area Health & Environment Program. This is a community program promoting health and the environment in the Trail BC area (www.thep.ca). The Trail team provides risk-based solutions to managing wide-spread metal contamination on public and private property. With the focus of preventing lead exposure to young children, they work with families, local residents, developers, and others offering a comprehensive program of services and supports. With over 25 years’ experience, THEP has greatly improved air quality and reduced lead exposure in children. THEP’s collaborative approach has been recognized with a BC Premier’s Award. AtkinsRéalis, formerly SNC-Lavalin, has delivered services on this project since 2008 from the Trail-based Community Program Office and has built a strong relationship with the client and community.

 How will you contribute to the team?

 The main tasks of the Administrative Assistant for the Community Program Office include:


 Support the work of the Community Program Office and occasionally other aspects of the THEP (e.g., Family Health, outreach).
 Answering phone calls, emails and handling walk-ins.
 Responding to or directing questions to the team from the public.
 Facilitating timely and accurate responses to inquiries about the THEP.
 In-take of lead (Pb) -safe renovation requests.
 Electronic data filing as per AtkinsRéalis’ Quality Management System.
 IT troubleshooting and/or coordinating IT support (printers/fax machine).
 Database tracking, scanning and filing.
 Data entry.
 Report generation and mailing.
 General office administration – office supply ordering, coordinating office maintenance, etc.
 Assist with monthly account reconciliation.
 Meeting preparation, coordination support, printing, creating meeting packages.
 Participation in AtkinsRéalis’ safety and integrity programs and assist with routine office safety procedures.
 Occasional notetaking during meetings.
 Minor website updates (upload minutes, links, small edits).
 Proof-reading THEP materials prior to distribution.
