 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe 
Au sein de l’équipe en génie routier, vous aurez à :

 Réaliser la conception assistée par ordinateur (modélisation 3D) des ouvrages routiers (géométrie, terrassement, drainage, signalisation, etc.)
 Vérifier les dessins et les plans de chaussée, de marquage et de signalisation afin de s’assurer de leur conformité aux exigences contractuelles;
 Préparer l’estimation des quantités;
 Jouer un rôle actif dans le développement de la relève et de la coordination technique en conception assistée par ordinateur.

 Possède un DEC en génie civil, un baccalauréat en génie civil ou diplôme connexe
 Maîtrise les logiciels de conception utilisés en génie routier au Québec, tels que OpenRoads Designer ainsi que PowerInroads et MicroStation, Civil 3D (un atout)
 Démontre du leadership naturel pour jouer un rôle actif dans la livraison de projets et le développement de la relève
 A déjà travaillé sur des projets du Ministère des Transports et de la Mobilité Durable du Québec
 Possède au moins 8 ans d’expérience en conception d’infrastructures routières au Québec

Reclamation Specialist

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 The Environment division of AtkinsRéalis is a rapidly growing full-service consulting firm that is committed to technical excellence and exceptional service to our clients. Our growing organization is seeking like-minded individuals to join our team. We have one of the most experienced environmental engineering consulting teams in Canada and we are seeking a Reclamation Specialist to join our team. This position is office/hybrid/or remote work based, focused on projects in Alberta and British Columbia, while providing support across Canada and internationally where needed. The position includes primarily office-based tasks, with field site visits/audits as required.

 Your role within the team

 Provide project management and technical expertise for reclamation programs throughout Western Canada with a primary focus in Alberta and British Columbia managing and supporting field staff completing tasks in soil and surface landscape reclamation (including earthwork subcontractor supervision and guiding quality control), re-vegetation planning and execution, plant identification, vegetation management, Detailed Site Assessment/Schedule B, Reclamation Certificate Application, and soil surveying using the Canadian System of Soil Classification.
 Actively maintaining client relationships, set and maintain project schedules and budgets, including project financial forecasting; makes decisions with respect to overall technical execution of the project; liaise with technical specialists or other senior project managers to ensure the technical integrity of the project.
 Interpret analytical data to identify trends, significant changes from historical patterns, deviations, or evidence of environmental stresses, etc. and ability to assess the accuracy and precision of analytical results by applying good practice guidance or established QA/QC methods.
 Strong ability to communicate results of assessments to stakeholders such as property owners, responsible party, regulators, the public, etc. via a public consultation or other appropriate communication process.
 Supervision and mentorship of junior professional staff involved in carrying out field programs, ensuring project requirements are communicated and health and safety protocols are adhered to while actively promoting Health and Safety programs and culture.
 Familiarity with or experience with the following would be considered an asset: unified soil classification system (USCS) and/or contaminated sites and/or mine land reclamation and/or wetland assessment/reclamation.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate

 Diploma or Degree from a program with relevant subject matter - Agriculture Science, Agrology, Forestry, Biology or Environmental Sciences, Engineering, Geology. Professional designation (P. Ag., P. Bio., or RPF preferred).
 5-10 years of environmental consulting experience with 3+ years of Environmental and specifically lease Construction or Reclamation Project Management encompassing project planning, coordinating and project management with strong emphasis in construction/reclamation and ecological restoration. Decommissioning, contaminated site assessment and remediation experience will be considered an asset.
 Computer Skills - MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, outlook, etc.).
 Strong written and communication skills in the English language and the ability to work well in a team environment, including working with colleagues in different geographic regions. Self-motivated, high energy, strong organizational skills, and the ability to manage time and multiple projects appropriately. Capable of understanding and appropriately applying prescribed safety and technical protocols.
 Must have a valid Class 5 driver’s license with a clean driving record.


 Are you up for this challenge? Apply today and join our team to help engineer a Better Future for our Planet and its People.

 About AtkinsRéalis
 Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. The breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital.

Technicien(ne) en électricité industrielle 

AtkinsRéalis a démontré de longue date sa capacité à mener à bien des projets dans tout le secteur industriel. Son savoir-faire couvre des secteurs aussi divers allant de ceux du domaine minier, du traitement de l’eau, à ceux du secteur pétrole et du gaz et des produits chimiques.
 En collaborant avec nos clients industriels, nous contribuons à maximiser les actifs et à accroître l’efficacité, peu importe le domaine ou l’envergure des activités.
 Nous fournissons en outre des solutions de formation virtuelle sur mesure aux industries de la transformation et des processus, créant ainsi une valeur durable pour nos clients
 Le département industriel du bureau de Québec est actuellement à la recherche d’un(e) technicien(ne) en électricité industrielle pour joindre l’équipe dynamique déjà en place.

 Votre rôle au sein de l'équipe :

 Participer à la conception des plans et à la rédaction des devis techniques pour des systèmes électriques
 Participer à l’élaboration des standards, des schémas unifilaires, plans d’implantation et des schémas d’interconnexions, distribution électrique
 Vérifier, accepter et/ou corriger les dessins des lots de fournisseurs pour confirmer leur pertinence aux exigences et conditions du projet
 Évaluer les coûts de construction
 Rédiger les fiches techniques
 Surveillance des travaux de construction
 Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis en tant qu'employeur ? Parce que nous offrons :

 L'opportunité de travailler sur divers projets majeurs pour des clients internes et externes.
 Un environnement passionnant où l'équilibre entre travail et vie personnelle est important.
 Une large gamme d'opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement.
 Un salaire compétitif, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un plan de participation des employés et un régime de retraite à cotisations définies.
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et la sécurité.

 DEC en technologie de l’électronique industrielle (option électrodynamique, option instrumentation, un atout) ou expérience équivalente
 Posséder 5 à 10 années d’expérience pertinente en électricité, idéalement dans des firmes d’ingénierie
 Excellente connaissance d’AutoCAD, connaissance d’AutoCad 3D ou de Revit,
 Le /la candidat (e ) est en mesure de s’exprimer en français (à l’oral et à l’écrit) et en anglais (à l’oral)*

Rail Infrastructure Engineer / Engineer-in-Training

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 The AtkinsRéalis Rail, Transit & Mobility group designs and builds lasting rail infrastructure for cities and communities across the globe. We offer strategic solutions for the planning, financing, design, construction, operation, testing and commissioning of mass transit systems and railways. Our diverse and multicultural team is driven by a fierce pride in their work, a pioneering vision and a passion for rail transportation.

 We are looking for at least two Generalist Engineers / EITs to work at the intersection of Engineering and Project Management at our Vancouver/Burnaby office. The successful candidate will report into the Rail Infrastructure team; however, responsibilities and opportunities will vary depending on interest, capabilities and career objectives. This role is not limited to trackwork design. Suitable candidates will be agile, self-motivated and interested in pursuing a career in the design, construction and project management for light rail, metro and/or heavy rail transportation networks in Canada and worldwide.

 Your role within the team:

 Conceptual and detailed design in Trackwork and Alignment, as well as potential opportunities in other disciplines:
   
 Rail Control Systems
 Rolling Stock
 Systems Engineering
 Systems Safety Assurance
 Project Management
 Civil Design



 Field engineering and construction support.
 Coordination of project deliverables and associated time management/teamwork.
 Multi-disciplinary coordination and communication.
 Communication with clients, contractors and/or other stakeholders.
 Drawing and documentation sign/seal (if applicable; this does not apply to EIT applicants).
 Assistance with project management tasks such as scheduling and estimating.
 Participation in the development of service offers (bids/pursuits).
 Attendance at the office (Vancouver or Burnaby) at least twice per week on average.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 A university degree in Civil, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering.
 Registration or eligibility for registration with the Engineers and Geoscientists British Columbia (EGBC).
 Experience in railway engineering or a related field – or a desire to learn.
 Computer competency and familiarity with AutoCAD and/or Microstation.
 High competency with Microsoft Office suite.
 Good communication skills / soft skills.
 Strong work ethic and career aspirations.
 All levels of experience are considered.

 Assets – 

French language skills.
 Experience with project management tools such as MS Project.
 Experience in railway project bids and/or construction – estimating, scheduling, construction methodology, quality, etc.
 Other technical rail systems experience – e.g. rolling stock, operations, etc.


 The Vancouver Rail Infrastructure team:

 The Vancouver Rail Infrastructure team is a diverse team of engineers, drafters, project/business managers and beyond, working together to strengthen our capabilities and to build meaningful transportation projects we can be proud of. We work in hybrid mode between our homes and two offices in the lower mainland – downtown Vancouver and Burnaby Kingsway.

 At AtkinsRéalis, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (i.e.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

Technical Engineering Manager- Fueling Machine Design

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 CANDU Energy Inc. is a leading full-service nuclear technology company providing nuclear power reactors and nuclear products and services to customers worldwide. Our 1,400 highly skilled employees design and deliver state-of-the-art CANDU® reactors, carry out life extension projects, provide plant life management programs and tools, and offer operation and maintenance services for existing nuclear power stations. This role is based out of the CANDU Energy Inc. home office in Mississauga, ON.

 Reporting to the Director of Retube, Inspection and Maintenance Systems, the Technical Engineering -Fueling Machine Design would support one of the various Refurbishment or New build projects. This leader will be responsible for individuals and teams executing commercial and internal work packages and projects, with respect to Fueling Machine Design including other closely related disciplines.

 Your role within the team: 

Forecast resource demands for the assigned work scope, including skills, capabilities, and durations.
 Defines the structure of the project team for their scope of accountability, including reporting relationships.
 Assigns and releases staff, secondees and contractors from their team, as required.
 As required, negotiates with other Technical Engineering Managers to optimize the use of available staff.
 As necessary, organizes and directs the development of project-specific training courses.
 Mentors and/or organizes mentoring of staff to maintain and improve staff performance and capabilities.
 Ensures all project training and qualifications records are up-to-date, and required training and qualifications are completed/updated on time.
 Provides clear expectations and performance measures, meaningful feedback, recognizes and rewards achievements, and takes disciplinary steps when warranted.
 Develops and implements corrective measures to improve the performance of individuals.
 Provides feedback to the Functional Manager on the performance of staff reporting to the Technical Manager.
 Provides feedback and effective recommendations into functional hire/fire processes.
 Participates in the preparation of commercial and internal proposals and approve the technical content of proposals prepared under their direction.
 Participates in proposal reviews, as required.
 For projects that do not involve a Technical Director, responsible for developing and implementing an approved Engineering Plan for the assigned work;
 Ensures that the final deliverables from their team meet customer requirements specified in the contract and overall alignment with nuclear codes and standards.
 Approves technical documents prepared by staff reporting to them.
 Plans and executes work consistent with quality, cost, and schedule requirements.
 Removes barriers that would impact deliverables to meet project requirements and priorities, working with the assigned staff to find solutions and optimizations.
 Work with marketing and other corporate groups to maintain and improve client relationships and offerings.
 Ensures that work is conducted in accordance with applicable Engineering and Quality Assurance procedures.
 Ensures all project engineering activities are performed in accordance with both statutory requirements and best practices in safety and quality.
 Ensures that all design work is executed effectively and that suitable reviews are undertaken to ensure adequacy to project requirements.
 Fosters a team environment and team building within Engineering and with internal and external customers.
 Oversee the preparation of cost estimates for engineering services to internal and external clients.
 Oversees cost, timeliness, quality, and technical adequacy of the work through regular reviews and evaluations.
 Implements planning, scheduling, and tracking of project engineering activities, commitments, costs, and labor resources.
 Interfaces with clients and successfully delivers engineering products in accordance with customer specifications and requirements.
 Establishes the technical approach to achieve project requirements and ensures the design satisfies these requirements.
 Manages the design process and products configuration in accordance with approved procedures.
 Ensures security access requirements including need to know are implemented on a project.

Ingénieur(e) résident – Infrastructures de l’eau
 Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe?
 Depuis plus de 100 ans, nos équipes conçoivent et bâtissent des infrastructures d’alimentation en eau potable et de traitement des eaux usées partout dans le monde.  Ingénieur résident pour la surveillance des travaux d’infrastructures de l’eau dans la région métropolitaine de Montréal

 Baccalauréat en génie civil ou mécanique

 Connaissance du milieu municipal et des contrats publiques
 Connaissance des chantiers de construction multidisciplinaires, 
Connaissance sur les plans et devis, les codes de construction et les normes de qualité utilisées au Québec
 Expérience en suivi et contrôle budgétaire de projets
 Maitrise éprouvée du français (parlé et écrit), la connaissance de l’anglais est un atout.
 Maitrise des logiciels Microsoft (Word, Excel, Projet)

 SNC-Lavalin inc., en collaboration avec ses partenaires, est fière d’avoir gagné le projet du prolongement de la ligne bleue du métro de Montréal, estimé à plus de 2.6 milliards de dollars. Ce prolongement s’étendra sur une longueur de tunnel d’environ 5,8 km et comprendra l’ajout de cinq (5) stations à l’est de l’actuelle station Saint-Michel, soit les stations Pie-IX, Viau, Lacordaire, Langelier et Anjou (terminus).

 Le projet comprend également l’ajout de deux terminus d’autobus métropolitains, un stationnement incitatif métropolitain ainsi qu’un tunnel piétonnier pour faire le lien avec le futur service rapide par bus sur le boulevard Pie-IX. Plusieurs infrastructures opérationnelles y seront construites afin d’assurer l’exploitation de ce nouveau tronçon, dont un garage de trains de métro, un centre d’attachement, un centre de services regroupant les équipes d’entretien des infrastructures en station et un poste de district.

 Ce prolongement de la ligne bleue participera au rayonnement de la ville, du fait de son aspect durable, en contribuant au développement du transport collectif, mais aussi d’un point de vue social en proposant un meilleur service et une meilleure circulation pour les usagers.

 Nous sommes donc à la recherche d’un.e Technicien.ne concepteur.rice Senior en électricité pour contribuer au succès de ce projet.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe 

Effectuer la synthèse et la conception des chemins de câbles dans un environnement BIM (maquette Revit) en respectant les normes en vigueur et les critères de conception à partir des besoins fournis par les différentes disciplines pour différents systèmes électriques comme :
   
 Les systèmes su La distribution électrique 25kV
 La transformation du 25kV à 600V et sa distribution primaire
 La transformation du 25kV à 750VCC, l’alimentation de l’énergie de traction
 Les postes de groupe électrogène
 La distribution électrique des emplacements critiques
 La télécommunication

 Produire plans en AutoCAD à partir de la maquette Revit.
 Supporter à la résolution des problèmes techniques en proposant des solutions qui tient compte des normes établies.
 Participer aux réunions techniques de projets en tant que représentant de la discipline ;


 Pourquoi choisir SNC-Lavalin comme employeur ? Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe;
 un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 l’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.

Diplôme d'études collégiales (DEC) en électricité (bâtiment, énergie ou industriel)
 Expérience minimum de 5 ans en la modélisation 3D 
Expérience du domaine ferroviaire, un atout
 Faire preuve de dynamisme, d'initiative, d’innovation;
 Connaissance de logiciels CAO (Autocad, Civil 3D, Revit)

 AtkinsRéalis is seeking a Senior/Intermediate Human Environment Specialist to support a wide variety of infrastructure (e.g., transit, road/highway, power, etc.) and other environmental assessment projects. The ideal candidate will be a motivated, detail-oriented, self-starter with 5-10 years of experience with environmental assessments and consulting services in Canada.

 Your role within the team

 To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

 Working with and supporting project managers in carrying out environmental assessments and permitting within a variety of sectors.
 Leading the assessment of project impacts on the human environment, including consideration of regional and local economies, community services and infrastructure, land use and recreation, and community well-being and safety.
 Utilizing standard environmental assessment methodology including
 Conducting baseline socio-economic studies, including desktop research, surveys, interviews, etc.
 Collaborating with technical and professional staff across the company in completing assignments.
 Overseeing and directing junior professionals in the execution of tasks, including providing senior review.
 Developing and maintaining project/task schedules and budgets for project components, and monitoring project progress, work hours, budgets and expenditures using project scheduling and cost control tools.
 Supporting business development efforts, including potential client/prospect identification, proposal writing and client-facing activities.
 Participating in industry events through presentations, papers at conferences or through membership in industry organizations.
 Mentoring and supporting the development of junior professionals.
 Keeping up to date on regulatory changes and advising project staff and clients regarding these changes.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.


 The Ideal Candidate

 University degree in social sciences (Anthropology, Economics, Political Science, Regional Planning, Health or Social Sciences, Geography, etc.).
 5-10 years of applied experience in the environmental and/or consulting engineering field.
 Full or provisional membership in a professional body (e.g. Registered Professional Planner (RPP and MCIP); Canadian Environmental Professional (EP); or Project Management Professional (PMP)) is an asset.
 Familiarity with environmental assessment processes (federal, provincial, and territorial, in particular, the Ontario Environmental Assessment Act is an asset).
 Knowledge of other relevant environmental legislation and federal/provincial policy.
 Experience conducting socio-economic baseline studies and impact assessments.
 Comfortable working in English, French language skills would be an asset.
 Valid Class G driver’s license.
 Willingness to travel for short time periods.

 Desired competencies

 Good research, analytical and interpersonal skills.
 Exceptional organizational skills.
 Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).
 Ability to plan and prioritize workload to manage multiple assignments at one time.

 Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people.  We are currently seeking a Geotechnical Engineer to join the Geotechnical Practice in Atlantic Canada, providing technical and operational leadership, having superior client relations skills and a proven ability to deliver major assignments.

 Your role within the team:

 Our geotechnical engineers work closely with other AtkinsRéalis professionals multiple sectors such as transportation, rail & transit, energy, cities and developments as well as industrial. You will participate on multi-disciplinary teams and projects and will be expected to collaborate on multidisciplinary projects of all scales.
 The successful applicant will be a senior Engineering Geologist / Geotechnical Engineer with a proven technical and project management track record and a particular focus on the Energy sector in Nova Scotia and Newfoundland. The role will include the execution of complex and major programs, supporting large proposals, mentoring of junior staff, as well as act as technical reference, and therefore good communication skills are essential.
 The candidate will have a degree in civil engineering or geology with a post graduate qualification in a geotechnical subject and have a minimum of 10 years’ pertinent experience.
 Candidates should have the right flare and ability that will help us develop and expand our infrastructure geotechnics capability by building on the existing portfolio of our rapidly expanding, flexible and outward looking team that can tackle work across a broad spectrum of sectors.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Proven experience in geotechnical engineering for energy, industrial, transport and infrastructure projects .
 A strong academic background with a relevant degree (ideally MSc or equivalent)
 Professional Engineering Designation in NL, NS, NB, or PEI.
 Proven experience of acting in a senior role in a fast-moving engineering consultancy environment.
 Project management - experience and understanding of the needs and approaches to the engineering consultancy and design markets, including relationships with clients, and work planning.
 Proven geotechnical design experience.
 Application of Design Standards and Guidelines in a design and ground investigation environment.
 Geohazards and geotechnical investigation experience.
 Experienced in general geotechnical numerical software
 Excellent interpersonal and technical skills and the ability to support the development of teams.
 Excellent communication skills and confidence to liaise with clients.
 Excellent report writing skills with the ability to peer-review and produce quality deliverables.
 A willingness to travel on short assignments both within Nova Scotia and nationwide.

 We are currently seeking a Junior Welder to join the CANDU Energy In. in Mississauga, Ontario (GTA).This position is responsible for welding the components of the compression and production equipment. Works with a limited degree of supervision within defined procedures.

 Your role within the team

 Familiar with SMAW, GMAW, GTAW
 Reads and interprets blueprints, including reading and interpreting GS's, flowcharts and spool drawings
 Makes comparison of spool drawings to GA's to assure correctness
 Works with different types and sizes of materials

 Good working knowledge with Computers.
 Understands the safety principles of overhead cranes, rigging, pipe threading machine, welding machine, waterjet cutter, brake press, tube bending machine, hydraulic press and various pneumatic hand tools
 Assembly of components with some fabrication of equipment needed for the job with limited supervision
 Carries out directions and works on own initiative with a limited level of supervision
 Works well with other departments.
 Promotes and supports safety, production and positive attitude

 Reporting to the Manager of Retube Tooling Design Engineering in Retube, Inspection and Maintenance Systems, the Engineer/Analyst-Retube Tooling Design would support multiple Refurbishment projects. The candidate will be responsible for developing and/or overseeing the conceptual and detailed design, manufacturing, testing, delivery and execution support of tooling systems.

 Location: Mississauga, ON

 Your role within the team: 


Independently evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering techniques, procedures and criteria using judgement in making minor adaptations and modifications.
 Assignments have clear and specified objectives requiring investigation of a limited number of variables.
 Assignments normally include system and equipment design and development, design modification, investigation of design difficulties, test of materials, preparation of specifications, process study, cost estimating and preparation of reports, review of vendor’s documentation, investigation of manufacturing and installation difficulties.
 May be assigned project engineering responsibilities on a technical or commercial endeavour of moderate scope.
 Work is limited in scope and generally related to one field or discipline of engineering, although a knowledge of related fields of engineering and an appreciation of the impact of the work on other areas may be required.
 Completed work is generally accepted as technically accurate and in compliance with policies and procedures and is reviewed for soundness of judgement and feasibility.
 Work objectives are specific, and supervision is usually general; the details of the work are not normally closely supervised but this may vary with the assignment.
 Normally required to plan, schedule and manage own time, including taking into account the plans of others.
 Ensures all project training and qualifications records are up-to-date, and required training and qualifications are completed/updated on time.
 Plans and executes work consistent with quality, cost, and schedule requirements.
 Ensures that work is conducted in accordance with applicable Engineering and Quality Assurance procedures.

 AtkinsRéalis is in search of a Senior Substation Designer to work within a multi-discipline team to design efficient and reliable electrical substations. 

Location – Toronto, ON

 Your role within the team:

 Assist Design engineer in developing electrical substation facilities including site and bus work layouts, ground grid drawings, plot plans and elevation drawings for outdoor substation equipment.
 Assist in developing Switchgear room and Control room layout drawings for substation projects.
 Assist design engineer to develop underground cable routing conduit and trench plan layout and sections for distribution network.
 Perform simple estimates using data from the utility material database.
 Assist Design Engineer to prepare electrical material requisitions and performance specifications.
 Prepare Bills of Materials and Cable Schedules.
 Guide and supervise the team of designers and drafters to ensure quality of drawings is maintained.
 Perform peer reviews of the drawings prepared by designers & drafters for compliance to utility CADD Standards.
 Assist Design Engineers in the preparation of Power Single Line Diagram, Relay and Metering One-line diagram and Communication architectural block diagram.
 Maintain complete project documentation with respect to all design packages.
 Maintain good working relationship with internal groups that support the project.
 Reports to the Engineering Manager.

**Programme de développement pour nouveaux gradués / Graduate development program**
 Candidat(e) à la profession d’ingénierie – conception ferroviaire

 Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?
 Chez AtkinsRéalis, groupe transports collectifs et ferroviaires, nos principaux domaines d'expertise couvrent tous les aspects de la conception de la voie ferrée, de la signalisation et des communications ferroviaires, ainsi que tous les aspects du matériel roulant.  La personne titulaire de ce poste assistera les ingénieurs et les chargés de projets dans la conception de projets ferroviaire et de produire tous les aspects d’alignement ferroviaire avec l’aide des logiciels Autodesk et Bentley habituel. Relevant du directeur de la ligne de produit système de voie, la personne retenue sera responsable de fournir le support au groupe de conception pour la préparation des alignements ferroviaire, à la production CAD des plans et de s’assurer de la conformité des dessins et des plans.

 Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe ?

 Fournir le support au groupe de conception de génie civil et ferroviaire avec le logiciel AutoCAD et Civil 3D
 Assister les ingénieurs dans la conception de projets ferroviaire
 Participer à conception de plans à partir de concepts préliminaires et assurer leur conformité.
 Mettre à jour les dessins techniques existants avec un minimum de supervision
 Supporter les équipes de projets pour développer des estimations spécifiques de travaux civils et ferroviaires
 Coordonner avec les dirigeants du BIM dans le but de corriger des chevauchements interdisciplinaires.
 Finaliser tous les aspects d’un alignement ferroviaire (géométrie horizontale et profiles verticaux)
 Analyser les données d’arpentage et produire des modèles de surface détaillés en 3D


 Que recherchons-nous ?

 Baccalauréat en génie civil.
 Souci du détail et du travail bien fait de haute qualité.
 Très bonne connaissance des outils de la suite Office de Microsoft est obligatoire.
 Capacité de lire et de comprendre des levés de cartes topographiques.
 Une connaissance d’AutoDESK CIVIL 3D, de Bentley POWER RailTrack et de l’expérience dans le secteur de l’ingénierie ferroviaire, particulièrement dans la conception d’alignement ferroviaires sera considéré comme un atout précieux.


 Ce que nous offrons chez AtkinsRéalis : 
Chez AtkinsRéalis, vous profiterez d’une rémunération compétitive, d’un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire, et d’une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (assurances collectives, programme d’épargne-retraite, régime d’actionnariat, emploi permanent, programme de formation continue, etc.).

Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 ProTrans BC Operations Ltd., a subsidiary of AtkinsRéalis, is the private operator of the Canada Line, a 19-km automated rail-based rapid transit system connecting Downtown Vancouver with central Richmond and the Vancouver International Airport. Our fleet of trains provide a 26-minute terminus-to-terminus service to an average weekday ridership of more than 120,000 passengers across 16 stations. Our operations office is in Richmond, British Columbia.

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 We are seeking an Electronics Technician to join our Maintenance Team and the successful candidate will report to the Maintenance Supervisors. The Electronics Technician works within a team of technicians carrying out comprehensive preventative and corrective maintenance, fault diagnosis, recovery and repair service to the Canada Line Automatic Train Control systems and Rail Communication systems & associated equipment including but not limited to Data communication and computer Network, SCADA, Fiber Optic Transmission, Public address, Emergency Telephone systems, Radio systems, CCTV, variable messaging signs and public information display, Security systems, Fire Detection Alarm and Intrusion Detection systems insuring that these systems are operating at a high standard of safety and reliability.

 The Electronics Technician maintains the systems assets and related support equipment in accordance with procedures, engineering drawings and specifications, and is proficient in the operation and maintenance of shop equipment and instruments.

 The Electronics Technician also provides first line maintenance response to help maintain a high quality, safe and efficient transit service; is involved in the installation, testing and commissioning of asset modifications or new assets implementation. Inspects and approve work undertaken by contractors or sub-system suppliers. Recommends and implement measures to improve asset performance.

 Your role within the team:

 Follow written procedures, engineering drawings and instructions to execute preventative maintenance, modification and corrective maintenance on Automatic Train control and Rail communication systems and related support equipment as required or directed by the Maintenance Supervisor or the Electronics Team Leader.
 Diagnose the cause of failures to equipment and assets and rectify them in an efficient manner following standard procedures and safety instructions; return the service as efficiently as possible.
 Complete checklists, tracking sheets and all necessary documentation related to assets maintenance relating to certifying Canada Line systems as serviceable.
 Perform first line response to Automatic Train Control and electronic systems failures.
 Respond to all requests from the Control Room relating to all systems under responsibility of the electronics department.
 Perform planned preventative maintenance following written procedures, keep records of the results and report all defects found.
 Prioritize work within a shift to minimize unavailability and ensure that assigned work is completed in a timely manner.
 Ensure that clear and concise records are maintained for failures daily, including actions taken and preventative maintenance actions.
 Recommend and implement measures to improve asset performance and reduce maintenance costs and/or response time.
 Responsible for ensuring working areas, storage areas and duty vehicles are kept in a clean and safe state and for completing housekeeping, vehicle usage and other related checklists.
 Ensures that any equipment or materials used are replenished at the earliest opportunity.
 Assist with commissioning of new and existing Electronics systems and support systems ensuring high reliability and safety of equipment.
 Step up and assume duties of the Team Leader’s position in the absence of the Team Leader.
 Other duties as assigned.
 Safety responsibilities:

 Maintain a personal duty of care for one's own safety, and take responsibility for his/her own colleagues, contractors and customer’s safety and welfare and that of others who may be affected by his/her activities.
 The holder of this position shall exercise good workplace housekeeping.

At United we are a team of engineers, builders, planners and thinkers that design and build today’s infrastructure, for tomorrow. We come to work every day committed to drive growth and deliver projects that matter for our clients, ourselves, and our communities. Through our work in the nuclear, conventional generation, renewable and power delivery markets, we create resilient infrastructure to last generations.

 ABOUT THE PROJECT

 The Shoreline Power Group is a fully integrated Joint Venture of Aecon, United and AtkinsRéalis located in Kincardine, Ontario. Shoreline Power Group is the centerpiece of the Major Component Replacement (MCR) program which replaces the main components of 6 reactors at the Bruce Power Nuclear Generating Station. The scope of work includes the removal and replacement of calandria tubes, pressure tubes, and feeders as well as construction management and trade labor. This project is part of Bruce Power’s Life Extension Program, which will allow Bruce Power’s CANDU units to continue to operate safely through to 2064.

 PURPOSE OF THE POSITION

 Under the general direction of the Welding Manager, the Project Coordinator will work with a team of Welding Specialists and Welding Supervisors. The team will support the welding program by preparing welding documentation, training welding trades and supporting field readiness and execution. 


WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING



 Review work instructions, inspection and test plans, technical specifications, drawings and operation and maintenance manuals to support training development per SAT standards and execution.
Collect and integrate OPEX and Lessons Learned from previous refurbishment campaigns.
Provide boots on the ground coordination, technical and administrative support for all active welding deliverables. 
Coordinate with project staff in the implementation and maintenance of weld management software (Weld Console). 
Develop and maintain welding performance statics and communication dashboards. 
Other duties as assigned.



 KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS NEEDED



 Post-secondary education, preference for Mechanical or welding background (degree or diploma).
Industrial construction experience in a coordination role.
Knowledge of construction industry best practices for Safety, Quality, Work Planning and Project Controls.
Advanced Skills using Microsoft Excel, Outlook, and VISIO.
Experience with database management and programming an asset.
Good communication, organization, and leadership skills.



 OTHER QUALIFICATIONS



 Our background check process includes a full security check and clearance process as well as reference checks. The security clearance process includes a comprehensive list of previous residences, employment, education, and other pertinent information. Those with a valid Bruce Power security clearance are strongly preferred.

Directeur.rice de projets en étude d’impact et autorisations environnementales - Secteurs industriel, de l’énergie et minier

 Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe?
 AtkinsRéalis conçoit un avenir durable en reliant les gens, les données et la technologie. Nos valeurs de sécurité, d'intégrité, de collaboration et d'innovation sont le moteur de notre réussite. Nous embrassons la diversité, représentant 130 nationalités au sein d'AtkinsRéalis, et nous nous targuons d'avoir plus de 50 % de femmes dans des rôles de leadership au sein de notre pratique de l'environnement. Votre bien-être est notre priorité, et notre culture de la santé et de la sécurité est à la pointe de l'industrie. Rejoignez-nous pour un parcours professionnel flexible, stimulant et inclusif.

 L'équipe Permis et Gestion de l'Environnement comprend près de 100 employés de tous les niveaux qui participent à des projets clés tout au long de leur cycle de vie: de l'évaluation initiale des contraintes clés à l'élaboration stratégique des processus d'approbation réglementaire, en passant par la gestion de la conformité tout au long de la construction et de l'exploitation. Notre équipe travaille en collaboration dans le cadre de projets afin d'obtenir l'acceptation sociale et de gérer les engagements de nos clients en matière d'environnement et de développement durable.

 L’évaluation des impacts environnementaux lors de l’exécution de projets majeurs dans les domaines minier, de l’énergie et industriel est une discipline devenue essentielle et au cœur des préoccupations de nos clients et des citoyens.

 AtkinsRéalis vous offre aujourd’hui l’occasion de joindre une équipe énergique et expérimentée offrant un service distinctif en matière d’évaluation des impacts environnementaux et sociaux pour de nombreux projets variés (énergie et ressources naturelles, industriels, miniers, etc.), et ce pour des clients privés ou publics majeurs. Une équipe au cœur des projets les plus ambitieux au Québec et au Canada et qui valorise l’implication, la collaboration et le partage des connaissances.

 Nous recherchons une personne dynamique pouvant agir comme directeur.rice de projet en évaluation des impacts environnementaux et sociaux et en autorisations environnementales. Notre équipe se distingue par son dynamisme et notre orientation est axée sur le développement de carrière des gens qui la compose, en offrant des formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun. Nos professionnels et ingénieurs seniors offrent également tout le support requis au développement de nos plus jeunes ressources.

 Le.la candidat.e relèvera du Chef d’équipe Évaluation des impacts environnementaux Secteur Industriel. Le poste est offert partout au Québec avec comme bureau s’attache Québec, Montréal, Trois-Rivières, Saguenay ou Abitibi, tout en offrant grande place au télétravail si désiré. En vous joignant à la grande famille d’AtkinsRéalis, vous pourriez avoir des opportunités de travailler sur des projets au Québec, mais aussi au Canada ou même ailleurs dans le monde.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe:

 À titre de Directeur.rice de projets vous serez amené.e à réaliser différentes tâches en lien avec la gestion et la coordination de projets majeurs d’évaluation des impacts environnementaux, dont notamment :

 Diriger et/ou participer à la réalisation d’études d’impact sur l’environnement et autres études connexes, au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire.
 Diriger et/ou participer à des demandes d’autorisations et de permis environnementaux.
 Assurer le respect des budgets et échéanciers des projets.
 Maintenir des relations efficaces et constructives avec les clients dans le cadre de ses attributions.
 Diriger et/ou participer à la préparation de propositions de services (stratégie, plan de travail, rencontre client, budget, etc.)
 Participer au développement des affaires du département.
 Agir comme mentor auprès de ses collègues.

 L'opportunité de travailler sur divers projets d'envergure pour des clients internes et externes.

 Un large éventail d'opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement.

 Il peut, à l'occasion, participer à la gestion de projets, y compris aux contacts avec les clients et le public.

 Cherche un rôle et une opportunité de développement et d'avancement au sein d'une entreprise multidisciplinaire.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ?
 Parce que nous proposons :

 L'opportunité de travailler sur divers projets d'envergure pour des clients internes et externes.
 Un environnement passionnant où l'équilibre travail-vie personnelle est important.
 Un large éventail d'opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement.
 Salaire compétitif, avantages sociaux flexibles, plan d'actionnariat des employés et régime de retraite à cotisations définies.
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et la sécurité.


 Que recherchons-nous ?

 Baccalauréat ou maîtrise (idéal) en génie océanique ou côtier, ou dans un domaine étroitement lié.
 Ce poste peut être occupé par des ingénieurs ayant 2 ans d'expérience depuis le baccalauréat ou 1 an depuis la maîtrise.
 Le professionnel idéal possède 1 à 3 ans d'expérience dans la mise en œuvre de projets de dragage et de construction d'infrastructures marines ou civiles depuis l'obtention de son diplôme.
 CPI de préférence. Possibilité d'obtenir le titre de l’OIQ dans les 2 ans suivant l'embauche.
 La connaissance du logiciel AutoCAD est préférable.
 La connaissance et l'expérience avec des outils logiciels d'ingénierie côtière est un plus.
 Connaissance avérée du codage de programmes
 Une expérience avec une variété de types de projets côtiers est un plus.

 Location – Toronto, ON. However candidate can be based anywhere in Canada and open to remote working if we don't have an office in that city.

 ProTrans BC Operations Ltd., a subsidiary of AtkinsRéalis, is the private operator of the Canada Line, a 19-km automated rail-based rapid transit system connecting Downtown Vancouver with central Richmond and the Vancouver International Airport. Our fleet of trains provide a 26-minute terminus-to-terminus service to an average weekday ridership of more than 120,000 passengers across 16 stations. Our operations office is in Richmond, British Columbia.

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 The Guideway Technician is responsible for the inspection and repair of mainline track, special trackwork, switch machines, structures, power rail, drainage, walkways, fencing, mechanical equipment, pumps, and control devices to ensure a safe and reliable Canada Line operation.

 Your role within the team:

 To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

 Inspects, maintains and repairs yard and mainline track, turnouts, expansion joints, switches, switch machines, restraining rails, traction power supply and distribution systems, propulsion rail, guideway structures, drainage, walkways and fences, and all other related systems and components.
 Identifies safety critical and high priority defects and implements slow orders and other safety measures as set out in company processes. Reports critical defects in accordance with the company reporting policy. May assist with maintaining a current perspective on the state of the various railway assets.
 Acquire and maintain an adequate level of technical proficiency in aspects of Canada Line systems and equipment, mechanical and trackwork to enable prompt response to operational issues.
 Participate in productive maintenance initiatives with a focus on continuous improvement.
 Undertakes the welding and grinding of frogs, switches, sliding rail expansion joints and running rail, and cuts, drills and prepares rail for rail plugs and installs as required.
 Implements work permits and clearances, and performs the duties of a Person in Charge (PIC) of work zone clearances, including issuing Secondary Clearances, checking power status and applying shunt straps.
 Escorts contractors, providing safety briefings, oversight and Quality Assurance inspections.
 Operates and maintains cranes and heavy rail maintenance equipment, following appropriate rules and procedures.
 Completes and enters records of inspections and completed work in compliance with standards and makes recommendations for equipment and procedural changes. Generates and updates work orders and defect reports.
 Troubleshoots issues and makes recommendations on methods to complete repairs including advising the necessary tools, equipment and estimating job duration.
 May assists with planning work including creating and reviewing Work Instructions and safety documents.
 Reviews the backlog of work and self-assigns work when extra time is available. Assists with setting priorities and flagging high priority work to management.
 Assists with equipment failures or emergencies and clearing tracks during severe weather or intrusion on the track, according to procedures.
 Provides on the job training to Guideway Service Persons and other personnel requiring further training and provides an assessment of the trainee to management.
 Maintains and inspects tooling and safety equipment. Assists with tidying and cleaning the shop and all facilities.
 When required picks stock, moves inventory and maintains accurate inventory.
 Assist with the commissioning of new and existing systems and subsystems to ensure high reliability, continuous improvement and safety of equipment and personnel.
 Participates in first line response to delays in service and assist with emergencies as required.
 Backfill the Team Lead role as required.
 Other related duties as assigned.

 Perform hydraulic analysis and modeling of storm and water systems, using stormwater, and water distribution network modeling software;
 Design of civil and municipal infrastructure including storm and sanitary systems, water distribution systems, storm detention ponds, force mains, and lift stations;
 Prepare SWM, utility design reports, preliminary and detailed drainage design drawings, construction contract documents and special provisions; cost estimates and tender documents for above works.
 Utility coordination, and ability to gather data for composite utility drawings.
 Assistant in proposal preparation for civil and municipal work through RFPs process.
 Conduct site visit and field inspection as needed.
 Ability to check own work for accuracy and completeness and manage time to meet project budget and schedule.

 The ideal candidate

 Holds a bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering (Environmental or Water resources) or equivalent;
 Is registered as a Engineer in Training (EIT) with EGBC;
 Has at least 2 years of experience in Municipal Engineering and/or Water Resource Engineering;
 Hands-on experience with AutoCAD, Civil 3D, MicroStation and storm and water hydraulic modeling using software such as PCSWMM, XPSWM, Info works, QHM, WBM, HEC-RAS, SWMHYMO, Water Cad, etc.

 Is self-motivated, a team player, and has strong technical report writing and communication skills.



 Has valid driver’s license.

 About AtkinsRéalis 
Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. The breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital.

 The Rail and Transit Engineering Guideway Design and Integration Designer position is ideal for an individual looking for an introduction to rail and transit engineering.  Your role within the team:

 Design and coordination of various right-of-way components.
 Coordinate design and manage requirements with external consultants and other third parties including, but not limited to: architects, design code consultants, suppliers, and client representatives. Heavy emphasis of essentializing complex engineering concepts to communicate with non-engineering parties.

 Provide procurement and construction support, including responding to Requests for Information (RFI) and reviewing vendor documents.
 Construction site reviews may be required to ensure conformance to contract documents during construction. Site reports, photos, and preparation of other documentation required. Ensure safe work practices are followed during site inspections.
 Ensure design compliance with the project requirements, codes, and standards.
 Monitor project timelines and ensure designs are released on schedule.
 Review As-built construction records for completed installation work and report on discrepancies compared with design.

Ingénieur (e ) sous-stations électriques 

Le département d’ingénierie en sous stations électriques au sein d’AtkinsRéalis a une opportunité formidable à temps plein pour un(e) Ingénieur (e ) Électrique avec 8 à 12 ans d’expérience dans le domaine du Réseaux électriques, Transmission et Distribution.

 L’ingénieur(e ) sous-stations électriques travaillera dans un environnement dynamique de génie-conseil avec d’excellentes opportunités d’avancement de carrière.

 Le candidat relèvera du chef de l’équipe électrique et travaillera en collaboration avec l’équipe électrique et sera basé(e ) à notre bureau à Montréal

 Votre rôle au sein de l'équipe :

 Préparer les devis techniques pour l’approvisionnement d’équipements électriques.
 Développer des designs conceptuels et détaillés de postes électriques de haute tension (schémas unifilaires, dessins d’implantation, liste de matériel, etc.).
 Faire de la conception détaillée de réseaux de distribution de moyenne tension et de réseaux de distribution de basse tension en courant alternatif et courant continu.
 Concevoir les interfaces avec les systèmes de contrôle et protection; civil; structures.
 Réviser la conception détaillée effectuée par O.E.M et firmes d’ingénierie.
 Auditer et évaluer l’aspect technique des postes électriques de haute et moyenne tension.
 Supervision de la construction; de la préparation des procédures d’installation et des méthodes de construction.
 Faire les études de faisabilité et études techno-économiques (postes électriques, réseaux de distribution, etc.).
 Faire les études de conception et calculs (écoulement de puissance, court-circuit, mise à la terre, protection contre la foudre, éclairage, conception des jeux de barres, etc.).
 Participer aux tests et mises en service, etc.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis en tant qu'employeur ? Parce que nous offrons :

 L'opportunité de travailler sur divers projets majeurs pour des clients internes et externes.
 Un environnement passionnant où l'équilibre entre travail et vie personnelle est important.
 Une large gamme d'opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement.
 Un salaire compétitif, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un plan de participation des employés et un régime de retraite à cotisations définies.
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et la sécurité.


 Le/la Ingénieur (e ) sous-stations électriques recherché(e ) :

 Baccalauréat en génie électrique d’une institution reconnue (Maîtrise en réseaux électriques, un atout).
 8 à 12 ans d’expérience pertinente, particulièrement en lien avec les réseaux électriques et/ou les postes électriques.
 Membre de l’ordre professionnel des ingénieurs.
 Connaissance ou expérience avec des systèmes CCHT, FACTS ou câbles haute tension
 Connaissance des standards IEC, IEEE et CSA équipements électriques et installations.
 Maîtrise des outils de logiciel suivants (ou similaire), un atout : ETAP, CYMECAP, AUTOCAD.
 Le /la candidat (e ) est en mesure de s’exprimer en français (à l’oral et à l’écrit) et en anglais (à l’oral)*



Puisque AtkinsRéalis est une entreprise internationale et qu’elle a des bureaux partout à travers le monde où des milliers d’employés s’y situent, et que sa clientèle est internationale et nationale, nous devons être en mesure de fournir des services en français et en anglais. Par conséquent, une bonne connaissance des deux langues est requise en raison de la nature des services professionnels que vous fournirez.

Substation Electrical Engineer

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is in search of a Substation Electrical Engineer to work within a multi-discipline team to design efficient and reliable electrical substations and distribution network. The Electrical Engineer will coordinate all design activities to maintain project schedules and ensure successful project completion. The Electrical Engineer will also assist the estimating team in preparation of estimates and project proposals. This position is accountable to provide all design activities in accordance with applicable Codes and Standards, including all of SNC-Lavalin’s policies and procedures, such as Safety, Environmental, Quality Assurance and Quality Control.

 Your role within the team:

 Prepare conceptual and detail engineering for assigned Transmission and Distribution projects.
 Assist in developing plot plans and elevation drawings for outdoor substation equipment.
 Develop Switchgear room and Control room layout drawings for substation projects.
 Prepare Bills of Materials and Cable Schedules.
 Work closely with peers to ensure accurate delivery and thorough electrical design that will meet industry standards and specifications and meet good engineering practices.
 Maintain complete project documentation with respect to engineering studies and calculations, all design packages.
 Maintain good working relationship with internal groups that support project such as other Engineering disciplines, Drafting, Procurement, Construction and Project Management etc.
 Coordinate design activities with other multi-discipline project team members.
 Construction support including resolving site queries, attending site meetings and performing site inspections during the construction phase of projects.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 A degree in Electrical Engineering from a recognized Institution.
 A minimum of 8-10 years of experience after graduation as Substation Electrical engineer in the field of Transmission and Distribution is considered to have gained the required experience for the position.
 P.Eng registration with PEO or equivalent required.
 Good knowledge of North American codes and standards such as CSA, NEC, IEEE, Reg 22/04.
 Experience in AutoCAD and Bentley MicroStation is an asset.
 Experience in Hydro One and Toronto Hydro Standards is an asset.
 Good written and verbal communication skills.

Technicien(ne) en caractérisation et réhabilitation des sols contaminés / Surveillant(e) de chantier

 Nous offrons des services environnementaux complets qui améliorent la qualité de notre milieu naturel et bâti. L'acoustique et les vibrations, la qualité de l’air, la réhabilitation des terrains contaminés, les changements climatiques, l’évaluation environnementale ne sont que quelques-uns des domaines que nos ingénieurs et scientifiques environnementaux couvrent pour nos clients au sein d’un vaste éventail de secteurs, dont les secteurs des infrastructures et des transports, les secteurs industriel, pétrole et gaz, énergie et minier.
 Nous utilisons des approches à la fine pointe pour obtenir des données et créer des solutions durables qui servent l’intérêt de nos parties prenantes et leurs collectivités. Grâce à notre capacité d’offrir un large éventail de services, nous aidons nos clients à réaliser des projets qui relèvent les défis du développement durable tout en établissant de nouvelles normes d’excellence dans le domaine.

 Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?
 La division Environnement est présentement à la recherche d’un(e) technicien(ne) en caractérisation et restauration de sites contaminés afin de soutenir la croissance des bureaux d’Abitibi et de l’équipe déjà en place.

 Vous serez encouragé à partager vos idées innovantes, vos perspectives différentes et vos connaissances afin de contribuer au succès du département! 

Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe ?
 Sous la supervision du coordonnateur et des chargés de projets, le technicien(ne) en caractérisation et restauration de sites contaminés sera principalement responsable de la surveillance et du suivi de travaux de démolition de bâtiments industriels. Il devra effectuer des prélèvements d'échantillons de matériaux, de poussière et potentiellement d’air dans le cadre desdits travaux. Notre équipe développe actuellement une expertise spécifique à la démolition et au démantèlement de bâtiments industriels incluant la gestion de peinture au plomb, de matériaux amiantés et diverses matières dangereuses.

 Responsabilités :

 Se conformer aux mesures de sécurité en vigueur, communiquer et promouvoir la culture et les programmes de santé et sécurité.

Cost Controller
 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Cost Control is an essential part of the AtkinsRéalis project services group that supports project managers through project execution to deliver projects on time and on a budget (as sold). You’ll play a key role in providing project managers with up-to-date cost reporting, assistance in planning and supportive analytics to proactively pinpoint cost overruns, offer potential solutions and/or inquire on mitigation strategies. If you enjoy the challenge of project controls by diving into project budgets, baseline schedules and undertaking analysis this position is for you.

 This position reports to Project Control Lead. The Cost Controller supports project managers in the planning and control aspects of projects for cost and schedule to accurately report against project budgets.

 This role will be based in Burnaby, BC.
 Your role within the team:

 Manage a full project control cycle throughout the execution of projects including setting up projects/mandates, monitoring budgets in the Oracle project management-based system against project contractual agreements, and ensuring correct calculations of the original budget based on the proposal
 Keep track of hours, expenses, costs, and budget updates including participating in regular meetings with project managers and other stakeholders (internal and external) to ensure the progress of the project and the achievement of project objectives and results.
 Ensure follow-up of scope changes and coordination with the project control team.
 Manage/validate cost allocations related to the purchase of goods and services through the procurement process.
 Ensure and manage the follow-up of the project progress with discipline managers, including cost and schedule controls.
 Follow-up with project managers on regular project forecast updates including periodic assistance in estimating the remaining project costs (ETC), as well as any necessary provisions and risks (analyze WIP, EV, AR, EAC, BAC, etc.).
 Make corrections to cost forecasts in Oracle system according to the directives of the project manager.
 Prepare and transmit to management reports on project performance (monthly, quarterly, and annual), as well as other documents related to project portfolios, including providing finance team with current reporting period project updates as required.

 AtkinsRéalis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU® nuclear technology and to apply our extensive knowledge to service the Boiling Water Reactor/Pressurized Water Reactor (BWR/PWR) market. Our expertise includes Nuclear Steam Plant (NSP) engineering, Balance of Plant (BOP) engineering, Plant Life Management and Extension, Retube Tooling Systems, Inspection and Maintenance Services, Steam Generator Replacement, Plant Equipment Refurbishment and Retrofits.

 New Nuclear will not be built in Canada without the meaningful consultation, active participation, and support with and by Indigenous (First Nations, Métis, Inuit) Peoples. Our Specialist, Indigenous Participation will support the development and integration of our Indigenous Engagement plan for New Builds in Canada. This role supports key efforts aligned with Our Values of working with Integrity, a flow down of AtkinsRéalis’ Progressive Aboriginal Relations (PAR) Certification Commitment through the Canadian Council for Aboriginal Business (CCAB), and our commitment to United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples (UNDRIP).

 Indigenous Engagement success is based on active and meaningful participation in the communities locally and nationally, building trust, and tangible results (implementation of our plan). This position will be part of a culturally informed and dedicate team focused on meaningful Indigenous participation in Nuclear New Build projects.

 The Specialist, Indigenous Participation will report to the Manager, Indigenous Participation – New Nuclear and supports all initiatives related to Indigenous Participation for large scale new build projects. This role will require collaboration with team members across various functions within the project (e.g., Procurement, HR, Marketing and Business Development, Commercial, Engineering and Project Delivery, others).

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the team: 

The Specialist, Indigenous Participation will support the following specific to Nuclear New Build:

 Indigenous Engagement strategy and action plan.
 Indigenous relations/awareness training plan.
 Indigenous capacity building strategy (including leveraging government programs to enhance Indigenous skills development and participation on the project).
 Calendar of relevant Indigenous events and participation list.
 Build meaningful Indigenous partnerships/relationships (including participation in community events, Indigenous conferences, and sponsorships).
 Internally market capabilities of Indigenous businesses to the Project team, mapping scope need with available services.
 Support AtkinsRéalis’ Indigenous Relations team with coordination/marketing of Indigenous awareness campaigns or days of significance.
 Reporting data for PAR commitment.
 Centralized depository of Indigenous Engagement resources for all Candu staff.
 Nuclear Canada’s overall and project-specific Indigenous engagement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
 Internal and external presentations and workshops throughout Ontario, and potentially Canada, to Indigenous business owners or to stakeholders and service providers who also support Indigenous entrepreneurship, always ensuring that the messaging and content is tailored to the audience.

The Vehicle Technician carries out comprehensive maintenance, fault diagnosis, recovery and repair service to Trillium Line trains and vehicle department equipment, ensuring that the trains operate in a safe reliable and efficient manner. The Vehicle Technician maintains trains and related support equipment in accordance with procedures, engineering drawings and specifications, and is proficient in the operation and maintenance of shop equipment associated with train maintenance.

 Safety critical position: This position is safety critical. Fitness for duty is a requirement of the position.

 How will you contribute to the team? 

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

 Follow written procedures, engineering drawings and instructions to implement the required maintenance, modification, overhaul and corrective maintenance requirements on trains and related support equipment as required or directed by the Maintenance Supervisor or Vehicles Team Leader.
 Diagnose the cause of failures to train equipment and rectify them in an efficient manner following standard procedures and safety instructions; return trains to service as efficiently as possible.
 Assist with commissioning of new and existing trains or related systems and support systems ensuring high reliability and safety of equipment.
 Complete check sheets relating to all work completed on trains and complete all necessary documentation relating to certifying Trillium Line vehicles as serviceable.
 Carry out Train movements to facilitate maintenance & fault finding.
 Carry out train rescue and or recovery as required.
 Participate in Total Productive Maintenance initiatives with a focus on Continuous Improvement.
 Engage in developing a full working knowledge of the train and operating systems, mechanical, electrical and electronic.
 Contribute to the delivery of safe, reliable required levels of vehicles in service as efficiently as possible.
 Carry out all activities with strict adherence to all relevant Safety Regulations, Departmental Instructions, Maintenance Procedures and Instructions.
 Well motivated and take a proactive approach to teamwork.
 Recommend a course of action in the event of an asset failure.
 Complete training for and operate the Wheel Lathe if required.
 Assume Hostler duties as required.
 Ensure that the Depot is maintained as a clean, healthy and safe working environment under the direction of the Vehicles Team Leader and Maintenance Supervisor.
 Direct and monitor the work of contractors employed within the Vehicles Department as required.
 Must maintain Certified Car Inspector qualifications.
 Other related duties as assigned.


 Safety responsibilities –

 Adherence to all statutory and (TNext?) InTransit Operations workshop and trackside regulations and procedures, including impairment and hours of work policies.
 Adherence toAtkinsRéalis Blue Book and associated Blue Rules.
 Carry out maintenance activities in a method that will not cause harm to themselves or other staff.
 Ensure that the tools used are correct for the maintenance action and are free from defect.
 Ensure that all Testing and Measuring equipment is calibrated and within date.
 Ensure all licenses are current and valid for equipment to be operated.
 Attend required safety related training.


 What will you contribute? 

Heavy Duty, Automotive Mechanic, Industrial Electrician, or Avionics Technician, Aircraft Maintenance Engineer, Electrical, Mechanical or Electronics Technologist or recognized equivalent.
 Minimum of 3 years relevant experience within a maintenance / workshop environment, experience with DMU vehicles or in a heavy industrial environment.
 Graduation from a recognized Trades or Technology School relevant to qualifying as a Trillium Line Vehicle Technician.
 Must possess strong communication skills; ability to work well with others in a team environment.
 Must be well motivated and have an aptitude for mechanical, electrical and electronic systems.
 Candidates will be subject to mechanical/electrical aptitude testing
 A combination of education and experience may also be considered.


 Required – 

High School Graduation (grade 12).
 This position requires shift work (nights, weekends and holidays) for continuous operation based on a 24/7 environment. Shifts will be awarded in accordance to date of hire.
 Note: Flexibility will be required to meet operational and other needs, and may require working shifts other than normally assigned.
 Required to give clear and concise reports both written and orally.
 Take ownership of their Personal Development Plan.
 Valid class G Ontario drivers license.


 Environmental aspects – 

This role has Significant Environmental Aspects associated with it which may include fuel handling of and exposure to batteries used in trains and from time-to-time other cleaning or hazardous product.
 Proper handling and disposal of all chemicals and items deemed to be surplus.
