Chargé(e) de projets - biologiste terrestre intermédiaire

 Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?
 AtkinsRéalis conçoit un avenir durable en reliant les gens, les données et la technologie. Nos valeurs de sécurité, d'intégrité, de collaboration et d'innovation sont le moteur de notre réussite. Nous embrassons la diversité, représentant 130 nationalités au sein d'AtkinsRéalis, et nous nous targuons d'avoir plus de 50 % de femmes dans des rôles de leadership au sein de notre pratique de l'environnement. Votre bien-être est notre priorité, et notre culture de la santé et de la sécurité est à la pointe de l'industrie. Rejoignez-nous pour un parcours professionnel flexible, stimulant et inclusif.

 La réalisation d’inventaires biologiques lors de l’exécution de projets d’évaluation des impacts environnementaux est une discipline devenue essentielle et au cœur des préoccupations de nos clients et des citoyens.

 AtkinsRéalis vous offre aujourd’hui l’occasion de joindre une équipe énergique et expérimentée offrant un service distinctif en matière d’évaluation des impacts environnementaux pour de nombreux projets variés (transport, énergie et ressources naturelles, immobiliers, industriels, matières résiduelles, etc.), et ce dans les différentes régions du Québec. Une équipe qui valorise l’implication, la collaboration et le partage des connaissances.

 L'équipe Permis et gestion de l'environnement comprend près de 100 employés de tous les niveaux qui participent à des projets clés tout au long de leur cycle de vie : de l'évaluation initiale des contraintes clés à l'élaboration stratégique des processus d'approbation réglementaire, en passant par la gestion de la conformité tout au long de la construction et de l'exploitation. Notre équipe travaille en collaboration dans le cadre de projets afin d'obtenir l'acceptation sociale et de gérer les engagements de nos clients en matière d'environnement et de développement durable. 

Nous recherchons une personne dynamique pouvant agir comme professionnel.le intermédiaire spécialiste en biologie terrestre. Le.la candidat.e idéal.e sera motivé.e par la compréhension des enjeux de conservation des espèces fauniques et floristiques, notamment les espèces menacées ou vulnérables.

 Le poste est offert à nos bureaux de Québec, de Montréal, du Saguenay ou d’Abitibi, tout en offrant grande place au télétravail si désiré. En vous joignant à la grande famille d’AtkinsRéalis, vous pourriez avoir des opportunités de travailler sur des projets au Québec, au Canada ou même ailleurs dans le monde.
 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe:
 À titre de professionnel.le membre de l’équipe, vous serez amené.e à réaliser différentes tâches qui en lien avec l’évaluation des impacts environnementaux, dont notamment :


 Planifier et participer et à la réalisation de programmes d’inventaires floristiques (caractérisation de la végétation, milieux humides, espèces exotiques envahissantes, etc.) et fauniques en fonction des projets.
 Participer aux inventaires et à la caractérisation de la végétation afin d’évaluer le potentiel de présence de la faune, en mettant particulièrement l'accent sur les espèces vulnérables, menacées ou en peril.
 Aider à l'élaboration de plans de restauration, de compensation, de surveillance et de suivi.
 Participer à la mise en place de projets de compensation et d’aménagement faunique.
 Participer à la réalisation d’études d’impact sur l’environnement et autres études connexes, au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire.
 Participer à la rédaction de rapports d’avant-projet et de plans et devis.
 Participer à des évaluations des effets environnementaux et demandes d’autorisation.
 Réaliser, selon les besoins, des travaux de surveillance environnementale.
 Maintenir une connaissance actualisée des exigences réglementaires existantes et émergentes, des méthodologies d'évaluation et des meilleures pratiques.
 Aider à l'élaboration de propositions (stratégie, plan de travail, rencontre client, budget, etc., de documents de qualification et d'autres activités liées au développement des affaires.
 Encadrer le personnel plus junior.

 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ? 

Parce que nous proposons :

 L'opportunité de travailler sur divers projets d'envergure pour des clients internes et externes.
 Un environnement passionnant où l'équilibre travail-vie personnelle est important.
 Un large éventail d'opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement.
 Salaire compétitif, avantages sociaux flexibles, plan d'actionnariat des employés et régime de retraite à cotisations définies.
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et la sécurité.

 Le candidat idéal :

 Diplôme universitaire en botanique, études écologiques, biologiques ou similaires, maîtrise un atout.
 3 ans d'expérience professionnelle pertinente en biologie Terrestre.
 Maitrise des lois et règlements au niveau provincial et fédéral .
 Connaissance des lois provinciales et fédérales relatives aux espèces en peril.

 Connaissances et expérience de terrain concrète dans un ou plusieurs des domaines suivants est un atout :

 Écologie : inventaires floristiques et écologiques, caractérisation des milieux humides et forestiers, espèces floristiques à statut particulier et exotiques envahissantes ;
 Habitat du poisson : Caractérisation, pêches scientifiques, coordination sur le terrain (un atout).
 Herpétologie.
 Mammifères et micromammifères.
 Avifaune.
 Capacité à identifier avec assurance les plantes à l'aide des ressources disponibles (guides de terrain, clés, etc.), un atout.
 Capacité à effectuer l’inventaire d’habitat afin de déterminer s’il est propice à la présence et au potentiel faune/flore, avec un accent particulier sur les espèces en péril, un atout .
 Capacité à analyser des données tabulaires et à interpréter le contenu des ensembles de données.
 Aptitude pour le travail en équipe et la gestion de projets.
 Excellentes aptitudes en rédaction, analyse et esprit de synthèse.
 D'excellentes aptitudes verbales et interpersonnelles sont requises, ainsi qu'une aptitude à assurer la liaison avec les clients.
 Formation ASP Construction (un atout)
 Permis de conduire valide ; et, être disposé.e à voyager (pour une courte durée).

 The Technical Manager will be responsible to manage a team of designers and modelers to support Darlington Small Modular Reactor (SMR) project.

 Lead a team of designers and modelers in preparation of overall plant (Civil, Mechanical, Electrical and I&C) 3D models and subsequent drawing output.

Engineering Discipline Manager – Feeder/ Piping

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 Reporting to the Director of Reactor Components and Mechanical Engineering Division, the Discipline Engineering Manager – Feeder/ Piping will be assigned to work on large scale projects (e.g., Bruce Power - Major Component Replacement) and will laterally report to the Project Engineering Director (PED) and Project Director (PD).

 The Engineering Discipline Manager – Feeder/ Piping will lead the design activity related to feeder and piping for the assigned project.

 Your role within the Team:

 Providing technical leadership in Feeder design engineering including the preparation of the technical specifications, drawings, design specifications, bill of materials, and design certifications.
 Providing technical expertise on code and standard requirements such as CSA N285 and ASME Section III Division 1 pressure boundary requirements.
 Responsible for developing project scope and deliverable definition in compliance with the governing contract documents, quality requirements for the project and any additional customer requirements.
 Assist in the preparation of proposals in support of the engineering scope on the assigned project.
 Makes decision/recommendation with respect to resourcing requirements on the project and work with the relevant functional managers who will assign the engineering resources.
 Ensure that an appropriate combination of skills and experience is maintained within the project to be able to provide technical leadership and specialized expertise as required to support the project.
 Mentoring, training, developing, motivating, coaching, and evaluating the performance of the staff.
 Working with the PD and PED to plan the work, ensuring resource availability and allocation, assigning tasks and progress reporting against deliverables.
 Ensuring that the activities are executed in accordance with the specified requirements including review and endorsement of the technical content of the deliverables, verification and ensuring a high-quality of deliverables, on-time and within budget delivery of the deliverables, and approval of the deliverables.
 Review and approve project related documents/drawings and ensure technical work meets the QA program and project requirements.
 Ensure that all project activities are performed in accordance with applicable codes and standards and company quality assurance manual.
 Interfacing with internal and external customers and stakeholders to establish the priorities and ensure leads and staff are working on the prioritized scope of work.
 Provide strong leadership within the project team, and within the company for aspects related to structural and fuel channel stress analysis engineering.
 Interface with the regulatory bodies such as TSSA and CNSC, as required.
 Form and maintain relationships with clients, partners, suppliers, and project stakeholders.
 Raise scope change (either requested by the client or discovered internally due to technical findings) and critical issues to the PD and PED.
 Lead assigned engineers to find solutions for the technical issues. If needed, engage additional help from Functional Engineering to seek issue resolution.
 Foster a good working relationship with staff, and managers in the Reactor Components and Mechanical Engineering Divisions as well as other Divisions.
 Provide clear expectations and performance measures, meaningful feedback, and recognize and reward achievements.
 Provides feedback and effective recommendations regarding technical staff performance to functional home.
 Make decisions/recommendations on human resource issues and effectively manage and resolve work performance problems as they relate to the project.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal Candidate:

 University bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or equivalent, with a minimum of 10 years technical experience.
 Qualification in ASME III appendix XXIII is preferred.
 Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario (or eligible for registration).
 Experience in piping or classical stress calculation.
 Knowledge of reconciliation and registration processes is preferred.
 General knowledge in finite element analysis techniques and codes such as ANSYS, and LS-DYNA would be beneficial.
 Overall understanding of the CANDU reactor design and understanding of the design of CANDU feeders and piping systems.

 Demonstrated skills in the management/lead of technical projects, and leadership of a highly technical group in feeder/piping design to accomplish the assigned project goals.
 Understanding of quality assurance manuals and procedures.
 Familiarity with CSA N285/ ASME Section III pressure boundary design.
 Good time management skills.
 Ability to resolve technical issues.
 Willing to visit project site to meet project needs.
 Excellent oral and written communication skills, and presentation skills.

Senior Piping / Feeder Analyst

 AtkinsRéalis/CANDU Energy Inc. is a leading full-service nuclear technology company providing nuclear power reactors and nuclear products and services to customers worldwide. Our 1,200 highly skilled employees design and deliver state-of-the-art CANDU® reactors, carry out life extension projects, provide plant life management programs and tools, and offer operation and maintenance services for existing nuclear power stations. This role is based out of the CANDU Energy Inc. home office in Mississauga, ON.

 Our expertise includes Nuclear Steam Plant (NSP) engineering, Balance of Plant (BOP) engineering, Plant Life Management and Extension, Retube Tooling Systems, Inspection and Maintenance Services, Steam Generator Replacement, Plant Equipment Refurbishment and Retrofits.
 AtkinsRéalis is currently looking for a Senior Piping / Feeder Analyst (s) to join our engineering team in Mississauga. The work is in support of Life Extension Projects and New Build project and requires a technical role in the design and analysis of feeder piping, feeder supports, and feeder in-line components. This is a permanent position.

 Your role within the team:
 This position requires an individual who is self-motivated and capable of working independently or under the instruction from a senior technical engineer and develop his/her career and experience in nuclear field. The candidate shall be able to follow the instruction from a qualified professional engineer to complete the assigned mechanical related scopes or tasks and develop necessary engineering design documentation as required.
 The qualified individual will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

 Perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulation requirements.
 Coordinate and interface with client, suppliers, stakeholders and other design disciplines or department to execute assigned engineering work.
 Involve in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design of CANDU or Nuclear process systems and modifications under supervision of a P.Eng.
 Learn and prepare engineering computations and analyses using applicable software (e.g., PipeStress, CaesarII, AutoPipe, MATLAB, MathCAD, ANSYS Mechanical (APDL preferred or Workbench), and LSDYNA. etc.).
 Modelling complex piping and support arrangements using finite element techniques.
 Perform pipe stress evaluation of piping systems (nuclear class or non-nuclear class) in accordance with ASME Section III, Div.1, and/or ASME B31.1 code requirements.
 Performing thermal, fatigue, seismic, linear and non-linear analyses in accordance with ASME Boiler & Pressure Vessel Code, Section III, Div.1 code requirements.
 Prepare Design Change Package (DCP) and Design Change Notice (DCN) packages following customer procedures.
 Prepare technical documents, such as: engineering drawings (including GA, ISO, pipe supports, flow diagrams), change paper markups, calculations, design/analysis reports, design requirements, design manuals, bill of materials, design specifications, technical specifications, data sheets, system classification lists, code classifications, commissioning specifications, etc.
 Prepare TSSA registration packages for pressure boundary modifications.
 Prepare requisitions or Engineering Quotation Requests (EQR) for equipment and materials to support procurement.
 Review supplier technical documents and performing technical bid analyses.
 Provide technical guidance and instruction to Designers/Drafters and more junior staff as required.
 Perform site visits to client and supplier shops as required.
 Perform field walk-downs during different design phases as required.
 Support field construction and execution activities, such as: field changes, design revisions, commissioning, AFS, closeout, etc.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matters.
 Complete the assigned scopes or tasks within given budget and schedule, and in good quality.

 The ideal candidate:

 Lead a team to Involve in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design and analysis of CANDU or Nuclear process systems and modifications.
 Engineering Degree in Mechanical from an accredited university or equivalent degree as recognized by Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO).
 Registered as an Engineer-In-Training or eligible to be registered as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario.
 10+ years of related work experience in mechanical engineering within a heavy industrial environment such as: mining, oil & gas, power, etc.
 Basic knowledge of mechanical and piping systems or equipment (knowledge of CANDU nuclear systems would be an asset).
 Working knowledge of CSA N285.0 and CSA B51, CSA N289 and ASME Section III and ANSI B31.1 codes and any other applicable standards or regulatory guides related to permanent plant components, pressure boundary equipment, and/or reactor systems is preferred.
 Design engineering experience in nuclear class 2, 3 and 6 piping systems, valves, pumps and for Nuclear Power Plants is preferable.
 Experience in Stress Analysis using PipeStress, CaesarII, AutoPipe, MATLAB, MathCAD, ANSYS Mechanical (APDL preferred or Workbench) , and LSDYNA. or other similar software program is an asset.
 Qualified or eligible to be qualified as ASME Appendix XXIII is an asset.
 Must be able to apply technical principles in a logical and practical manner to resolve engineering issues or technical problems.
 Shall have excellent communication and technical writing skills.
 Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment.
 Site experience in construction, or commissioning of plant mechanical systems for nuclear or other heavy industries would be an asset.
 Must be willing to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW), although this will not be a regular requirement as part of the job.

Develops and implements management systems for assurance that the Company’s objectives for Health, Safety, Security, Quality and the Environment (HSQE) will be met. Progressively develops the Health, Safety, Quality and Environmental practices aligned with Corporate and other stakeholder requirements and acts as the liaison with the Ontario Safety Authority to maintain all requirements of the Project Agreement and the Trillium Line Safety Case. This role manages the triage of all incidents and suggestions submitted into SharePoint and ensures that required investigations are promptly and thoroughly conducted with assigned Corrective Action Requests resulting. A subject matter expert leading the implementation and the maintenance of the Safety, Security, Quality and Environmental programs and the ISO Integrated Management System. This includes training and communications, data collection and analysis, handling of non-conformances, conducting audits, leading incident investigation, and working with other departments closely.

 This position also acts as the Management Representative associated with the ISO registrations and provides technical, legal, and regulatory oversight and support associated with the maintenance of the Trillium Line.

 SAFETY CRITICAL POSITION - This position is not safety critical.

 What will you contribute? 

Manages budget, time, quality and other agreed targets.
 Maintains and develops relationships with the Client, third parties and the executive management team to promote an open and honest dialogue and a consistency of approach throughout the railway system.
 Ensure that integrated Safety, Quality and Environmental Management Systems are fully implemented throughout the Company and ensure compliance with all applicable legislation including all aspects of security on the Trillium Line.
 Ensure that the ISO registrations for the Safety, Quality and Environmental Management Systems are maintained and that the Safety Management System is maintained. 
Ensures audits are planned and conducted internally and externally as necessary to support requirements.
 Ensures Controlled Documents are maintained and proposed changes to processes and procedures detailed within the Management Systems are scrutinized to ensure all aspects have been fully considered and addressed.
 Leads the development and implementation of HSQE processes and ensures that HSQE procedures are developed, reviewed and correctly applied. Leads and coordinates initiatives to develop the safety culture within the organization and chair the Company’s Management Reviews and HSQE Reviews.
 Benchmarks against comparable organizations to ensure that best practice is adopted, adapted and integrated into the organization.
 Provides support in the implementation and operation of competency management and document management systems.
 Ensure that all reportable accidents and incidents and all observations or reports of unsafe practices, security breaches, poor quality or environmental incidents are thoroughly investigated and documented in formal reports as prescribed in the appropriate Management System.
 Ensures that all actions arising from incidents, reports and inspections are brought to a satisfactory conclusion in a timely and effective manner in order to maintain and improve operating conditions.
 Maintains all external third-party reporting for Health, Safety, Quality and the Environment and liaises as necessary with Corporate, regulatory, governmental and policing agencies to satisfy all requirements and reporting obligations the Company has while operating.
 Ensure the implementation of safe working practices for all activities in the Company, including works carried out by subcontractors for the railway in full compliance with Occupational Health and Safety, Corporate guidelines and legislation.
 Develops and maintain the Company’s Safety, Quality and Environmental plans and targets, and communicates them to relevant persons and third parties. 
Keep abreast of changes in legislation and advances in practices, in the HSQE disciplines. Ensures a development program and associated funding is available for new product development, placement and training.Other duties as assigned.


 OTHER FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES - 

Performs other duties as required including acting as facilitating host for special events, presentations and training.
 Investigates and review industry developments and recommends application to the Trillium Line system as appropriate.
 Support business case development and manage the implementation of best practices and new technology.
 Gather system data and compile reports as required to meet contractual obligations, regulatory requirements, and other internal requirements as required including extrapolating data analyses for business narrative.
 Manage assigned staff and work with staff to find resolution to technical issues using sound judgment and engineering practices.
 Responsible for the development of HSQE and development talent pool to ensure collective and individual competencies are suited to meet organizational requirements.
 Working with Human Resources provides mentorship and coaching for staff providing guidance on technical problems, as well as professional and personal growth.
 Manages performance of personnel including identifying individual strengths while supporting opportunities for improvement.
 Ensures that individual contributors comply with and deliver annual objectives aligned with departmental and organizational goals.


 What will you contribute? 

Minimum of 15 years experience in a similar role on projects of similar scope and complexity including Quality Management experience.
 A certified QMS 2000 series Auditor or at a minimum successfully completed a recognized ISO 9001, 14001 or OHSAS 18001 Lead Auditor Course.
 Registration as a Canadian Registered Safety Professional is an asset.
 A detailed knowledge of Management Systems for Health, Safety, Quality and the Environment. Practical experience with ISO registrations and auditing same.
 Ability to work with policing agencies and have knowledge of security systems, CCTV systems and associated legislation.
 An understanding of the technology and operation of a computer-controlled railway systems.
 The experience and presence to contribute to team management at a senior level and the necessary drive and application to see difficult projects through to successful completion. This will call for a high level of interpersonal skills, and the capacity to communicate and influence at all levels of management.
 Experience and skills in using computerized systems and current software used in the Engineering field.
 Organized and methodical approach to problem solving with strong analytical skills.
 Strong interpersonal and communication/presentation skills.
 Technical writing skills.


 PREFERRED -

 Augmenting degree or diploma in HSQE or equivalent work experience an asset.
 The HSQE Manager must be a team leader with the ability to motivate and persuade all levels of staff to ensure that the Trillium Line fully complies with its obligations and continually improves in all aspects of its operations.
 The incumbent should be independent and free from undue influence. He/she must maintain a broad, unconstrained overview of the advice given on all work assignments (particularly within subjects being audited/investigated) and must not be unjustly biased by other senior members of staff.
 The incumbent may be exposed to information that is personally sensitive for individuals, security sensitive or commercially sensitive to AtkinsRéalis.
 A top-level security clearance is preferred.
 Designation or registration as a safety professional is an asset.
 Designation or registration as a Professional Engineer is an asset.
 Current ON driver’s license is an asset.


 SAFETY ASPECT - This role has significant oversight associated with safe work and a safe working environment. The incumbent is expected to follow Company Policy relative to all matters pertaining to safety. Safety Leadership is expected in this role.

 ENVIRONMENTAL ASPECT - This role has Environmental Aspects associated with it and the incumbent is expected to follow and implement the requirements of the Trillium Project Agreement Schedule and Company Policy relative to all matters pertaining to the environment.

Manager, Indigenous Participation - New Nuclear

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 New Nuclear will not be built in Canada without the meaningful consultation, active participation, and support with and by Indigenous (First Nations, Métis, Inuit) Peoples. Project Manager, Indigenous Participation will lead the development and integration of our Indigenous Engagement plan for New Builds in Canada. This role leads some key efforts aligned with Our Values of working with Integrity, a flow down of AtkinsRéalis’ Progressive Aboriginal Relations (PAR) Certification Commitment through the Canadian Council for Aboriginal Business (CCAB), and our commitment to United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples (UNDRIP).

 Indigenous Engagement success is based on active and meaningful participation in the communities locally and nationally, building trust, and tangible results (implementation of our plan). This position will be part of a culturally informed and dedicate team focused on meaningful Indigenous participation in Nuclear New Build projects.

 The Project Manager, Indigenous Participation – New Nuclear, will report to the Program Management Office – Nuclear New Build.

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the Team:

 Responsibilities include developing work execution plans, assignment of our recruitment of project team members, budgeting, scheduling, subcontracting, and developing supplier strategies, risk management, and labour/project forecasts. In addition, the Engagement Lead will build relationships with both Indigenous suppliers and communities, create strategies for inclusion of Indigenous Peoples in project activities either through recruitment, development or other innovative methods and advocate for meaningful Indigenous reconciliation and actions within the larger Project teams. This role will require leadership of project team members across various functions within the project to support execution of the plan.

 Essential Roles and Functions:

 The Project Manager, Indigenous Participation is responsible for developing, implementing, and monitoring the following specific to Nuclear New Build:

 Indigenous Engagement strategy and action plan.
 Indigenous relations/awareness training plan.
 Indigenous Engagement budget.
 Indigenous capacity building strategy (including leveraging government programs to enhance Indigenous skills development and participation on the project).
 Calendar of relevant Indigenous events and participation list.




 Responsibilities also include:
 Provide advice/resources/support for Indigenous Engagement New Build requirements.
 Build meaningful Indigenous partnerships/relationships (including participation in community events, Indigenous conferences, and sponsorships).
 Acting as the first point of contact with Indigenous businesses seeking business opportunities on the project.
 Develop and help execute strategies to maximize Indigenous-owned business participation in the project.
 Internally market capabilities of Indigenous businesses to the Project team, mapping scope need with available services.
 Maintain alignment with AtkinsRéalis Indigenous Relations efforts/strategy.
 Support AtkinsRéalis’ Indigenous Relations team with coordination/marketing of Indigenous awareness campaigns or days of significance.
 Provide all required reporting data for PAR commitment.
 Responsible for regular formal reporting to sr. internal and client mgmt. stakeholders.
 Maintain relationships with independent third-party business networks and organization that promote Indigenous and diverse businesses.
 Develop and implement recruiting strategies for the project support Nuclear Canada’s Indigenous recruitment plan to maximize Indigenous representation within the project.
 Support Nuclear Canada’s overall and project-specific Indigenous engagement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
 Deliver internal and external presentations and workshops throughout Ontario, and potentially Canada, to Indigenous business owners or to stakeholders and service providers who also support Indigenous entrepreneurship, always ensuring that the messaging and content is tailored to the audience. 
Ensure that all project activities are performed in accordance with corporate standards of ethical compliance, cyber-security, import-export regulations, intellectual property protections and security clearance protocols.
 Accountable for rigorous risk analysis in accordance with corporate standards and application of industry best practice.
 Approval of hours of work (e.g., timesheet approvals, overtime approvals, vacation authorization) for assigned scope/project in accordance with company policies, project policies and any applicable collective agreements.
 Approval of Purchase Orders and Project Change Orders within the company or project tiered limits of authority.

 We are currently seeking a Project Manager to join our team in British Columbia. AtkinsRéalis Power and Renewables designs, develops, and delivers engineering, including system planning and studies, procurement, and construction solutions for high voltage power transmission line and substation projects in North America and abroad.

 Based out of our Burnaby offices, our Project Managers are responsible for the timely and efficient coordination and delivery of transmission and substation projects for major utility clients. This position reports to the Director of Project Delivery. The incumbent will be responsible for working alongside other discipline managers, technical leads and project managers and be responsible for project management of various projects within the team.

 The ideal candidate is an engineering professional who will have a broad base of engineering design and leadership experience and will be a motivated self-starter who embraces the opportunity to work on a variety of projects concurrently. Projects vary in size and complexity, resulting in the necessity to manage multiple projects simultaneously. The Project Manager will manage activities including, but not limited to, budget, schedule, quality assurance, engineering, procurement support, construction management support and safety.

 Your role within the team:
 To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

 Identifying, escalating, and managing any matters which could pose a potential contractual and, or commercial risk.
 Setting objectives, and defining tasks for the project team, delegating authority, and agreeing with the project director how risks will be shared, as necessary.
 Actively managing the project – both technically and financially, in accordance with corporate and business policies, directives, guidance and procedures. Protecting the commercial interest of the project.
 Facilitating communication, co-ordination, and information flow with the Client and within the project team, including any subcontractors and partners (internal and external).
 Facilitation of all technical documentation required for the execution of the project (Technical studies, Design basis, Conceptual designs, Detailed designs, technical specifications, Field work, Tender Phase services, Construction Phase Services and Record drawings).
 Work within financial constraints and understanding of project financial workings.
 Establishing and maintaining a climate favorable to the application of ethical and professional practices in the execution of the engineering work.
 The successful delivery of the project to agreed targets, e.g., schedule, budget, and quality.

Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 AtkinsRealis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology.

 Your role within the team

 This manager provides technical management for civil/structural design activities for Nuclear Power Plants within a matrix organization

 As a member of our PROCESS AND CIVIL ENGINEERING team, you will:


 Provide technical management of individuals and teams executing commercial and internal work packages and projects in civil/structural engineering. This includes:

 Approving technical documents prepared by the civil team they supervise.
 Removing barriers that would impact deliverables to meet project requirements and priorities, working with the assigned staff to find solutions and optimizations.
 Providing technical advice to staff and as appropriate subject matter expertise to staff and management.
 Participating in the preparation of commercial proposals and approving the technical content of proposals prepared under their direction.
 Ensures that work is conducted in accordance with applicable Engineering and Quality Assurance procedures, as well as statutory requirements and best practices in safety and quality.
 Fosters a positive team environment and team building within Engineering and with internal and external customers
 Planning and executing work consistent with quality, cost, and schedule requirements
 Forecasting resource demands for the assigned work scope, including skills, capabilities, and durations.
 Collaborating with clients and successfully delivering engineering deliverables in accordance with the signed contract, customer specification and requirements.
 Interfacing with engineering director and other engineering disciplines to address interfaces between disciplines.
 Working with marketing and other corporate groups to maintain and improve client relationships and offerings.



 Why choose AtkinsRealis as an employer? Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients;
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important;
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities;
 Competitive salary, flexible benefits, an employee share ownership plan and also a defined contribution pension plan;
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate

 Engineering degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or a related field from an accredited University
 Registered Professional Engineer in a Province of Canada, qualified to seal civil engineering documents.
 10 years of structural analysis and design experience in steel and concrete structures.
 5 years nuclear and/or CANDU technology experience
 3 or more years of experience leading engineering teams
 Experience managing multidisciplinary work with significant interfacing requirements with non-civil engineering disciplines such as Licensing, Safety Analysis, Mechanical, Electrical/I&C, and Process Control.
 Experience managing and/or performing work under nuclear Codes and Standards such as CSA N287, CSA-N289, and CSA N291.
 Experience analyzing structural systems and elements as required using ANSYS, SAP2000, STAAD Pro, SSASI and/or other structural programs
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
 Willing to travel to and potentially work at Project sites to meet corporate needs (Note: the initial site location is at the Mississauga head office in Ontario
 Good knowledge of evaluation of structures including inspection and testing is an asset.
 Experience working in a nuclear facility licensed in Canada is an asset.
 Security Clearance with Public Services and Procurement Canada is a condition of employment

Planificateur.ice de Projet

 Si vous êtes à la recherche d’un employeur qui a des projets internationaux d’ingénierie de grande envergure à vous proposer. Si vous souhaitez faire la différence auprès d’une multitude de communautés en améliorant leur quotidien. Si vous souhaitez vous joindre à une équipe inclusive et diversifiée sur qui vous pouvez compter… alors nous sommes l’employeur qu’il vous faut!

 Pour le Prolongement Ligne Bleue (GPLB), le ou la titulaire du poste sera appelé à soutenir l'équipe de services au projet de le Bureau de projets du STM. Les tâches du poste peut comprennent:

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe 

En tant que Planificateur.ice, vous aurez à :

 Relevant du chef de section PCC, le planificateur(ice) élabore la structure de découpage de projets «SDP» à partir des besoins de gestion et de réédition de comptes et de la portée desdits projets.
 Est responsable d’optimiser l’ordonnancement des activités du projet afin d’en faciliter sa réalisation et son déroulement;
 Travaille en étroite collaboration avec le contrôleur financier
 Propose, développe et implante des stratégies et des méthodes de contrôles pour les projets
 Effectue différentes analyses et recommande des orientations dans son secteur;
 Réalise la planification, le suivi, le contrôle et la clôture du projet
 Suite aux modifications quant à la portée des projets, révise sa planification et apporte les correctifs nécessaires aux activités de contrôle sous sa responsabilité
 Assure la production des rapports, indicateurs et autres éléments de suivi et de contrôle
 Assiste et conseille les responsables de lots dans le contrôle de leurs activités de projets
 Est responsable de la reddition de comptes et du suivi des engagements pour les projets auxquels il est attitré
 Assure une vigie et veille à l’application du Plan de contrôle de la STM, dans un souci de cohérence d’entreprise en matière de contrôle de projets;
 Agit comme expert-conseil, maintient ses connaissances et est mis à contribution pour la maintenance et le développement de normes, applications et systèmes disponibles dans sa spécialité;
 Exerce une gouverne fonctionnelle sur du personnel professionnel et administratif/technique;
 S'acquitte de façon autonome des tâches normales pour la profession;
 Assume toutes tâches et toutes responsabilités inhérentes à sa fonction ou qui peuvent lui être confiées.


 Pourquoi choisir SNC-Lavalin comme employeur ? Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe;
 un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 l’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.


 Le/la Planificateur.ice recherché.e

 Formation universitaire en administration ou en ingénierie
 Au moins vingt (20) ans d’expérience dans le domaine de la planification et contrôle de projets de construction d’envergure dans des domaines associés aux infrastructures (architecture, civil, structure, mécanique, électrique, télécommunications, automatisation, ... etc.) et aux équipements industriels spécialisés (ex. voie, installations motorisées, TCPE,etc.)
 Au moins dix (10) ans d’expérience en tant que planificateur sénior pour des projets de construction d’envergure (50M$ et plus)
 Avoir assumé un rôle de planificateur senior – intégration globale du projet dans un projet de construction dont le budget, incluant honoraires et coût de construction, est d’au moins un milliard de dollars (1G$)
 Avoir utilisé en mode écriture le système Primavera (P6) dans au moins deux (2) projets de construction d’envergure (50 M$ et plus)

Directeur(trice) de portfolio

 Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?

 SNC-Lavalin est une compagnie québécoise d’envergure internationale, qui a acquis, au fil des années, une réputation d’excellence en ingénierie. En activité depuis maintenant plus de 100 ans, SNC-Lavalin est le plus important groupe de sociétés d’ingénierie et de construction au Canada et se situe au 8e rang sur la scène internationale. Afin de satisfaire les besoins spécifiques de chaque client, SNC-Lavalin confie la réalisation de ses mandats à des groupes d’exploitation spécialisés dans le domaine approprié. Le présent poste se trouve sous la division Services d’ingénierie qui chapeaute l’ensemble des activités d’ingénierie pour les Unités d’Affaires de Transport, Villes et Développement, et Industrielle.
 Bâtir des villes réellement intelligentes
 Nos clients sont à l’avant-garde de certains des plus importants changements apportés à la vie urbaine partout dans le monde, et ils ont besoin d’un partenaire qui peut réaliser leurs ambitions. Ensemble, nous façonnons aujourd’hui les villes du futur.
 De la conception d’un hôtel qui fait connaître un quartier, à la transformation de toute une région grâce à un système de transport entièrement revu, nous partageons un objectif universel avec nos clients. Peu importe à quel endroit et de quelle façon ils exploitent leur entreprise, l’objectif est d’offrir des solutions novatrices et intelligentes qui réunissent les communautés et permettent de nous assurer que nos villes deviennent de meilleurs endroits où vivre, aujourd’hui et dans le futur.

 Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe ?

 Sous la Vice-Présidence de la Division, le Directeur(trice) de portfolio, est responsable de développer une approche stratégique des marchés, des clients et des projets associés, amenant les meilleures solutions afin d’augmenter la part de marché de manière fiable et prédictible. Afin d’atteindre les objectifs, le Directeur(trice) de portfolio devra travailler de concert avec les autres groupes de l’organisation que ça soit pour la stratégie de développement du marché, la préparation des réponses aux appels d’offres ou la vigie de la performance des projets. Le Directeur(trice) de portfolio sera responsable d’un portfolio d’une valeur de 30M$ à 50M$.

 Croissance et ventes


 Maintient une présence hautement visible auprès des clients de son portfolio.
 Participe activement à la stratégie de développement et d’exécution du marché afin d’assurer une croissance en termes de volume et de rentabilité.
 Supervise les contrats cadre et assure le suivi de l’exécution du projet associé à son portfolio de clients.
 Effectue une vigie des appels d’offres, orchestre les décisions concernant les opportunités à poursuivre, élabore les stratégies et dirige le développement des réponses aux appels d’offres.


 Mise en place et exécution des projets


 Gère les relations avec les clients.
 Chapeaute des réunions internes (réunion de démarrage, suivi de l’avancement des travaux, jalons).
 Valide les demandes de changement / modifications contractuelles.
 Soutien à la gestion des dossiers de réclamations.
 Gère les risques et les dépenses imprévues.


 Exécution opérationnelle


 Gère le portefeuille de projets afin d’atteindre l’ensemble des objectifs opérationnels régionaux (mensuels, trimestriels, annuels).
 Maintenir des niveaux de risque raisonnables.
 Facilite la résolution des plaintes des clients.
 Participe aux réunions mensuelles internes de l’unité d’affaires.
 Offre une efficacité opérationnelle maximale tout en atteignant les objectifs de croissance.


 Que recherchons-nous ?


 Plus de 15 ans d’expérience de travail pertinent
 Expérience en gestion de relation client; le domaine public un atout;
 Avoir réalisé et participé activement à des projets d’infrastructures d’envergures;
 Avoir participer au développement de marché;
 Maîtrise du français et de l'anglais (parlé et écrit);
 Vision stratégique;
 Leadership, professionnalisme, intégrité et excellent sens de l’organisation;
 Excellente capacité à communiquer, à répondre et à interagir avec les clients;
 Sens politique, compréhension des finances et capacité de travailler en équipe.
 Baccalauréat en génie un fort atout;


 Ce que nous offrons chez SNC-Lavalin :
 Chez SNC-Lavalin, vous profiterez d’une rémunération compétitive, d’un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire, et d’une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (assurances collectives, programme d’épargne-retraite, regime d’actionnariat, emploi permanent, programme de formation continue, etc.).  Vous pensez qu’une carrière dans notre équipe pourrait correspondre à votre profil, soumettez sans attendre votre candidature en ligne !
 Vous désirez mettre à profit votre expérience et contribuez ? Postulez dès maintenant!

 Portfolio Director

 Why join us?

 Our clients are at the forefront of some of the biggest changes to urban life around the world, and they need a partner who can deliver on their ambitions. Together, we are shaping the cities of the future today.
 From designing a hotel that puts a neighborhood on the map, to transforming an entire region with a completely redesigned transportation system, we share a universal purpose with our clients. No matter where or how they operate their business, the goal is to provide innovative, intelligent solutions that bring communities together and ensure our cities become better places to live, now and in the future.

 How will you contribute to the team?

 Reporting to the Vice President of the Division, the Portfolio Director is responsible for developing a strategic approach to markets, customers and associated projects, driving the best solutions to increase market share in a reliable and predictable manner. In order to achieve the objectives, the Portfolio Director will work in concert with other groups in the organization on market development strategy, bid preparation and project performance monitoring. The Portfolio Manager will be responsible for a portfolio of $30M to $50M.

 Growth and Sales


 Maintains a highly visible presence with clients in the portfolio.
 Actively participates in the market development and execution strategy to ensure growth in volume and profitability.
 Oversees framework contracts and monitors project execution associated with the client portfolio.
 Conducts bid monitoring, orchestrates decisions regarding opportunities to be pursued, develops strategies and leads the development of bid responses.


 Project implementation and execution


 Manages client relationships.
 Leads internal meetings (kick-off meeting, progress tracking, milestones).
 Validates change requests/contract modifications.
 Supports the management of claims files.
 Manage risks and unexpected expenses.


 Operational Execution


 Manages project portfolio to meet overall regional operational goals (monthly, quarterly, annual).
 Maintains reasonable risk levels.
 Facilitates the resolution of customer complaints.
 Participates in monthly internal business unit meetings.
 Delivers maximum operational efficiency while achieving growth objectives.


 What will you contribute?


 Over 15 years of relevant experience
 Experience in managing client relationship; public sector an asset
 Must have completed and actively participated in large-scale infrastructure projects;
 Have participated in market development;
 Fluency in French and English (spoken and written);
 Strategic vision;
 Leadership, professionalism, integrity and excellent organizational skills;
 Excellent ability to communicate, respond and interact with clients;
 Political and business (finance) acumen and ability to work in a team environment.
 Bachelor's degree in engineering a strong asset;


 What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

 At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).
 You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!
 You wish to leverage your experience and contribute? Apply now!

Engineering Director, Safety and Licensing

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 AtkinsRéalis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology.

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the team:

 You'll be a Safety and Licensing Engineering Director in support of Cernavoda 3 and 4 New Build. You will be responsible for delivering the Candu safety analysis, reactor core design and licensing engineering scopes of work, and acting as a liaison between the project and the client on all matters related to Canadian and Romanian nuclear regulatory authority licensing topics and reports to the VP Engineering and C34 Project Engineering Director.
 Responsible for developing and implementing Engineering Plans for the project, or phase of the project, for all scopes pertaining to sub-department scopes of work.
 Technical integration and interface control both within the project across the various disciplines involved, and with the client.
 Ensure qualified and appropriate staff are working on the project and are assigned work within their experience and skills.
 Provides guidance, technical insight, supervision, and feedback to the Project Discipline Managers that are part of his/her team.
 Oversight of technical deliverables budget, schedule, and quality.
 Ensure that the final deliverables meet customer requirements specified in the contract and overall alignment with nuclear code and standards.
 Review and approve key technical documentation for the project, or phase of the project.
 Monitoring the technical quality of engineering deliverables for the project, or phase of the project.
 Identifying and proposing improvements in the areas of the project – both proactively and in response to customer requirements.
 Liaise with external client engineering organization at the behest of the Project Engineering Director regarding the technical matters.
 Provide guidance and insight into the regulatory practices and regulations of the nuclear regulators in both Canada and the host country.

 Because we offer:

 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 University degree in an applicable field of engineering or science.
 At least 10 years of experience in managing and/or performing work pertaining to all relevant CNSC REGDOCs.
 At least 15 years of applicable engineering experience including applicable experience prior to engineering management roles.
 Registered Professional Engineer in a Province of Canada, qualified to seal engineering documents in a relevant field of engineering, or eligible to obtain such registration within 6 months of hiring.
 Sound knowledge of multiple engineering fields and of nuclear technologies.
 Demonstrated skills in the management of nuclear safety and regulatory interfaces on complex technical projects, leadership, and project management of a highly technical group.
 Strong leadership and coaching skills in the development of team members and support staff.
 Excellent client focus and conflict resolution skills.
 Demonstrated business acumen – the ability to think, plan and negotiate strategically with a strong commercial orientation and good understanding of financial measurements.
 Excellent communication (both verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.

MSF Construction Manager 

Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is in search of a MSF Construction Manager to join a transformative transit infrastructure project in Calgary.

 The Green Line LRT (light rail transit) Project is the largest infrastructure investment in Calgary’s history. It comes with $5.5 billion in commitments from the Government of Canada, Government of Alberta and The City of Calgary. The Green Line LRT is designed to be both a transit system and a platform for future city building opportunities. It encourages redevelopment and investment in Calgary businesses and communities. At 18-kms, Phase 1 will create 20,000 jobs, $2.2B in long-term city-shaping benefits and more than $6B in property value uplift by 2040.

 You will be embedded within the client office team environment, and as such you are required to be in downtown Calgary, for the full working week.

 Your role within the team:

 Lead a team of construction professionals in a senior management role.
 Lead a constructability analysis.
 Provide field execution leadership during various phases of the project.
 Liaise with the contractor and sub contractor as required.
 Review and direct the contractor works.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field.
 Minimum 15 years of experience as a Civil Construction Manager on $500M and larger projects.
 Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and regulations.
 Strong knowledge of LRT/Metro maintenance storage facilities operations
 Experience on both contractor and owner side is a plus.
 Prior experience as a superintendent is a must.
 Knowledge of health and safety regulations and best practices in construction.
 Experience in Maintenance and Storage facilities is required

 Reporting to the Manager of Engineering, the Senior Structural Engineer is responsible for working with AtkinsRéalis Engineering's multidisciplinary team to engage new clients and architect firms in Downtown Vancouver and being the face of the team for the specific market of Institutional and Healthcare business.

 AtkinsRéalis has extensive experience in developing healthcare facilities across Canada and we are looking for an experienced engineer that is ready to grow in their career and become a Structural Area Lead. Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?

 Nous recherchons un(e) ingénieur(e) en chef passionné(e) pour diriger notre équipe exceptionnelle dédiée aux turbines et aux alternateurs au sein de notre dynamique division Énergie Hydraulique et Barrages, couvrant nos divers bureaux à travers le Canada. Dans ce rôle clé, vous serez le moteur de l'innovation, façonnant l'avenir de notre secteur.

 En tant que leader visionnaire, vous prendrez les rênes d'une équipe talentueuse composée de professionnels du génie mécanique et électrique. Votre rôle essentiel consistera à orchestrer la coordination technique et à travailler main dans la main avec le chef de service mécanique et électrique pour bâtir une équipe de choc spécialisée dans les turbines et les alternateurs.

 Votre mission consistera à élever notre division à de nouveaux sommets, en repoussant les limites de l'ingénierie et en repensant les normes du secteur. Vous serez le catalyseur de la croissance, formant et guidant votre équipe vers des succès exceptionnels et influençant positivement notre domaine d'activité.

 Lieux : Montréal – 455, Boul. René-Levesque Ouest ou Vancouver (d’autres lieux au Canada peuvent être considérés)

 Quelle sera votre contribution à ce nouveau projet ?

 Relevez ce défi stimulant et laissez votre empreinte dans le monde de l'énergie en prenant en charge les responsabilités suivantes :

 Gestion et développement d’une équipe de professionnels en ingénierie.
 Identifier les besoins d’affaires et représenter SNC-Lavalin auprès des clients dans le but de faire progresser notre secteur d’activité.
 Établir et développer des relations de qualité avec les clients ou clients potentiels.
 Participer activement au processus de recrutement et développement de l’équipe turbine/alternateur.
 Participer aux revues de talents, à la gestion des ressources, offrir du coaching et veiller au développement des employés.
 Collaborer avec les directeurs de projets pour assurer la qualité des livrables, le respect des échéanciers et l’obtention des résultats financiers escomptés.
 Participation aux diverses étapes d’un projet hydro-électrique (faisabilité, avant-projet, ingénierie détaillée, etc.) pour de nouvelles centrales ou pour des réfections de centrales existantes.
 Déterminer le type, le nombre de groupes, les caractéristiques et les dimensions principales des turbines et alternateurs en fonction des données hydrauliques du projet à l’étude.
 Définir l’agencement des passages hydrauliques, le calage et l’entraxe des groupes qui serviront de base pour l’élaboration de l’agencement de la centrale.
 Estimer le rendement des groupes pour les besoins des calculs énergétiques.
 Estimer les dimensions et masses des composants principaux afin de déterminer les caractéristiques des ponts roulants de la centrale et vérifier leur faisabilité du point de vue fabrication, transport et montage.
 Effectuer un suivi de la conception hydraulique, du développement du modèle réduit et d'assister aux essais sur modèle réduit afin de valider les performances de la turbine.
 Rédaction des spécifications techniques et supervision de la préparation de dessins.
 Revue de documents de manufacturiers et recommandations (dessins, notes de calcul, procédures de fabrication, spécifications d’achat, procédures de montage, etc.).
 Suivi de fabrication et de montage des groupes ainsi que participation aux tests d’équipements (revue des non-conformités, DMT, QRT, et autres documents).
 Participation aux audits techniques des centrales, de l’analyse des besoins des clients et rédactions de rapports d’inspection.
 Coordination multidisciplinaire.
 Contribuer au manuel d’exploitation et d’entretien du projet.
 Participation aux offres de services


 Que recherchons-nous ? 

Formation universitaire dans un domaine du génie (idéalement Mécanique ou électrique);
 Expérience de plus de 15 ans, principalement reliée au domaine des Turbines-Alternateurs;
 Expérience dans la gestion d’une équipe de professionnels;
 Membre de l’Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec ou équivalent;
 Bilinguisme français / anglais serait un atout.


 Team leader – Turbine and Generators
 Why join our team?

 We are seeking a passionate Chief Engineer to lead our exceptional team dedicated to turbines and alternators within our dynamic Hydraulic Energy and Dams division, spanning across our diverse offices throughout Canada. In this pivotal role, you will be the driving force of innovation, shaping the future of our industry.

 As a visionary leader, you will take the reins of a talented team of mechanical and electrical engineering professionals. Your essential role will involve orchestrating technical coordination and working hand in hand with the head of mechanical and electrical services to build a powerhouse team specialized in turbines and alternators.

 Your mission will be to elevate our division to new heights, pushing the boundaries of engineering and reimagining industry standards. You will be the catalyst for growth, molding and guiding your team towards exceptional achievements, and positively influencing our field of expertise.

 Location: Montréal - 455, Boul. René-Lévesque West or Vancouver (other locations in Canada may be considered)

 How will you contribute to this new project?

 Take up this challenging task and make your mark in the world of energy by assuming the following responsibilities:

 Manage and develop a team of engineering professionals.
 Identify business needs and represent SNC-Lavalin to clients to advance our business.
 Establish and develop quality relationships with clients or potential clients.
 Actively participate in the recruitment and development process of the turbine/alternator team.
 Participate in talent reviews, resource management, coaching and employee development.
 Collaborate with project managers to ensure quality of deliverables, respect of deadlines and achievement of expected financial results.
 Participate in the various stages of a hydroelectric project (feasibility, preliminary design, detailed engineering, etc.) for new power plants or refurbishments of existing plants.
 Determining the type, number of units, characteristics and main dimensions of turbines and alternators based on the hydraulic data of the project under study.
 Define the layout of the hydraulic passages, the timing and center-to-center distance of the units, which will serve as a basis for the power plant layout.
 Estimate unit efficiency for energy calculations.
 Estimate the dimensions and weights of the main components in order to determine the characteristics of the power plant's overhead travelling cranes and verify their feasibility from the manufacturing, transport and assembly points of view.
 Monitor hydraulic design, scale model development and assist in scale model testing to validate turbine performance.
 Write technical specifications and supervise preparation of drawings.


 Review of manufacturers' documents and recommendations (drawings, calculation notes, manufacturing procedures, purchasing specifications, assembly procedures, etc.).
 Follow-up of unit manufacturing and assembly, as well as participation in equipment testing (review of non-conformances, RFI, and other documents).
 Participation in technical audits of plants, analysis of customer requirements and drafting of inspection reports.
 Multidisciplinary coordination.
 Contribute to the project operations and maintenance manual.
 Participation in service offers.


 What are we looking for? 

University degree in an engineering field (ideally Mechanical or Electrical);
 Over 15 years' experience, mainly in the turbine-generator field;
 Experience in managing a team of professionals;
 Member of the Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec or equivalent;
 Bilingualism French / English would be an asset.

 Chez SNC-Lavalin, vous profiterez d’une rémunération compétitive, d’un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire, et d’une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (assurances collectives, programme d’épargne-retraite, regime d’actionnariat, emploi permanent, programme de formation continue, etc.).  Vous pensez qu’une carrière dans notre équipe pourrait correspondre à votre profil, soumettez sans attendre votre candidature en ligne !

 Project Control Activities

 Manage a full project control cycle throughout the execution of projects which include cost & schedules.

Chargé(e) de projets en études sociales et évaluation environnementale

 Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe?
 AtkinsRéalis conçoit un avenir durable en reliant les gens, les données et la technologie. Nos valeurs de sécurité, d'intégrité, de collaboration et d'innovation sont le moteur de notre réussite. Nous embrassons la diversité, représentant 130 nationalités au sein d'AtkinsRéalis, et nous nous targuons d'avoir plus de 50 % de femmes dans des rôles de leadership au sein de notre pratique de l'environnement. Votre bien-être est notre priorité, et notre culture de la santé et de la sécurité est à la pointe de l'industrie. Rejoignez-nous pour un parcours professionnel flexible, stimulant et inclusif.

 Les enjeux socio-économiques et l’évaluation des impacts environnementaux sont plus que jamais des conditions essentielles de réalisation de tout type de projet. L’évaluation des impacts d’un projet dans une communauté, l’interaction et la participation des collectivités représentent des occasions privilégiées de faire la différence et de travailler au quotidien auprès de promoteurs, de milieux et de citoyens interpellés par des projets, en combinant à la fois un travail de terrain près des gens, de documentation, d’analyse et de stratégie.

 AtkinsRéalis vous offre aujourd’hui l’occasion de joindre une équipe énergique et expérimentée offrant un service distinctif en matière d’études sociales et environnementales et d’interaction avec le milieu qui participe au développement et à l’implantation de nombreux projets variés (transport, énergie et ressources naturelles, immobiliers, industriels, matières résiduelles, etc.), et ce dans les différentes régions du Québec. Une équipe qui valorise l’implication, la collaboration et le partage des connaissances.

 L'équipe Permis et Gestion de l'Environnement comprend près de 100 employés de tous les niveaux qui participent à des projets clés tout au long de leur cycle de vie : de l'évaluation initiale des contraintes clés à l'élaboration stratégique des processus d'approbation réglementaire, en passant par la gestion de la conformité tout au long de la construction et de l'exploitation. Notre équipe travaille en collaboration dans le cadre de projets afin d'obtenir l'acceptation sociale et de gérer les engagements de nos clients en matière d'environnement et de développement durable. 

Nous recherchons une personne dynamique pouvant agir comme professionnel.le spécialiste du milieu humain, de l’aménagement du territoire, des populations et des études socio-économiques. Le.la candidat.e idéal.e sera motivé.e par la compréhension des dynamiques sociales et territoriales et l’interaction avec les communautés.

 Le poste est offert à nos bureaux de Québec, de Montréal, du Saguenay ou d’Abitibi, tout en offrant grande place au télétravail si désiré. En vous joignant à la grande famille d’AtkinsRéalis, vous pourriez avoir des opportunités de travailler sur des projets au Québec, au Canada ou même ailleurs dans le monde.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe:

 Sous l’autorité du chef d’équipe en acceptabilité sociale, vous serez amené.e à réaliser différentes tâches de documentation et de caractérisation des milieux, études sociales ou auprès de communautés, d’analyse des impacts et d’approches en participation publique, consultation et gestion des parties prenantes.
 Vos tâches incluront entre autres :


 Participer à des projets multidisciplinaires et à l’étude de projets varies.
 Réaliser des analyses et des études socioéconomiques et de faisabilité.
 Prendre en charge le volet socio-économique d’études d’impacts (caractérisation du milieu, consultations publiques, évaluation d’impacts).
 Participer à la préparation de demande d’autorisation en environnement.
 Réaliser des études/services socio-économiques ponctuels (enquêtes, démarches de consultation plans/stratégies de communication, approches d’acceptabilité sociale, relations communautaires, etc.).
 Mettre en place des approches de collaboration avec des groupes autochtones.
 Collaborer avec à la réalisation de proposition, approche et rédaction.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ? 

Parce que nous proposons :

 L'opportunité de travailler sur divers projets d'envergure pour des clients internes et externes.
 Un environnement passionnant où l'équilibre travail-vie personnelle est important.
 Un large éventail d'opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement.
 Salaire compétitif, avantages sociaux flexibles, plan d'actionnariat des employés et régime de retraite à cotisations définies.
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et la sécurité.


 Le candidat idéal :

 Diplôme universitaire en sciences sociales (anthropologie, économie, sciences politiques, aménagement du territoire, géographie, etc.).
 5 années d’expérience appliquée au domaine de l’environnement et/ou du génie-conseil.
 Expérience en études d’impacts, participation publique, et acceptabilité sociale.
 Connaissance générale du cadre général d’aménagement du territoire.
 Expérience de terrain dans diverses régions du Québec (un atout).
 Expérience de travail avec des communautés autochtones (un atout).
 Bilinguisme français/anglais.


 Compétences recherchées

 Personne dynamique, motivée par l’atteinte des résultats, avec un profil d’entreprenariat.
 Être motivé, posséder une bonne capacité d'analyse et être apte à résoudre les problèmes.
 Posséder de bonnes habiletés en recherche, analyse et communications interpersonnelles.
 Avoir de la rigueur, être organisé et faire preuve d’autonomie.
 Être capable de mener plusieurs projets de front, avec divers clients et diverses équipes de travail.
 Être capable d’accomplir le travail demandé en respectant des budgets serrés et de courts délais.

 Créée par l'intégration d'organisations de longue date remontant à 1911, AtkinsRéalis est une société de services professionnels et de gestion de projets de premier plan qui se consacre à l'ingénierie d'un avenir meilleur pour notre planète et ses habitants. Nous créons des solutions durables qui relient les personnes, les données et la technologie afin de transformer les infrastructures et les systèmes énergétiques du monde entier. Nous déployons des capacités mondiales au niveau local pour nos clients et fournissons des services uniques de bout en bout tout au long du cycle de vie d'un actif, notamment en matière de conseil, de services consultatifs et environnementaux, de réseaux intelligents et de cybersécurité, de conception et d'ingénierie, d'approvisionnement, de gestion de projet et de construction, d'exploitation et de maintenance, de démantèlement et de capital. L'étendue et la profondeur de nos capacités sont mises au service de nos clients dans des secteurs stratégiques clés tels que les services d'ingénierie, le nucléaire, les opérations et la maintenance et le capital. Des nouvelles et des informations sont disponibles à l'adresse suivante : www.atkinsrealis.com

 Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?

Votre bien-être est notre priorité, et notre culture de la santé et de la sécurité est à la pointe de l'industrie. Rejoignez-nous pour un parcours professionnel flexible, stimulant et inclusif.

The Systems Integration Specialist is responsible for ensuring that all systems are integrated seamlessly and that any issues are identified and addressed in a timely manner. The Systems Integration Specialist will collaborate with the Systems Engineer and Requirements Manager to ensure that all systems are properly integrated and tested.

 How will you contribute to the team? 

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

 Ensure that all systems and components are properly integrated and work together as a whole.
 Review design documents to ensure that all components are properly integrated.
 Participate in system integration testing and resolve any integration issues that arise.
 Collaborate with other members of the project team to ensure seamless integration of all systems and components.
 Develop and maintain system integration documentation.
 Stay up-to-date with the latest industry developments and technologies.


 What will you contribute? 

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
 Experience in systems integration, with a focus on large-scale rail infrastructure projects.
 Strong understanding of system design and integration concepts.
 Ability to analyze complex technical systems and resolve integration issues.
 Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
 Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
 Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
 Proficiency in relevant software and tools, such as CAD, MATLAB, and simulation software.
 Familiarity with industry standards and regulations, such as safety standards and EMC standards.


 What we offer at SNC-Lavalin: 

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

 AtkinsRéalis is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world. We are hiring an Project Controls Specialist to join our growing team in British Columbia.

 Your role within the team:
 To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

 Project Control Activities

 Manage a full project control cycle throughout the execution of projects which include cost & schedules.
 Setting up projects/mandates, monitoring budgets in the Oracle project management-based system against project contractual agreements.
 Ensure correct calculations of the original budget based on the proposal.
 Keeps track of hours, expenses, costs, and budget updates.
 Participating in regular meetings with project managers and other stakeholders (internal and external) to ensure the progress of the project and the achievement of project objectives and results.
 Ensure follow-up of scope changes and coordination with the project control team.
 Manage/validate cost allocations related to the purchase of goods and services through the procurement process, including the follow-up of the project progress with discipline managers, cost and schedule controls.


 Scheduling Activities

 Assist Project Management team by serving as the owner of project schedules and coordinating all inputs, reviews and updates required for the development and implementation of project schedules.
 Collaborate with all the project stakeholders in establishing and maintaining resource loaded baseline schedules that meet the needs of, and are used by the project team.
 Sequence all related Engineering tasks and deliverables to the completion of the project including all phases of engineering, procurement, and construction.
 Review vendor, sub-consultant and contractor schedule submittals and incorporate them into the project schedules.
 Ensure that the project schedules are updated regularly with progress achieved and make changes to the sequence and duration of activities where appropriate.
 Perform Earned value analysis to identify divergences from the project plan as established in the baseline schedule to the project team, as well as coordinate with Project Controls Lead and Project Management for periodic project control reporting deliverables.
 Perform the required planning for the next phase of the project and adhere to the client’s progression activities and processes, including implementation and tracking of all project changes in the schedules.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Technical degree or equivalent in the related field such as Engineering, Construction or Project Management with 3-5 years of relevant experience in an engineering or construction environment.
 Knowledge of scheduling software (Primavera P6 and MS Project) and highly proficient in Excel.
 Strong oral and written communication skills in English with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Proven ability to multi-task with demonstrated ability to work independently or as part of a team.
 Proven ability to understand, multi-discipline levels of project planning, scope, schedule, work breakdown structures, cost breakdown structures, including revenue, cost and profit analysis and budget variance reporting.
 Knowledgeable of project control systems – budget setup, forecasting, resourcing, planning, baselines. Project Management / Cost Management / Project Controls accreditation e.g. PMI, AACE, APM, RICS is an asset.
 Proven ability to identify project trends - interrogate, report on, and provide recovery recommendations for the status of the project.
