 AtkinsRéalis is in search of a Substation Electrical Engineer to work within a multi-discipline team to design efficient and reliable electrical substations and distribution network. The Electrical Engineer will coordinate all design activities to maintain project schedules and ensure successful project completion. The Electrical Engineer will also assist the estimating team in preparation of estimates and project proposals. This position is accountable to provide all design activities in accordance with applicable Codes and Standards, including all of SNC-Lavalin’s policies and procedures, such as Safety, Environmental, Quality Assurance and Quality Control.

 Your role within the team:

 Prepare conceptual and detail engineering for assigned Transmission and Distribution projects.
 Assist in developing plot plans and elevation drawings for outdoor substation equipment.
 Develop Switchgear room and Control room layout drawings for substation projects.
 Prepare Bills of Materials and Cable Schedules.
 Work closely with peers to ensure accurate delivery and thorough electrical design that will meet industry standards and specifications and meet good engineering practices.
 Maintain complete project documentation with respect to engineering studies and calculations, all design packages.
 Maintain good working relationship with internal groups that support project such as other Engineering disciplines, Drafting, Procurement, Construction and Project Management etc.
 Coordinate design activities with other multi-discipline project team members.
 Construction support including resolving site queries, attending site meetings and performing site inspections during the construction phase of projects.

 The ideal candidate:

 A degree in Electrical Engineering from a recognized Institution.
 A minimum of 8-10 years of experience after graduation as Substation Electrical engineer in the field of Transmission and Distribution is considered to have gained the required experience for the position.
 P.Eng registration with PEO or equivalent required.
 Good knowledge of North American codes and standards such as CSA, NEC, IEEE, Reg 22/04.
 Experience in AutoCAD and Bentley MicroStation is an asset.
 Experience in Hydro One and Toronto Hydro Standards is an asset.
 Good written and verbal communication skills.

Chargé (e ) de projets industriel senior (e)

 La division du génie industriel est actuellement à la recherche d'un (e) Chargé(e ) de projets industriel senior(e ) , qui agira à titre de spécialiste technique, de chef d'équipe et de professionnel de la conception.  S’assurer que l’information de projet est traçable, bien documentée, vérifiée et classée dans le répertoire de projet ainsi que dans les outils informatiques tels que le système financier et les formulaires SharePoint.

Chargé.e de projets - Biologiste senior.e

 AtkinsRéalis conçoit un avenir durable en reliant les gens, les données et la technologie. Nos valeurs de sécurité, d'intégrité, de collaboration et d'innovation sont le moteur de notre réussite. Nous embrassons la diversité, représentant 130 nationalités au sein d'AtkinsRéalis, et nous nous targuons d'avoir plus de 50 % de femmes dans des rôles de leadership au sein de notre pratique de l'environnement. Votre bien-être est notre priorité, et notre culture de la santé et de la sécurité est à la pointe de l'industrie. Rejoignez-nous pour un parcours professionnel flexible, stimulant et inclusif.

 La réalisation d’inventaires biologiques lors de l’exécution de projets d’évaluation des impacts environnementaux est une discipline devenue essentielle et au cœur des préoccupations de nos clients et des citoyens.

 AtkinsRéalis vous offre aujourd’hui l’occasion de joindre une équipe énergique et expérimentée offrant un service distinctif en matière d’évaluation des impacts environnementaux pour de nombreux projets variés (transport, énergie et ressources naturelles, immobiliers, industriels, matières résiduelles, etc.), et ce dans les différentes régions du Québec. Une équipe qui valorise l’implication, la collaboration et le partage des connaissances.

 L'équipe Permis et Gestion de l'Environnement comprend près de 100 employés de tous les niveaux qui participent à des projets clés tout au long de leur cycle de vie : de l'évaluation initiale des contraintes clés à l'élaboration stratégique des processus d'approbation réglementaire, en passant par la gestion de la conformité tout au long de la construction et de l'exploitation. Notre équipe travaille en collaboration dans le cadre de projets afin d'obtenir l'acceptation sociale et de gérer les engagements de nos clients en matière d'environnement et de développement durable.

 Nous recherchons une personne dynamique pouvant agir comme professionnel.le senior.e spécialiste en biologie terrestre. Le.la candidat.e idéal.e sera motivé.e par la compréhension des enjeux de conservation des espèces fauniques et floristiques, notamment les espèces menacées ou vulnérables.

 Le poste est offert à nos bureaux de Québec, de Montréal, du Saguenay ou d’Abitibi, tout en offrant grande place au télétravail si désiré. En vous joignant à la grande famille d’AtkinsRéalis, vous pourriez avoir des opportunités de travailler sur des projets au Québec, au Canada ou même ailleurs dans le monde.

 À titre de professionnel.le membre de l’équipe, vous serez amené.e à réaliser différentes tâches qui en lien avec l’évaluation des impacts environnementaux, dont notamment :


 Diriger, planifier et réaliser des inventaires floristiques (caractérisation de la végétation, milieux humides, espèces exotiques envahissantes, etc.) et fauniques.

Senior Piping / Feeder Analyst

 AtkinsRéalis/CANDU Energy Inc. is a leading full-service nuclear technology company providing nuclear power reactors and nuclear products and services to customers worldwide. Our 1,200 highly skilled employees design and deliver state-of-the-art CANDU® reactors, carry out life extension projects, provide plant life management programs and tools, and offer operation and maintenance services for existing nuclear power stations. This role is based out of the CANDU Energy Inc. home office in Mississauga, ON.

 Our expertise includes Nuclear Steam Plant (NSP) engineering, Balance of Plant (BOP) engineering, Plant Life Management and Extension, Retube Tooling Systems, Inspection and Maintenance Services, Steam Generator Replacement, Plant Equipment Refurbishment and Retrofits.
 AtkinsRéalis is currently looking for a Senior Piping / Feeder Analyst (s) to join our engineering team in Mississauga. The work is in support of Life Extension Projects and New Build project and requires a technical role in the design and analysis of feeder piping, feeder supports, and feeder in-line components. This is a permanent position.

 Your role within the team:
 This position requires an individual who is self-motivated and capable of working independently or under the instruction from a senior technical engineer and develop his/her career and experience in nuclear field. The candidate shall be able to follow the instruction from a qualified professional engineer to complete the assigned mechanical related scopes or tasks and develop necessary engineering design documentation as required.
 The qualified individual will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

 Perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulation requirements.
 Coordinate and interface with client, suppliers, stakeholders and other design disciplines or department to execute assigned engineering work.
 Involve in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design of CANDU or Nuclear process systems and modifications under supervision of a P.Eng.
 Learn and prepare engineering computations and analyses using applicable software (e.g., PipeStress, CaesarII, AutoPipe, MATLAB, MathCAD, ANSYS Mechanical (APDL preferred or Workbench), and LSDYNA. etc.).
 Modelling complex piping and support arrangements using finite element techniques.
 Perform pipe stress evaluation of piping systems (nuclear class or non-nuclear class) in accordance with ASME Section III, Div.1, and/or ASME B31.1 code requirements.
 Performing thermal, fatigue, seismic, linear and non-linear analyses in accordance with ASME Boiler & Pressure Vessel Code, Section III, Div.1 code requirements.
 Prepare Design Change Package (DCP) and Design Change Notice (DCN) packages following customer procedures.
 Prepare technical documents, such as: engineering drawings (including GA, ISO, pipe supports, flow diagrams), change paper markups, calculations, design/analysis reports, design requirements, design manuals, bill of materials, design specifications, technical specifications, data sheets, system classification lists, code classifications, commissioning specifications, etc.
 Prepare TSSA registration packages for pressure boundary modifications.
 Prepare requisitions or Engineering Quotation Requests (EQR) for equipment and materials to support procurement.
 Review supplier technical documents and performing technical bid analyses.
 Provide technical guidance and instruction to Designers/Drafters and more junior staff as required.
 Perform site visits to client and supplier shops as required.
 Perform field walk-downs during different design phases as required.
 Support field construction and execution activities, such as: field changes, design revisions, commissioning, AFS, closeout, etc.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matters.
 Complete the assigned scopes or tasks within given budget and schedule, and in good quality.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Lead a team to Involve in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design and analysis of CANDU or Nuclear process systems and modifications.
 Engineering Degree in Mechanical from an accredited university or equivalent degree as recognized by Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO).
 Registered as an Engineer-In-Training or eligible to be registered as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario.
 10+ years of related work experience in mechanical engineering within a heavy industrial environment such as: mining, oil & gas, power, etc.
 Basic knowledge of mechanical and piping systems or equipment (knowledge of CANDU nuclear systems would be an asset).
 Working knowledge of CSA N285.0 and CSA B51, CSA N289 and ASME Section III and ANSI B31.1 codes and any other applicable standards or regulatory guides related to permanent plant components, pressure boundary equipment, and/or reactor systems is preferred.
 Design engineering experience in nuclear class 2, 3 and 6 piping systems, valves, pumps and for Nuclear Power Plants is preferable.
 Experience in Stress Analysis using PipeStress, CaesarII, AutoPipe, MATLAB, MathCAD, ANSYS Mechanical (APDL preferred or Workbench) , and LSDYNA. or other similar software program is an asset.
 Qualified or eligible to be qualified as ASME Appendix XXIII is an asset.
 Must be able to apply technical principles in a logical and practical manner to resolve engineering issues or technical problems.
 Shall have excellent communication and technical writing skills.
 Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment.
 Site experience in construction, or commissioning of plant mechanical systems for nuclear or other heavy industries would be an asset.
 Must be willing to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW), although this will not be a regular requirement as part of the job.

 Le groupe d’électricité d’ingénierie Montréal est spécialisé dans le domaine institutionnel, commercial, aéroportuaire et industriel léger et a acquis au fil des années une réputation d’excellence en la matière.  Responsabilités :

 Participer aux réunions de coordination.
 Rédiger des devis techniques d’électricité.
 Évaluer les coûts des travaux.

 Fournir une assistance au client et au personnel technique.

Administrative Assistant

 Why Join Us?

 Our Environmental Team has an immediate opening for an Administrative Assistant in Trail, BC to support The Trail Area Health & Environment Program. This is a community program promoting health and the environment in the Trail BC area (www.thep.ca). The Trail team provides risk-based solutions to managing wide-spread metal contamination on public and private property. With the focus of preventing lead exposure to young children, they work with families, local residents, developers, and others offering a comprehensive program of services and supports. With over 25 years’ experience, THEP has greatly improved air quality and reduced lead exposure in children. THEP’s collaborative approach has been recognized with a BC Premier’s Award. AtkinsRéalis, formerly SNC-Lavalin, has delivered services on this project since 2008 from the Trail-based Community Program Office and has built a strong relationship with the client and community.

 How will you contribute to the team?

 The main tasks of the Administrative Assistant for the Community Program Office include:


 Support the work of the Community Program Office and occasionally other aspects of the THEP (e.g., Family Health, outreach).
 Answering phone calls, emails and handling walk-ins.
 Responding to or directing questions to the team from the public.
 Facilitating timely and accurate responses to inquiries about the THEP.
 In-take of lead (Pb) -safe renovation requests.
 Electronic data filing as per AtkinsRéalis’ Quality Management System.
 IT troubleshooting and/or coordinating IT support (printers/fax machine).
 Database tracking, scanning and filing.
 Data entry.
 Report generation and mailing.
 General office administration – office supply ordering, coordinating office maintenance, etc.
 Assist with monthly account reconciliation.
 Meeting preparation, coordination support, printing, creating meeting packages.
 Participation in AtkinsRéalis’ safety and integrity programs and assist with routine office safety procedures.
 Occasional notetaking during meetings.
 Minor website updates (upload minutes, links, small edits).
 Proof-reading THEP materials prior to distribution.

Project Manager, Construction, Modularity & Logistics

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 The Project Manager - Construction, Modularity and Logistics will report to the Program Management Office, Large CANDU Development, and will be responsible for all aspects of construction planning for new nuclear plant design. The PM will work with the design and deployment teams to develop the overall deployment and construction schedule, identify best practices and innovative solutions for construction, modularization of the design and logistics at site, for a full new build program. As part of the program execution, the PM will be relied upon as key contributor to the deployment strategy.

 The PM is expected to have significant experience in project pre-planning, constructability initiation & reviews and forward thought of construction planning, construction techniques and technologies, engineering, procurement, contract management and project controls principles.

 This role will require leadership of all project team members and will be responsible for the development of work execution plans, assignment of or recruitment of project team members, development of overall work breakdown structure (WBS), project deliverables, organizational chart, budget, schedule, subcontract and supplier strategy, risk management, project forecast and people forecasting and levelling (PFL) for the project.

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the Team:

 PM shall provide best practices experience and smart solutions to the design development team to support modularity of the design, manufacturing of modules and logistics at site during actual construction.
 PM shall provide guidance to the deployment team to develop the construction schedule and site activities.
 PM shall support the deployment and development teams to determine needed resources (manpower, equipment, and materials) from start to finish with attention to budgetary limitations.
 PM shall identify and plan all construction operations and schedule intermediate phases to ensure deployment deadlines will be met.
 PM is responsible for developing project scope and deliverable definition in compliance with the governing contract documents, quality requirements for the project and any additional customer requirements.
 PM is responsible for all contract management including scope & change control, requirements management, subcontractor and supplier management and governance for any flow-down requirements from the parent contract to subs and vendors.
 PM is responsible and accountable for all aspects of nuclear and industrial safety including adherence with corporate and customer safety programs, development and enforcement of necessary training and requirements, adherence to corrective action programs and enforcement of performance standards for all the above.
 PM shall apply appropriate key performance indicators to monitor project health and performance and establish rigorous reporting protocols that meet all requirements of the contract, corporate standards and project-specific oversight as established by senior management or customer.
 PM shall ensure that all project activities are performed in accordance with corporate standards of ethical compliance, cyber-security, import-export regulations, intellectual property protections and security clearance protocols.
 PM shall ensure that project procurement and subcontract management including subcontractor and supplier oversight, invoicing, accruals, and supply chain strategies are aligned with risk management, quality requirements, schedule and budget considerations and overall performance standards commensurate with the project and customer requirements.
 PM shall apply project controls methodology with respect to planning and scheduling, baseline management, cost control, budgeting, cashflow, invoicing, cost and revenue forecasting and resource management.
 PM shall develop and implement detailed project execution plans and monitoring their execution through comprehensive reporting to clients and senior management.
 PM shall perform rigorous risk analysis in accordance with corporate standards and application of industry best practice including monte-carlo methodology and contingency draw-down curves.
 PM shall form and maintain relationships with clients, partners, suppliers, and project stakeholders.
 PM shall ensure that all formal approvals for project bids, changes and settlements are prepared and approved in accordance with corporate Level of Authority (Loa) procedures.

 A focused expertise on cold and northern region projects dealing with permafrost, peat land, climate change, and remote infrastructures.

Chargé(e) de projets

 AtkinsRéalis a démontré de longue date sa capacité à mener à bien des projets dans tout le secteur industriel. Son savoir-faire couvre des secteurs aussi divers allant de ceux du pétrole et du gaz et des produits chimiques, à ceux de l’énergie et de l’eau, en passant par les produits pharmaceutiques, la biotechnologie et l’agroalimentaire. En collaborant avec nos clients industriels dans le monde entier, nous contribuons à maximiser les actifs et à accroître l’efficacité, peu importe le domaine ou l’envergure des activités. Nous fournissons en outre des solutions de formation virtuelle sur mesure aux industries de la transformation et des processus, créant ainsi une valeur durable pour nos clients.

 Joignez la division industrielle de AtkinsRéalis et devenez partie prenante d’une équipe qui change le visage des opérations de fabrication et de l'infrastructure au Canada, et dans le monde. Nous sommes à la recherche d'un candidat d’expérience motivé, qui veut jouer un rôle central dans la conception, le développement et le déploiement de systèmes de contrôle industriels et de gestion des données, et dans le développement de relations clients durables.

 Sous l’autorité du directeur adjoint de projet, le chargé de projet est responsable de l'exécution des activités nécessaires à la réalisation d’un projet. Il assure l'organisation, la supervision, la réalisation et le contrôle du projet dans son domaine d'expertise, en faisant appel aux ressources humaines et matérielles mises à sa disposition par AtkinsRéalis.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe

 Au sein de l’équipe d’opération et maintenance, vous relèverez du Directeur adjoint de projets et vous aurez à :

 Maîtriser les exigences contractuelles ainsi que les plans et devis d’exécution de projets de construction et de rénovation de bâtiment dont la valeur est située entre $5,000 et $2,000,000.
 Élaborer, concevoir et développer avec l’aide des professionnels (architectes et ingénieurs) les plans et devis du projet.
 Participer et animer des réunions de coordination de chantier.
 Préparer les échéanciers détaillés du projet.
 Préparer les documents d’appel d’offres en collaboration avec le directeur des achats et suivre les procédures en place.
 Contacter les fournisseurs et les entrepreneurs pour les demandes de prix.
 Préparer les estimations des coûts de construction des projets et estimer les honoraires pour leur réalisation.
 Coordonner les activités du projet avec les clients internes et externes, superviser les travaux des entrepreneurs, vérifier la qualité d’exécution et la conformité des livrables.
 Assurer le respect des coûts et la qualité du produit fini dans les délais prescrits et entendus avec le client.
 Évaluer les risques reliés au projet et prendre les mesures nécessaires pour les éliminer.
 Assurer l’atteinte des profits anticipés sur les projets.
 Gérer la documentation de projet, tel que les lettres et courriels, les rapports techniques, les spécifications, les plans et devis, etc.
 Avoir une bonne compréhension des composantes architecturales, mécaniques et électriques de bâtiment.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ?

 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe, au Canada et dans le monde entier;
 un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 l’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.

Engineering Discipline Manager - Calandria Tube and Calandria Vessel Design

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Reporting to the Director of Reactor Components and Mechanical Engineering Division, the Discipline Engineering Manager - Calandria Tube and Calandria Vessel Design will be assigned to work on large scale projects (e.g., Cernavoda Unit 1 Retube Pre-Project, Qinshan Units 1 and 2 Retube Pre-Project etc.) and will laterally report to the Project Engineering Director (PED) and Project Director (PD).

 The Calandria Tube and Calandria Vessel Design Engineering Manager will lead the calandria tube and calandria vessel design engineering activities for the assigned project.

 Your role within the team:

 Providing the lead role in calandria tube and calandria vessel design engineering including the preparation of the technical specifications, drawings, design specifications, bill of materials, and design certifications.
 Providing technical expertise on code and standard requirements such as CSA N285 and ASME Section III Division 1 pressure boundary requirements.
 Responsible for developing project scope and deliverable definition in compliance with the governing contract documents, quality requirements for the project and any additional customer requirements.
 Assisting in the preparation of proposals in support of the engineering scope on the assigned project.
 Makes decision/recommendation with respect to resourcing requirements on the project and work with the relevant functional managers who will assign the engineering resources.
 Ensuring that an appropriate combination of skills and experience is maintained within the project to be able to provide technical leadership and specialized expertise as required to support the project.
 Mentoring, training, developing, motivating, coaching, and evaluating the performance of the staff.
 Working with the PD and PED to plan the work, ensuring resource availability and allocation, assigning tasks and progress reporting against deliverables.
 Ensuring that the activities are executed in accordance with the specified requirements including review and endorsement of the technical content of the deliverables, verification and ensuring a high-quality of deliverables, on-time and within budget delivery of the deliverables, and approval of the deliverables.
 Review and approve project related documents/drawings and ensure technical work meets the QA program and project requirements.
 Ensure that all project activities are performed in accordance with applicable codes and standards and company quality assurance manual.
 Interfacing with internal and external customers and stakeholders to establish the priorities and ensure leads and staff are working on the prioritized scope of work.
 Provide strong leadership within the project team, and within the company for aspects related to calandria tube and calandria vessel design engineering.
 Interface with the regulatory bodies such as: TSSA, ISCIR, CNCAN, and CNSC, as required.
 Form and maintain working relationships with clients, partners, suppliers, and project stakeholders.
 Raise scope change (either requested by the client or discovered internally due to technical findings) and critical issues to the PD and PED.
 Lead assigned engineers to find solutions for the technical issues. If needed, engage additional help from Functional Engineering to seek issue resolution.
 Foster a good working relationship with staff, and managers in the Reactor Components and Mechanical Engineering Divisions as well as other Divisions.
 Provide clear expectations and performance measures, meaningful feedback, and recognize and reward achievements.
 Provides feedback and effective recommendations regarding technical staff performance to functional home.
 Make decisions/recommendations on human resource issues and effectively manage and resolve work performance problems as they relate to the project.

Senior Environmental Project Engineer

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 The Environment Technical Professional Organization at AtkinsRéalis is dedicated to responding to the changing needs of our clients and communities. Our growing organization is seeking like-minded individuals to join our Site Assessment and Remediation team in BC, and we are looking for a Senior Environmental Project Engineer or Senior Environmental Scientist to join our team. We have offices in Victoria, Nanaimo, Vancouver, Burnaby, Kelowna, Trail, Nelson, and Cranbrook as well as locations in Northern BC.

 You will work on a variety of projects for various clients across Canada but primarily in BC. The ideal candidate is an industry professional that has proven project experience and the long-term drive, ambition and potential to develop and progress within our organization. Individuals who join our team can expect to work closely with other professionals in a wide variety of fields, collaborating across regions and groups to provide high-quality technical solutions for our clients. The work environment is dynamic and flexible, offering a strong emphasis on health and safety with competitive compensation and benefits.

 The successful candidate will bring leadership skills and provide senior level technical direction and mentoring of staff, strong client management skills and the ability to collaborate with others across the Environment Practice. They will provide leadership through mentorship and supporting the technical development of staff to support project execution.

 Your role within the team:

 Provide technical direction and project management of fundamental tasks related to environmental projects (e.g., soil and groundwater investigation), remediation scopes of work and report preparation.
 Communicate with and provide mentorship to junior staff.
 Oversee contractors and field-staff to ensure the project is delivered as per pre-defined specifications.
 Review and evaluate large amounts of field collected data to support data gap analyses and selection of remedial options.
 Provide technical expertise for contaminated site investigation, remediation and reclamation programs.
 Interpret findings and prepare and review technical reports.
 Interact with clients and provide verbal and written project updates.
 Track budgets and identify and communicate scope changes in a timely manner.
 Supervise and mentor staff involved in carrying out field programs; ensure project requirements are communicated and health and safety protocols are followed.
 Promote a positive Health and Safety culture.
 Participate in business development activities and maintaining client relationships.

Project Director - Standard Plant Design

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!
 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 The Project Director will report to the Program Director or General Manager, New Nuclear & New Markets and will be responsible for all aspects of engineering, procurement, and construction delivery for a New Nuclear design project. The project entails multi-disciplinary design of a standard plant for a new nuclear plant. It may include one or more sub-projects.

 This role will require leadership of all project team members, and will be responsible for developing work execution plans, assignment of or recruitment of project team members, development of overall work breakdown structure (WBS), project deliverables, organizational chart, budget, schedule, subcontract and supplier strategy, risk management, project forecast and people forecasting and leveling (PFL) for the project. A project director is expected to have significant experience in project delivery and project execution methodology including an understanding of engineering, procurement, construction, contract management and project controls principles. Leading large teams is an equally important skill; developing and building a large team of professionals is a requirement of this role.

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the Team:

 Assemble a project team through recruiting, interviewing and/or selecting staff with appropriate skills and establishing training and development programs suitable for the work. This generally requires close coordination with functional managers from various functions (engineering, project controls, safety, quality etc.) and in some cases with JV partner companies.
 Accountable for all aspects of one or more projects within the mandate and to lead all team members who are performing duties to ensure that the work progresses with safety, quality, schedule, cost, and contractual requirements.
 Developing all project scopes and deliverable definition in compliance with the governing contract documents, quality requirements for the project and any additional customer requirements.
 Responsible for all contract management including scope & change control, requirements management, subcontractor and supplier management and governance for any flow-down requirements from the parent contract to subs and vendors.
 Responsible and accountable for all aspects of nuclear and industrial safety including adherence with corporate and customer safety programs, development and enforcement of necessary training and requirements, adherence to corrective action programs and enforcement of performance standards for all the above.
 The Project Director shall apply appropriate key performance indicators to monitor project health and performance and establish rigorous reporting protocols that meet all requirements of the contract, corporate standards and project-specific oversight as established by senior management or customer.
 Ensure that all project activities are performed in accordance with corporate standards of ethical compliance, cyber-security, import-export regulations, intellectual property protections and security clearance protocols.
 Ensure that project procurement and subcontract management including subcontractor and supplier oversight, invoicing, accruals, and supply chain strategies are aligned with risk management, quality requirements, schedule and budget considerations and overall performance standards commensurate with the project and customer requirements.
 Apply project controls methodology with respect to planning and scheduling, baseline management, cost control, budgeting, cashflow, invoicing, cost and revenue forecasting and resource management.
 Develop and implement detailed project execution plans and monitoring their execution through comprehensive reporting to clients and senior management.
 Perform rigorous risk analysis in accordance with corporate standards and application of industry best practice including monte-Carlo methodology and contingency draw-down curves.
 Form and maintain relationships with clients, partners, suppliers, and project stakeholders.
 Ensure that all formal approvals for project bids, changes and settlements are prepared and approved in accordance with corporate Level of Authority (Loa) procedures.

 Demonstrates initiative and decisiveness.
 Plans and communicates effectively.
 Seeks and accepts responsibility and accountability.
 Possesses excellent judgment and can correctly apply skills and knowledge.
 perform well under stress.
 delegates effectively.
 Commitment to Safety.
 Stakeholder Management.
 Problem Solving.
 Integrity and Trust.
 Customer Focus.
 Team Player, Shares Knowledge.

 In the AtkinsRéalis Rail Infrastructure team, our main areas of expertise cover all aspects of track design for LRT, passenger and freight rail, including alignment and profile design, track componentry, materials specifications, detail design and construction support.

Senior Feeder Support Engineer- Lead

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world since for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology.

 Reporting to the Manager, Feeder & Piping Engineering, Materials, Welding & Chemistry, Senior Feeder Support Engineer- Lead will work in support of Life Extension Projects and New Build project and requires a technical leadership role in the design of feeder piping, feeder supports, and feeder in-line components.

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the team:

 Lead a team to Involve in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design of CANDU or Nuclear piping and process systems and modifications.
 Design complex piping and support arrangement, and prepare technical documents, such as: engineering drawings (including GA, ISO, pipe supports, flow diagrams), change paper markups, calculations, design/analysis reports, design requirements, design manuals, bill of materials, design specifications, technical specifications, data sheets, system classification lists, code classifications, commissioning specifications, etc.;
 Performing thermal, fatigue, seismic, linear, and non-linear analyses in accordance with ASME Boiler & Pressure Vessel Code, Section III, Div.1 code requirements is preferred.
 Perform complex engineering tasks with efficiency and accuracy.
 Prepare and review registration packages for pressure boundary components.
 Interface with the regulatory bodies such as: TSSA, and CNSC, as required.
 Provide technical guidance and instruction to Designers/Drafters, and Junior/Intermediate Engineers.
 Perform design review and design verification for the design and engineering work completed by others.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matters.
 Perform site visits to client and supplier shops as required.
 Perform field walk-downs during different design phases as required.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matter.
 Take a senior role in a group of Design and Stress Engineers/Analysts on multiple CANDU Reactor Components tasks.
 Defining work scope, preparing budget estimates and schedules, and reporting progress
 Report to engineering or project management with timely updates on project performance for the assigned scopes or tasks.
 Perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy Quality Assurance programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulation requirements.
 Coordinate and interface with client, suppliers, stakeholders and other design disciplines or department to execute assigned engineering work.

Senior Environmental Project Engineer

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 The Environment Technical Professional Organization at AtkinsRéalis is dedicated to responding to the changing needs of our clients and communities. We are committed to technical excellence and provide solution-driven environmental services to assist clients in planning, managing, and conducting their projects. Our growing organization is seeking like-minded individuals to join our Site Assessment and Remediation team in BC, and we are looking for a Senior Environmental Project Engineer or Senior Environmental Scientist to join our team. We have offices in Victoria, Nanaimo, Vancouver, Burnaby, Kelowna, Trail, Nelson, and Cranbrook as well as locations in Northern BC.

 You will work on a variety of projects for various clients across Canada but primarily in BC. The ideal candidate is an industry professional that has proven project experience and the long-term drive, ambition and potential to develop and progress within our organization. Individuals who join our team can expect to work closely with other professionals in a wide variety of fields, collaborating across regions and groups to provide high-quality technical solutions for our clients. The work environment is dynamic and flexible, offering a strong emphasis on health and safety with competitive compensation and benefits.

 The successful candidate will bring leadership skills and provide senior level technical direction and mentoring of staff, strong client management skills and the ability to collaborate with others across the Environment Practice. They will provide leadership through mentorship and supporting the technical development of staff to support project execution.

 Your role within the team:

 Provide technical direction and project management of fundamental tasks related to environmental projects (e.g., soil and groundwater investigation), remediation scopes of work and report preparation.
 Communicate with and provide mentorship to junior staff.
 Oversee contractors and field-staff to ensure the project is delivered as per pre-defined specifications.
 Review and evaluate large amounts of field collected data to support data gap analyses and selection of remedial options.
 Provide technical expertise for contaminated site investigation, remediation and reclamation programs.
 Interpret findings and prepare and review technical reports.
 Interact with clients and provide verbal and written project updates.
 Track budgets and identify and communicate scope changes in a timely manner.
 Supervise and mentor staff involved in carrying out field programs; ensure project requirements are communicated and health and safety protocols are followed.
 Promote a positive Health and Safety culture.
 Participate in business development activities and maintaining client relationships.

 The ideal candidate:

 Degree from a program with relevant subject matter in the field of Environmental Sciences, Engineering, Geology, or Biology.
 Eligibility for professional designation and an interest in obtaining CSAP designation within the next 5 years would be considered an asset.
 Minimum of 15 years of progressive experience encompassing project coordination and project management and with emphasis in the areas of contaminated site assessment, remediation and reclamation.
 Demonstrated experience in activities related to environmental site assessment and remediation such as Phase I and II Environmental Site Assessments (ESA) including groundwater monitoring and sampling techniques, various drilling techniques, soil sample collection and logging, soil vapour sampling, remedial excavations, reclamation, spill response and quality assurance / quality control protocols.
 Strong understanding of regulatory frameworks and guidelines of the Environment Management Act and specifically the BC Contaminated Sites Regulation under the Ministry of Environment & Climate Change Strategy.
 The ability to work well in a team environment.
 Strong communication skills and experience in public facing roles such as responding to questions and interacting with the public on large-scale development or environmental projects.
 Experience managing contractors and working closely with clients on large, multi-year projects.
 Self-motivated, high energy, strong organizational and time management skills.
 Strong written and verbal communication skills in the English language.
 Capable of understanding and appropriately applying prescribed safety and technical protocols.
 Experience in routine statistical analysis would be an asset.
 Candidates may need a Valid Class 5 Full driver’s license.

Buyer

 Reporting to the Procurement Manager, the Buyer is responsible for the procurement of goods and services for various projects and business units. Purchases of goods and services can include moderate complexity, including various quality levels. Complexity of packages is determined by the Procurement Manager assigning the task.

 Location – Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the team:

 Review Purchase Requisition (PR) packages, for goods, services, technical and overhead procurement.
 Query the supplier database or source the market.
 Obtain NDA and Export permits when required.
 Prepare and obtain approval of Bidders List.
 Prepare, obtain approval and issue RFP packages.
 Evaluate proposals/bids, obtain approved Technical and QA Evaluations from Engineering and Procurement Quality Assurance Representative.
 Finalize all technical and commercial exceptions between Supplier, Legal, QA and Engineering.
 Complete competitive analysis and bid scorecards of proposals/bids.
 Recommend suppliers providing adequate justification for the decision making, ensuring all due diligence measures have been met.
 Ensure all required approvals are obtained in accordance with levels of authority Policy 1009.
 Prepare and issue Purchase Order Sign-off Checklists.
 Prepare and issue Purchase Orders.
 Prepare and issue Change Order, ensuring all change control protocols have been met.
 Ensure all Key control records are filed in accordance with company procedures.
 Update purchasing database to ensure all fields are complete and accurate.

Highway Maintenance Snowplow Operator
AtkinsRéalis provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision. AtkinsRéalis is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.
Brun-Way Highways Operations Inc. is a branch within AtkinsRéalis responsible for 275 kilometers of the Trans-Canada Highway, from the Quebec border to Longs Creek (West of Fredericton) and Route 95 between Woodstock and the Houlton Border, until the year 2033. The Brun-Way project has met the client’s goals of reducing maintenance costs, continuously improving performance anddelivering one of the most efficient and modern highways in the world. Safety targets have been met every year, with a dramatic reduction in the number of road incidents. The project’s success hasbeen recognized with numerous awards for safety, innovation, and Operations & Maintenance excellence.
We are seeking a Winter Seasonal Part-Time Highway Maintenance Snowplow Operator to join our team at Brun-Way. This position is responsible for operating a variety of equipment and performing manual labor required to maintain the highway and right-of-way assets to ensure conformance of the designated section of the highway with required Operation, Maintenance, and Rehabilitation (OMR) standards and contractual requirements. The incumbent would be part-time and may be requested to work on an on-call basis as work will be determined mainly on snow and ice events.
Compensation includes hourly wage PLUS $1000 bonus per month. **Eligibility conditions apply for the bonus as per the company compensation guideline.
Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!
Your role within the team:

Operate highway vehicles, predominantly snowplow and materials spreader trucks in the winter season, for maintaining the travelled highway surfaces in safe condition according to contractual requirements.
Operate and maintain a variety of highway maintenance equipment (including loaders, tractors, small power equipment, and power tools) required to repair and maintain all highway roadway and corridor assets according to contractual requirements.
Perform general manual labour required to maintain and repair the highway and related corridor assets (including litter removal, traffic control, signs and related damages, spring debris clean-up).
Prepare daily work records of activities and accomplishments, including equipment operating times and vehicle performance.
Assist in routine equipment maintenance and repairs.
Assist in yard maintenance and general good house-keeping clean-up practices.
Required to work scheduled rotating shifts during Winter Operations.

The ideal candidate:

Minimum 2 years’ previous job-related experience preferred.
General knowledge of highway operations and working experience with various types of vehicles and equipment used in road maintenance activities is preferred.
Valid driver license with Class 1 or Class 3 endorsement.
Clean drivers’ abstract.
Proven work performance related to timeliness and organization.
Attention to detail with a focus on accuracy, efficiency, and compliance with defined standards.
Good personal documentation and problem solving.
Must be able to lift up to 80 lbs.

Team Player.

 À propos d’AtkinsRéalis
 Issue de l’intégration d’organisations établies de longue date, la première en 1911, AtkinsRéalis est une entreprise mondiale de pointe de services professionnels et de gestion de projet, dédiée à façonner un meilleur avenir pour notre planète et ceux qui l’habitent. Nous créons des solutions durables qui lient individus, données et technologie pour transformer les infrastructures et les systèmes énergétiques du monde. Nous déployons des capacités mondiales à l’échelle locale pour fournir à nos clients des services uniques et complets couvrant tout le cycle de vie d’un actif — consultation, services-conseils et services environnementaux, réseaux intelligents et cybersécurité, conception et ingénierie, approvisionnement, gestion de projet et de construction, exploitation et entretien, mise hors service et capital. Nous offrons l’ampleur et la profondeur de nos capacités dans des secteurs stratégiques clés tels que Services d’ingénierie, Énergie nucléaire, Exploitation et entretien et Capital.

 Chez AtkinsRéalis, nous cherchons à embaucher des individus possédant des caractéristiques, parcours et perspectives diversifiés. Nous croyons fermement que le talent de classe mondiale ne fait aucune distinction à l’égard du genre, de l’origine ethnique ou nationale, de l’identité et de l’orientation sexuelle, de l’âge, de la religion ou de la déficience, mais s’enrichit plutôt de ces différences.

Coordinateur(trice), Propositions

 AtkinsRéalis fournit des solutions d'avant-garde en matière d'ingénierie, d'approvisionnement, de construction et de financement pour des projets dans plus de 100 pays à travers le monde. De l'Arctique canadien à l'Afrique australe en passant par l'Australasie, notre main-d'œuvre multiculturelle est animée d'une grande fierté pour son travail et d'une vision avant-gardiste.

 AtkinsRéalis est véritablement un leader mondial dans son domaine et a été choisie pour concevoir et construire certains des projets les plus prestigieux au monde.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe

 Au sein de l’équipe M&M, vous relèverez du Gestionnaire des propositions et vous aurez à :

 Diriger le processus de bout en bout et l'élaboration de la proposition pour les projets de petite et moyenne envergure.
 Pour les projets de grande envergure, et sous la direction du responsable de l'appel d'offres, comprendre les exigences relatives à la soumission et appliquer les politiques et les lignes directrices établies par AtkinsRéalis en matière de propositions.
 En appui au responsable de l'appel d'offres, coordonner la planification des réunions de lancement des propositions, l'élaboration et la production des propositions en établissant les calendriers des propositions, les matrices d'affectation, les matrices de conformité et les modèles de proposition, ainsi que planifier et faciliter les réunions de coordination des propositions en cours et, enfin, créer et remplir de façon autonome les formulaires à inclure dans les soumissions de propositions et contribuer à l'obtention des signatures appropriées.
 Communiquer oralement et par écrit avec les participants à la proposition afin de suivre les tâches par rapport au calendrier et de contrôler l'avancement du processus de proposition en assurant un suivi en temps utile pour garantir le respect des délais internes de la proposition. Identifier et résoudre les problèmes susceptibles d'avoir une incidence sur le calendrier ou la qualité de la proposition, le cas échéant.
 Coordonner l'élaboration du texte, des honoraires et des autres documents nécessaires par le personnel interne et les sous-consultants, le cas échéant, et veiller à ce que le document global soit cohérent en termes de formatage, d'orthographe, de grammaire et de professionnalisme en général.
 Contribuer aux clarifications, aux exigences postérieures à la soumission de l'offre ainsi qu'aux leçons tirées et aux réunions internes de débriefing des propositions.
 Contribuer à l'élaboration de déclarations de capacités, d'études de cas et de matériel standard (graphiques, organigrammes, etc.) à utiliser dans les propositions, les soumissions de qualification et tenir à jour la bibliothèque de contenu des propositions.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ?

 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe, au Canada et dans le monde entier;
 un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 l’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.


 Le/la Coordinateur(trice), Propositions recherché(e)

 Licence en sciences appliquées et/ou en anglais/marketing avec au moins 5 ans d'expérience dans la rédaction de propositions, avec une connaissance du conseil en ingénierie et une compréhension de l'industrie minière et de ses clients, ce qui constitue un atout.
 Maîtrise de MS Office (Word, Excel et PowerPoint), d'InDesign et d'Adobe Acrobat, ainsi qu'une expérience de MS SharePoint sont des atouts.
 Capacité à mener plusieurs tâches de front et à gérer plusieurs projets en même temps, tout en ayant le souci du détail et en faisant preuve d'une éthique de travail extrêmement élevée, de normes de qualité rigoureuses et d'une attitude positive.
 Aisance à communiquer et à travailler avec des personnes à tous les niveaux d'une organisation, avec des compétences rédactionnelles et éditoriales supérieures en anglais
 Aptitude avérée à rester calme sous pression et expérience du travail dans des délais stricts et de la gestion du temps.

 About AtkinsRéalis

 Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. The breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital.

Deputy Manager, Communications and Stakeholder Engagement

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world. Our Major Projects division is in search of a Deputy Manager, Communications and Stakeholder Engagement to join a transformative transit infrastructure project in Toronto, ON. The Deputy Manager role will be part of a high-performing project team that is dedicated to delivering this complex undertaking through collaboration and a best-for-project vision. The role will report to the Stakeholder & Community Engagement Manager.

 Your role within the team:
 Are you the kind of communicator who likes to get out of the office and into the field? Are you inspired by big construction projects and the chance to put all your communications skills to work?
 We are currently seeking a Deputy Manager who will help lead a small but mighty team responsible for managing both internal and external communications for a large, transformative infrastructure project in the heart of Toronto. Our ideal candidate is equal parts strategist and doer; a communications generalist who loves it all, from storytelling to managing issues; and who is looking for an opportunity to build or further grow their management skills.
 Here's what our communications team is responsible for and what the Deputy Manager will help lead and execute with the support of two full-time team members:
 Internal Communications:

 The maintenance and continuous improvement of an internal communications program that supports employee engagement, our Values, and a High Performing Team culture.
 Manage the consistent, high-quality delivery of internal communications tactics including but not limited to a weekly Director’s Message, virtual town hall series and intranet (SharePoint).
 Support internal clients with the delivery of initiatives and campaigns ranging from health and safety awareness to ED&I, helping create the content and select the delivery method best matched to the objective and audience.
 Align internal communications with the emerging topics, construction progress and milestones reached across the project team and sites.
 Plan and execute employee events, team building and community giving opportunities, compiling metrics and successes into a year-in-review report.

 External Communications:

 Maintain outstanding relationships with public and private sector partners across the project landscape, ensuring our client and key stakeholders feel informed and always engaged.
 Maintain visibility of impactful construction activities and prepare communications plans, based on the size and scale of the impact, to provide appropriate public notice based on our contractual requirements.
 Develop content – both written and multimedia - that tells the story of what we are building and helps our client build awareness and excitement.
 Manage inquiries and complaints swiftly and respectfully, liaising with technical disciplines to mitigate escalation.
 Support response to issues and/or media inquiries through the development of collateral (messaging, briefing materials, etc.).
 Lead the planning and execution of public meetings and information-sharing events for local communities and support the successful execution of on-site tours and celebrations involving senior government officials and media.
 Strive to meet and exceed Communications and Stakeholder Engagement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
 Manage and oversee contracts with third-party suppliers, ensuring quality and service standards are met and that we work within allocated budgets.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:
 We know that the people who love working in our industry don’t always fit into a traditional mold. Here are the qualifications we think would make you a great candidate, but we also know that the right attitude and lived experience can be just as valuable. Don’t be deterred if this list isn’t a perfect match with your profile, tell us why you’re interested in how your skills and career journey translate:

 7 to 10 years’ experience in communications/public relations in public-facing roles, ideally within the infrastructure/construction/transit sectors.
 A post-secondary degree in communications, public relations, or related field.
 Experienced in issues management and stakeholder and community relations.
 A demonstrated people leader with the ability to both set the vision and roll up your sleeves to help the team deliver.
 Excellent writing, editing and presentation skills with the ability to translate complex ideas and issues in a clear and concise manner.
 Highly organized project manager with the ability to balance multiple initiatives and effectively prioritize deliverables in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
 Customer and people focused with strong active listening and problem-solving skills.
 Digital, social, and traditional media savvy.

Senior Environmental Project Engineer

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 The Environment Technical Professional Organization at AtkinsRéalis is dedicated to responding to the changing needs of our clients and communities. We are committed to technical excellence and provide solution-driven environmental services to assist clients in planning, managing, and conducting their projects. Our growing organization is seeking like-minded individuals to join our Site Assessment and Remediation team in BC, and we are looking for a Senior Environmental Project Engineer or Senior Environmental Scientist to join our team. We have offices in Victoria, Nanaimo, Vancouver, Burnaby, Kelowna, Trail, Nelson, and Cranbrook as well as locations in Northern BC.

 You will work on a variety of projects for various clients across Canada but primarily in BC. The ideal candidate is an industry professional that has proven project experience and the long-term drive, ambition and potential to develop and progress within our organization. Individuals who join our team can expect to work closely with other professionals in a wide variety of fields, collaborating across regions and groups to provide high-quality technical solutions for our clients. The work environment is dynamic and flexible, offering a strong emphasis on health and safety with competitive compensation and benefits.

 The successful candidate will bring leadership skills and provide senior level technical direction and mentoring of staff, strong client management skills and the ability to collaborate with others across the Environment Practice. They will provide leadership through mentorship and supporting the technical development of staff to support project execution.

 Your role within the team:

 Provide technical direction and project management of fundamental tasks related to environmental projects (e.g., soil and groundwater investigation), remediation scopes of work and report preparation.
 Communicate with and provide mentorship to junior staff.
 Oversee contractors and field-staff to ensure the project is delivered as per pre-defined specifications.
 Review and evaluate large amounts of field collected data to support data gap analyses and selection of remedial options.
 Provide technical expertise for contaminated site investigation, remediation and reclamation programs.
 Interpret findings and prepare and review technical reports.
 Interact with clients and provide verbal and written project updates.
 Track budgets and identify and communicate scope changes in a timely manner.
 Supervise and mentor staff involved in carrying out field programs; ensure project requirements are communicated and health and safety protocols are followed.
 Promote a positive Health and Safety culture.
 Participate in business development activities and maintaining client relationships.

 The ideal candidate:

 Degree from a program with relevant subject matter in the field of Environmental Sciences, Engineering, Geology, or Biology.
 Eligibility for professional designation and an interest in obtaining CSAP designation within the next 5 years would be considered an asset.
 Minimum of 15 years of progressive experience encompassing project coordination and project management and with emphasis in the areas of contaminated site assessment, remediation and reclamation.
 Demonstrated experience in activities related to environmental site assessment and remediation such as Phase I and II Environmental Site Assessments (ESA) including groundwater monitoring and sampling techniques, various drilling techniques, soil sample collection and logging, soil vapour sampling, remedial excavations, reclamation, spill response and quality assurance / quality control protocols.
 Strong understanding of regulatory frameworks and guidelines of the Environment Management Act and specifically the BC Contaminated Sites Regulation under the Ministry of Environment & Climate Change Strategy.
 The ability to work well in a team environment.
 Strong communication skills and experience in public facing roles such as responding to questions and interacting with the public on large-scale development or environmental projects.
 Experience managing contractors and working closely with clients on large, multi-year projects.
 Self-motivated, high energy, strong organizational and time management skills.
 Strong written and verbal communication skills in the English language.
 Capable of understanding and appropriately applying prescribed safety and technical protocols.
 Experience in routine statistical analysis would be an asset.
 Candidates may need a Valid Class 5 Full driver’s license.

 À propos d’AtkinsRéalis
 Issue de l’intégration d’organisations établies de longue date, la première en 1911, AtkinsRéalis est une entreprise mondiale de pointe de services professionnels et de gestion de projet, dédiée à façonner un meilleur avenir pour notre planète et ceux qui l’habitent. Nous créons des solutions durables qui lient individus, données et technologie pour transformer les infrastructures et les systèmes énergétiques du monde. Nous déployons des capacités mondiales à l’échelle locale pour fournir à nos clients des services uniques et complets couvrant tout le cycle de vie d’un actif — consultation, services-conseils et services environnementaux, réseaux intelligents et cybersécurité, conception et ingénierie, approvisionnement, gestion de projet et de construction, exploitation et entretien, mise hors service et capital. Nous offrons l’ampleur et la profondeur de nos capacités dans des secteurs stratégiques clés tels que Services d’ingénierie, Énergie nucléaire, Exploitation et entretien et Capital.

 Chez AtkinsRéalis, nous cherchons à embaucher des individus possédant des caractéristiques, parcours et perspectives diversifiés. Nous croyons fermement que le talent de classe mondiale ne fait aucune distinction à l’égard du genre, de l’origine ethnique ou nationale, de l’identité et de l’orientation sexuelle, de l’âge, de la religion ou de la déficience, mais s’enrichit plutôt de ces différences.

Highway Maintenance Operator
AtkinsRéalis provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision. AtkinsRéalis is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.
Brun-Way Highways Operations Inc. is a branch within AtkinsRéalis responsible for 275 kilometers of the Trans-Canada Highway, from the Quebec border to Longs Creek (West of Fredericton) and Route 95 between Woodstock and the Houlton Border, until the year 2033. The Brun-Way project has met the client’s goals of reducing maintenance costs, continuously improving performance anddelivering one of the most efficient and modern highways in the world. Safety targets have been met every year, with a dramatic reduction in the number of road incidents. The project’s success hasbeen recognized with numerous awards for safety, innovation, and Operations & Maintenance excellence.
We are seeking a full-time Highway Maintenance Operator to join our team at Brun-Way. This position is responsible for operating a variety of equipment and performing manual labor required to maintain the highway and right-of-way assets to ensure conformance of the designated section of the highway with required Operation, Maintenance, and Rehabilitation (OMR) standards and contractual requirements.
Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!
Your role within the team:

Operate highway vehicles, equipment and tools including but not limited to snowplow trucks, dump body trucks, loaders, Skid Steer loaders, tractors, light vehicles, etc. required to maintain and repair the highway surfaces and other assets in a safe condition according to OMR standards and contractual requirements.
Perform general maintenance activities of vehicles and equipment, such as pre-trip inspections activities, greasing and washing.
Perform general manual labour required to maintain and repair the highway and related corridor assets (including, but not limited to, traffic control, grass cutting, drainage facilities, signs, asphalt and concrete patching and other assets, spring debris clean-up, litter removal, etc.).
Perform planned and emergency traffic control signing and services, and assist in accident response and site clean-up, in compliance with the Work Area Traffic Control Manual and safety standards.
Prepare daily work records of activities, including equipment operating times and vehicle performance.
Assist the Mechanics in routine vehicle and equipment maintenance and repairs, as needed
Assist in yard maintenance and general good house-keeping clean-up practices.
Assist with the annual detailed inspections for the highway asset management system.
Required to work scheduled rotating shifts during Winter Operations.
Required to be on rotating on-call schedule during Summer Operations for after-hour incident response.
Flexible to work at different locations along the Facility (from Long’s Creek to Quebec Border).

The ideal candidate:

Minimum 2 years’ previous job-related experience preferred.
General knowledge of highway operations and working experience with various types of vehicles and equipment used in road maintenance activities is preferred.
Valid Class 1 or Class 3 driver license with commercial vehicle endorsement (with air brake) is required.
Clean driving record is required.
Attention to detail with a focus on accuracy, efficiency, and compliance with defined standards.
Good personal documentation and problem solving.
Capable of lifting heavy objects on occasion.
Demonstrate good working knowledge of workplace health and safety.
Ability to deal with the public in a calm, patient, and professional manner.

Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 AtkinsRéalis is seeking a Senior Environmental Planner who is seeking more experience and increased responsibility combined with exposure to a wide variety of infrastructure (e.g., transit, road/highway, power, etc.) and other environmental assessment planning projects. The ideal candidate will be a motivated and detail-oriented with a minimum of 5 years of demonstrated experience providing environmental assessment and consulting services in Canada.

 This position can be based anywhere in Canada with an option to work remote.

 Your role within the team:

 Lead, implement and manage all aspects of environmental assessment for municipal, provincial, federal, or territorial projects following the relevant assessment processes.
 Independently conduct, coordinate, and manage external subcontractors, where required, to complete environmental assessments and supportive technical studies and documentation (e.g., noise, air, natural and cultural heritage, property contamination/remediation, etc.) for projects.
 Coordinate and guide efforts to obtain environmental approvals for projects from government/regulatory agencies (all jurisdictions).
 Effectively delegate tasks and activities to intermediate and junior staff and providing technical and supervisory guidance on assigned tasks.
 Interact with clients on technical tasks as Project Manager and/or Environmental Manager.
 Liaise and communicate with regulatory agencies, and authorities having jurisdiction to address project issues and obtain agreement in principle.
 Manage the development and implementation of consultation and engagement programs, directed at municipal, federal, provincial, and territorial regulatory agencies, and Indigenous peoples, including providing strategic oversight to ensure effective engagement.
 Collaborate with technical and professional staff across the company in completing assignments.
 Develop, prepare, and maintain project/task schedules and budgets for the environmental component of projects, including monitoring project progress, work hours, budgets and expenditures using project scheduling and cost control tools.
 Assist with and, as necessary, taking a lead role in the development of proposals, qualification documents and other business development related activities.
 Help to grow environmental planning / environmental assessment market share in strategic markets with a primary focus on Ontario and the Greater Toronto/ Hamilton Area while contributing to growth in western Canada.
 Leverage existing industry / client relationships and establish and foster new client relationships.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.


 The ideal candidate:

 Bachelor’s degree in environmental planning, Geography, Environmental Science, Environmental Studies).
 10 + years of related experience in managing and coordinating environmental assessments and securing construction permits/approvals.
 Experience working in a fast-paced consulting environment.
 Familiarity and demonstrated experience with the provincial, federal, and territorial environmental assessment processes in a variety of jurisdictions, with in-depth understanding of regulatory environment in Ontario being an asset.
 Demonstrated experience working on Canadian projects.
 Full or Provisional membership in a professional body (e.g., Registered Professional Planner (RPP and MCIP).
 Canadian Environmental Professional (EP) or Project Management Professional (PMP).
 Knowledge of other relevant environmental legislation and policy.
 Knowledge of and experience with project management fundamentals including cost control, scope management and scheduling.
 Exceptional organizational skills.
 Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), as well as an aptitude for client liaison.
 Ability to train and mentor junior and intermediate staff.
 Ability to plan and prioritize workload to manage multiple assignments at one time.
 Must possess a valid Class G driver’s license.

Rédacteur(trice) technique en réseaux électrique -Technical writer for power grids

 En tant que Rédacteur(trice) technique au sein de l'unité d'affaires des réseaux électriques et des énergies renouvelables de AtkinsRéalis, vous rejoindrez une équipe d'experts mondiaux et jouerez un rôle central dans la rédaction, l'édition et la publication de divers documents et supports d'une importance stratégique pour l'entreprise.

 Veuillez noter que nous recherchons une personne ayant une expérience dans les réseaux électriques et les énergies renouvelables pour rédiger des documents techniques. Cette personne devra être capable de communiquer et de traduire des informations à un niveau technique.

 Votre rôle au sein de l'équipe :

 Contribuer à la rédaction d'articles de réflexion en améliorant la qualité et en mettant à jour les textes rédigés par des experts en la matière, assurant ainsi une communication claire des concepts techniques.
 Coordonner avec des experts techniques de haut niveau pour établir des dates cibles pour la collecte d'informations, la rédaction si nécessaire, la relecture et l'approbation.
 Rédiger, créer et améliorer des documents et modèles marketing et commerciaux pour les ventes et le développement des affaires, tels que des brochures, des présentations et d'autres supports promotionnels.
 Travailler avec des experts en la matière, des graphistes et des équipes marketing pour créer un contenu stimulant et développer de nouvelles solutions.
 Éditer et reformuler le contenu pour assurer la continuité du message stratégique et la clarté des points clés.
 D'autres tâches peuvent inclure l'examen de fiches de projets et de curriculum vitae, ainsi que le soutien rédactionnel et les conseils aux différents départements de l'unité commerciale.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis en tant qu'employeur ? Parce que nous offrons :

 L'opportunité de travailler sur divers projets majeurs pour des clients internes et externes.
 Un environnement passionnant où l'équilibre entre travail et vie personnelle est important.
 Une large gamme d'opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement.
 Un salaire compétitif, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un plan de participation des employés et un régime de retraite à cotisations définies.
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et la sécurité.


 Le/la Rédacteur(trice) technique en réseaux électrique recherché(e ) :

 Diplôme en ingénierie ou dans un domaine technique connexe,
 Avoir au moins 2 ans d'expérience pertinente dans un rôle impliquant la rédaction et la publication de contenu en ligne ou dans des revues.
 Excellentes compétences en rédaction, en édition, en relecture et en mise en forme pour garantir l'exactitude et la qualité.
 Connaissance en ingénierie, notamment les secteurs de l'énergie électrique, de la transmission et de la distribution.
 Excellente maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office.
 Le /la candidat (e ) est en mesure de s’exprimer en français (à l’oral et à l’écrit) et en anglais (à l’oral)*
