 Ingénieur(e) civil sénior – projets miniers
 Si vous êtes à la recherche d’un employeur qui a des projets internationaux d’ingénierie de grande envergure à vous proposer, qui figure au premier plan dans le domaine de l’ingénierie et de la construction et qui est présente dans une grande variété de secteurs de marché. Si vous souhaitez faire la différence auprès d’une multitude de communautés en améliorant leur quotidien. Si vous souhaitez vous joindre à une équipe inclusive et diversifiée sur qui vous pouvez compter… alors nous sommes l’employeur qu’il vous faut!

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe

 Effectuer la conception conceptuelle, préliminaire et détaillée des ensembles techniques d'infrastructure minière.
 Produire des documents d'ingénierie tels que des rapports de conception, des estimations de coûts et des devis de construction, des fiches techniques, des documents de soumission, des évaluations de soumission, des directives d'ingénierie et d'autres données, conformément aux spécifications du client.
 Concevoir et/ou diriger la conception des infrastructures civiles des opérations, routes, drainages, services pour les projets d'infrastructure dans les industries de traitement minier.
 Diriger l’interface technique génie civil du projet et veiller à ce que les solutions de conception du projet soient fournies conformément aux codes et règlements pertinents et aux normes les plus élevées de l'industrie, dans le respect du calendrier et du budget.
 Établir et surveiller les budgets et le calendrier des produits livrables du projet.
 Assurer l'interface avec les équipes de projet pour élaborer et mettre en œuvre des stratégies de projet multidisciplinaires.
 Réalisation d’inspection sur le terrain au besoin.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur?
 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 L’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe;
 Un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 L’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;
 Un salaire concurrentiel, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un régime d’actionnariat et un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées;
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et sécurité.


 L’ingénieur(e) recherché(e)

 BAC ou Maîtrise en génie civil.
 Membre OIQ, PEO ou PEGNL.
 Minimum de 15 ans d'expérience en génie civil et en gestion de projet.
 Connaissance approfondie/expérience dans la conception de travaux de terrassement, de systèmes de drainage, de services souterrains sur le site.
 Gestion des infrastructures civiles des opérations, bassins versants, conception de chemins de halage et connaissance et expérience des systèmes de pompage et services.
 Excellentes aptitudes à la communication écrite et verbale en français et en anglais*

 Senior Civil Engineer - Mining Projects
 If you're looking for an employer with large-scale international engineering projects, a leading position in engineering and construction, and a presence in a wide variety of market sectors. If you'd like to join an inclusive and diverse team you can count on... then we're the right employer for you!

 Your role within the team

 Perform conceptual, preliminary and detailed design of mining infrastructure engineering packages.
 Produce engineering documents such as design reports, cost and construction estimates, data sheets, bid documents, bid evaluations, engineering guidelines and other data in accordance with client specifications.
 Design and/or lead the design of civil infrastructure operations, roads, drains, services for infrastructure projects in the mining processing industries.
 Lead the civil engineering interface of the project and ensure that project design solutions are delivered in accordance with relevant codes and regulations and the highest industry standards, on time and on budget.
 Establish and monitor budgets and schedule for project deliverables.
 Interface with project teams to develop and implement multidisciplinary project strategies.
 Perform quality control on all design work to ensure it meets SNC QA/QC requirements.
 Conducting field inspections, if needed.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate

 Bachelor's or Master's degree in Civil Engineering.
 Minimum of 15 years experience in civil engineering and project management.
 OIQ, PEO or PEGNL Member.
 Extensive knowledge/experience in the design of earthworks, drainage systems, underground site services.
 Civil infrastructure management of operations, watersheds, haul road design and knowledge and experience with pumping systems and services.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, ability to maintain confidentiality of critical information.

Come Build Your Career at Aecon!
As a Canadian leader in infrastructure development, Aecon is safely and sustainably building what matters for future generations to thrive! We lead some of the most impactful infrastructure projects of our generation, at the forefront of transformational change in transportation and energy, and partnering every day to build, connect, power, and strengthen our communities.
At Aecon, you can count on:

Safety First. Our number one core value. If we can’t do it safely, we don’t do it at all.
Integrity. We lead by example, with humility and courage.
Accountability. We’re passionate about delivering on our commitments.
Inclusion. We provide equitable opportunities for everyone.





  We lead the infrastructure industry with purpose, and our people are at the heart of everything we do. So, we invest in our people, just like they invest in us!
 


At Aecon we:

Ensure you and your family receive the services needed to support your mental, emotional, and physical well-being 
Believe in helping you build your career through our Aecon University and Leadership Programs 
Are committed to supporting and investing in inclusive work environments, through initiatives like Equity, Diversity & Inclusion training, our Aecon Women in Trades and Aecon Diversity in Trades programs, and our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to ensure we are building inclusion into every aspect of our culture at Aecon.
Are a leader in sustainable construction. With a strong commitment to operating responsibility by minimizing our impact on the environment and surrounding communities.




Our business success relies on strong execution and continuous improvement – driven by the diversity, expertise and teamwork of our people. We’re always searching the globe for innovative, collaborative minds to join our best-in-class Aecon community!



 About Us


  The Shoreline Power Group is a fully integrated Joint Venture of Aecon, United and AtkinsRéalis located in Kincardine, Ontario. Shoreline Power Group is the centerpiece of the Major Component Replacement (MCR) program which replaces the main components of 6 reactors at the Bruce Power Nuclear Generating Station. The scope of work includes the removal and replacement of calandria tubes, pressure tubes, and feeders as well as construction management and trade labor. This project is part of Bruce Power’s Life Extension Program, which will allow Bruce Power’s CANDU units to continue to operate safely through to 2064.
 



  Under the general direction of the Construction Manager, the Feeders Removal Superintendent will assist in the supervision, coordination and scheduling of construction activities on project construction site and/or supervise a construction project in compliance with the contract and the job cost estimate and ensures all the work is completed safely to acceptable standards of quality and workmanship.
 



What You'll Do Here


Maintain excellent relationships with client, engineers, consultants, subcontractors and public
Responsible to ensure that all work is conducted in a safe manner in compliance with safety, quality and human performance policies
Implement Joint Venture and Client policies and project procedures as required
Assist in developing, monitoring, and updating of project schedule with the Construction Manager. Ensure subcontractors comply with project master schedule
Utilize project master schedule to help create detailed look ahead schedules with the supervisors and subcontractors
Assist in developing recovery strategies when project schedule or budget are in jeopardy
Plan, supervise and approve the work of project team members and subcontractors on the project including determining methods of construction, manpower levels, materials, tools & equipment, rentals and work schedules
Assume responsibility for productivity of trades and subcontractors, efficient use of materials and equipment and contractual performance of the project
Ensure trades personnel complete all necessary training in areas of safety, quality assurance, technical qualifications, equipment operation and owner specified requirements
Ensure project is constructed in compliance with drawings, specifications, Field Work Packages (FWPs), Construction, Inspection & Test Plans (CITPs) and project schedule and budget
Interface with client representatives, design engineers, consultants, other contractors, etc.
Ensure the work is carried out in accordance with QA Programs and project quality guidelines
Maintain appropriate field documentation including safety records, daily progress reports, training records, T&E and rental records, manpower reports, owner support requests, FWP documents, etc.
Participate in layout and preparation of work instructions, field engineering activities, etc.
Stand in as nominated delegate for Construction manager when required


Direct General Forepersons, Forepersons, hourly trades and subcontractors in the execution of their assigned duties
Maintain discipline and implement procedures where necessary



What You Bring To The Team
 • Education to include a technical college diploma or equivalent combination of technical training and/or related experience
  

Minimum 5 years construction and subcontractor supervision experience
Ability to successfully supervise a construction project
Knowledge of all aspects of construction such as; technology, equipment, methods, trade agreements and jurisdiction, engineering, cost control, scheduling and safety requirements
Good communication, organizational and supervisory skills are essential
Basic knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook
Ability to read and understand Cost Reports
Basic presentation skills
Leadership. This is a vital role in the organization and leading of the project plans. Leadership by example

Claims Manager

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is in search of a Claims Manager to join a transformative transit infrastructure project in Calgary.

 The Green Line LRT (light rail transit) Project is the largest infrastructure investment in Calgary’s history. It comes with $5.5 billion in commitments from the Government of Canada, Government of Alberta and The City of Calgary. The Green Line LRT is designed to be both a transit system and a platform for future city building opportunities. It encourages redevelopment and investment in Calgary businesses and communities. At 18-kms, Phase 1 will create 20,000 jobs, $2.2B in long-term city-shaping benefits and more than $6B in property value uplift by 2040.

 You will be embedded within the client office team environment, and as such you are required to be in downtown Calgary, for the full working week.
 Your role within the team:

 Draft claims and claims responses for the Client, including Extension of Time, prolongation, acceleration and disruption claims.
 Protect the Client’s best interest as required and defend claims from the contractors in conjunction with commercial strategy.
 Manage, maintain and report claim files, with claim status reports to Management Team on a regular basis.
 Participate in project related meetings; work closely with the different teams including: designers, design project managers and project controls teams.
 Identify opportunities for revenue enhancement, schedule relief and claim avoidance.
 Identify and prepare comprehensive claims documentation and coordinate the efforts to negotiate and help to resolve claims with the Design Built Joint Venture (DBJV).
 Prepare, maintain, retrieve, and communicate records, reports, or documents that may be required to meet corporate and Contract Management requirements.
 Draft contractual commitment documents, particularly responding to contractual letters.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Bachelor’s degree in Business, Quantity Surveying, Law, Engineering or Construction Management.
 Minimum of 10+years of contract / claims management experience, preferably management of prime contract in heavy civil/infrastructure projects.
 Membership of CIQS, RICS, CIArb or equivalent is a plus.
 Experience in compiling, finalizing, defending and winning claims.
 Understanding of alternative dispute resolution techniques.
 Thorough understanding of P3 Contracts in engineering/construction industry and the flow-down of applicable clauses and requirements, and preferably hands on experience on alternate procurement methods.
 Good understanding of delay analysis methodologies and their utilization in claims.

Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 ProTrans BC Operations Ltd., a subsidiary of AtkinsRéalis, is the private operator of the Canada Line, a 19-km automated rail-based rapid transit system connecting Downtown Vancouver with central Richmond and the Vancouver International Airport. Our fleet of trains provide a 26-minute terminus-to-terminus service to an average weekday ridership of more than 120,000 passengers across 16 stations. Our operations office is in Richmond, British Columbia.

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 We are seeking a Maintenance Supervisor to join our Maintenance Team and the successful candidate will report to the Maintenance Managers. The Maintenance Supervisor supervises the activities of technicians and contractors for inspections, maintenance, repairs, and new installations of railway systems. The Supervisor also schedules and co-ordinates special projects, ensuring that priority is given to failures affecting service, and checks that work carried out is done according to specification, quality, and safety requirements.

 Your role within the team:

 Supervise service contractors’ and technicians’ work and ensure the work is performed according to safe work plans, schedule and is completed to required standards. Ensure all necessary tools and materials for scheduled maintenance requirements and special projects are available in stock and kitted for work assignments.
 Prepare work schedules and assign special projects and repairs by priority daily.
 Manage projects adhering to work schedules and budgets.
 Respond to emergency incidents day or night and prepare reports.
 Ensure compliance with safety regulations, safe work practices and coordinate monthly departmental safety meetings.
 Assist with the implementation of policies, procedures, and programs, both routine and emergency, relating to scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, repair and new installations of railway systems and provide feedback on status of work and effectiveness.
 Participate in the recruitment process by reviewing applications and resumes, short-listing candidates, interviewing candidates, and making recommendations.
 Manage performance and competency levels of individuals and team.
 Participate in incident investigations and implement necessary corrective actions as required.
 Develop and deliver various on-the-job and classroom training sessions.
 Perform relief duties for the Manager as required.
 Other duties as assigned.


 Safety responsibilities –

 Responsible for ensuring safe working practices are adopted in the maintenance of equipment and work performed.
 Ensuring that the team is provided with, and is correctly using, personal protective equipment and clothing.
 Ensuring that technical staff and contractors under their responsibility are aware of the safety procedures for working on the track.
 Ensuring that assigned assets are safe for operation.
 Ensuring that the safety training for the team is regularly refreshed and re-assessed.
 Practicing personal safety when on or about the guideway.
 Ensuring that the requirements of the Safety Management System are met with respect to the reporting of accidents and incidents on the railway.
 Ensuring that maintenance facilities and equipment are correctly maintained and fit for use.


 Environmental aspects – this role has Significant Environmental Aspects associated with it which may include handling of and exposure to Batteries used in vehicles, stations, substations, and generators and from time-to-time working with other cleaning chemicals or hazardous products.

 Why pick AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 The opportunity to work on an innovative and award-winning project.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive salary, great benefits, an employee share ownership plan, and a pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.
 Expected compensation for this role is between Pay Range $86,600 - $119,000 annually. Base salaries are determined according to several parameters like skills, experience, and potential impact on the role. Internal and external competitiveness are also taken into account in our offers.


 The ideal candidate:

 Degree or technical diploma in a related field; or a red-seal certification in a related field; or experience as a Track Supervisor or Track Inspector.
 Experience in a variety of technical fields.
 At least eight years of experience in a maintenance environment.
 A combination of education and experience may also be considered.
 Strong leader and motivator of the maintenance team to consistently deliver objectives.
 An achiever with track record of high performance of a unionized maintenance team in meeting the program objectives set in accordance with the daily and Annual Maintenance Plan, and the prioritization of corrective works.


 Required – 

This position is safety critical. Fitness for duty is a requirement of the position.
 Prioritization of workload to minimize asset and equipment failures, and completion of planned scheduled work.
 Able to participate in a rotational on-call program and work shifts.
 Valid class 5 BC driver’s license.
 Must be able to work night shifts (2000-0600). This role is expected to work 50%-night shift.
 Must be able to work in an outdoor night environment year-round.

 About AtkinsRéalis
 Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. The breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital.

 Maîtrise du français (parlé et écrit)
 Approche collaborative

 Leadership et aptitudes à diriger une équipe

 Candu Energy Inc. is a leading full-service nuclear technology company providing nuclear power reactors and nuclear products and services to customers worldwide. Our 1,400 highly skilled employees design and deliver state-of-the-art CANDU® reactors, carry out life extension projects, provide plant life management programs and tools, and offer operation and maintenance services for existing nuclear power stations. This role is based out of the Candu Energy Inc. home office in Mississauga, Ontario.

 Reporting to the Manager of Retube Tooling Design Engineering in Retube, Inspection and Maintenance Systems, the Engineer/Analyst-Retube Tooling Design would support multiple Refurbishment projects. The candidate will be responsible for developing and/or overseeing the conceptual and detailed design, manufacturing, testing, delivery and execution support of tooling systems.

 Location: Mississauga, ON

 Your role within the team: 


Independently evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering techniques, procedures and criteria using judgement in making minor adaptations and modifications.
 Assignments have clear and specified objectives requiring investigation of a limited number of variables.
 Assignments normally include system and equipment design and development, design modification, investigation of design difficulties, test of materials, preparation of specifications, process study, cost estimating and preparation of reports, review of vendor’s documentation, investigation of manufacturing and installation difficulties.
 May be assigned project engineering responsibilities on a technical or commercial endeavour of moderate scope.
 Work is limited in scope and generally related to one field or discipline of engineering, although a knowledge of related fields of engineering and an appreciation of the impact of the work on other areas may be required.
 Completed work is generally accepted as technically accurate and in compliance with policies and procedures and is reviewed for soundness of judgement and feasibility.
 Work objectives are specific, and supervision is usually general; the details of the work are not normally closely supervised but this may vary with the assignment.
 Normally required to plan, schedule and manage own time, including taking into account the plans of others.
 Ensures all project training and qualifications records are up-to-date, and required training and qualifications are completed/updated on time.
 Plans and executes work consistent with quality, cost, and schedule requirements.
 Ensures that work is conducted in accordance with applicable Engineering and Quality Assurance procedures.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal Candidate:

 Bachelors Degree in Engineering (Mechanical) with 3-5 years of practical experience.
 Professional Engineer designation from PEO or Eligible.
 Excellent communication (both oral and written) skills.
 Strong Interpersonal skills in communicating with a large team.
 Organizational and time management skills. Ability to prioritize and multi-task/ Service orientated.
 Demonstrated ability to support complex and parallel technical projects.
 Experience working in a nuclear facility licensed in Canada would be an asset.
 Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.
 Willing to travel to and potentially work at Project sites to meet project needs.

Senior Feeder Support Engineer- Lead

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world since for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology.

 Reporting to the Manager, Feeder & Piping Engineering, Materials, Welding & Chemistry, Senior Feeder Support Engineer- Lead will work in support of Life Extension Projects and New Build project and requires a technical leadership role in the design of feeder piping, feeder supports, and feeder in-line components.

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the team:

 Lead a team to Involve in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design of CANDU or Nuclear piping and process systems and modifications.
 Design complex piping and support arrangement, and prepare technical documents, such as: engineering drawings (including GA, ISO, pipe supports, flow diagrams), change paper markups, calculations, design/analysis reports, design requirements, design manuals, bill of materials, design specifications, technical specifications, data sheets, system classification lists, code classifications, commissioning specifications, etc.;
 Performing thermal, fatigue, seismic, linear, and non-linear analyses in accordance with ASME Boiler & Pressure Vessel Code, Section III, Div.1 code requirements is preferred.
 Perform complex engineering tasks with efficiency and accuracy.
 Prepare and review registration packages for pressure boundary components.
 Interface with the regulatory bodies such as: TSSA, and CNSC, as required.
 Provide technical guidance and instruction to Designers/Drafters, and Junior/Intermediate Engineers.
 Perform design review and design verification for the design and engineering work completed by others.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matters.
 Perform site visits to client and supplier shops as required.
 Perform field walk-downs during different design phases as required.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matter.
 Take a senior role in a group of Design and Stress Engineers/Analysts on multiple CANDU Reactor Components tasks.
 Defining work scope, preparing budget estimates and schedules, and reporting progress
 Report to engineering or project management with timely updates on project performance for the assigned scopes or tasks.
 Perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy Quality Assurance programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulation requirements.
 Coordinate and interface with client, suppliers, stakeholders and other design disciplines or department to execute assigned engineering work.

 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The Ideal Candidate:

 Engineering Degree in Mechanical from an accredited university or equivalent degree as recognized by Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO).
 Registered as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario (a must).
 Minimum 10 years of related work experience in the field of pipe/pipe support design/analysis within a heavy industrial environment such as: mining, oil & gas, power; preferably with work experience in CANDU feeder analysis.
 General knowledge of CANDU nuclear mechanical and piping systems or equipment.
 Working knowledge of CSA N285, CSA B51, CSA N289, ASME BPVC Section III, Div.1, ASME B31.1 and any other applicable standards or regulatory guides related to permanent plant components, pressure boundary equipment, and/or reactor systems is required.
 Experience in stress analysis of pressure boundary components, for deadweight, thermal, and seismic conditions is required.
 Design engineering experience in nuclear piping systems is preferable.
 Experience in FEA using ANSYS Mechanical APDL is required. Experience in ANSYS Workbench is an asset.
 Experience in other FEA software, such as LS-DYNA is an asset.
 Qualified or eligible to be qualified as ASME Appendix XXIII is preferred.
 Must have excellent technical and practical skills to resolve engineering issues or technical problems.
 Must have excellent communication and technical writing skills.
 Must have experience working and leading a team of engineers, in completing highly technical integrated tasks.
 Demonstrate ability to interact effectively with clients at all levels of the client organization.
 Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment.
 Must be capable of working independently and planning tasks, yet be an active team member supporting the project team and their development.
 Site experience in construction, or commissioning of plant mechanical systems for nuclear or other heavy industries would be an asset; and
 Must be willing to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW), although this will not be a regular requirement as part of the position.

 We are currently seeking a Physicist to be a part of our team in the Fuel and Physics department supporting the design of new nuclear power plants and the operation, refurbishment, or waste management and decommissioning of existing CANDU nuclear power plants.

 Your role within the team:

 Lead, plan, perform, document, review, and/or verify technical analyses that includes: The use of radiation transport codes, performing dose calculations, and/or application / development of activity transport models.
 Produce high quality reports effectively summarizing technical information.
 Present results to internal and/or external stakeholders.
 Collate, assimilate, and summarize results from existing analyses.
 Follow the relevant procedures, guidelines and standards governing the work being performed.
 Develop, adapt, or modify computer codes for specific applications and to solve new problems.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The Ideal Candidate:

 Undergraduate degree in Physics, Engineering Physics, Nuclear Engineering, Health Physics or equivalent.
 Minimum of (5) five years of experience with Undergraduate degree OR Minimum of (2) Two years of experience with Graduate degree in radiation transport, performing dose calculations, activity transport and/or dispersion models (less experience required if candidate possesses an advanced degree).
 Experience with the computer codes MCNP, SCALE, or ADDAM (equivalent codes acceptable).
 Ability to program especially in python, PERL, MATLAB, C++, or Fortran.
 Willing to be designated as a Nuclear Energy Worker.

 Additional Preferred Qualifications:

 Postgraduate degrees or equivalent qualifications in Physics, Engineering Physics, Nuclear Engineering, Nuclear Chemistry, or equivalent.
 Experience working at a nuclear facility performing radiation transport and shielding calculations.
 Experience with rehabilitation and decommissioning activities and supporting station operations.
 Familiarity with codes and standards applicable nuclear work in Canada.

Conseiller(ère) principal(e) en communication interne d’entreprise

 Vous excellez dans un milieu où les activités se déroulent à un rythme rapide au sein d’une équipe d’experts répartis partout à travers le monde? Vous êtes allumés par l’idée de contribuer à faire rayonner la culture d’entreprise auprès de milliers d’employés? Vous vous démarquez par votre goût de faire les choses différemment et d’innover?

 Nous avons le défi pour vous! Constituée de conseillers travaillant sur de multiples projets mondiaux, l’équipe des communications internes d’entreprise s’affaire à favoriser la cohérence organisationnelle, assurer l’alignement stratégique et maximiser la performance des employés(ées) grâce à des initiatives engageantes et percutantes.

 En tant que conseiller(ère) principal(e) relevant de la gestionnaire principale, Communications internes d’entreprise, vous jouerez un rôle central dans le développement de la stratégie, de la planification et de la livraison des initiatives de communications internes pour l’ensemble des fonctions d’AtkinsRéalis. Vous serez le gardien de la marque, de la voix et de l’identité visuelle d’AtkinsRéalis auprès des publics internes à l’échelle mondiale. Vous travaillerez avec des membres de la haute direction afin d’identifier les meilleures approches, canaux et messages de communication pour assurer une circulation efficace de l'information, promouvoir la collaboration et améliorer l'expérience et l'engagement des employés.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe

 Au sein de l’équipe communication interne, vous relèverez de la gestionnaire principale, Communications internes d’entreprise et vous aurez à :


 Travailler avec les différentes équipes des Communications mondiales et du marketing pour élaborer, réaliser et mesurer les campagnes et les plans de communications internes intégrés.
 Développer des relations de confiance et conseiller les clients internes sur les pratiques exemplaires en matière de communications internes.
 Gérer la création et le déploiement des initiatives de communication et d’engagement des employés sur nos canaux internes y compris des articles, des infolettres, des vidéos, des webdiffusions, etc.
 Coordonner les événements internes, de la logistique au contenu.
 Assurer l’utilisation efficiente des pratiques, des procédures, des méthodologies et des outils tout en visant l’atteinte des objectifs fixés du plan d’affaires.
 Participer à des groupes de travail sur l’innovation en communication interne.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ?

Ingénieur(e) senior électricité de bâtiment industriel

 Nous sommes à la recherche d’un(e) ingénieur(e) senior(e) en électricité de bâtiment afin de joindre l'équipe de conception œuvrant à Montréal principalement dans le domaine des bâtiments industriel.

 Le groupe d’électricité d’ingénierie Montréal est spécialisé dans le domaine institutionnel, commercial et industriel léger et a acquis au fil des années une réputation d’excellence en la matière. Les candidats choisis auront l’occasion d’œuvrer et de diriger une équipe technique hautement qualifiée et pourront mettre à profit leurs connaissances et leur savoir-faire sur des projets d’importances. Avec la possibilité d’avoir un mode de travail hybride, la majorité des projets sur lesquels le candidat sera appelé à travailler se dérouleront dans le secteur de Montréal et ses environs. Il s’agit d’une occasion de vous impliquer au sein d’une équipe dynamique et en pleine croissance et de mettre à profit votre talent en gestion et en conception électrique. Les projets visés sont de nature industriel léger tel que principalement la filière batterie, récemment médiatisé ainsi d’autre type de bâtiments manufacturiers.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe:

 Diriger les équipes de conception en électricité pour les projets assignés.
 Recueillir les données de base du client et des autres intervenants.
 Préparer, vérifier et effectuer le suivi des échéanciers et des budgets de réalisation des travaux.
 Diriger toutes les phases de la conception des systèmes tels que distribution, éclairage, alarmes incendie, contrôle d’accès, surveillance vidéo, mise à la terre et autres systèmes connexes.
 Participer et diriger les réunions de coordination.
 Rédiger des devis techniques d’électricité.
 Évaluer les coûts des travaux.
 Superviser la surveillance des travaux.
 Fournir une assistance au client et au personnel technique.

 Le candidat idéal :

 Baccalauréat en génie électrique avec une orientation bâtiment.

 Être membre de l’Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ).

 Capacité à mener et diriger des projets en électricité.
 Capacité à "coacher" des ingénieurs plus juniors et intermédiaires.
 Maîtrise du français et anglais (parlé et écrit).

Vice-President Transformation, Canada
 Location: Toronto

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

 The VP Transformation role is a cornerstone of performance improvement for the Canada Region, leading transformation, and continuous improvement efforts, especially in the digital domain.
 The VP Transformation is a major contributor in the realization of the strategic plan for the Canada Region. They establish improvement priorities and define a vision for transformation - working in collaboration with other members of the leadership team.
 The Transformation VP oversees the portfolio of improvement projects executed by the various entities within the Canada Region:

Maintains an overview of the Region's strengths and weaknesses. Recommends priority areas for improvement.
Ensures that the objectives of new initiatives are consistent and aligned with regional and corporate strategy.
Reviews and validates their business plans. Constructively criticizes the associated action plans.
Monitors their progress and the operational and financial results achieved. Intervenes actively where necessary, including assisting in resource mobilization.
Collaborates with Finance business partners to integrate the result of its actions into the Region's budget and financial reports.

 The VP Transformation will ensure the consideration of the specific context and needs of the Canada Region in corporate initiatives. They will coordinate between these initiatives and those initiated by the Region itself.
 The VP Transformation also directly leads several critical initiatives for the Canada Region, including:

Enhanced integration of the Region to maximize commercial (cross-selling, bundled offers) and operational synergies.

 - Accelerated deployment of digital tools and - where necessary - adjustment of engineering, operations & maintenance, and project management processes

Optimization of operational performance management systems


 For organizations: by strengthening the alignment of performance metrics with value creation drivers and management discipline at all levels.
 For projects: by improving the robustness of planning and monitoring deviations from the plan.


 - Implementation of a continuous improvement routine in all Canada Region organizations - with particular emphasis on reducing non-value-added 'bureaucratic' tasks.

 PROFILE Requirements
 Education and experience

 MBA, Bachelor of Engineering or other relevant discipline
 And/or, can demonstrate 10 - 15 years of experience in relevant senior roles: piloting transformation plans, strategy and management consulting, project & program management or operations
 Successful experience in implementing improvement/transformation plans, from concept through to operational implementation


 SKILLS
 o Strategic thinking: ability to define transformation vision
 o Leadership and communication excellence (English)

 Ability to inspire and lead teams through profound change
 Ability to engage teams at all levels of the organization around vision and transformation plans
 Ability to build strong and trusting relationships with operational and corporate teams in order to mobilize relevant contributors across the company and drive adoption of new ways of working;
 Ability to lead multi-disciplinary work teams, resolve conflicts
 Perseverance and adaptability
 Autonomy and results orientation

 o Ability to manage a large portfolio of tasks and move between a supervisory or execution role depending on the subject.
 o Analytical and problem-solving skills
 o Mastery of change management principles and practices
 o Understanding of engineering, operations & maintenance and project management business processes
 o Understanding of the digital ecosystem

 LOCATION AND TRAVEL

The position will ideally be based in Toronto

 - Regular national travel (10% - 15%)

 About AtkinsRéalis
 Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people.  AtkinsRéalis has been dedicated to providing engineering services for bridges, tunnels and transportation structure in Canada. Our department has enables professionals (engineers and technicians) to achieve a career in this field and to develop expertise in design, technical assistance, construction administration and inspection for structures of all sizes, including some of the most prominent in Canada. Our aim is to offer expertise and professional services that meet the current and future needs of all our clients. In Canada, our Bridge department has offices in Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal and Québec City. AtkinsRealis also has a large international presence with over 700 bridge professionals globally, and involvement in some of the most complex structures in the world.

 The Bridges Department is looking for a Bridge and Structures Manager for our team in Ontario.

 Reporting to the Director of Bridges, the Manager, Bridges Center will be responsible for developing services for different clients (public and private), as well as managing and developing the Toronto team. The Team Leader is responsible for leading, accompanying, supporting and guiding the employees (engineers and technicians) of their team, as well as collaborating with other team leaders and other AtkinsRéalis units, maintaining and developing new expertise in transportation structure and to offer a high-level of service that meets the needs, expectations and requirements of customers and owners of structures, within their timelines and budget constraints.

 As a bridge and structures Manager, you will support and develop the technical knowledge of professionals (engineers and technicians) who carry out studies, evaluations, preliminary projects, design and tender preparation for the construction and/or rehabilitation of bridges and other structures, as well as inspections and asset management activities.
 The Manager, Bridge Center liaises with public and regulatory bodies. He/she will network with other professionals and develop new business.

 Your role within the team

 Support the strategic direction for Bridges and Structures Canada.
 Develop and maintain client relationships.
 Manage the staff of the team he supervises.
 Lead proposal development, including preparation of qualifications, bids and narrative submissions.
 Project Management and Project Management Oversight.
 Carry out technical activities of projects.

 The ideal candidate

 Member of Professional Engineers Ontario. Bachelor of Civil Engineering required. Masters of Business Administration is an asset.
 Have more than 15 years of experience in the design and implementation and managing a technical team.
 Have successfully assumed the role of project manager for at least 10 years.
 Have carried out and actively participated in large-scale projects in engineering structures.
 Experience on projects and Solid working relationship with clients like MTO, TTC, GO Transit/Metrolinx, and Municipalities.

Conseiller (e ) stratégique sénior(e ) en batteries de véhicules électriques

 La division procédés industriels chez AtkinsRéalis propose des solutions d'ingénierie, d'approvisionnement, de construction et de financement de pointe pour des projets dans plus de 100 pays à travers le monde. Du Grand Nord canadien à l'Afrique australe en passant par l'Océanie, notre effectif multiculturel est animé par une grande fierté pour son travail et une vision tournée vers l'avenir. AtkinsRéalis est véritablement un leader mondial dans son domaine et a été sélectionné pour concevoir et construire certains des projets les plus prestigieux au monde.

 Votre rôle au sein de l'équipe :

 Pour réussir dans ce rôle, la personne sera chargée, entre autres, des missions suivantes :

 Consulter les clients, les conseiller, identifier et résoudre les problèmes liés aux processus.
 Concevoir de manière conceptuelle, basique et détaillée les processus de fabrication de batteries et les processus de fabrication assistée par ordinateur (FAO).

 Élaborer l'architecture des processus aux premières étapes des projets.

 Diriger les efforts de conception des processus sur des projets internationaux.


 Diriger l'équipe d'ingénierie des procédés pour :

 Élaborer des schémas de procédé, des PFD, des PID, des plans et des bilans thermiques et matériels.

 Participer aux réunions mensuelles de revue de projet et effectuer les actions nécessaires.
 Gérer et surveiller la qualité des livrables et des services conformément au contrat.
 Effectuer la clôture du projet selon les processus internes de qualité.

At United we are a team of engineers, builders, planners and thinkers that design and build today’s infrastructure, for tomorrow. We come to work every day committed to drive growth and deliver projects that matter for our clients, ourselves, and our communities. Through our work in the nuclear, conventional generation, renewable and power delivery markets, we create resilient infrastructure to last generations.

 ABOUT THE PROJECT

 The Shoreline Power Group is a fully integrated Joint Venture of Aecon, United and AtkinsRéalis located in Kincardine, Ontario. Shoreline Power Group is the centerpiece of the Major Component Replacement (MCR) program which replaces the main components of 6 reactors at the Bruce Power Nuclear Generating Station. The scope of work includes the removal and replacement of calandria tubes, pressure tubes, and feeders as well as construction management and trade labor. This project is part of Bruce Power’s Life Extension Program, which will allow Bruce Power’s CANDU units to continue to operate safely through to 2064.

 PURPOSE OF THE POSITION

 Reporting to the Contracts Manager, the Contracts Coordinator is responsible for providing accurate and timely commercial advice, consistent with their education, training, and experience, all in accordance with Contracts Manager direction, home companies’ and Joint Venture project requirements and policies.


 WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING



 Work closely with Contracts Administration and Contracts Management to create and maintain a cohesive and dependable Commercial Team. 
Help ensure that Commercial contractual obligations are identified and met by the Joint Venture.
Assist project staff with identification, documentation, notification, and quantification of changes in the Work and claims.
Assist in expediting contractual notices and correspondence, and follow-ups as necessary.
Draft commercial letters to client and subcontractors.
Maintain appropriate contract records. 
Attend and support customer and JV project meetings and reviews.
Assist project staff with the interpretation and practical application of contract documents.
Support close functional interface between Commercial, Finance and Project Controls. 
Other duties as assigned.



 WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU



 Technical or business post-secondary education.
Minimum 2-5 years of experience in the project management / contract administration.
Knowledge of construction project operations, policies, and procedures.
Basic knowledge of construction planning, scheduling, and management.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.).
Proven attention to detail.
Organization and strong time management skills.
Ability to work accurately under pressure.
Strong communication skills - oral and written.
Must be a self-starter attitude with proactive, results-oriented focus; and willing and capable to assume additional responsibilities and proven ability to multi-task.



 OTHER QUALIFICATIONS



 Our background check process includes a full security check and clearance process as well as reference checks. The security clearance process includes a comprehensive list of previous residences, employment, education, and other pertinent information. Those with a valid Bruce Power security clearance are strongly preferred.



 United offers a benefit rich offering to our employees. United provides access to Extended Heath Care, Vision Coverage, Dental Coverage, Health Spending Accounts, Critical Illness Coverage, Life and AD&D Coverage and Disability Coverage for Short and Long Term Disability. United supports life balance by offering a competitive PTO program in addition to paid holidays. We enjoy a great wellness program with regular incentives.

 The Engineering services division is currently looking for a Senior Code Consultant for its National Capital Region office in Ottawa, ON.  Investigate and report on building and fire code compliance of new and existing facilities.

 Produce building evacuation plans and conduct egress analysis and modeling.

 Coordinate with other disciplines in planning and executing project tasks.
 Represent the fire protection discipline within AtkinsRéalis and in the development of external clients.

Commercial / Risk Manager 

Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 AtkinsRéalis’s Minerals and Metals team in Canada is made up of more than 400 employees who work on large-scale projects to support mining sustainability, pit-to-port opportunities, metallurgical plant engineering, or mine closure and capabilities in the study, design, and construction of mining projects across a wide range of mining and processing methods and commodities. The team combines global-caliber expertise to provide tailored solutions for projects of any size, scope, or complexity. We believe in working openly and transparently, together, delivering world-class projects. We work collaboratively with teams across the world, from Canada to Brazil in the south to India in the east, delivering exceptional value and innovation to our clients. To support our growth initiatives, we are expanding our team and are looking for innovative, forward-thinking people who enjoy challenges and want to add value to project success, both locally and internationally.

 We are seeking a Commercial / Risk Manager to join our Global Minerals & Metals (M&M) team and to support our growth to align with the demand to supply responsibly sourced critical minerals. The Commercial Manager is someone who has sound commercial knowledge of all commercial aspects related to bids and project execution. The Commercial Manager will provide commercial support and assistance to the Mining & Metallurgy (M&M) North America and other Global M&M offices on as needed basis.

 There are two key aspects of the role, one will be developing and building strong relationships with internal clients, and another will be supporting the leadership, development, and progression of the commercial function. You’ll have the ability and the desire to manage teams and deliver all aspects of your work to a very high standard. You will be able to work both independently and within the team.

 This opportunity will be to support the M&M business located in Toronto, ON. The candidate would be located in any of the major cities of Canada.

 Your role within the team: 


Implement commercial best practices to maximize value and minimize risk and cost, including coordinating commercial support and legal reviews for client submissions.
 Participate in proposal kick-off and follow-up meetings, reviewing Request for Proposals (RFPs) and developing commercial strategy for bids, presenting it to Commercial Director and Senior Management.
 Review contracts with corporate insurance, treasury, taxation, and legal teams, while coordinating with engineering and project management disciplines to develop cost estimates and price sheets for service mandates.
 Ensure internal risk committee presentations are complete with relevant commercial information, document minutes and action items, and follow up on action items.
 Negotiate, manage, and coordinate contracts, non-disclosure agreements, and trading agreements and lead the development of innovative commercial models.
 Ensure all commercial bids are complete and submitted on time to meet deadlines, documenting all relevant commercial information for records and audit purposes.
 Manage risk on bids and projects, including claims management and providing commercial and contractual support and guidance to Project Managers.

Highway Maintenance Operator
AtkinsRéalis provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision. AtkinsRéalis is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.
Brun-Way Highways Operations Inc. is a branch within AtkinsRéalis responsible for 275 kilometers of the Trans-Canada Highway, from the Quebec border to Longs Creek (West of Fredericton) and Route 95 between Woodstock and the Houlton Border, until the year 2033. The Brun-Way project has met the client’s goals of reducing maintenance costs, continuously improving performance anddelivering one of the most efficient and modern highways in the world. Safety targets have been met every year, with a dramatic reduction in the number of road incidents. The project’s success hasbeen recognized with numerous awards for safety, innovation, and Operations & Maintenance excellence.
We are seeking a full-time Highway Maintenance Operator to join our team at Brun-Way. This position is responsible for operating a variety of equipment and performing manual labor required to maintain the highway and right-of-way assets to ensure conformance of the designated section of the highway with required Operation, Maintenance, and Rehabilitation (OMR) standards and contractual requirements.
Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!
Your role within the team:

Operate highway vehicles, equipment and tools including but not limited to snowplow trucks, dump body trucks, loaders, Skid Steer loaders, tractors, light vehicles, etc. required to maintain and repair the highway surfaces and other assets in a safe condition according to OMR standards and contractual requirements.
Perform general maintenance activities of vehicles and equipment, such as pre-trip inspections activities, greasing and washing.
Perform general manual labour required to maintain and repair the highway and related corridor assets (including, but not limited to, traffic control, grass cutting, drainage facilities, signs, asphalt and concrete patching and other assets, spring debris clean-up, litter removal, etc.).
Perform planned and emergency traffic control signing and services, and assist in accident response and site clean-up, in compliance with the Work Area Traffic Control Manual and safety standards.
Prepare daily work records of activities, including equipment operating times and vehicle performance.
Assist the Mechanics in routine vehicle and equipment maintenance and repairs, as needed
Assist in yard maintenance and general good house-keeping clean-up practices.
Assist with the annual detailed inspections for the highway asset management system.
Required to work scheduled rotating shifts during Winter Operations.
Required to be on rotating on-call schedule during Summer Operations for after-hour incident response.
Flexible to work at different locations along the Facility (from Long’s Creek to Quebec Border).

Why pick AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

The opportunity to work on an innovative and award-winning project
An exciting environment where work-life balance is important;
A wide array of learning and development opportunities;
Competitive salary, great benefits, an employee share ownership plan and also a defined contribution pension plan;
A work environment focused on health and safety.

The ideal candidate:

Minimum 2 years’ previous job-related experience preferred.
General knowledge of highway operations and working experience with various types of vehicles and equipment used in road maintenance activities is preferred.
Valid Class 1 or Class 3 driver license with commercial vehicle endorsement (with air brake) is required.
Clean driving record is required.
Attention to detail with a focus on accuracy, efficiency, and compliance with defined standards.
Good personal documentation and problem solving.
Capable of lifting heavy objects on occasion.

Ability to deal with the public in a calm, patient, and professional manner.

 À propos d’AtkinsRéalis

 Issue de l’intégration d’organisations établies de longue date, la première en 1911, AtkinsRéalis est une entreprise mondiale de pointe de services professionnels et de gestion de projet, dédiée à façonner un meilleur avenir pour notre planète et ceux qui l’habitent. Nous créons des solutions durables qui lient individus, données et technologie pour transformer les infrastructures et les systèmes énergétiques du monde. Nous déployons des capacités mondiales à l’échelle locale pour fournir à nos clients des services uniques et complets couvrant tout le cycle de vie d’un actif — consultation, services-conseils et services environnementaux, réseaux intelligents et cybersécurité, conception et ingénierie, approvisionnement, gestion de projet et de construction, exploitation et entretien, mise hors service et capital. Nous offrons l’ampleur et la profondeur de nos capacités dans des secteurs stratégiques clés tels que Services d’ingénierie, Énergie nucléaire, Exploitation et entretien et Capital.

 Chez AtkinsRéalis, nous cherchons à embaucher des individus possédant des caractéristiques, parcours et perspectives diversifiées. Nous croyons fermement que le talent de classe mondiale ne fait aucune distinction à l’égard du genre, de l’origine ethnique ou nationale, de l’identité et de l’orientation sexuelle, de l’âge, de la religion ou de la déficience, mais s’enrichit plutôt de ces différences.

Independently evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering techniques, procedures and criteria using judgement in making minor adaptations and modifications.

 Work objectives are specific, and supervision is usually general; the details of the work are not normally closely supervised but this may vary with the assignment.
 Normally required to plan, schedule and manage own time, including taking into account the plans of others.

 Plans and executes work consistent with quality, cost, and schedule requirements.

 As a new member of the Nuclear Steam Plant (NSP) electrical engineering department, you will involved with a variety of exciting projects supporting the design and modifications for the electrical power system for Candu and other Nuclear power plants. This role will require carrying out various duties involved with conceptual, preliminary and detailed engineering as well as procurement support for associated electrical power system equipment.

 This position is for an experienced individual who is extremely self-motivated and looking to further develop his/her career in the nuclear field. The candidate shall be able perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulatory requirements as well as coordinate and interface with colleagues and the client to execute assigned engineering work. Duties can also include supervision and leading of a team of other engineers.

 How will you contribute to the team? 

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

 Perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy procedures and QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulatory requirements.
 Coordinate and interface with client(s), suppliers, stakeholders and other design disciplines to execute assigned engineering work.
 Become involved in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design phases to support CANDU and other Nuclear electrical systems and modifications.
 Prepare technical documents, such as: engineering drawings (including GAs, DDs, EDs), change paper markups, calculations, design/analysis reports, design requirements, design manuals, bill of materials, design specifications, technical specifications, component specification sheets, commissioning specifications, etc.
 Participate in review of interfacing discipline’s documentation.
 Prepare requisitions or Engineering Quotation Requests (EQR) for equipment and materials to support procurement.
 Interface and provide technical guidance and instruction to Designers/Drafters.
 Supervising, coordinating and reviewing the work of junior and assistant engineers/ designers; preparing estimates and monitoring schedules and assigns work to meet completion dates to team members.
 Prepare scope of work and input to bid proposals.
 Perform field walk-downs during different design phases, and prepare Walkdown reports as required.
 Assist field construction and execution activities, such as: field changes, design revisions, commissioning, AFS, closeout, etc.
 Complete the assigned scopes or tasks within given budget and schedule, and in good quality.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matters.

 What will you contribute? 

Engineering Degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited university or equivalent degree as recognized by Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO).
 Registered as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario.
 15+ years of related work experience in electrical engineering and power systems design in the Nuclear industry.
 Good knowledge and experience of CANDU nuclear electrical power systems.
 Good working knowledge of applicable codes and standards, such as of CSA 22.1, Canadian Electrical Code Part I and The Ontario Electrical Safety Code (OESC).
 Experience with medium voltage and low voltage power distribution systems, including preparation of Single Line diagrams, Elementary Diagrams, Wiring Diagrams, Cable Block Diagrams and schedules, and calculation of power demand/ electrical load lists.
 Experience with transformer sizing, cable sizing, circuit breaker sizing calculations.
 Familiar with specifying and procurement support for electrical equipment such as Transformers, MCCs, low voltage distribution load centers, UPS systems including rectifiers and inverters and Diesel Generators (emergency and standby), power and control and instrumentation cables.
 Experience in modelling electrical power systems and use of analysis functions in ETAP, or other similar software program is an asset.
 Shall have fundamental technical knowledge to resolve engineering issues or technical problems.
 Shall have excellent communication and technical writing skills and good ability to interact and communicate (both verbal and in writing) professionally with colleagues, clients and contractors.
 Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment.
 Site experience in construction, or commissioning of electrical systems for nuclear or other heavy industries would be an asset.
 Already is or is willing to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW).

 AtkinsRéalis is in search of a Lead Estimator to join a transformative transit infrastructure project in Calgary.

 The Green Line LRT (light rail transit) Project is the largest infrastructure investment in Calgary’s history. It comes with $5.5 billion in commitments from the Government of Canada, Government of Alberta and The City of Calgary. The Green Line LRT is designed to be both a transit system and a platform for future city building opportunities. It encourages redevelopment and investment in Calgary businesses and communities. At 18-kms, Phase 1 will create 20,000 jobs, $2.2B in long-term city-shaping benefits and more than $6B in property value uplift by 2040.

 This role will be based in Calgary, AB.

 Review the project design drawings and specifications to determine assigned scope of work. Collaborate to the development of the Work Breakdown Structure.

 Develop conceptual and feasibility cost model estimates utilizing historic benchmarking information and industry experience from limited information for early-stage estimates.
 Prepare and develop detailed quantity takeoff when sufficient information is available. Develop construction hours, composite crew rates and productivity factors.
 Review estimates prepared by other estimating groups to determine estimate completeness and procedures.
 Organize, coordinate, and manage required staff resources, both locally and remotely, to complete conceptual and detailed estimates. Responsible for proper training of new Estimators, when necessary.

 Vice-Président, Chef de la Pratique en Structure de Bâtiment

 Sous la supervision du Vice-Président, Ingénierie et Conception (E&D), le Chef de la Pratique sera responsable de la performance opérationnelle globale de la Pratique en Structure de Bâtiment, supervisant près de 130 ingénieurs, professionnels et techniciens.

 En collaborant avec nos différentes pratiques, marchés, équipes de Win Work et de livraison de projets, le Chef de la Pratique en Structure de Bâtiment veillera à ce que les services techniques en structure de bâtiment soient livrés de manière très efficace et de qualité, pour soutenir le succès et la durabilité globaux de l'entreprise au Canada.

 Les principales mesures de succès pour ce rôle incluent l'atteinte des objectifs de chargeabilité, la livraison telle que vendue, la garantie de la conformité globale du personnel avec les nouvelles procédures et processus, la garantie de la qualité technique dans la pratique et l'utilisation de GTC, ainsi qu'un accent sur le personnel.

 Votre rôle au sein de l'équipe :

 Assurer la collaboration au sein de la Pratique en Structure de Bâtiment et avec d'autres Pratiques, Marchés, Win Work, et équipes de livraison de projets pour garantir le partage efficace des ressources et l'équilibrage de la charge de travail.
 Fournir un leadership opérationnel à la Pratique en Structure de Bâtiment en affectant des équipes d'ingénieurs et de techniciens aux projets.
 Assurer l'application des normes techniques de l'entreprise sur les projets, fournir des orientations techniques au cas par cas, et superviser la qualité du travail technique fourni.
 Élaborer des plans pour développer les compétences en ingénierie et en technique, les alignant sur les besoins du marché et l'évolution technologique.
 Optimiser le taux d'utilisation des ingénieurs et des techniciens.
 Affecter des équipes d'ingénieurs/techniciens pour soutenir les marchés dans leurs efforts de vente (contributions aux propositions, présentations clients).
 Garantir que les efforts de vente menés par l'équipe E&D sont conformes au mandat défini par les Marchés (modèle de vendeur-faiseur).
 Mettre en œuvre les stratégies E&D et ES Canada en collaboration avec les leaders E&D et les responsables de la pratique pour impliquer le personnel à tous les niveaux, unissant l'opération autour d'une vision commune pour atteindre les objectifs.
 Collaborer avec les leaders au niveau national et dans d'autres géographies pour exploiter l'expertise technique au sein de la Pratique en Structure de Bâtiment.
 Fournir un leadership en identifiant les membres clés de l'équipe de livraison pour une soumission en collaboration avec les Marchés et Win Work. Contribuer aux propositions et participer aux décisions d'acceptation ou de refus.
 S'assurer que la Pratique en Structure de Bâtiment est mise en place pour livrer efficacement les projets en cours et sécuriser la charge de travail future.
 Maximiser le flux de travail pour la Pratique en Structure de Bâtiment vers le Centre Technique Global (GTC) basé en Inde.
 Contribuer au processus de planification des ressources humaines pour la Pratique en Structure de Bâtiment afin de garantir les compétences et capacités appropriées pour réaliser nos stratégies actuelles et futures en réponse aux facteurs externes et internes.
 Inspirer et cultiver une culture d'excellence et d'innovation qui offre des résultats exceptionnels pour les clients, reconnus par des récompenses de l'industrie et des retours de clients exceptionnels/répétés.
 Être un leader de la culture de la sécurité, de l'éthique et de la conformité, de l'égalité, de la diversité et de l'inclusion de SNC-Lavalin.
 Effectuer d'autres tâches assignées/nécessaires.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ?
 Parce que nous offrons :

 L'opportunité de travailler sur divers projets majeurs pour des clients internes et externes.
 Un environnement passionnant où l'équilibre entre travail et vie personnelle est important.
 Une vaste gamme d'opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement.
 Une rémunération compétitive, des avantages sociaux flexibles, un plan d'achat d'actions pour les employés et un régime de retraite à cotisations définies.
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et la sécurité.


 Le candidat idéal :

 Minimum de 15 ans d'expérience dans les domaines de la Structure de Bâtiment ou des domaines connexes.
 Diplôme universitaire en ingénierie ou un domaine similaire.
 Minimum de 10 ans d'expérience dans des rôles opérationnels commerciaux, dirigeant de grandes équipes et des projets dans différents endroits.
 Expérience antérieure au sein d'une équipe de direction, démontrant la capacité à créer des collaborations mutuellement bénéfiques.
 Solides compétences en leadership démontrées par la collaboration, l'empathie et le développement des employés.
 Un dossier éprouvé de performances dans des rôles pertinents.
 Centré sur le client et capable de garantir la réussite du client et/ou des ventes.
 Expérience en gestion financière et commerciale avec une compréhension de la maximisation des opportunités de revenus et de marge.
 Si vous êtes dans la province du Québec, la connaissance du français et de l'anglais est requise, car ce rôle implique des interactions avec des parties prenantes et des organisations à travers le Canada et à l'international.
 Si vous êtes en dehors de la province du Québec, la connaissance de l'anglais est requise et le français est considéré comme un atout.

Deputy Construction Director 

Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is in search of a Deputy Construction Director to join a transformative transit infrastructure project in Calgary. 

The Green Line LRT (light rail transit) Project is the largest infrastructure investment in Calgary’s history. It comes with $5.5 billion in commitments from the Government of Canada, Government of Alberta and The City of Calgary. The Green Line LRT is designed to be both a transit system and a platform for future city building opportunities. It encourages redevelopment and investment in Calgary businesses and communities. At 18-kms, Phase 1 will create 20,000 jobs, $2.2B in long-term city-shaping benefits and more than $6B in property value uplift by 2040.

 You will be embedded within the client office team environment, and as such you are required to be in downtown Calgary, for the full working week.

 Your role within the team:

 Ensure that all construction works are in accordance with design specifications and are carried out in accordance with budget and quality standards.
 Provide a broad range of high quality and reliable construction expertise in a proactive manner.
 Provides field execution leadership during the construction phase.
 Receive functional and operational guidance from the Construction Director and provide technical and administrative guidance to construction personnel on site.
 Lead the development and implementation of a training program for junior staff as well as all project security programs while ensuring they strictly adhere to federal and national security codes.
 Maintain ongoing contact with customers, subcontractors and suppliers.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 University degree in engineering or construction management or equivalent.
 Minimum of 15 years of experience in construction management/ project management, including 5years as a supervisor and director of major construction projects of $500M or more.
 Experience in design and supervision of infrastructure construction.
 Experience working and coordinating the technical aspects of bids.
 15 years of experience in the realization and management of major rail and / or road infrastructure projects and / or passenger transport in a similar role.
 Participation in a similar role for at least 3 years on an LRT project.
 Experience in Target Price project is a plus.
 Experience in tunnels, heavy civils is a plus.
 Combination of contractor and owner side experience is a plus.
