Why join us?
 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!
 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.
 AtkinsRéalis provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

 AtkinsRéalis is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world. 

We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world since for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology and to apply our extensive knowledge to service the BWR/PWR market. Our expertise includes: Nuclear Steam Plant (NSP) engineering, Balance of Plant (BOP) engineering, Plant Life Management and Extension, Retube Tooling Systems, Inspection and Maintenance Services, Steam Generator Replacement, Plant Equipment Refurbishment and Retrofits.

 As a new member of the Nuclear Steam Plant (NSP) electrical engineering department, you will involved with a variety of exciting projects supporting the design and modifications for the electrical power system for Candu and other Nuclear power plants. This role will require carrying out various duties involved with conceptual, preliminary and detailed engineering as well as procurement support for associated electrical power system equipment.

 This position is for an experienced individual who is extremely self-motivated and looking to further develop his/her career in the nuclear field. The candidate shall be able perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulatory requirements as well as coordinate and interface with colleagues and the client to execute assigned engineering work. Duties can also include supervision and leading of a team of other engineers.

 How will you contribute to the team? 

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

 Perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy procedures and QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulatory requirements.
 Coordinate and interface with client(s), suppliers, stakeholders and other design disciplines to execute assigned engineering work.
 Become involved in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design phases to support CANDU and other Nuclear electrical systems and modifications.
 Prepare technical documents, such as: engineering drawings (including GAs, DDs, EDs), change paper markups, calculations, design/analysis reports, design requirements, design manuals, bill of materials, design specifications, technical specifications, component specification sheets, commissioning specifications, etc.
 Participate in review of interfacing discipline’s documentation.
 Prepare requisitions or Engineering Quotation Requests (EQR) for equipment and materials to support procurement.
 Interface and provide technical guidance and instruction to Designers/Drafters.
 Supervising, coordinating and reviewing the work of junior and assistant engineers/ designers; preparing estimates and monitoring schedules and assigns work to meet completion dates to team members.
 Prepare scope of work and input to bid proposals.
 Perform field walk-downs during different design phases, and prepare Walkdown reports as required.
 Assist field construction and execution activities, such as: field changes, design revisions, commissioning, AFS, closeout, etc.
 Complete the assigned scopes or tasks within given budget and schedule, and in good quality.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matters.

 What will you contribute? 

Engineering Degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited university or equivalent degree as recognized by Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO).
 Registered as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario.
 15+ years of related work experience in electrical engineering and power systems design in the Nuclear industry.
 Good knowledge and experience of CANDU nuclear electrical power systems.
 Good working knowledge of applicable codes and standards, such as of CSA 22.1, Canadian Electrical Code Part I and The Ontario Electrical Safety Code (OESC).
 Experience with medium voltage and low voltage power distribution systems, including preparation of Single Line diagrams, Elementary Diagrams, Wiring Diagrams, Cable Block Diagrams and schedules, and calculation of power demand/ electrical load lists.
 Experience with transformer sizing, cable sizing, circuit breaker sizing calculations.
 Familiar with specifying and procurement support for electrical equipment such as Transformers, MCCs, low voltage distribution load centers, UPS systems including rectifiers and inverters and Diesel Generators (emergency and standby), power and control and instrumentation cables.
 Experience in modelling electrical power systems and use of analysis functions in ETAP, or other similar software program is an asset.
 Shall have fundamental technical knowledge to resolve engineering issues or technical problems.
 Shall have excellent communication and technical writing skills and good ability to interact and communicate (both verbal and in writing) professionally with colleagues, clients and contractors.
 Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment.
 Site experience in construction, or commissioning of electrical systems for nuclear or other heavy industries would be an asset.
 Already is or is willing to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW).


 What we offer at AtkinsRéalis: 

At AtkinsRéalis, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

Directeur(trice), gestion des réclamations d’assurance

 AtkinsRéalis est à la recherche d’un directeur pour la gestion de ses réclamations d’assurance. Vous devrez posséder dix (10 ans) d'expérience dans la gestion des réclamations et ferez partie intégrante du département se rapportant à la vice-présidente, gestion globale des assurances. Dans ce rôle, vous serez responsable d’analyser et gérer les dossiers de réclamations, en collaboration avec les unités d’exploitation et la fonction juridique afin de déterminer la couverture d'assurance applicable, développer des stratégies de défense de la réclamation et recommander les montants de réserves à prendre sur les réclamations. Vous soutiendrez l’équipe dans l’élaboration et l’exécution de la stratégie de financement des risques assurables de AtkinsRéalis. Vous préparerez des rapports trimestriels des réclamations pour nos assureurs et fournirez les informations requises sur le statut des réclamations aux parties prenantes internes et externes (tels assureurs, finance d'entreprise, audit interne et externe, courtiers, etc.).

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe

 Au sein de l’équipe gestion globale des assurances, vous relèverez de la Vice-présidente, gestion globale des assurances et vous aurez à :


 Gérer toutes les questions reliées aux réclamations d’assurance de la compagnie;
 Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les chefs de unités d’exploitation, les directeurs de projets et ingénieurs, et le service juridique en charge des projets dans le cadre du processus de gestion et de résolution des sinistres;
 Déterminer la (les) couverture (s) des polices d'assurance applicables et veiller à ce que les réclamations soient rapportées dans les délais aux assureurs et aux courtiers d'assurance
 Produire des rapports sur le développement des réclamations ainsi que la justification de l'établissement des réserves;
 Participer à l’élaboration et à l’exécution de la stratégie globale de financement des risques assurables de SNC-Lavalin
 Être à jour sur les tendances en matière de couverture d'assurance, des précédents juridiques majeurs en matière de couverture d'assurance et des innovations en matière de couverture des polices
 Donner le support nécessaire au reste de l’équipe d’assurance sur toutes les questions concernant les réclamations.


 Pourquoi choisir AtkinsRéalis comme employeur ?

 Parce que nous offrons notamment :

 l’opportunité de travailler sur des projets variés et d’envergure autant à l’interne qu’à l’externe, au Canada et dans le monde entier;
 un milieu de vie stimulant où l’équilibre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle est important;
 l’accès à une offre de formations diversifiées axées sur le développement et les intérêts de chacun;

 Director - Insurance Claims Management 

AtkinsRéalis is seeking a Director to handle its Insurance Claims Management. You will have at least the (10) years of experience with the handling of insurance claims and will be part of the Insurance Department, reporting to the Vice President, Global Insurance Risk Management. You will be responsible to actively analyze the various claims, together with the Business Units and AtkinsRéalis Legal function to determine applicable insurance coverage, develop strategies of defending the claim, and recommend reserve amounts to be taken on claims. You will also have a role in developing and executing AtkinsRéalis insurable risk financing strategy. You will prepare quarterly status reports on the development of the claims for our insurance carriers and you will provide timely input on claim status to all internal and external stakeholders (e.g. insurers, corporate finance, audit, brokers, etc.).
 Your role within the Team

 As a member of the Global Insurance Risk Management team, you will report to the Vice President, Global Insurance Risk Management and be responsible for:


 Responsible for the management and handling of all Company’s insurance claims
 Work in close collaboration with business unit heads, project managers, engineers, and legal department responsible in the claim management and resolution process; Determine applicable insurance policy coverage(s), and ensure timely reporting of claims to the relevant insurers and insurance brokers;
 Responsible for the development and production of the status reports on the claim development as well as justification for reserve setting;
 Participate in the development and execution of SNC-Lavalin’s overall insurable risk financing strategyBe aware of insurance coverage trends, major legal precedents with respect to insurance coverage, and policy coverage innovations;
 Support the rest of the insurance team with any claims related matters


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an Employer?

 Because we offer:


 The opportunity to work on diverse and large-scale projects, both domestically and internationally.
 A stimulating work environment where work-life balance is valued.
 Access to a wide range of training opportunities focused on individual development and interests.
 Competitive salary, flexible benefits, share ownership plan, and defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment that prioritizes health and safety.


 Qualifications for the Position


 University degree, preferably in law, however candidates with degrees in business, finance, accounting, or engineering will also be considered
 Previous role as a lawyer with experience in insurance coverage, defense of insured professionals, professional liability and/or construction claims loss adjuster, claims manager within a major insurance company, claims advocacy role within a major insurance broker, or other similar experience
 CIP or CRM qualification (an asset)
 Strategic and critical thinking with strong analytical skills
 Capacity to work on many files simultaneously, manage timelines and priorities
 Strong knowledge of engineering and construction contracts, project execution, commercial issues and project management
 Knowledgeable of the legal system in Quebec and Canada, with an ability to become familiar with foreign legal systems as required
 Knowledgeable in the key insurance products available to a global Engineering & Construction business
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills
 Strong initiative-taking capabilities and appetite for challenging mandates
 Team player with the ability to work autonomously
 Capacity to build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders
 Very good working knowledge of various office software [Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel]
 High integrity
 Bilingual (French and English)

Intermediate Solid Waste Management Engineer

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 The Environment division of AtkinsRéalis is a rapidly growing full-service consulting firm that is committed to technical excellence and exceptional service to our clients. Our growing organization is seeking like-minded individuals to join our team. Individuals who join our team can expect to work closely with senior technical experts and professionals in a wide variety of fields, collaborating across regions and groups to provide the high-quality technical solutions that our clients expect, while receiving unparalleled mentorship and long-term career growth opportunities. The work environment is dynamic and flexible, offering a strong emphasis on health and safety, continuous training, and competitive compensation and benefits.

 We have one of the most experienced environmental and geosciences engineering consulting teams in Canada, and we are seeking an Intermediate Solid Waste Management Engineer to join our team. This position is based in our Toronto, Ancaster, Ottawa, or Edmonton offices. However, consideration will be given to other locations where AtkinsRéalis has Canadian offices. This position is office/hybrid work based, focused on projects providing support on projects across Canada and internationally where needed.

 The successful candidate will bring practical, progressive experience in solid waste management and be able to communicate effectively with our staff and clients, applying their technical skills and knowledge on a project basis. Liaising with regulatory agencies, networking with professionals, and developing business would be secondary duties in this role.

 Your role within the team

 Participation in projects of varying complexity involving the engineering design for solid waste management facilities, including some or all of landfills, organics processing, material recovery facilities, transfer stations and public drop-off facilities – tasks may include detailed design, preparation of technical specifications, cost estimating, tender support, and construction supervision/contract administration services.
 Support waste planning opportunities, including preparing design and operations plans; generating or modifying monitoring plans for groundwater, surface water and landfill gas; and obtaining environmental compliance approvals and amendments for waste operations, air quality and stormwater management discharges.
 Project coordination and management, tracking costs and managing budgets, hiring, and directing subcontractors, etc.
 Liaising with clients and regulatory agencies.
 Executing technical tasks requiring accuracy in calculations, completeness, and adherence to prescribed data testing methods.
 Preparing reports, proposals, and other project documents of varying complexity.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate

 Degree in Engineering (Geological, Environmental, Biosystems, Civil, or other relevant engineering backgrounds), Environmental Sciences, Earth Sciences, Geology, Hydrogeology, or relevant field and be licensed as a Professional Engineer (P. Eng) or eligible for licensure within 6 months of hire. Licensure or consideration for obtaining licensing in multiple Provinces would be considered an additional asset.
 A minimum of 5 years of practical, progressive solid waste management consulting experience including relevant experience in various facets of the waste management sector.
 Possess demonstrable knowledge and skills in at least one of the following relevant disciplines, and demonstrable familiarity with the others, including landfill or facility engineering design/construction management, environmental compliance, and waste management planning support.
 Ability to identify and manage implementation of practical, cost-effective solutions to client problems and/or resolve potential non-compliance situations. Demonstrated expertise in contractor supervision, project management and contract administration.
 Proven technical writing and analytical skills.

 About AtkinsRéalis
 Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. The breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital.

Intermediate Electrical Engineer

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is looking for a Electrical Engineer to join our growing Winnipeg team. In this role you will be responsible for the electrical design and execution of a wide variety of projects, with a focus on industrial, municipal and hydro-electric utilities. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining existing client relationships and developing new clients, coordinating work with other offices and disciplines, and satisfying customer expectations and requirements. Your technical knowledge of low, medium and high voltage electrical distribution and associated protection of electrical equipment will set you apart from other candidates.

 Your role within the team

 The Electrical Engineer will report to the Project Manager and Electrical Department Head who will provide supervision for the electrical design work that includes the following:

 Preparation of electrical single line diagrams, AC control schematics, wiring distribution schemes, panel schedules.
 Development of cable block diagrams and cable and conduit schedules.
 Design of physical layout of electrical equipment, raceway and grounding plans related to the various facilities within the plant.
 Preparation of cable and raceway routing layouts. Arc Flash calculations and label preparation. Work on reports. Perform site visits.
 Design and development of electric heat tracing systems.
 Perform drafting / drawing tasks using AutoCAD.
 Perform design work in accordance with the Canadian Electrical Code.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate

 Completion of an Electrical Engineering degree program. Registration or eligible to be registered with EGM.
 5+ years’ experience in the electrical consulting or construction industries. Knowledge and application of the Canadian electrical code.
 Previous electrical design work experience in heavy industrial and/or mining projects is an asset. Experience in a consulting environment is an asset.
 Experience with AutoCAD and Revit is an asset.
 Must have a valid drivers license.

 About AtkinsRéalis
 Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to transform the world's infrastructure and energy systems. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. The breadth and depth of our capabilities are delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital.

At United we are a team of engineers, builders, planners and thinkers that design and build today’s infrastructure, for tomorrow. We come to work every day committed to drive growth and deliver projects that matter for our clients, ourselves, and our communities. Through our work in the nuclear, conventional generation, renewable and power delivery markets, we create resilient infrastructure to last generations.

 ABOUT THE PROJECT

 The Shoreline Power Group is a fully integrated Joint Venture of Aecon, United and AtkinsRéalis located in Kincardine, Ontario. Shoreline Power Group is the centerpiece of the Major Component Replacement (MCR) program which replaces the main components of 6 reactors at the Bruce Power Nuclear Generating Station. The scope of work includes the removal and replacement of calandria tubes, pressure tubes, and feeders as well as construction management and trade labor. This project is part of Bruce Power’s Life Extension Program, which will allow Bruce Power’s CANDU units to continue to operate safely through to 2064.

 PURPOSE OF THE POSITION

 Reporting to the Contracts Manager, the Contracts Coordinator is responsible for providing accurate and timely commercial advice, consistent with their education, training, and experience, all in accordance with Contracts Manager direction, home companies’ and Joint Venture project requirements and policies.


 WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING



 Work closely with Contracts Administration and Contracts Management to create and maintain a cohesive and dependable Commercial Team. 
Help ensure that Commercial contractual obligations are identified and met by the Joint Venture.
Assist project staff with identification, documentation, notification, and quantification of changes in the Work and claims.
Assist in expediting contractual notices and correspondence, and follow-ups as necessary.
Draft commercial letters to client and subcontractors.
Maintain appropriate contract records. 
Attend and support customer and JV project meetings and reviews.
Assist project staff with the interpretation and practical application of contract documents.
Support close functional interface between Commercial, Finance and Project Controls. 
Other duties as assigned.



 WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU



 Technical or business post-secondary education.
Minimum 2-5 years of experience in the project management / contract administration.
Knowledge of construction project operations, policies, and procedures.
Basic knowledge of construction planning, scheduling, and management.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.).
Proven attention to detail.
Organization and strong time management skills.
Ability to work accurately under pressure.
Strong communication skills - oral and written.
Must be a self-starter attitude with proactive, results-oriented focus; and willing and capable to assume additional responsibilities and proven ability to multi-task.



 OTHER QUALIFICATIONS



 Our background check process includes a full security check and clearance process as well as reference checks. The security clearance process includes a comprehensive list of previous residences, employment, education, and other pertinent information. Those with a valid Bruce Power security clearance are strongly preferred.



 United offers a benefit rich offering to our employees. United provides access to Extended Heath Care, Vision Coverage, Dental Coverage, Health Spending Accounts, Critical Illness Coverage, Life and AD&D Coverage and Disability Coverage for Short and Long Term Disability. United supports life balance by offering a competitive PTO program in addition to paid holidays. We enjoy a great wellness program with regular incentives.

Chemist or Corrosion Engineer

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world since for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology.

 Reporting to the Manager, Feeder & Piping Engineering, Materials, Welding & Chemistry, Chemist or Corrosion Engineer will work on chemistry and corrosion related work, supporting and consultation for manufacturing of nuclear components.

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the team:

 Perform chemistry and corrosion related work in an engineering environment and prepare technical documents following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and (regulation) regulatory? requirements.
 Lead or support improvement materials and manufacturing processes through chemistry considerations.
 Establish and understand chemistry specifications for nuclear power plant systems to prevent degradation of components including new builds, refurbishment projects, and operating Candu stations.
 Assess and evaluate the use of materials (metallic and non metallic) in nuclear systems, components, tooling, and construction; Includes failure analysis.
 Support and consultation for manufacturing of nuclear components (steam generators, heat exchangers, pumps, valves, piping) related to cleanliness, handling, corrosion protection, and inspections.
 Incorporate R&D results and products, in the areas of chemistry, corrosion, and material behaviours, into the CANDU systems and new reactor designs.
 Conduct statistical analysis and modeling of test and plant data.
 Lead or support material degradation testing programs in a test lab environment, and/or work with external testing laboratories.


 Coordinate and interface with clients, suppliers, fabricators, and stakeholders and other design disciplines or department to execute assigned engineering work.
 Provide technical guidance and support and collaborate with other entities including laboratories, and other third parties.
 Perform complex assignments independently or under limited supervision of a senior Chemist, analyst, or engineer.
 May be required to develop and deliver presentations to communicate status, problem resolution or promote related reactor components and Balance of plant equipment.

 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?

 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The Ideal Candidate:

 B. Sc., B. Sc. Eng. Or Graduate degree related to chemistry or Engineering Chemist including courses and/or work experience in such applications.
 Knowledge of process chemistry of nuclear power plants, including primary and secondary water-borne systems, and water radiolysis
 Knowledge of degradation mechanisms impacting metallic and non-metallic materials in nuclear power plant environments, including from the contribution of radiation
 Experience using statistical/data analysis software.
 Basic knowledge of CANDU mechanical and process systems, structures and components is an asset.
 Eligibility to be registered as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario is an asset.
 3-5 years of related work experience in process chemistry or corrosion with specialization in nuclear power plant environments.
 Prior experience working in a lab/testing environment.
 Working knowledge of CSA N285.6 and ASME Section II/III/V/IX codes and any other applicable standards or regulatory guides related to permanent plant components, pressure boundary equipment, and/or reactor systems is preferred.
 Must be able to apply technical principles in a logical and practical manner to resolve engineering issues or technical problems.
 Self initiative to perform research and gather information.
 Ability to communicate effectively, both verbal and written.
 Excellent organizational and time management skills, including considering the plans of others.
 Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and the ability to work cooperatively in a multidisciplinary team.
 Computer skills (Word, Excel) and,
 Willing to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW)

Senior Feeder Support Engineer- Lead

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is one of Canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. We have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in Canada and around the world since for more than 60 years. We are proud to be the steward of Canadian CANDU nuclear technology.

 Reporting to the Manager, Feeder & Piping Engineering, Materials, Welding & Chemistry, Senior Feeder Support Engineer- Lead will work in support of Life Extension Projects and New Build project and requires a technical leadership role in the design of feeder piping, feeder supports, and feeder in-line components.

 This role will be based in Mississauga, ON.

 Your role within the team:

 Lead a team to Involve in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design of CANDU or Nuclear piping and process systems and modifications.
 Design complex piping and support arrangement, and prepare technical documents, such as: engineering drawings (including GA, ISO, pipe supports, flow diagrams), change paper markups, calculations, design/analysis reports, design requirements, design manuals, bill of materials, design specifications, technical specifications, data sheets, system classification lists, code classifications, commissioning specifications, etc.;
 Performing thermal, fatigue, seismic, linear, and non-linear analyses in accordance with ASME Boiler & Pressure Vessel Code, Section III, Div.1 code requirements is preferred.
 Perform complex engineering tasks with efficiency and accuracy.
 Prepare and review registration packages for pressure boundary components.
 Interface with the regulatory bodies such as: TSSA, and CNSC, as required.
 Provide technical guidance and instruction to Designers/Drafters, and Junior/Intermediate Engineers.
 Perform design review and design verification for the design and engineering work completed by others.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matters.
 Perform site visits to client and supplier shops as required.
 Perform field walk-downs during different design phases as required.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matter.
 Take a senior role in a group of Design and Stress Engineers/Analysts on multiple CANDU Reactor Components tasks.
 Defining work scope, preparing budget estimates and schedules, and reporting progress
 Report to engineering or project management with timely updates on project performance for the assigned scopes or tasks.
 Perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy Quality Assurance programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulation requirements.
 Coordinate and interface with client, suppliers, stakeholders and other design disciplines or department to execute assigned engineering work.

 The Ideal Candidate:

 Engineering Degree in Mechanical from an accredited university or equivalent degree as recognized by Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO).

 Minimum 10 years of related work experience in the field of pipe/pipe support design/analysis within a heavy industrial environment such as: mining, oil & gas, power; preferably with work experience in CANDU feeder analysis.

 Experience in FEA using ANSYS Mechanical APDL is required. Experience in ANSYS Workbench is an asset.

 Qualified or eligible to be qualified as ASME Appendix XXIII is preferred.
 Must have excellent technical and practical skills to resolve engineering issues or technical problems.
 Must have excellent communication and technical writing skills.
 Must have experience working and leading a team of engineers, in completing highly technical integrated tasks.
 Demonstrate ability to interact effectively with clients at all levels of the client organization.
 Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment.
 Must be capable of working independently and planning tasks, yet be an active team member supporting the project team and their development.
 Site experience in construction, or commissioning of plant mechanical systems for nuclear or other heavy industries would be an asset; and
 Must be willing to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW), although this will not be a regular requirement as part of the position.

Ingénieur(e) électrique principal(e)

 Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?

 SNC-Lavalin fournit des solutions d'ingénierie, d'approvisionnement, de construction et de financement de pointe pour des projets dans plus de 100 pays à travers le monde. Notre main-d'œuvre multiculturelle est animée d'une grande fierté à l'égard de son travail et d'une vision avant-gardiste.
 SNC-Lavalin est véritablement un chef de file mondial dans son domaine et a été choisie pour concevoir et construire certains des projets les plus prestigieux au monde.

 SNC-Lavalin a une offre d'emploi passionnante pour un ingénieur principal en électricité qui se joindra à notre équipe à Montréal. En vous joignant à nous, vous jouerez un rôle important dans la construction d'usines de batteries canadiennes de grande envergure. SNC-Lavalin vise à jouer un rôle important dans la transformation vers une société sans carbone.

 Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe ?

 En tant qu'ingénieur(e) électrique principal(e), vous dirigerez le travail de cette discipline au sein de l'équipe d'ingénierie d'usine et collaborerez au sein de l'organisation en soutenant l'élaboration de solutions de conception optimisées pour la conception actuelle et future des usines de batteries, afin de garantir les meilleures installations de fabrication de batteries de leur catégorie.


 Examiner et clarifier les exigences électriques, I&C et informatiques des différents groupes d'utilisateurs clients pour leur secteur désigné et, le cas échéant, les traduire en un ensemble d'exigences fonctionnelles à utiliser comme base de la conception.
 Résoudre les questions techniques, assurer en permanence la qualité de la conception et examiner la documentation de conception.
 Collaborer avec d'autres disciplines d'ingénierie afin de faciliter une conception optimisée et pleinement intégrée qui réponde à toutes les exigences fonctionnelles
 Agir en tant qu'autorité technique pour la conception des systèmes électriques, I&C et informatiques
 Fournir un soutien technique aux équipes de construction et de mise en service.


 Que recherchons-nous ?

 Licence ou maîtrise en génie électrique ou équivalent
 10 ans d'expérience dans l'industrie du bâtiment, de préférence dans la conception de services de bâtiment dans des projets industriels tels que le pétrole et le gaz, l'automobile, les produits pharmaceutiques, les centres de données, etc.
 Expérience de la conception électrique, des livrables associés, des systèmes et équipements électriques tels que la distribution d'énergie, les équipements MT/BT, les générateurs, les transformateurs, les onduleurs, etc.
 Excellentes compétences écrites et orales en anglais


 Points bonus pour :

 Expérience antérieure et intérêt pour les projets à grande échelle, en particulier dans l'industrie manufacturière et le développement de l'infrastructure du site.
 Connaissance des lois et normes canadiennes et européennes
 Connaissance des techniques, outils et principes de conception d'instruments et de contrôle (I&C) ou de systèmes de surveillance des bâtiments (BMS) impliqués dans la production d'exigences et de livrables de conception.
 Connaissance de la langue française


 La personne que nous recherchons est passionnée et motivée, elle aime travailler en interface avec de multiples disciplines d'ingénierie dans un environnement en constante évolution.
 Vous êtes flexible, travailleur, ouvert d'esprit, vous avez du cran et bien sûr le sens de l'humour.

 Ce que nous offrons chez SNC-Lavalin : 

Chez SNC-Lavalin, vous profiterez d’une rémunération compétitive, d’un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire, et d’une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (assurances collectives, programme d’épargne-retraite, régime d’actionnariat, emploi permanent, programme de formation continue, etc.).

 Vous pensez qu’une carrière dans notre équipe pourrait correspondre à votre profil, soumettez sans attendre votre candidature en ligne !

 Electrical Lead Engineer

 Why join us? 

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. Our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.
 SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

 SNC-Lavalin has an exciting job offer for a Electrical Lead Engineer to join our team in Montreal. In joining us you will play an important part in the construction of large scale Canadian battery factories. SNC-Lavalin aims to play an important role in the transformation to a carbon free society.

 How will you contribute to the team?

 As a Senior Electrical Engineer, you will lead the work of this discipline in the Factory Engineering team and collaborate within the organization by supporting the development of optimized design solutions for current and future design of battery factories, ensuring best in class battery manufacturing facilities.

 Review and clarify the relevant electrical, I&C and IT requirements from the different client user groups for their designated area, and where necessary translate them into a set of functional requirements to be used as a basis of design
 Resolve technical queries, continually assure the quality of the design and review of design documentation
 Collaborate with other engineering disciplines to facilitate a fully integrated, optimized design that meets all functional requirements
 Act as technical authority for concept design of electrical, I&C and IT systems
 Provide technical support to the construction and commissioning teams


 What will you contribute?

 Bachelor or master's degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent
 10 years’ work experience in building industry, preferably designing building services in industrial projects such as oil & gas, automotive, pharmaceutical, data centers, etc.
 Experience with electrical design, associated deliverables, electrical systems and equipment such as power distribution, MV/LV equipment, generators, transformers, UPS, etc.
 Excellent English written and oral skills


 Bonus points for:

 Previous experience and interest with large scale projects, specifically in manufacturing industry and site infrastructure development
 Familiarity with Canadian and European laws and standards
 Knowledge of Instrument & Control (I&C) or Building Monitoring System (BMS) design techniques, tools, and principals involved in production of requirements and concept design deliverables
 French language skills


 The person we are looking for is passionate and purpose driven, enjoys to interface with multiple engineering disciplines in a very fast-paced environment. You are flexible, hardworking, open minded, got a lot of grit and of course a sense of humor.

 What we offer at SNC-Lavalin: 

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

Senior Solid Waste Management Engineer

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is seeking a Senior Solid Waste Management Engineer in the Solid Waste field to join our growing group of professionals in providing innovative solutions to our clients and building what matters. Our Environment group requires someone to oversee complex environmental projects in the waste management sector. This position is based in our Toronto, Ancaster, Ottawa, or Edmonton offices. However, consideration will be given to other locations where AtkinsRéalis has Canadian offices. This position is office/hybrid work based, focused on projects providing support on projects across Canada and internationally where needed.

 The successful candidate will bring developed leadership skills and be able to communicate effectively with our staff and clients and provide appropriate technical direction on a project basis. Liaising with regulatory agencies, networking with professionals, and developing business would be secondary duties in this role.

 Your role within the team

 Management of projects of varying complexity involving the engineering design for solid waste management facilities, including some or all of landfills, organics processing, material recovery facilities, transfer stations and public drop-off facilities – including detailed design, cost estimating, tender and specification support, and construction supervision/contract administration services.
 Providing specialist input or leading waste planning related opportunities including preparing design and operations plans; generating or modifying monitoring plans for groundwater, surface water, landfill gases; obtaining environmental compliance approvals and amendments for waste operations, air quality and stormwater management discharges.
 Providing expertise related to operations-based support including the calculation of landfill liabilities, complete capacity studies and estimate waste density and consumption rates, assess operations capacities, coordinate supplemental studies completed by specialists including noise assessments, odour assessments, traffic impact reviews, etc.
 Project management, tracking costs and managing budgets, hiring, and directing subcontractors, etc.
 Executing technical tasks requiring accuracy in calculations, completeness, and adherence to prescribed data testing methods.
 Preparing and reviewing reports, proposals, and other project documents of varying complexity. Liaising with clients and contacts to secure additional business.
 Supervising junior and intermediate engineering and non-engineering stream staff on an individual project basis and providing technical direction and mentoring.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate

 Degree in Engineering (Geological, Environmental, Biosystems, Civil, or other relevant engineering backgrounds), Environmental Sciences, Earth Sciences, Geology, Hydrogeology, or relevant field. Must be licensed as a Professional Engineer (P. Eng) with a minimum of 10 years of practical solid waste management consulting experience including relevant experience in various facets of the waste management sector.
 Possess expertise in at least one of the following relevant disciplines and demonstrable familiarity with the others: landfill engineering design/construction management; environmental compliance and operations support; and/or waste management planning support.
 Demonstrated expertise in contractor supervision, project management and contract administration.
 Strong commitment to teamwork and multi-disciplinary communication skills.
 Proven technical writing skills.

Environmental Planner/ Project Manager

 Working At AtkinsRéalis
 AtkinsRéalis engineers a sustainable future, connecting people, data, and technology. Our values of Safety, Integrity, Collaboration, and Innovation drive success. We embrace diversity, representing 130 nationalities across AtkinsRéalis, and boast over 50% women in leadership roles in our Environment practice. Your well-being is our priority, and our Health & Safety culture is industry leading. Join us for a flexible, challenging, and inclusive career journey.

 Environment Permitting & Management
 The Environmental Permitting and Management team comprises close to 100 employees at all levels involved in keystone projects throughout their lifecycle: from their early assessment of key constraints to strategic development of regulatory approvals processes to compliance management through construction and operations. Our team works collaboratively within projects to gain social acceptance and manage our clients' commitments to the environment and sustainable development.

 We currently have an opening for an Environmental Planner/ Project Manager in our Toronto location.

 Your role within the Team:

Technicien(ne)/Dessinateur(rice) en mécanique de bâtiment - Ventilation

 Si vous êtes à la recherche d’un employeur qui a des projets internationaux d’ingénierie de grande envergure à vous proposer.  L’équipe de Mécanique & électricité du bâtiment à Québec est présentement et sera très occupée pour les prochaines années sur des projets de nouvelles constructions et de maintien d’actifs dans le milieu de la santé, institutionnel, pharmaceutique, industriel ainsi que des projets d’infrastructures publiques.
 Vous pourrez travailler à partir de notre bureau de Québec ou de Rimouski, selon votre préférence.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe

 Réaliser la conception et la mise en plan de projets de ventilation avec les outils RÉVIT (et AUTO-CAD à l’occasion).
 Interagir avec le client, avec les collègues en mécanique & électricité, de même qu’avec les autres professionnels en architecture et en structure.
 Élaborer des diagrammes et des schémas de contrôle des réseaux et des équipements;
 Réaliser la rédaction de devis techniques nécessaires aux divers projets;
 Procéder à des relevés techniques et d’évaluations d’installations existantes;
 Réaliser des estimations de coût de travaux.
 Effectuer la revue des dessins d’atelier.
 Fournir une assistance technique durant les travaux de construction

Independently evaluates, selects, and applies standard engineering techniques, procedures and criteria using judgement in making minor adaptations and modifications.

Piping / Feeder Designer

 AtkinsRéalis/CANDU Energy Inc. is a leading full-service nuclear technology company providing nuclear power reactors and nuclear products and services to customers worldwide. Our 1,200 highly skilled employees design and deliver state-of-the-art CANDU® reactors, carry out life extension projects, provide plant life management programs and tools, and offer operation and maintenance services for existing nuclear power stations. This role is based out of the CANDU Energy Inc. home office in Mississauga, ON.

 Our expertise includes Nuclear Steam Plant (NSP) engineering, Balance of Plant (BOP) engineering, Plant Life Management and Extension, Retube Tooling Systems, Inspection and Maintenance Services, Steam Generator Replacement, Plant Equipment Refurbishment and Retrofits.
 AtkinsRéalis is currently looking for Junior to Intermediate Piping / Feeder Designer (s) to join our engineering team in Mississauga. The work is in support of Life Extension Projects and New Build project and requires a technical role in the design and analysis of feeder piping, feeder supports, and feeder in-line components. This is a permanent position.

 Your role within the team:
 This position requires an individual who is self-motivated and capable of working independently or under the instruction from a senior technical engineer and develop his/her career and experience in nuclear field. The candidate shall be able to follow the instruction from a qualified professional engineer to complete the assigned mechanical related scopes or tasks and develop necessary engineering design documentation as required.
 The qualified individual will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

 Perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulation requirements.
 Coordinate and interface with client, suppliers, stakeholders and other design disciplines or department to execute assigned engineering work.
 Involve in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design of CANDU or Nuclear process systems and modifications under supervision of a P.Eng.
 Learn and prepare engineering computations and analyses using applicable software (e.g., PipeStress, CaesarII, AutoPipe, MATLAB, MathCAD, ANSYS Mechanical (APDL preferred or Workbench), and LSDYNA. etc.).
 Modelling complex piping and support arrangements using finite element techniques.
 Perform pipe stress evaluation of piping systems (nuclear class or non-nuclear class) in accordance with ASME Section III, Div.1, and/or ASME B31.1 code requirements.
 Performing thermal, fatigue, seismic, linear and non-linear analyses in accordance with ASME Boiler & Pressure Vessel Code, Section III, Div.1 code requirements.
 Prepare Design Change Package (DCP) and Design Change Notice (DCN) packages following customer procedures.
 Prepare technical documents, such as: engineering drawings (including GA, ISO, pipe supports, flow diagrams), change paper markups, calculations, design/analysis reports, design requirements, design manuals, bill of materials, design specifications, technical specifications, data sheets, system classification lists, code classifications, commissioning specifications, etc.
 Prepare TSSA registration packages for pressure boundary modifications.
 Prepare requisitions or Engineering Quotation Requests (EQR) for equipment and materials to support procurement.
 Review supplier technical documents and performing technical bid analyses.
 Provide technical guidance and instruction to Designers/Drafters and more junior staff as required.
 Perform site visits to client and supplier shops as required.
 Perform field walk-downs during different design phases as required.
 Support field construction and execution activities, such as: field changes, design revisions, commissioning, AFS, closeout, etc.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matters.
 Complete the assigned scopes or tasks within given budget and schedule, and in good quality.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Engineering Degree in Mechanical from an accredited university or equivalent degree as recognized by Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO).
 Registered as an Engineer-In-Training or eligible to be registered as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario.
 10 years of related work experience in mechanical engineering within a heavy industrial environment such as: mining, oil & gas, power, etc.
 Basic knowledge of mechanical and piping systems or equipment (knowledge of CANDU nuclear systems would be an asset).
 Working knowledge of CSA N285.0 and CSA B51, CSA N289 and ASME Section III and ANSI B31.1 codes and any other applicable standards or regulatory guides related to permanent plant components, pressure boundary equipment, and/or reactor systems is preferred.
 Design engineering experience in nuclear class 2, 3 and 6 piping systems, valves, pumps and for Nuclear Power Plants is preferable.
 Experience in Stress Analysis using PipeStress, CaesarII, AutoPipe, MATLAB, MathCAD, ANSYS Mechanical (APDL preferred or Workbench) , and LSDYNA. or other similar software program is an asset.
 Qualified or eligible to be qualified as ASME Appendix XXIII is an asset.
 Must be able to apply technical principles in a logical and practical manner to resolve engineering issues or technical problems.
 Shall have excellent communication and technical writing skills.
 Demonstrate good interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a multidisciplinary team environment.
 Site experience in construction, or commissioning of plant mechanical systems for nuclear or other heavy industries would be an asset.
 Must be willing to become a Nuclear Energy Worker (NEW), although this will not be a regular requirement as part of the job.

Commercial Manager

 Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 Come join us in reshaping the future with AtkinsRéalis. AtkinsRéalis is dedicated in engineering a better future for our planet and its people.

 AtkinsRéalis is in search of a Commercial Manager to join a transformative transit infrastructure project in Calgary.

 The Green Line LRT (light rail transit) Project is the largest infrastructure investment in Calgary’s history. It comes with $5.5 billion in commitments from the Government of Canada, Government of Alberta and The City of Calgary. The Green Line LRT is designed to be both a transit system and a platform for future city building opportunities. It encourages redevelopment and investment in Calgary businesses and communities. At 18-kms, Phase 1 will create 20,000 jobs, $2.2B in long-term city-shaping benefits and more than $6B in property value uplift by 2040.

 You will be embedded within the client office team environment, and as such you are required to be in downtown Calgary, for the full working week

 Your role within the team:

 In alignment with the project controls, reporting, risk and other parties in the Delivery Partner structure, provide support to the Commercial Director on all aspects of contract administration including payment certification, cost reporting, change management and commercial performance.
 Proactively raise issues and concerns to the Client project team with regard aspects such as Contractor performance and behaviors in order to effectively address situations and implement effective solutions.
 Provide support in managing the project procurement approach and process, including the prequalification, solicitation, bidding strategies, evaluation (including overhead & profit rates) and implementation.
 Working with the project controls and overall project team, align deliverables and role requirements with the project management software selected for effective project delivery, and ensure that you develop a robust understanding of the tools and processes implemented.
 Be involved in conversations to include budget planning, forecasting and cost management where appropriate.

 Join the renowned Damn and Hydropower Group at AtkinsRealis, a true industry leader with over a century of expertise in power generation and distribution.  Your role within the team:

 We have an exciting opportunity for an Intermediate Mechanical Engineer (HVAC & Piping) to join our dynamic team! In this role, you will be involved in a wide range of Hydro and Transmission and Distribution Projects, specifically focusing on Balance of Plant systems.

 Our project portfolio is diverse, including both large and small hydro projects across Canada, the US, and international locations. As part of our Mechanical team, you will have the chance to conduct inspections, perform design calculations, develop procurement specifications, collaborate with equipment vendors, and engage with our esteemed clients.  Act as Package Engineer (technical lead) working directly with vendors on equipment supply contracts for, piping, pumps, oil handling systems, HVAC systems, compressed air systems, wastewater systems, raw water systems, dewatering systems, drainage systems, and service water systems.
 Work effectively within a multidisciplinary engineering team, coordinating with civil, electrical, and other mechanical engineers.

 Preliminary sizing of equipment for conceptual designs and to provide input to support civil design.
 Work with drafting technicians to prepare design drawings and conceptual / tender level drawings for equipment.
 Prepare design basis memoranda, technical memoranda, and reports, and coordinate report preparation within a multidisciplinary team.

Ingénieur(e) intermédiaire - Mécanique du bâtiment projets nordiques

 La division Services d'ingénierie – Canada est présentement à la recherche d’un(e) ingénieur(e) en mécanique du bâtiment pour se joindre à notre équipe hautement qualifiée et dédiée aux projets nordiques, soit ceux réalisés au nord du 55e parallèle, principalement au Nunavik et au Nunavut. Vous aurez la chance de développer une expertise en ingénierie adaptée aux conditions nordiques et à la culture inuite. Leader en ingénierie et en construction nordique depuis plus de 35 ans, notre firme vous donnera accès à un vaste éventail de projets stimulants et variés (ex. éducation, santé, laboratoires de recherche, récréatif, aéroportuaire, industriel, résidentiel, etc.). Sans aucune obligation de voyager, les aventuriers seront comblés par la possibilité de se rendre sur le territoire lors de la réalisation des projets. Il s’agit d’une formidable occasion de vous joindre à une équipe dynamique, en pleine croissance, et ayant une expertise unique.

 Notre équipe bénéficie d’une vaste expertise soutenue par une communauté de pratique qui rassemble les plus grands experts de nos divers bureaux au Québec et au Canada. Nos professionnels bénéficient d’une formation continue, tout en mettant de l’avant les technologies de pointe, l’environnement et l’efficacité énergétique.

 Il s’agit d’une occasion de vous impliquer au sein d’une équipe dynamique et en pleine croissance et de mettre à profit votre talent en conception dans ce domaine spécialisé qu’est le Grand Nord. Nous avons présentement un carnet de commandes avec des projets à réaliser pour plusieurs années.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe:


 Recueillir les données de base du client et des autres intervenants.
 Effectuer la conception des systèmes mécanique du bâtiment, tels que plomberie, chauffage hydronique, ventilation, protection incendie et de réseau de mazout.
 Assurer la mise en modèle de l’ingénierie en mécanique du bâtiment (CVCA, plomberie, mazout).
 Effectuer, développer, valider les calculs et dimensionnement liés à la discipline.
 Rédiger les devis techniques et rapports nécessaires à la réalisation du projet;.
 Réaliser des estimations de coûts de travaux et de cycle de vie.
 Participer à la surveillance de chantier au bureau avec possibilité de visites sur les chantiers.
 Identifier et traiter les déficiences en mécanique du bâtiment.

Ingénieur(e) en mécanique du bâtiment - CVAC

 Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?
 SNC-Lavalin est l’un des plus importants groupes d’ingénierie et de construction au monde, et un acteur majeur en matière de propriété d’infrastructures et de services d’exploitation et d’entretien. Le groupe SNC-Lavalin a des bureaux partout au Canada et travaille actuellement dans une centaine de pays.

 (www.snclavalin.com).

 Le monde qui nous entoure se transforme, notre façon de l’alimenter doit donc aussi évoluer. Depuis plus d’un siècle, nous avons une longueur d’avance sur ces changements, évoluant avec le secteur de l’énergie pour nous assurer que nos clients qui alimentent la planète peuvent le faire de façon responsable et durable et avec succès. Nous sommes fiers de notre feuille de route et nous nous engageons à être des pionniers des progrès de l’énergie propre.

 Nous mettons à contribution nos capacités en ingénierie inégalées et notre compréhension de l’ensemble des systèmes énergétiques pour créer des solutions d’hydroélectricité, d’énergie renouvelable, de transport, de stockage d’énergie et de réseaux électriques.

 SNC-Lavalin recherche, pour son département Énergie hydraulique et barrages, un(e) Ingénieur(e) en mécanique du bâtiment pour rejoindre une équipe dédiée à la conception et la construction de centrales hydro-électriques. À ce titre vous serez impliqués au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire dans la réalisation de projets allant des études de faisabilité à la construction.

 Secteur d’activité :
 Tous les systèmes de mécanique comprenant les systèmes de CVAC, de protection incendie, d’eau potable et des eaux usées ainsi que les systèmes mécaniques d’air comprimé, d’eau de refroidissement et de manutention d’huile.

 Quelle sera votre contribution dans l’équipe ?

 Participer à la conception des divers systèmes mécaniques requis dans les projets hydro-électriques, tels que: CVAC, plomberie, protection incendie, air comprimé, manutention d’huile et d’eau de refroidissement
 Rédiger les devis techniques et rapports nécessaires à la réalisation du projet
 Revue de documents de manufacturiers/fournisseurs et recommandations (dessins, notes de calcul, procédures de fabrication, spécifications d’achat, procédures de montage, etc.)
 Fournir une assistance technique durant les travaux de construction, suivi de fabrication et de montage ainsi que participation aux tests d’équipements (revue des non-conformités, DMT, QRT, et autres documents)
 Participation aux audits technique des centrales, de l’analyse des besoins des clients et rédaction de rapports d’inspection
 Effectuer la gestion de projet
 Effectuer les calculs liés à la discipline
 Définir les besoins des clients et la portée des projets
 Effectuer l’estimation de coût de réalisation
 Évaluer les soumissions des fournisseurs et entrepreneurs
 Effectuer des visites de chantiers
 Effectuer de la modélisation 3D et la préparation de dessins


 Que recherchons-nous ?

 Baccalauréat en génie mécanique
 Entre 3 à 5 ans d’expérience en conception mécanique
 Être membre de l’Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ)
 Connaissance dans les systèmes de commande des équipements de CVAC
 Connaissance dans la conception de supports de CVAC et plomberie (un atout)
 Capacité à travailler avec des logiciels 3D (ex. Autocad, Revit, Catia, …)
 Connaissance des logiciels de simulation des fluides pour des réseaux de tuyauterie (AFT Fathom, PIPE-FLO ou équivalent) (un atout)
 Connaissance des logiciels d’analyses des contraintes dans les tuyaux (Caesar II ou équivalent) (un atout)
 Capacité à travailler en équipe
 Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais (parlé/écrit)
 Habileté à effectuer des présentations techniques

Piping / Feeder Designer

 AtkinsRéalis/CANDU Energy Inc. is a leading full-service nuclear technology company providing nuclear power reactors and nuclear products and services to customers worldwide. Our 1,200 highly skilled employees design and deliver state-of-the-art CANDU® reactors, carry out life extension projects, provide plant life management programs and tools, and offer operation and maintenance services for existing nuclear power stations. This role is based out of the CANDU Energy Inc. home office in Mississauga, ON.

 Our expertise includes Nuclear Steam Plant (NSP) engineering, Balance of Plant (BOP) engineering, Plant Life Management and Extension, Retube Tooling Systems, Inspection and Maintenance Services, Steam Generator Replacement, Plant Equipment Refurbishment and Retrofits.
 AtkinsRéalis is currently looking for Junior to Intermediate Piping / Feeder Designer (s) to join our engineering team in Mississauga. The work is in support of Life Extension Projects and New Build project and requires a technical role in the design and analysis of feeder piping, feeder supports, and feeder in-line components. This is a permanent position.

 Your role within the team:
 This position requires an individual who is self-motivated and capable of working independently or under the instruction from a senior technical engineer and develop his/her career and experience in nuclear field. The candidate shall be able to follow the instruction from a qualified professional engineer to complete the assigned mechanical related scopes or tasks and develop necessary engineering design documentation as required.
 The qualified individual will be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

 Perform engineering work following AtkinsRéalis/Candu Energy QA programs, and applicable codes, standards, and regulation requirements.
 Coordinate and interface with client, suppliers, stakeholders and other design disciplines or department to execute assigned engineering work.
 Involve in conceptual, preliminary and/or detailed design of CANDU or Nuclear process systems and modifications under supervision of a P.Eng.
 Learn and prepare engineering computations and analyses using applicable software (e.g., PipeStress, CaesarII, AutoPipe, MATLAB, MathCAD, ANSYS Mechanical (APDL preferred or Workbench), and LSDYNA. etc.).
 Modelling complex piping and support arrangements using finite element techniques.
 Perform pipe stress evaluation of piping systems (nuclear class or non-nuclear class) in accordance with ASME Section III, Div.1, and/or ASME B31.1 code requirements.
 Performing thermal, fatigue, seismic, linear and non-linear analyses in accordance with ASME Boiler & Pressure Vessel Code, Section III, Div.1 code requirements.
 Prepare Design Change Package (DCP) and Design Change Notice (DCN) packages following customer procedures.
 Prepare technical documents, such as: engineering drawings (including GA, ISO, pipe supports, flow diagrams), change paper markups, calculations, design/analysis reports, design requirements, design manuals, bill of materials, design specifications, technical specifications, data sheets, system classification lists, code classifications, commissioning specifications, etc.
 Prepare TSSA registration packages for pressure boundary modifications.
 Prepare requisitions or Engineering Quotation Requests (EQR) for equipment and materials to support procurement.
 Review supplier technical documents and performing technical bid analyses.
 Provide technical guidance and instruction to Designers/Drafters and more junior staff as required.
 Perform site visits to client and supplier shops as required.
 Perform field walk-downs during different design phases as required.
 Support field construction and execution activities, such as: field changes, design revisions, commissioning, AFS, closeout, etc.
 Provide prompt response and engineering resolutions on any critical engineering related matters.
 Complete the assigned scopes or tasks within given budget and schedule, and in good quality.


 Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
 Because we offer:

 The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
 An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
 A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
 Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
 A work environment focused on health and safety.


 The ideal candidate:

 Engineering Degree in Mechanical from an accredited university or equivalent degree as recognized by Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO).
 Registered as an Engineer-In-Training or eligible to be registered as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Ontario.
 10 years of related work experience in mechanical engineering within a heavy industrial environment such as: mining, oil & gas, power, etc.
 Basic knowledge of mechanical and piping systems or equipment (knowledge of CANDU nuclear systems would be an asset).
 Working knowledge of CSA N285.0 and CSA B51, CSA N289 and ASME Section III and ANSI B31.1 codes and any other applicable standards or regulatory guides related to permanent plant components, pressure boundary equipment, and/or reactor systems is preferred.
 Design engineering experience in nuclear class 2, 3 and 6 piping systems, valves, pumps and for Nuclear Power Plants is preferable.
 Experience in Stress Analysis using PipeStress, CaesarII, AutoPipe, MATLAB, MathCAD, ANSYS Mechanical (APDL preferred or Workbench) , and LSDYNA. or other similar software program is an asset.

Concepteur en électricité du bâtiment - Secteur santé

 Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe ?
 Nous sommes à la recherche d’un(e) concepteur(trice) en électricité du bâtiment afin de joindre l'équipe de conception œuvrant à Montréal principalement dans pour des projets dans le milieu hospitalier.
 Le groupe d’électricité d’ingénierie Montréal est spécialisé dans le domaine institutionnel, commercial, aéroportuaire et industriel léger et a acquis au fil des années une réputation d’excellence en la matière. Les candidats choisis auront l’occasion d’œuvrer dans une équipe technique hautement qualifiée et pourront mettre à profit leurs connaissances et leur savoir-faire sur des projets d’importances. Avec la possibilité d’avoir un mode de travail hybride, la majorité des projets sur lesquels le candidat sera appelé à travailler se dérouleront dans le secteur de Montréal et ses environs. Il s’agit d’une occasion de vous impliquer au sein d’une équipe dynamique et en pleine croissance et de mettre à profit votre talent en conception électrique. Les projets visés sont de nature institutionnelle et principalement dans le milieu hospitalier.

 Votre rôle au sein de l’équipe:

 Effectuer la conception des systèmes électriques tels que distribution, éclairage, alarmes incendie et autres systèmes connexes.
 Effectuer la modélisation 3D de la conception sur plateforme REVIT, obligatoire.
 Rédiger et effectuer les calculs reliés à la conception.
 Participer à la rédaction de devis techniques d’électricité.
 Participer à la rédaction d’étude technique en électricité.
 Évaluer les coûts des travaux.
 Effectuer l’ensemble de ces responsabilités sous la supervision de l’ingénieur responsible.

 Salaire compétitif, avantages sociaux flexibles, plan d'actionnariat des employés et régime de retraite à cotisations définies.
 Un environnement de travail axé sur la santé et la sécurité.

 DEP, AEC ou DEC en électricité du bâtiment ou l'équivalent
 Expérience de 5 ans minimum sur des projets en électricité institutionnel du bâtiment

 Maitrise des logiciels Word, Excel, power point, Outlook.

 AtkinsRéalis is in search of a Commercial Manager to join a transformative transit infrastructure project in Calgary.

 The Green Line LRT (light rail transit) Project is the largest infrastructure investment in Calgary’s history. It comes with $5.5 billion in commitments from the Government of Canada, Government of Alberta and The City of Calgary.  Are you looking for a company that works on major engineering projects all over the world? Do you want to make a difference by improving the daily lives of communities worldwide? Are you seeking to join an inclusive and diverse team that you can truly count on? You’ve come to the right place!

 AtkinsRéalis Mining & Metallurgical (M&M) team in Canada is made up of more than 400 employees who work on large-scale projects to support mining sustainability, pit-to-port opportunities, metallurgical plant engineering, or mine closure and capabilities in the study, design, and construction of mining projects across a wide range of mining and processing methods and commodities. The team combines global-caliber expertise to provide tailored solutions for projects of any size, scope, or complexity. We believe in working openly and transparently, together, delivering world-class projects. We work collaboratively with teams across the world, from Canada to Brazil in the south to India in the east, delivering exceptional value and innovation to our clients. To support our growth initiatives, we are expanding our team and are looking for innovative, forward-thinking people who enjoy challenges and want to add value to project success, both locally and internationally.

 We are seeking Director of Mine Permitting to join our Canadian Operations. Applying your previous leadership and market experience, you will be leading a team of professionals in sustaining and growing its business and providing high quality services in mine water related services.

 As the Director of Mine Permitting, you will report to the VP Tailings, Water, and Environment, North America and will lead the team’s strategic planning, growth, team development, and provide technical leadership across Canada. The Mine Permitting service offering includes coordination of numerous disciplines throughout the mining lifecycle.  This opportunity can be based in Vancouver, BC or Calgary, AB or Montreal, QC or Toronto, ON.

 Your role within the team:

 Lead and grow the mining permitting business across the mining sector for new, existing, and legacy Mine projects.
 Identify/anticipate/evaluate and report on market trends, opportunities, and industry dynamics.
 Identify resource gaps in the team and attract/retain key staff to the team.
 Guide technical team in successful project delivery applying industry leading best practices related to mining e.g., Environmental Assessment Act, Mining association of Canada (MAC), Towards Sustainable Mining (TSM) best practices, Canadian Dam Association (CDA), Global Industry Standard on Tailings Management (GISTM), as well as applying applicable local, provincial, and federal regulations to solutions.
 Apply extensive knowledge and experience in permitting and environmental compliance including but not limited to impact assessment, permitting, ecology, air and acoustics, geochemistry, hydrology, regulatory affairs, tailings management, geomorphology, hydrotechnical engineering, hydrogeology, climate change and asset resilience, water treatment.
